Not just room temperature but like it came out of the fridge. Thinking we may have placed the order wrong, we asked the server if it was supposed to be cold. She acted surprised and took the crab back and said she will send it back to be reheated. She came back just few minutes after she sent back the crab, im not surprised that its still not warm. What a waste of money. 

Silverwares have heavy water stains, looks very unsanitary. Forks were crooked. We asked for water refill for all 5 glasses and she only filled 2 glasses and attended to needs of the other customers. Good for them, bad for us. We will never come back.

This was a nice dining experience, and it's definately very hard to decide whether it's 3 stars or 4 stars. Here's the breakdown of my experience at Bistro St. Tropez...

Location- 2 Stars; it was a very odd location

View- 4 Stars; it offered a nice view of 30th St station and the river

Food- 3.5 Stars;  I enjoyed the Saumon Fume I ordered for my appetizer, but my meal was good, not great. My husbands meal was great, not excellent

Decor- 3 Stars; The decor was a tad 90's. It could use a little decor update, but it wasn't horrible

Service- 4 Stars; our waiter was attentive and pleasant without being overbearing

Overall, it was a pleasant enough experience, but I probably wouldn't head back there again any time soon.

I assume this is the BP we get delivery from. Which is always amazing! I admit they are a few $$ more but in the end they are my fav. pizza delivery place. Prompt and tasty. Lunch wasn't that great. The service was good. I mean not amazing. I did ask for a second to pick a drink but it did take a few minutes. The ceaser I had was great though. While the ribs were tasty the size was tiny. Overall it was a decent lunch but I wish I had stuck to the pizza or pasta I know is always good there. It is the delivery that gives this place a 4/5 in the end!

We came here for a change as we hadn't eaten here in quite  a while. The hostess seated us promptly within moments of our arrival. Next, came Joe our server who took excellent care of our needs. 

We started with Calamari as an appetizer which was excellent. My wife had the blu salad which she said was great. I had the Capris salad which was excellent. Next my wife ordered the mix grill which was way to spiceynfor her as they used way too many  red peppers. 

I ordered the steak med rare and it was cook perfectly, but was way tuff and had no flavor. If it wasn't for Joe's service I would have given 2 stars

Ok so I'm gonna be honest and say I really only went here for the cookie dough egg roll because I saw a video on Facebook and knew I was going to be in Nashville and HAD to try it! Well, it didn't disappoint. We went and had brunch - I had the breakfast sliders which I thought were just ok because the biscuit was a little dry (not sure why most biscuits I had were dry). The portions were fairly small so I was able to get my dessert and enjoy it. The egg roll wrapper was odd but with the chocolate it really didn't taste any different. Glad I came across the Facebook video about this place

5 stars

Pretty sure it's Halal now, so that's a plus [not a muslim, but i'm all for adhering to a strict code of cleanliness, etc. when it comes to food]

Always fresh, always cooked per order
All their chicken, large pieces, or just wings, are deep fried after your order them, not once have I gotten any chicken from under the heat lamp.

Today, I got a fish sandwich, best fish sandwich I've had in a while.
Cooked per order, 5 minute wait and I had myself a great little fish sandwich.

Fish sandwich, side of fries, and a medium coke for $5.50 is a pretty good deal by me.

We stopped in on a Monday afternoon and gave this place a try after reading the reviews. It was really a great place. The drink specials they offer was 1/2 off margaritas on Mondays and the best part was the service. Our server Natasha was awsome. She explained some of her favorite dishes when we told her it was our first time and couldn't decide what to try. 
The grilled beef burrito was delicious with the red sauce and the portion was huge. We certainly were surprised at the great  level of service we got because Natasha was working by herself and she had 6 tables by the time our food arrived. If you want a great laid back spot to enjoy a drink and get some good food , check this spot out!
4.5....only because the icecream is exceedingly sweet. Toasted coconut in a sugar cone was soooooo good.

Bland, nothing special abt it. A to go joint.  If you decide to eat there you will be served a plastic baggie with watery wasabi, and plastic cup with nasty tasting soy sauce. Really wanted to like this place but besides the cool look, it was a huge disappointment. Btw, the specialty rolls are ridiculously small for the price.

five stars for their soon doo boo.  soon doo boo is a spicy silken tofu stew served in a mini stone pot.  the soup is meant to be eaten spicy so it will taste bland if you order it mild.  for me, their soon doo boo stands out because of the broth.  it is full of complex flavors other than red chili peppers.  

i loved that the rice was served in a stone pot as well.  when you finish your meal, you will notice a layer of roasted rice at the bottom of the pot.  you can ask for hot water to be poured into your rice pot for an after-meal palette cleanser.

the restaurant is clean and has a traditional feel to it.  the servers left us alone but we were able to use the call buttons on the table for service.

overall, excellent soon doo boo!!

I really like the design of this place. Very tropical, very beachy which I love. You walk in and painted all over the walls is fish, and birds, and palm trees. Very beachy type drinks and food. Food is excellent I usually get some sort of fish. Very fresh and tasty. The amount of TVs help you keep up with sports if you need to, but if not it's just a nice place to go hang out for a little

OMG!!  No wonder this place is always PACKED!!  The decor is so pretty and fitting in the Quarter. It's totally fine dining with a more relaxed attitude and ambiance.  JC is AWESOME!!  So nice, so accommodating and friendly! And the food....must have the Gumbo Ya Ya!!  Super tasty, best gumbo I had on my visit to NOLA BY FAR!  We had 4 in our party, had a drink at the bar...waited maybe 10 minutes tops!!  My hubby had the pork chop, 2 of us had the filet and 1 had the fish of the day.   We ALL were sharing and raving.  The food is TOP NOTCH!!  Can't wait for our next trip to NOLA and to Mr. B's.

I selected Mr. B's Bistro for my birthday dinner and was not disappointed. We had the BBQ shrimp and the bacon wrapped shrimp and grits. The BBQ shrimp were easily the best I've ever had. They were flavorful and it was a very generous portion in which we ate every last bite. The grits were creamy and delicious with the right amount of sweetness and the shrimps were perfectly cooked. The service was professional and attentive and the ambiance of the restaurant was very nice. We will be back!

Found this place during a rain delay for a softball tournament.  Will definitely come back if we are back in town.  The flautas were great and the queso was amazing. The beef was spicy on the tacos. Great authentic mexican food.

Ice cream is pretty good and the espresso is ok. I recommend the black cherry. Bathrooms are clean and service is pretty good. They offer a variety of flavors and combinations. Overall, it is pretty good and very fair pricing for being in downtown Nashville. Service was great

Of course Chick-fil-A is great. But this franchise consistently has the slowest service compared to any other franchise I've ever been to. Word to the wise, when you see a long line, move on somewhere else.

This place is absolutely beautiful! Once you're inside, its almost as if youre in this tropical paradise. There's so much to do here. There are beautiful waterfalls and some great restaurants. 

They have a river boat ride that gives you a bit about the history of the hotel and the water the river contains. You could get lost in this place. I have been here on 2 occasions and I still don't think I've seen everything. Great place to take some nice photos!

Spend the few extra dollars and stay here. You won't be sorry!!

Don't let the exterior fool you, the food here is fantastic! I was feeling very veg when I visited Tomo, so I ended up ordering clear soup along with the cucumber roll and sweet potato roll. I am partial to cucumber rolls, ordering them everywhere I go. However, the sweet potato roll was the show-stopper for me. It was tempura sweet potato in a roll. Fried potato in a roll. So. Good. 

It was a great and inexpensive lunch option on the north side. 

I am excited to revisit Tomo soon and continue to explore their menu.

This place is a good neighborhood Thai restaurant - mostly standard dishes, not fancy but good. I like the spicy eggplant. Very nice people who own it, and a nice place to sit outside on a summer evening walking home from the beach. Or better yet get takeout and head over to Island Brewing Company for a pint or two to wash it down while the sun sets.

I tried this place for takeout last night. I called in and they said 30 min but it took almost an hour for them to get my food ready. I was not impressed with the lamb curry it was runny and just not what I was expecting. I have eaten indian food all over the PNW and I wouldn't eat here again.The owners were nice they did try and gave me tea while I waited but I don't think I would eat here again.

Looking for Unique liquor, this is the spot to go. Unlike most liquor stores their stock here has more variety in choices. See photos. Although it can be quite pricey but they do carry the cheap stuff too. A bit smaller than most common liquor stores. They do have a very wide selection of wines so if that's your thing, check this place out. Maybe even if your cooking for that special someone for a perfect night. Staff is friendly, parking is moderately small. This place is also good for a quick liquor stop before house parties. Some of these alcoholic drinks look very foreign maybe that's why the price is high. After visiting this place, i'd come here for their rare drinks. 
Recommended for the chefs looking for a unique wine to cook with or people seeking new liquor tastes.

We will not return to this place. Ordered Fried Green Tomato Sliders and mushroom Swiss sliders!  Bread was cold and hard and most of the sandwich WAS bread!  Meat was flavorless....
Fried Mac n cheese was ok but the onion rings were greasy.  Bill was $39 for two people! Crazy for not good food.  Sorry, Burger Up, we won't be going back.
Pho bistro is amazing! Every time I eat there I get great food and fast service!! I would highly recommend eating here!!
Delicious ice cream! I had ice cream in a few different places in Nashville and besides Jeni's this place is the best! Try their nutter butter. It's to die for!

Wonderful new addition to Philly/Old City. Isreal behind the bar is a real bartender in a city of imposters, completely​ knowledgeable​ about cocktails/liquor​. ​Chef Ken is running a tight ship. the sushi is consistently​ fresh/clean everything you want in a sushi place. Happy hour is prime. Don't​ have anything negative​ to say about this beautiful new spot. I love everything down to the glassware​ and bar tools.

Great staff, great food and great atmosphere. The staff was friendly, accommodating, and professional. My wife an I enjoyed the decor and the food. The waitress stopped by multiple times to check on us and our young son. She even played with him for a bit. The staff seems to be close knit and fun loving. We'll be coming back.
Great spot for a shave and a cut. No wait, great service. The guy who shaved me had been in the business for over 30 years. Needless to say I wasn't nicked.

Recently stopped in during a bar crawl for some drinks and Battletoads. Couldn't eat the buzz away, but loved what I saw. Photos on walls showed the transformation from Tahiti Joe's/Latitudes into The Bricks of today, and brought back some old Ybor memories. The staff was kind, and the video game corner was a blast. Delicious coffee, and had an artsy feel as well. Every food item that passed our sniffers en route to their respective hipster pie holes was cause for comment. I will certainly be coming by for a sammich at this place.

Oh how I miss you, Wawa!

This was the Wawa that I visited frequently for lunch when I worked in Philly.  Now that I work near Au Bon Pain, Sebastian's and Cosi in Cambridge, MA and can no longer afford as many lunches, my heart yearns for thee.

Two staples that made me fat and happy:

Breakfast sandwiches and corn chowder

Their soups are delicious.  They check you out super fast.  Free ATM machines in the back.  Sandwiches are yummy and cheap, and their baked goods were always fresh.

*Sigh*

Well, at least there's now less of me mourning you.

Many improvements found after a follow up visit months after their startup.  Lighting has improved, chips are much better, service was spot on and outside of a service error at the table next to mine, I'd call this location a solid three star location.

This place just opened, and I had a coupon so my friend and I decided to check it out.  It's really close to USF, and they have great lunch and dinner specials.  You can get a full meal (including soup, salad, and two rolls) for $8/$9 at lunchtime or $10/$11 at dinnertime.  
The service was very quick and friendly, as well.  The waiter *actually told us* that the dinner special was a better deal than what I would have gotten with my coupon.   
Great quality for the price --  I'm a big white tuna fan, and theirs definitely did not disappoint!

Hmm, Ok, I'm lookin at these other reviews and I'm wondering if we went to the same place!. Grantid, this is the NEW location in the strip mall on the corner of Carrollton and Hampson. I RARELY give 5 stars but this place slapped some damn good food on my plate. But I'm gonna back it up and start from the beginning. When we sat down we were asked what we would like to drink,  a Pinot Noir I said. They didnt have it (their wine list is actually limited) so I had a Merlot. The waiter explained that since they didnt have their liquor license the wine was free!  Shit! give me a bottle then! Our waitress was both informative and friendly. Her suggestions were awsome!  My companion and I could not belive how awsome our entrees were. Its an intimate resteraunt that has the whole casual dining experience down. This is going to be one of my old reliable places to get fantastic food. It should also be the next place that you eat out. I'm just so happy that its in my "hood". Carrollton in da house! So, guess what...this is one of my best meals in recent memory and it only cost $35 for 2 people. Now, thats because the wine was free. But I'd gladly pay top dollar for wine to have that meal again!  Ok, I'm gonna shut up now.....just go.

This is our second Christmas visit.  We will not be returning.  On arrival it took 30 minutes for each person to be checked in.  Lines were long.  On the second day we tried to leave the parking lot and our card would not work.  Cars were backed up.  We all called trying to get someone to come out and help us.  No one came.  Finally another resident used their card and we were all able to get out.  The final insult was to get home and find that a large number of our clothes were missing.  Many were new from Christmas gifts.  We tipped the hotel staff every day.  We will never return.  For the prices we had to pay in premium rooms we are greatly disappointed.

We flew out from Los Angeles and planned on staying here just for our first night.  We were planning on spending the rest of our stay downtown.  This was our first trip to Nashville and I had some relatives stay here and express how great it was.  I booked our reservations 3 weeks in advance and received the usual emails from Marriott before the trip letting us know how they were looking forward to seeing us.

We arrived at the hotel around 4:00 to check-in.  This is when things went downhill.  The gentleman at the desk apologized and said he had bad news for us.  Apparently, the hotel was way overbooked for the night as they had something big going on at their convention center and we would be unable to stay there.  He said the "good" news was they were setting us up at the Airport Marriott 5 miles away and we would not be charged for our night's stay.  We did not really care about the money as we paid hundreds of dollars to fly to Nashville for the experience. Several other guests who were checking in were getting the same story.  There was nothing we could do and we were really upset.  My wife stood to the side with her back turned away from the center atrium rejecting this overrated place.  Thereafter, we left and did not have any interest in coming back to look around then or ever again. 

It is our guess that they bumped anyone who was staying just for one night as that would put us lower on the priority list to stay.  I guess all I could say is I would be weary about booking a reservation with this hotel and being confident that you will get your room.
I am so pleased with this place, for a get down and dirty messy delicious burger...can't be beat!  Love the Roasted Peanuts in the shell!
I am delighted to hear that Gary's carry 2 Degrees Bars!

Probably the best liquor store in town.  I accidentally stumbled across this amazing store after going out for dinner one night and spent almost an hour inside.  They have a huge walk in fridge/cooler room with every craft beer/ale/specialty pretty much everything from pretty much everywhere you can imagine. In addition to that, their liquor selection is vast and diverse as well.  They have a generous selection of imported alcohol that I don't think I've seen anywhere else in Canada.  In addition to their amazingly vast selection of alcohol, they also have adorable cups, mixology gadgets and trinkets, and fun kitchen stuff.  Even though it's a little out of the way, everyone should come to Sherbrooke liquor to get their alcohol!! You won't be sorry you took the extra trip :)

This place was the only place with a lot of stars and over 600 yelpers were on board stating it was good...

Unfortunately this place was simply okay. There is a sign in sheet by the door and the place is a small restaurant and maybe a five table seating outside, inside seemed crowded.

After standing there I noticed a side window and tables across the way, felt that we were hungry and really didn't want to wait.

Went with the shrimp and scallop pasta dish with linguine and it wasn't outstanding, it was okay. Also tried their clam chowder and the clams were non existing. 

My date tried their shrimp tacos (2) with some rice, she said they were okay, nothing great either.

Bill came out to $45 for just okay food. I for one don't mind spending on good food, but I truly felt this place was hype.

Oh well.
Very good pancakes and eggs! I knocked it a star because it was a breakfast place with bad coffee (burnt, flavorless). Can't have that.

They were nice enough to let us eat here even though the BFF and I were dressed way too casually for dinner. But then again, how do you turn away money paying customers?! Right?! Lol

Waited for 30-45 min to get seated because we didn't have reservations but as long as you're in before closing time they are able to still seat you. We've been wanting to try this place so we didn't mind the wait. 

For starters, we had the Truffled Garlic fries. It's served with a half head of freshly roasted garlic. Very good!

I had the Honey Ginger Pork chops! Wow! This dish is delish!! I'll remember this as a really amazing dish because it was so flavorful and there is so much meat to get you full! It's served with Jasmine rice so it reminded me of an Asian inspired dish which I love Asian food! 

My BFF had the bacon wrapped shrimp and grits! The only shrimp and grits I always compare everything to is from Dante's and Mr. B's is just as good, if not, better! The grits were very creamy. Once you've had really really good shrimp and grits, you tend to judge everyone else's harder and I can honestly say, the shrimp and grits here is outstanding!

For dessert, we shared the buttered pecan pie....and wow!!! This was awesome! I love how the pecans are chopped! It's served with French vanilla ice cream and it's making my mouth water just writing about it. Yum yum yum!! We asked a couple different waiters which dessert they preferred and they said pecan pie. Glad we took the advice. 

Mr. B's makes it to the top of my list!
Great food, but I'm not Cajun expert. What I was more impressed with was the excellent service. Very well trained staff. A little pricey, but that's the only negative thing I could say.

I love this place. I came here for the second time last weekend and as far as seafood goes, it will never let me down.

The only reason I took off a star was because I listed my family's name down and they skipped over it. We came for lunch on a Saturday at 2:00pm and I had listed my name, then crossed the first one out since it was a bit messy, then wrote it again right next to it. After about 25 minutes of waiting, they call our names, say the table will be ready soon, and never call us again. We figure out that our name has already been crossed off. UGH! So, we had to list our name again and waited another 15 minutes. In total, we waited approximately 40 minutes -____-

Anyways, we had their oyster shooters, rock crab, lobster, lobster tacos, and calamari sandwich - all of which were very good. Very fresh! Very tasty! The lobster and crab also came with soup and salad beforehand. The clam chowder is amazing. It's so good. I don't know how they do it. Maybe it's something with the clams and fresh seafood. 

Overall, I love this place. I understand it was a misunderstanding that our names were crossed off the list, but still, if I didn't love this place, I wouldn't have waited that extra 15 minutes.
The food is out of this world. The sweet Italian sausage, the striped bass, the salmon. Delicious!  And Victoria is the best.waitress.ever. She took such great care of us. No one better.

The service was excellent and friendly, starting with the host -- in jeans on a Saturday night, which I preferred to some of the over-dressed stuffiness elsewhere in the FQ -- and I'm guessing from another review that he is the owner. The food was just ok. I had the rabbit, which was reasonable but nothing special. The most striking thing about it was that carrot appeared in three forms: diced in the stew, carrots among the baby veg side, and a pickled raw carrot unnecessary garnish. And, seriously, baby veg? I expected classic Creole, and didn't need to know that the chef cut his teeth in the 1970s or whenever those were popular. If you're looking for a restaurant with no wait at 8pm on a Saturday, this is an option, but you might prefer to look for a better one.

I didn't eat here but just stopped in for some drinks.  Nice outdoor area that is perfect for people watching on south street.  the beer list is shockingly good for a place that doesn't have a real reputation in the craft beer community.  

The service was a little subpar.  I think we may have actually had a barback/bus boy as our server which wasn't a big deal given that we just wanted a drink and a place to sit outside for a while.  Since its on South St. it is going to get a mixed crowd but that's part of the appeal.  

I don't think i'd go in the winter and sit inside but when the weather is nice and you want to check out the happenings on south st. its a good place to sit outside and grab a drink.

This place might serve the BEST Indian food I have ever had in America! We had the Bollywood dosa, railway cutlet, idli vada sambar n utthapam! Everything we tried exceeded our expectations by tenfolds. The flavors were so authentic that it reminds you of food in India. The place is small and quaint... very much a hole in the wall place. Will definitely return to try more amazing dishes!!!!!!

Off the charts! Superior flavors, hearty portion sizes, creative menu, hip vibe. Allergen indicators on menu would be my only suggestion! Erin, our waitress, was visibly annoyed both times I've visited for having to field my inquiries (celiac, not lifestyle choice). But the warmth and hospitality of the owner and other staff more than made up for her! Amazing addition to Boise and we love that it's off the beaten path.

I wanted to get the bbq shrimp, but they come fully dressed, and i'm not a fan of having to work for my meal, so didnt go that route. Glad I didnt, especially since my friend got them and he had to wear a bib, sucka! had the shrimp and grits instead and they were the best ever. 

the atmosphere is a little too stuffy yet has a bit of a diner feel...so thats not my fave, but i'd go back for the shrimp for sure!

BBQ shrimp, two nights in a row.  Yes, it's that good.  The pork belly fig/spinach appetizer is amazing.  Our first night, we walked in at 9:30pm and were surprised that they were no longer seating at tables, as they close at 10pm.  We were served at the bar, where it was gracially explained, most fine dining restaurants in the FQ close by 10pm.  The reason is legitimate as "nothing good walks in after 10pm".  If you were hungry and wanted their shrimp, you shoulda gotten there by 6.  I couldn't agree more.  Lots of drinking happening in the FQ, and we were just grateful that they seated and served us at the bar.  Came back the next day for a proper sit down dinner and we were not dissappointed.
Plenty of space by the bar to wait for our table. Great service and friendly staff. Food was very good. Although my 1 1 1 appetizer was room temp. Still I'll be back!

This place is amazing, we walked in at 630 on a Friday night with decent weather, and none of the pro sports teams in town. Somehow snagged a table. The staff hostile was polite, and said give me a minute and I'll get you seated. She did just that. 

The ambiance is amazing, beautiful place, nice decorated with a modern feel. Comfortable seating. Good lighting.

Waiter(Brian) was awesome, he knew the drinks, he knew the menu.

Thw drinks came quickly, and were perfectly made. ( it was busy)

Sushi....was....amazing...
It came quickly, was plated nicely, and the fish was beatifilly cut, and tasted like it was swimming this morning.

We had quite the feast sampling several of the menu options. Sushi, sashimi, rolls, blah blah blah. It's great 
You won't regret coming here.

I do recommend getting a reservation, we lucked out.

It's not cheap, but you should already know that by the $$$$ on the main Paige for reviews....very worth it by any standard.

I can find myself here at least once a week even in the summer for their soft tofu or soondubu. I brought my boyfriend here for his first soondubu, and he's now hooked. They have a scale on how spicy you like your tofu to be (1-nonspicy to 5-very spicy), and the portions are generous. I'm always walking out of the door with a full and satisfied tummy. 
After ordering they serve you five side dishes, that compliment the meal perfectly. Instead of trying to flag your server down, there is a button on the table that you ring if you need them. They also bring you a pitcher of water or tea--depending on which on you have--so you don't have to constantly ask for refills. Although I never tried the Korean pancake yet, I always want to order it because it looks so yummy, and its huge. 
Parking is available on the side (where the door is), and on the street, even arriving around peak dinner time on a Saturday, parking was not a problem.
This is my favorite Korean restaurant in Philly, and I HIGHLY recommend it.

Bub's Cafe is a great place for breakfast or lunch. It's in walking distance and I go there frequently. However, I have been very disappointed with the host/hostess stand people my last two visits. I have put my name in on the wait list to sit outside to only have people working the host/hostess stand take people to a table when they initially walk up to put their name on the wait list instead of seating the people that were there first. Staff needs to look at their wait list and work it appropriately!!!!  If you don't watch host/hostess stand people you may not get seated!!!

I'm speechless so I'll keep my review short and sweet...

Service, Food, Décor all amazing... My server was attentive and outgoing.  I ordered the Pork shank which was finger licking good; tender and seasoned to perfection.  If you enjoy phenomanel food, this is your place..

Well, when I got there they were closed for lunch, and I just missed it by 10 minutes. I had walked 2 miles to get there but I didn't realize they closed after lunch. The manager told me that I could go to the bar because they had a limited menu there. So, I went to the bar top where I was ignored for about 5 minutes, the 2 bartenders didn't even make eye contact with me or even let me know that they would be with me in a minute. There was only 4 other people at the bar at the time. I was going to order the BBQ shrimp because I have heard rave reviews about them, but when I asked if they de-vein the shrimp the bartender told me know. Well, as I have mentioned before, this is really culinary 101 here folks, how many times have you heard a chef like Gordon Ramsay or Bobby Flay etc. tell people to de-vein those things because no one wants to eat their poop tract!! The bartender asked me if I liked crab cakes and I smiled and told hime that I loved them and that I was a bit of a connoisseur about them. Well, he told me that they had the best in town and that I wouldn't be disappointed. Well, he couldn't have been more wrong! Although they had a good amount of crab in them, they were one note and quite tasteless, I was really disappointed to say the least. I walked all that way for nothing.......guess maybe I might go back and try something else on the menu, I don't know yet.

First timer here. I am in town for a conference and decided to get my hairs cut. Checked yelp and decided on this place. I called to make an appointment and was able to get in that day. I was greeted as i walked in and offered an adult beverage of my choice. I chose an amber ale. Sat down for a few minutes as i was a bit early for my appointment. Eric was my barber and he called me and we began.  He sat me down in the chair and asked me what i was looking to be done with my hair. After that it was hot towel and shampoo time. Then back to the chair for the cut. Then back to the basin for a final rinse. Then back to the chair for the final styling and tips to maintain the cut. Eric was informative and very easy to talk to. Thanks again. If i am ever back in Nashville i will definitely go here again.

I get breakfast and bagels from here just about every weekend. I love their everything bagels, best j e had in philly. Their pancakes are good, both special but hit the spot. Corn muffins are quite tasty and their blueberry muffins are good too, just a bit sweet for me. Service is always very good.

Loved the vibe and music and the service was great. I ordered the salmon and it was excellent.  However, my boyfriend ordered the Noble Pig pizza and it was very soggy. Besides that, it was a great experience and we'd come back.

I just ordered the Bison Burger with a gluten-free bun for dinner tonight and it was so delicious! The grass fed burgers at Burger Up are the best I have tried in Middle Tennessee. Highly recommend :)

Great place !! My first time so the guy behind the counter made it very simple to order, with me just telling him what foods I like ...the chow mein  noodles are fine like angel hair, so it's definitely different but I would recommend this place to anyone ...not very expensive either 20$ for 2 large meals
Great ice cream with a wonderful assortment of flavors.  Anytime I visit downtown Nashville, a stop here is almost a requirement.
Excellent for lunch. Have the pecan pie!  Excellent service with lots attention to detail. Waiter was also helpful in recommendations.

It was so difficult deciding what to order here. I was in the mood for a skanky chai latte, but the skinny bitch latte just had that calorie conscious ring to it.

After a bit of thought I decided, skanky it shall be!

This has got to be one of my favorite places in Tampa. I had never really put a pulse on "hipster" in Tampa, but I found the closest thing to it at Bricks. Plenty of space to lounge here with a nice offering that ranged from caffeinated beverages to brews and snacks.

I would have never typically thought to throw bacon on a peanut butter and banana sandwich and then drizzle with honey, but I'm glad someone did.
The Elvis sandwich is a hunka, hunka, burning yum!

I would give this place five stars all day, except for the fact that service is slow. Like, dial-up slow. Like larvae to butterfly metamorphosis slow. So slow in fact that on a pretty *slow* afternoon, it would take 20 minutes just to get an iced chai even though you have a clear view of queue and activity of the servers. So slow that from time of check request to actually receiving it, was about another 20 minutes.

While the laid back atmosphere is one of the things that makes this place so cool, it's also the incredibly laid back service that could put a damper on things if you're in a rush.
Waiting staffs r great but raw oysters r dirty n torn. We order the seafood stuff mushrooms n it is dry n salty. The 2 lbs lobster was actually 1 1/4 pound.

Quick, delicious and fresh. This was my first trip, so I didn't know what to expect, but I knew it better be good since walk to get there was so long. Lol
Anywho, all the ingredients are right there at your disposal,     And fresh! The prices are great, build your own any toppings for $7.95, that's a steal. And the staff was extra friendly, helpful and quick!!!!!

Man oh Man.

This is by far my favorite generic center city deli.  First off, they have some really innovative sandwich constructions.  A personal fave of mine is the Brian, which combines turkey (tastes freshly roasted), muenster, sauteed garlicky greens and pears (!?!) on some griddled bread.  I also like the option of getting my chicken or tuna salad made with fat free mayo.  

All sandwiches come with a side.  The asian pasta salad? gross.  But the whole wheat pasta with eggplant and sun dried tomatoes? A little cup of heaven.  

Occasional mistakes due to quick service are understandable, but the source for the lack of a 5th star.

Also, bagel chips while you wait (lines are long but move fast) and prices are somehow always below what's quoted on the board.  I don't really understand their discounting, but I'm not complaining...

They have a pretty big selection and more than just sandwiches.  While not the most interesting lunch, in the wasteland between 16th and 21st on Market, this is a gem.

What a huge disappointment. Note, we did not stay there but since we were traveling through Nashville on St. Patrick's day, I thought I would take my wife there for dinner and to watch the NCAA bracket announcements.
I had heard and read that there was a great sports bar in the hotel. Drove over, found out we had to PAY $20 JUST TO PARK. 
So, came that far so figured what the H.
Wandering around the hotel took quite awhile to find Fusio? We asked several employees and it seemed like we kept getting incorrect answers.
Finally found it, and guess it was closed. A Sports bar closed on the day the NCAA's were announced?  And Jack Daniels was closed.
We ended up eating at the Irish Pub where the food was just so so and expensive for what we got.
I came, I saw, I won't return.

Came in to an almost empty restaurant. Tucked in location off of bay to bay. Lit bit of outdoor seating. Inside seating felt chipotle-esk. Not your typical sushi spot. If you crave the typical asian atmosphere this is not your place. Our server was not Asian. Open kitchen visible for patrons. I had green tea, edamame salad, miso soup, and a rose cave roll. Edamame salad was okay.. I prefer the hot edamame with salt. The rose cave roll was okay as well. Nothing to rave about. I probably will not be back but mostly because I like the typical Asian decor service experience.

I've always loved mellow mushroom. this place was no exception. very consistent across their restaurants.

tried the potato pizza, wouldn't try again but wasn't bad. got the pretzels with marinara, always love those. great to share.

drinks were good, had some apple pie cocktail and some other refreshing cocktail, both great. 

we also sat on the patio which was nice and relaxing. apparently upstairs they have karaoke sometimes?

even though there are a lot of good pizza places in town and this place is a chain, would rate this high up with the other ones and would choose this place just as often.

Flat out wonderful. Everything we ordered was tasty, beautifully arranged, and fresh. My husband had the fried chicken and really liked it. It was tender, juicy, freshly fried, and served over a delicious bed of black eyed peas and rice. It was a tad spicy, but totally delicious! The corn was by far the best ever! It was absolutely perfect. Tender, flavorful, and dusted with cotija cheese. I had the flatbread which was also good, but I'd probably go with another choice the next time we dine here. The side of cornbread was a lovely addition to the fried chicken. Warm, cake-like, and drizzled with fresh honey. If that's not enough to entice you, let me mention the pecan pie we had for dessert. Nothing compares! Although the meal was a little more on the expensive side, every bite felt worth it. Sit outside to avoid the rowdy indoor bar area, or if you're into that, it seemed liked a good scene. Must try it!

Food was really good. I got a bacon blue cheese burger. It was a fantastic burger. Perfectly cooked, the blue cheese was awesome. The beer wasn't the coldest but it was good. That's why the 4 stars. Would definitely go back
Amazing food and great quality. So much variety. My favorite place to come when I visit Tampa!
Adorable small place with indoor and outdoor seating. Food was good with good portion. Service was top notch. Always had full glasses of water.

One of the best steaks I've ever had. Got the creamed spinach for an appetizer, the Double Cut Filet Mignon, and Morton's hot chocolate cake, which oozes godiva chocolate and has Haagendaaz ice cream on the side. It gave me multiple foodgasms :). This place is pretty pricy, but if you want one of the best steaks out there, this is the place to check out!
Great food and amazing service. One of the best place in NOLA. Really enjoyed the shrimp BBQ!

Went here recently for a dude's night out. Has a kind of old-school Italian decor. Service was fantastic. The food was pretty good, not great. Prices are about what you'd expect. I probably won't be back soon, but if you've never been I do recommend you try it.
Ate at the New Orleans store.  It was great. I had never been to Blaze before. The pizza artist helped me understand what I was doing. My pizza was delicious!

Great little family run Italian restaurant..Lunch was great,all homemade dishes.We had classic dishes as I always do my first time in a restaurant,eggplant parmigiana,spaghetti and meatballs and chicken piccata!!Each dish came out piping hot,enough to split,we all had leftovers and they were very very good!!Bread and soup or salad comes with your entree,$9.99 is a great deal considering the quality/portions..I will be back this weekend for dinner!!Chris the owner Chef was very gracious and knows his stuff!
Bartender told me, best Whiskey selection in Phila....decent pricing (as opposed to indecent pricing.... Whiskey Village, but I  like them too)

Mikes was a mid day dessert, and boy were we glad we came in.  The blackberry cornbread ice cream is out of this world!!

There are actual pieces of cornbread in the ice cream.  Who knew these would go together this well.  If you are in the neighborhood, definitely stop by.  You won't be sorry.

The ice cream is creamy and not too sweet.

I'll re-review this place once they get their liquor license. There's definitely some irony in a place called Mezcal that doesn't actually serve it, but I'm sure it's not their fault and they're just waiting for the city to tell them they can legally sell what people can legally drink outside on the sidewalk. I digress.

The best thing about the restaurant is the decor. I love it. It's interesting enough to blow way past tacky and circle back around to being attractive and fun.

The second best thing is the hot sauce they have on the table, the first hot sauce I've had on a restaurant table in New Orleans that actually applied a higher ratio of heat than vinegar. I'm a hot sauce nut, and I'll do some dousing in Crystal or Tabasco if it's right for the dish. But those are not spicy hot sauces, and I don't want them anywhere near my Mexican food.

As for the food, it was hit or miss. The tacos were good, but not outstanding. I had the pork with chicharrones, and the chicharrones actually seemed like bagged pork rinds. It was a good taco concept, and I enjoyed it, but it didn't have the taste and texture of mama's homemade chicharrones (translation for Louisianas - it's the difference between grandmama's cracklin and what you buy off a shelf at the corner store). The sides were mostly good, but one, the charred onions, were fibrous and inedible.

The worst part about the meal, though, were the taco tortillas. They were blue. And I don't mean blue corn, blue. I mean like bright, blue-green blue. Like Florida Marlins teal. Like, this is not the color of food in the real world blue. Like I don't really want to eat this blue. Not that it stopped me, mind you. But I wish it was just a normal-colored taco.

As a local, I have been coming here since I was a little girl. I hadn't been back in years until the other night. I came in and sat at the bar for date night and had a blast. Pete, our server or potentially manager, made us Bloody Mary's made with so much care. They were absolutely delicious even with out having vodka in them (used a substitute to obey liquor licenses) our food was delicious and fresh and the ambiance has not changed since I can remember. Huge shout out to Pete, I work in the industry as an F&B manager and his hustle and dedication did not go unnoticed. Incredibly impressed.

Just as Martha had mentioned in her review, Kelly's must have been such a dump at the time I was at 'Nova that I either can't remember or avoided having to go there... jump ahead to 2009 and Kelly's is a real nice pub in the mainline.  Usually populated with 'Nova supporters of all ages, there are a handful of large flat screen tv's throughout the bar as well as a large projection screen on the mid-level.  

Good crowd, good pub food, good service, and an option to play photohunt by the bar.  What more can you ask for?

If you are ever in Conshohocken and are craving italian, this is the place to go. My god this place is delicious. 

I went on a double date during restaurant week, so I had a set menu to choose from. However, their menu compared to others during restaurant week was pretty large with several options. I even asked for no  mushrooms and they were able to accommodate. Not all places do that during restaurant week. 

The restaurant is a quaint area with food to die for. Fresh pasta, bread, and BYO! They were a bit busy as it seemed like there was a large party, however, the waiters handled it with ease. My boyfriend and I are excited to go back and take a look at the whole menu.

Such a modern new place to eat in the wiregrass mall. I recommend making a reservation because going on a weekend the place is packed! I had the bronzed salmon which was the best salmon i've ever had and we also got the chicken parmesan which was amazing and the meatball app. Service was great and the food is well worth the prices!
Vegetarian or not, Blue Sage has some amazing dishes. The pressed sandwiches are filling and flavorful. The chefs really know how to blend flavors well.

Carmine's Steakhouse provides a reasonable Steak along with a admissible ambiance in DTSTL.

 After the raucous afternoon at the Rams game I decided that an agreeable meal was in order. Eschewing the Ruth Chris chain experience, I figured that Carmine's Steakhouse would offer a more uniquely "Saint Louis" feel. To be forthcoming it really feels like a Hotel Restaurant (as it is) which in and of itself is not a particularly bad thing, it is just the service was a bit stiff and forced for my liking. Also, the interior is quite dated.

The menu is about as stereotypical as Steak House dining gets and all of the usual suspects in Midwestern dining are well represented. The local favorite "Toasted Ravioli" was my first order in and is came to the table at breakneck speed. Basically it is the same as any Ravioli, just twice the size and Breaded and deep fried. Considering the great hype surround the dish i was honestly underwhelmed. It basically tasted like an amalgamation of Ground Beef, grease and Marinara with a bit of crunchy mouth feel mixed in. Ho hum at best but I came for steak, so it was not a deal killer at that point. 

As for the Steak, Carmine's does put out a very solid 21 day aged Bone-In Ribeye when they get the temperature right. On the kitchen's first attempt my Steak came to the table still eating the salad. After returning it to the kitchen (I loathe doing this), a perfectly marbled 20 ounce piece of charred delight came to my table seared to order (medium rare) along with Steak Butter on their second try. Returning meat to a kitchen in a Steakhouse always irks me, but at least they erred to the side of caution.  

As I side I ordered the Twice Baked Potato which was rather uninspired and boring thanks too being under-seasoned. 

In closing, Carmine's Steakhouse is probably a pass for future visits if and when I get back to Saint Louis as there are several other Chop Houses in the area that deserve a fair shake before a return trip. 2 stars and moving on.

The Positives:  The food is delicious...loads of meat on the gyro and the gyro salad.  I highly recommend both.  Their pita bread is hot and irresistible.  We have eaten there many times and I am sure we will return.  

The Negatives:  It is a tiny place and tables/seating isn't very comfortable.  They also do not offer free water.  You must buy a soda or bottled water.  This isn't a big deal for some, but drinking water is one of the ways we try to cut expenses so that we can eat out more often.  (Really?  You can't provide a small plastic cup?)  They also ran a coupon in the Entertainment Book which they will not honor.  Finally, on several occasions I have found small bits of bone in the meat.  Again, not a huge deal, but not exactly ideal.

Recommendation:  Watch for a coupon and get food  "To Go"

Absolutely love Caleco's! I had bites from the Baked lasagna, Baked spaghetti, White sauce pasta, and the Red sauce pasta. It was all completely phenomenal! The Gooey butter cake was the best thing I've ever eaten. Do yourself a favor and go here!

Good place for hangover ,not a usual place to eat . Great food (Mexican) people are very nice . Is not a fancy restaurant with all kind electronics things . It's a mom and pops place . Food is real you can get as Mexican culture . Try!!! But be OPEN MIND

We stopped in for lunch- as my husband was having a recollection of a great chicken and pasta meal he had a year or so ago- I looked over the menu and ordered a Bibb and blue salad, crispy artichoke appetizer and pomodoro soup. He had chicken Marsala. Our server was Denise. It was early, 1140 or so- not busy or rushed to say in the least. Our order was brought to us in a timely manner, my husband enjoyed the mushrooms in the entree, the chicken was cold around the edges and a bit chewy. I had a salad with greens that were not as fresh as I like, the dressing was flavorless and the artichokes were definitely  NOT crispy- but tasted ok. My husband had to ask for Parmesan and cracked pepper, also the soup was forgotten and cold when served. I can't understand some of the reviews with 4 stars- as this meal was not terrible, but freshness and adequate temperature were seriously lacking. Our bright spot was the male who was attentive, smiled and had a great attitude overall. Our waitress needed a little help in the customer service area. I would say that this meal was not a terrible experience, but I gave it two stars for a really good reason. Maybe next time.

As a vegetarian, this place rocks!!! Their Brussels sprouts are awesome!!! To top it off the service was fantastic!! Our waitress suggested the bread pudding and we were blown away! We will be back soon!

I have been going to brew brothers since I was 18 (I'm now 28), the food- while basically american classics, is outstanding. I travel for work and whenever I go to Reno I have dinner at least one night here. As far as food goes I highly recommend the ribs (smoked 14 hours!), They have large and flavorful salads, rich and creamy soups, and some great burgers/ sandwiches. Their Pizza is also really popular (i get the margehritta). You can order food to go which is great if you still have work to do in your room.

For drinks; its a brewery so of course they have wide selection of beer varietals. You can see some of the brew tanks inside the restaurant. They also house make their rootbeer, very tasty. They have a personal favorite on their wine list (ferari carano which you'll find throughout the El Dorado) and they have a full bar.

I usually sit at the bar and most of the bar tenders are quick and friendly, Tim and Elijah have served me most of the times I've been and I feel completely comfortable sitting at the bar alone. There is plenty of seating there at the bar or at the tables. Sadly I often feel that the hostesses are less than happy to see you but once your seated the service is good. 

Entertainment- live everynight starting at 9pm, sometimes its live karoke but usually a cover band (all that I've seen there were good). Its a great place to get your dance on without the club athmosphere.

Since the restaraunt is at a casino there isn't a restroom inside, you have to walk just a short distance through some slot machines to get to it, not too bad exept the smell of ciggarette smoke is hard to avoid (not Brew Brothers fault though).
Delicious. A bit of a wait at lunch but so Worth it.  I got an artist pie with pepperoni and spinach added. Yum.
Our party had Chicken Satay combo, Thai basil eggplant and pumpkin curry , loved it all.   We will be back when in area.

Homemade ice cream, fro yo, waffle cones, and nice people.  Need I say more?!  I went with the frozen yogurt since I was trying to be "healthy" and it was delish but I was kind of jealous of my friends once I saw their heaping scoops of mint chocolate chip and cookies and cream.  Maybe next time!

I thought over this rating for quite some time, and also ran it by my boyfriend who accompanied me here this morning.  I was hesitant to rate this at 2 stars especially due to the other reviews that came before me (4 stars, 5 stars, etc)- which, by the way, was WHY we came here in the first place rather than going somewhere else.  Im going to start right off the bat with what I and my boyfriend ordered.  I ordered a cappuccino (I have been ordering them EVERYWHERE lately so I base my experience on everywhere else in fishtown/no libs that offers a cappuccino) and my boyfriend ordered his usual plain iced coffee (he orders it even in the dead of winter so he's tried an iced coffee all over as well).  Ill get to the point, my cappuccino was 'eh'- it tasted burnt and unpure.  I'm no coffee connoisseur but I do know a good cup when I taste one and this wasn't it.  My boyfriend said his iced coffee tasted watered down and unremarkable.  He ordered an everything bagel with butter and I just opted for a yogurt because thats what I was in the mood for.  The bagel was also 'eh' and the butter literally tasted like nothing (not sure if that's what theyre going for or not but it was unremarkable as well).  All in all, that's exactly our experience this morning- unremarkable.  I hate leaving reviews like this because I want to give places the benefit of the doubt and maybe we just didn't order a good signature coffee that theyre known for or maybe we should have tried a pastry but I had to go by the rating system and since I went by the rating system, the experience was "Meh. I've experienced better."  The prices are better than other coffee shops in the area but that doesnt mean the quality should lack.  I'd rather pay the extra couple of bucks for a really truly good experience.  
And when I talk experience I am not just referring to the food and drink.  The establishment itself was "meh"- water stains on the ceiling (signifying a leak of some sort- not something to take lightly) and overall the interior decor was just shotty.  Granted, the floor was clean (always something I look for), the service was polite but not out of their way friendly, the utensils were clean and there werent any bugs floating in my drink, but at 2 stars as Yelp's rating states- my experience was all around 'meh'.  Sorry reAnimator- I left your place un-animated and unimpressed.

I don't know how to NOT make this review annoying.  You've been warned.

Here's the thing:  I'm new to Nashville, and in the months leading up to our move (from Oklahoma no less, so pretty much anything with electricity AND running water impresses me) I fantasized about what Nashville would be to me.  Creative, diverse, full of energy, and mohawks, and skinny girls in scarves.  I could be someone better in Nashville.

So now I'm here, and I'm still completely boring, but everything else I idealized Nashville to be I found at Edgehill Cafe.  I was there midday on a Wednesday, and had a nonfat latte (see? BORING!).  The cafe was busy, but I still found a small table right away to set up.  The furniture is coffee house eclectic, and I was very excited to see a large wrap around couch in one area.  Someone occupied it the entire time I was there, and I bet she got a lot done--it is the kind of nook that just inspires creativity.

I was able to sit and work for a few hours uninterrupted, and even went back to order an iced tea.  While I didn't  order food, I noticed that everyone who did looked quite pleased with themselves.  I will definitely be back for a meal and a glass of wine!  

Next time, though, I'll bring headphones.  The cafe is clearly a hub for business meetings, job interviews, and retired musician reminiscing.  If you have a list to accomplish, and have an eavesdropping tendency, as I do, prepare to be distracted!

We were looking for a dinner alternative so we went to Mike's. The line was not terribly long which was great.  Ice cream was yummy! It was not as creamy as I had hoped - almost a little crumbly until it melted a little. I loved the red velvet and mint white chocolate Oreos. I would recommend trying.

I came here because a friend highly recommended it. 

Just in location alone, at the end of a pier, in beautiful Santa Barbara, a small bar/shack restaurant, it is a fun and romantic set up.

The place is small and everyone is seated counter style along the kitchen and along the windows. There are some tables outside as well. You will get to know your neighbors, so get ready to be cozy. But I found this part of the charm and fun.

The seafood is fantastic. Fresh, simple and just a pleasure. I have been here twice, the first time we shared the 3 lb crab, shared the clam chowder and both had oyster shooters and an extra order of onion rings. The crab was fresh and that platter was worth it. The clam chowder had lots of chunks of clam and a good briny broth. The oyster shooters were delicious. The onion rings were more heavily battered than I liked, but still tasty.

The second time, we got ciopinno and clams strips. The cioppino was served in a large sour dough bowl brimming with a garlicky, spicy broth and chunks of scallops, shrimp, mussels and a side of crab. I LOVED IT. For winter time, this is the dish to get! We also got the clam strips and they were very well prepared. Not too heavily battered and the clams were tender.

Overall, I have several items on the menu and covered the bases among steamed and fried dishes. I will come back and look forward to making the drive to visit this place again. It's a gem!
If you ever get to go here, you should definitely get the chicken catch. It has mushrooms and a very good sauce. This is s good place to go with a "fine dine" I reckoned going here.

Roman Forum has been open for about a week. 8000 ft.² of new restaurant is a bold move, and the first impression is very good.

This is a large operation with a variety of different styles of food, and is very nicely done with an open and bright decor. You can tell that they are just getting up on their legs. Tonight's service included a very nice garden salad that was not your usual dish of iceberg lettuce with a yellow tomato. It was fresh, bright with variety and garlic bread croutons on the side.  I followed this with a 12" Margarita pizza and a tooth achingly cold Stella. I mean that in the best of ways.

My pizza was a pleasant surprise... very fresh, very nice sauce and not heavy at all. The crust was light and wonderful.

My server, Kim, was friendly and attentive and did a great job. The manager checked on me a couple times and was friendly and was encouraging me to come back with friends. She's got experience in the business and seems like a true professional.

I've had a similar business and I know what a daunting task it is to open those doors and wait for the crowds to come in. They weren't here on this first Saturday night but I have a hunch that if they keep it up there will be lots of people stopping by.
I love this place. This is my #1 spot for sushi. Food  is fresh and the services is excelente.

Disappointing.  With delicious other Mexican options close by, this place was overpriced and underwhelming.  The tacos have interesting combinations (like fried chicken) which could either be kitschy or creative but you can't mix and match which makes one apprehensive to commit to three cauliflower tacos.  Fajitas were not sizzling (which is one of the main reasons for ordering fajitas.)  Some of the drinks came out as a shot and a mixer for you to put together rather than the bartender making it for you.  Will not return.
Forgetful pub. The food is defrosted and microwaved...enough said

This place is a hidden gem in Mt Juliet! Wow! I am a die hard Woodlands Nashville fan when it comes to Indian food, but Persis has stolen my heart with their Gobi Manchuria and Bhindi Masala. 

Small and unassuming in a strip shopping center off the main drag by Providence, but don't let this fool you. The space is adorable and clean in white and gray decor, and the delicious smell hits you when you open the door. 

Our server was so sweet and friendly, and agreed with our decision of Gobi Manchuria for an appetizer. I will now get this every time I come. The spice is perfection. I always err on the side of caution and get mild spice, and it was perfect without being overpowering. 

The Bhindi Masala was a generous portion of tender chunks of okra cooked with tomatoes and onions, and the rice was cooked to perfection. My dining friend ordered the Vegetable Biryani, and I think I probably ate a lot of her food, too! Once again, a huge portion of food and the flavor was on point. 

I actually left my credit card here the first time I came in, and ended up ordering take out when I went to pick it up. If you do take out, call ahead. It can take 20-30 minutes. I have nothing bad to say--I'll be driving to Mt Juliet for my Indian cravings from now on. Yummy!

My wife & I wanted Japanese but were looking for something different than our usual Japanese go-to spots. We had previously been to Benihana, Izakaya, and Kazaan. This restaurant was the worst of the four. Our waitress was often MIA - I had to ask another waitress for a refill. My steak was overcooked and the shrimp wasn't seasoned with anything but butter. Her Yakisoba was prepared in the back kitchen as opposed to on the grill and was also under seasoned. The whole presentation by the chef was rushed and impersonal. My wife did enjoy the atmosphere better than some of the other Japanese steakhouses but the food was considerably lower in quality. Tomo's pricing is positioned lowered then the other steakhouses so our expectations were probably a bit high but we ended up spending around the same amount. If you are considering this place, pay an extra 10% and head a few miles up the road to Benihana.
LOVED tonight's burger - bacon jam?!? What?!? Great staff and good food. The Woodstock burger with aioli fries is a staple.

Recently adopted a vegan diet and have been growing tired of cooking all of my meals at home. Ordered the Havana (sub daiya non-dairy cheese) which came with mixed greens and guacamole- it 's basically a quesadilla on a whole wheat tortilla with black beans and peppers.  The quesadilla had a very nice flavor, the "cheese" didn't taste processed, but was creamy and smokey. The guacamole was excellent. Only suggestion would be to ask for a side of hot sauce, if you like things spicy- it didn't have much kick. The maple balsamic on the greens was also nice. All in all, a hearty portion, if a bit pricey- if you're tired of cooking at home for lack of good vegan/vegetarian options, Blue Sage is a wonderful and exciting treat!

Seated upstairs next to the AC unit our table and chairs vibrated through dinner.. we order Margarita's that were 12.00 and straight sweet and sour mix, not even a buzz off a 12.00 drink.  I don't know when it became acceptable for Mexican restaurants to serve nachos without adding real cheese. Our nachos were served with watered-down queso watered-down sour cream no guacamole even though the waitress told us it came with guacamole, the only positive was that they did add a generous serving if meat with the nachos and the waitress was very nice. Other than that I'd go somewhere else.
Best Mexican food in St. Charles!

The food is excellent, no matter what you order. The wine is overpriced. The service is good except we had to ask for the bread and ask for my dessert. 

The problem is  they have 2 types of menus...an a la carte and a 3 course inclusive menu...My wife ordered the lamb a la carte and I ordered the ribs as part of the three course menu that also included Hors d'oeuvre (I  ordered the  fried green  tomatoes) and dessert. (Bread pudding)...All delicious! 

When the bill came I was charged extra for the fgt even though it was not on the a la carte menu?  It was corrected as per my request. When the bill arrived again I noticed the tip was included??? I normally add a tip...Glad I did a double take...While great food..check your bill!

This was my second restaurant week stop this go-around and tbh I was v disappointed. It was a true bummer!

So, my qualms were mainly the food - for starters it was four courses. The first course was an antipasto board and let me tell you, it was a sad excuse for an antipasto board. I was looking forward to it most, but it turned out to be dry and bland. There were little cheese balls and olives and I don't even know what else. I can't remember because it was so forgettable. 

Second, I got the verde salad and it was eh. It didn't have enough avocado and it was also way too bitter. I was so excited for the pasta I ordered, but was again...sorely disappointed. The servings were small and it was extremely garlicky. For dessert I got the "chocolate cake." It came out and my friend said, "is this cake for ants." It was a tiny little circle brownie that you can get pre-packaged at Costco. 

I would totally understand if this spot had small portions cus the food was decadent and luxurious, but it wasn't at all.  It was nothing special or tasty. 

I did like the aesthetic, although casual, it was also modern and chic. It was located, however, in a weird spot attached to a We Work on 24th and Walnut. 

In all, I probs won't be back and 24 has gotta step up their restaurant week game!
Depending on what you order can be $$ but the food is awesome. It's not a fancy place and it's a busy place but it is soo worth it!

The location is five star, the service four stars and the food was two at best. Clam chowder was okay but the bread bowl was stale and tough. We also had a crab salad sandwich and it was just okay. 

Pack a lunch and just eat at the pier.

Highly recommend the best barber shop in Tennessee. 

They welcomed a large group of friends who came to support a very brave woman shaving her head in preparation for her chemo treatments. It was an emotional moment for everybody, and I do not think we could have been at a better place for it. 

A special thanks to Eric Miller. Attentive and focused on his work while having at least ten people standing right behind him and 70 more pairs of eyes watching him on the live stream.
Amazing food, great service, coming back again and again! I have been coming for years and it has the best Peruvian Food in tampa hands down

Michael Brown gives it 10 thumbs up with regards to their menu, specials, drinks, delicious foods, superb atmosphere and exceptional service (Justin)!  Dawn & I expect to make this our new home for a tasty exceptional experience.  Please stay, as the fall/winter is the time we look for a place where we could visit multiple times weekly and not be bored by what is great food and drink!!!

I understand the appeal, but not my cup of tea. Was here over the weekend since my boyfriend had a room for a work event the following week. Very crowded and very manufactured, like all of the Gaylord resorts. If you've never been, it's a cross between a Disney world resort and a wannabe Vegas resort. The hotel common areas are very pretty, with lots of foliage and greenery throughout the atrium, but the rooms were just okay and a little outdated.

Everything I have had so far is delicious! As soon as you walk in, your mouth will start watering because of the smells and spices that fills the restaurant! You can also order online and orders are ready to be picked up on time or sooner!
First time here, but the beer is outstanding and the Baja fish tacos were excellent! Really nice atmosphere for a brewpub, my server, Andres, was very attentive and got a nice tip for his service.

They are open late and they have very good ice cream. It's about the same price as any other ice cream shop would be, and they are located right in downtown where everything else is which makes it convenient to get to on Broadway.
We are here today for the buffet lunch! It was fantastic! We will be back...the wait staff was quick and efficient the food was yummy!

We cam here for my wife's birthday this year that also just so happens to be Cinco De Mayo. We didn't want to go to a mexican joint so we chose the Bricks after reading some specials that they had going online. I have to say it was a good night and a lot of fun. Good drinks as well as food. Great ambiance, this is an older building in Ybor that they really did a great job of restoring. These guys are always having great food and happy hour specials. You won't be disappointed.

i really like the food here, but the service is hit or miss.  i would definitely go if you have a bit of patience!  the cookie dough egg rolls are delicious, a definite recommendation!  when i ate meat, the best dish was the chicken salad torrado.  i also like their panini's and their cocktails!  have fun!
I had the short rib and had a taste of the sautéed scallops from my wife's dish along with sharing the cheese platter. It was delicious

The gyros at this place are awesome!  The gyros alone would make this a 5 star  The rest of the menu is hit or just ok.  This place is always clean, (in fact every time i've walked in there off peek hours they are cleaning.) but its not a fancy place and its loud in there when they are busy. I recommend taking the food to go.

Where do i start with this place!
I love that they have local art on the walls/ always doing art shows 

the staff that works there always rocking smiles talking to all the guess a all around good atmosphere vibe

I tip my hat to the head chef (Chef Ben) The food is always on point and i like when the cooks yell "ORDER UP" hahaha 

I can wright a book about how awesome this place is 

KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK and SEE YOU SOON!

No complaints about this place! My group ordered pork/shrimp & shrimp spring rolls, beef "tacos" (which are really steamed buns), a banh mi, and chicken bun. My favorites were the beef steamed bun and banh mi! The bread was perfect. The service was fast and efficient. I definitely suggest giving this place a try!!!

The wait for inside seating is always going to be super packed on a Saturday but I'd suggest opting to take the food to-go to eat on the outdoor benches, assuming that you're not afraid of birds! Those seagulls can be pretty vicious...(I'm terrified of birds so thank goodness we found a little bench off to the side of the restaurant safe from those monstrous creatures..)

My boyfriend and I wanted to grab a snack and try something from this famous restaurant. The rock crab seems to be the house favorite but we wanted something more than just crab so we opted for the cioppino in a bread bowl ($18.95). 

We expected it to come with all the seafood out of their shells. Boy, were we terribly wrong! It literally came with a leg of rock crab, and mussels and clams in their shells. At least the shrimp was ready to eat. Thus, it was a bit hard to eat the bowl but still delicious. The bread bowl itself was a little stale but still yummy once drenched in the sauce.

I'd be back to try the lobster tacos and maybe the rock crab once I'm in the mood!
Four of us, four different meals for lunch.  3 of us flexitarians, 1 a meat eater.  We ALL loves our meals.  Food was fresh and flavorful.  Can't wait to go back!

Comfort Food in a comfortable setting.  This is sort of like a more interesting version of a hometown diner; the kind of place where friendly people from the community meet and eat BUT where the food ranges from great cheeseseaks to homemade pasta, grilled veggies and Asian delicacies.  The specials are always changing and so creative and tasty. I never order off the menu and usually ask Misha, the delightful owner/chef,  to make me whatever she likes. It is always a wonderful surprise. Try the homemade dumplings for lunch. For breakfast, pancakes are the best around. Call ahead to order if you are in a rush. This place is busy; especially around lunchtime.  Or take it outside and sit at the tables on the sidewalk for a moving portrait of small town Americana.

I am really overwhelmed by the amount of frozen yogurt shops that are springing up everywhere (especially between Broadway and West End - yikes!). I do love my fro-yo, but sometimes I need a some real ice cream in my life. (Especially with the growing prices of self-serve yogurt, non-identifiable soft serve, and other 'yogurt like' desserts that can't even be called yogurt.. sheesh!)

What brings me back to Mike's is their delicious red velvet cake ice cream. It is full of pieces of real red velvet cake AND cream cheese frosting pieces. DELICIOUS! I don't mind throwing a quarter into a parking meter so I can run in to Mike's and pick up a single scoop. It is totally worth it.
The food is good but the service is pretty bad. My food came out 10 minutes prior to my friend's food and we had planned to eat TOGETHER so I had the server re-heat my food.

This is our second time going to capital cellars. I'm leaving my review based on price point and comparison to other similar priced venuses such as Brick 29, Chandlers, Ruth Chris and Alavita.  We had a salmon fish and a seafood risotto dish.  For appatizer we had a bowl of French onion soup, no doubt the best thing the entire night.  The salmon should have never made it to our table. Even a new chef would have know it was way over cooked and extremely dry.  The seafood risotto was ok but nothing I'd pay $20+ for.  This was our second go at the place and for sure our last.  I always give a place two attempts to get it right, capital failed on both.

This place is awful with customer service. Upon arriving for a 3 day conference, there was a long line that wrapped around to check in.  We stood in line and there were women with clipboards, but I don't know what they were trying to do.  They couldn't offer any assistance and it seemed as if they were just wandering around the lobby.  I get to the front of the line and one of them asks me if I'd like to go to another line.  Why would I want to do that when I've reached the front?  Also, when I got to the front of the line, there were three open check-in stations right in front of me with no one manning them. They only had a few people checking us in when there was a long line and clearly they had the capacity to add staff to this area.  The prices are ridiculous.  My club sandwich and diet coke was $30.  If you want wine, prepare to spend $12-14 per glass. This place is also very large and confusing to navigate.  It's worse at night because it gets dark inside and there is NO ONE around to help you.  All the storefronts are closed and there is literally not one soul that you could ask for directions.  They claim to be a high-end, more fancy hotel, but this place is the pits.  I wouldn't return nor would I recommend it. I recommend staying downtown where you are close to good food and other amenities.

Being from NY I am particular about my fast delivery Pizza/Italian food! I have to say that I am very impressed!!! We ordered a pepperoni pizza, 50 wings, a cheesesteak, and chicken cutlet parmigiana! Nothing was remotely bad, they must have a trained chef that owns this place! What great food, service and cost! Bravo La Cucina of Conshohocken! You have a few fans from a different area of the country! In particular you have me, and it is hard to impress this foodie!

Had take out--ordered the pan seared chicken. It was very rubbery, hard, dry.  The sides were so so.  My husband had salmon with crab hash that was so so.  Quality definatlely going down.  Its a shame because we have a huge gift card here from their black Friday half price sale.

Disappointing. We asked the bar tender if we could get fried oysters, which are not on the menu, he said no problem. We asked how many, he said 4 per order so we asked for two orders. When the oysters came out there we only six not eight. They were nothing but breading. We couldn't even find the oysters in two of the lumps of fried breading. We ate two and sent the remaining dough back. They did not charge us for the order.

Been here multiple times over the last 2 years.
Seems as if tofu isn't quite as good as it was when I started coming here.  Not sure if it's actually changed, or our tasting of it.

I had a good time at The Bricks of Ybor.  The service is really spot on and the quality of the food's pretty good.  I had the pulled pork sandwich.  It was pretty good.  Nothing memorable but what makes this place a four star place are the happy hour beer prices and the interesting art inside.

I loved the star wars art throughout this place and particularly loved the berpo and ern2d2 painting.

Friendly, fun crowd that looks like they're coming to a John Waters costume party.
I love this little Italian gem in Lafayette Square.  The atmosphere is so quaint and inviting.  They have a great menu and I've never had a bad glass of wine there.  Yum.
Came for lobster bisque had to settle for shrimp bisque instead.   rob loves Dungeness crab   Santa Barbara is beautiful!  My checkin here are sure tallying up.  Enjoy    Highly recommend.

Awesome Saturday lunch here. My party was seated with no wait. Even on the touristy part of town, the restaurant was very clean and the service was friendly and prompt. Food (3 po-boys) came out super hot and quickly. The dressed shrimp poboy was delicious. The onion rings were a little greasy but still good. YUM. Fun decor and bar, too

My husband and I went to this Thai restaurant, Siam Elephant  for lunch or dinner several times whenever we went to visit our friends in Carpinteria. Very nice and lovely atmosphere inside and outside seats.  It is close to the beach. Foods are so delicious as we expected. Love their Shrimp Pad Thai, Spicy Seafood Fried noodle, Spicy Seafood Soup, Asparagus and Avocado salad.  Prices are reasonable. Good customer services.  Owners and staff are very nice and friendly.  If you happen to be in this area, we highly recommended.  We will definitely go back to this restaurant again.
We had Katsu Don and Sushi and Sashimi combo. The Don was salty and the fried chicken was so wet. Fish was not fresh. Not deserve 4 stars at all.

Very good lunch. Had the meatloaf which was very good. Nice touch of spice and moist 
The waitress was terrific would definitely recommend

Note: I am not giving it a mediocre rating due to food or cleanliness, this rating is simply for the horrendous service. 

My roommate and I went for sushi while my boyfriend was in class (I know, completely unfair). She's been with her significant other several times and she said it was pretty cheap and really good. We walked in and were seated at the bar. I ordered a beer, she a water (they carded me; shocker!) the waiter came back over and took our orders: we both got the $15.99 dinner special which were two rolls of our choice, miso soup, and salad. Our soup and salad came out promptly and the guys behind the counter even gave us a complimentary spicy crab salad, which was my favorite. 

Now, I understand when I order sushi that needs to be fried, it takes a while. But it was grueling trying to wait between the appetizer and main course. Finally after 20 minutes after the salad, the sushi came out. It was hot and delicious! But since I have to watch my girlish figure (hey, round is a shape!), I had the desire to box up what was left and go pick up the boyfriend. I had to wait THIRTY MINUTES for my freaking check! Not once did anyone say anything to us or even glance in our direction, because believe me I would've gotten their attention. The place had gotten considerably more crowded since I had walked in, but come on. Half an hour? Maybe if I go back and it's slow the whole time it'll be better, but I was definitely not happy at all over the service.

This hotel is so nice. It's in Nashville Tennessee and the decor, food and Southern hospitality all strike just the right note. They have wines tastings, a walking tour of the gardens, a boat tour of the grounds, 3 pools many shops and many restaurants. We are having so much fun here and the staff has been so kind and helpful with all our needs.

Hope everybody had a nice Valentine's Day yesterday! I had a great dinner which lead right into our trip to San Francisco so I'll have to write about it later! In the mean time, just wanted to post up my visit to ROAST Coffeehouse on 104 St!

It took me a long time to make my way down to ROAST but I finally did it. As much as I love the atmosphere of Transcend (may you return to downtown one day) and Credo, I think I like ROAST the best!
