The servicer, Julia, was friendly and had recommendations. A great sense of humor and a smile. 

We had the Arancini appetizer, special of the night tacos with cauliflower with a lightly spiced carrot reduction sauce, a Blue Cobb salad and Fresco salad. Each was so tastes! Blueberry fool with lemon curd and a spiced cookie. Really good!

My boyfriend stopped by this place from our drive from LA to SF. Based on the great reviews, we decided to give this place a try and I am so glad we did! Their food was amazing! The place is small so there is often a long wait list or crowd waiting. The servers quote about a hour wait, however the lines often speed through faster since there is a to-go window on the side. So if you have the time, I would definitely recommend this place. The place is constantly busy and their ciopinno, lobster and oysters were amazing. I would skip on the lobster taco as it was not as impressionable as the other dishes.

Outrageously overpriced for what it is. Insultingly so. It would be one thing if the cocktails warranted $12 but they simply do not. The bartender was very friendly so 2 stars for that but for that area and the subpar cocktails not even close to worth the price. Cannot speak to the food but definitely not a place I would go back to have a few drinks at.

Best subs around!!! Trust me, I've done my homework!! And CHEAP!! 
And, open past lunch.
Thank you John and Kim for making Pieology a great experience.. The entire team at Hollister Village enjoyed the good eats

Don't Underestimate the Lobster and Shrimp Ravioli

It's another surprising dish from the Olive Garden's specials. I asked before I ordered what the waitress's evaluation of this dish was, knowing from the past I get a true evaluation. She stated: "We sell out of this at times." My reply: "let me have it."
Well she wasn't wrong at all. It was delicious and my evaluation comes from a person who is an Italian cook. The staff here is always very nice. I sat at the bar because I was eating solo and it's more convenient. Don't miss this dish as it will not always be available.

Love the space, drinks and food, but service is not so good. Owner needs to make sure the bartenders 'get it'. Too much chatting amongst the bartenders and not enough attention to the customers. We'll be back but maybe try the upstairs bar next time.

Morton's Steakhouse simply isn't worth it.  Everything about my dinner there was lackluster.  But the most important question is, how was the steak?  My 8oz filet was overcooked (medium instead of medium-rare), burnt/blackened on top, and lacking in flavor.  My date's slightly smaller filet was properly cooked (medium rare), but was similarly lacking in flavor.  The chocolate cake dessert was okay, but I've had better at local diners.  To make matters worse, our server did not introduce himself and was not pleasant towards us.  There are so many wonderful steakhouses in Philly.  Morton's just doesn't happen to be one of them.

My husband and I just had dinner there. I had seen the reviews, which were good, so we gave it a shot. I am so glad we did, everything was amazing. I had the pork... something (can't remember the name but it started with a B) and my husband had the prime rib. He is a prime rib snob and he said it was delicious, and the pork was so good. The atmosphere is great, it's a small little place, but that adds to the experience. We will definitely be going back, a lot.

Amazing food (dinner and brunch), amazingly sweet family who owns the restaurant (Kim & Phyllis are the best!); best restaurant on the Main Line with creative dishes and high quality, fresh food. Michael is a wonderful chef and always willing to accommodate meals for customers. Do not leave without dessert; Phyllis makes the BEST desserts, they will never disappoint!   We are regular customers for eat in and take in and they are always so welcoming to us and our young toddlers (since they were babies). Just the BEST!

One of the best things we did while my friend was visiting. Went to 5 fun bars (one of them was a shot bar and I conquered the Jell-O shot). We had a superstar tour guide Kinzey who kept it lively with trivia and candid photos and all that good stuff. At the end we got to ride the bull and sing karaoke. Would 10/10 recommend to anyone - locals or tourists!

the new food menu is still awesome for the price.  i recently tried the grilled cheese sandwich burger and it was pretty good.  the grilled cheese sandwich part could have used some more cheese, but overall delicious.  the special sauce was really tastey and i recommend asking for an extra side of it to load on the burger.
We weren't all that impressed with the shop. It was more than my coffee at Starbucks which I would have preferred. The atmosphere was trendy and industrial looking.

The food is excellent, the seating is comfortable with plenty of room, the prices are cheap, and the service is adequate. 

The delicious, freshly cooked salmon embedded in a salad was only $11 for dinner. If you order this dish, ask for extra tomatoes (they tend to skimp on them).

Our tour guide from the Road Scholar tour told us that BBQ shrimp was a "must" while we were in New Orleans.  It was conveniently located across from the Hotel Monteleone where we were staying.  Reservations are a must!  We were seated promptly and the service was very good.  We started with the Jumbo Sea Scallops for an appetizer and unfortunately did not read the menu thoroughly.  It was two scallops for $15.  They were excellent, but a bit pricey and very difficult to share 6 ways. 4 out of the 6 of us had the BBQ shrimp and it was truly delicious!  One had the bacon wrapped shrimp & grits.  It was fabulous!  One had the wood grilled fish and thought it was just okay.  It really didn't hold a candle to the other dishes.  We shared a chocolate molten cup cake for dessert and it was really yummy!!!  Tasted like more!

Love the bread from here.  They have a nice variety of organic breads and treats.  The service is fast and friendly. The breads are a tad expensive and they don't take visa but they are much better quality then bread you will find at major grocery stores.

I have to admit the reviews brought me to this place but when I saw the location I was skeptical at first. It's  nestled right next to a couple strip clubs. While the location isn't its strong suit once you taste a slice you forget all about it. This pizza had some of the best cheese I've ever had on a pie. The crust had that perfect amount of chew that you're looking for. Not wet and doughy and not that cardboard stuff you get for $5. Overall I'd say if you're looking to feed just yourself go for the single slices, if you're looking to feed a family order a whole. You can't go wrong either way.

One fish, two fish. Raw fish, cooked fish.

We walked in for dinner
and they asked us to wait.
We asked "for how long?"
they stared with a blank on their face.

Habachi tables were open and plenty
the booths are not.
So the wait for a table
could be a long shot.

Patiently we wait for the an answer or a guess
Then they shoot out 20 minutes at best.
25 minutes later we are called up to eat.
The initial experience already spells defeat.

Service at the table was friendly and kind
The food was ok not the best that I've had
Fried banana dessert however, did blow my mind. 

Not sure I'd come back
based on the wait.
The food was lackluster
in the department of taste.

I love the archiecture more then anything. It was a very impressive place to be. At the end you were given two free beverages. I went with the Pumpkin and Stella. 

What else can be said about a brewery tour. You do have the option to choose between the fast tour, which routes you to the beer samples right away, or the extended which takes you along the streets and into several buildings for a more detailed tour. 

Go on the extended your first time, from then on out skip to the fast routed tour.

I have high expectation when it comes to ramen. I noticed this place for a while and decided to stop by with my SO to check it out. The staffs were friendly and seated us right away. The interior is a little spacious and has a lot of seatings which is great for family and groups. Like some reviews, I agree that the broth is not as flavorful and it somehow tastes similar. The noodle itself was a little soggy as well. However, on the positive note, the service was very good, the staffs were very attentive and our food came out fast and hot. For about $11-13 the portion here is very generous, your belly will be fully satisfied :) Perhaps it was a bad day but this place has potential. Might come again in the future

it was snowing. so of course, i had to get some ice cream. this being my first time in the snow, I was well prepared with a thin cardigan, leggings and some high heeled ankle boots that only served to elevate the risk of sliding on my ass in the snow.

I walked about 8 blocks from my hotel in my ill-fitted snow garb to the warmest, coziest ice cream shop I have ever been in. my husband had some hot chocolate....which they have about half a dozen different kinds.

however, the majority of my greatness of this review is based off of one flavor: red velvet cake. Now, I have to tell you, every red velvet cake I've ever had has been dry and not that appetizing. Like its supposed to taste good, but it doesn't. However, on this occasion-- this flavor left me begging for more and I came back for a second trip down and up hill in my skimpy snow ware for red velvet ice cream.

amazing.

Simply the BEST BBQ shrimp and a hall of fame great dish. And then there's the amazing hot crusty loaf of bread to soak up of the sauce...frankly, it would be great without any shrimp. ;)  each at the bar. No reservations, no problem. Brendan is a great bartender / waiter and will take great care of you!

I have eaten a lot of BBQ over the past 20 years in North Carolina. 
Every thing we ordered was excellent. Love the pulled pork with slaw. Tender with that nice browned edges and no fatty waste!  Love their sauces and the hush puppies are awesome. Will return many times!

It's been YEARS since we have found a GREAT barbecue place. And now it's right in our backyard! 
Walked in and welcomed wonderfully! If it's your first time, it's a lot of information. So nice and helpful since they have a great big yummy menu board. We decided on a City Sampler. We were so pleased! (They have Nehi soda!!! Just a blast from the past!)
The slaw is the best I have ever had. The beans, I have to admit are even better than mine. They were cooked to perfection with some brisket in them. The meats were tender and tasty. The sauces were good, the original my favorite, but in the end, I felt like it was an injustice to put sauce on any of them, since they stood up well on their own. The brisket was my favorite. The wood was piled high outside and the smell of the fire was just heavenly. 
On to the nice people! Even though you go up to get your food, we were so kindly attended to. We went at a slow time, which is our typical dinner time. I can imagine the place gets really busy though. 
The atmosphere was very fitting for a barbecue place. I love the barbecue history on the wall. I love the wood and the aluminum ceiling. 
We got our food very quickly, but in NO WAY was this fast food. Just well prepared, easy to serve and cooked to perfection. The prices, considering what we got were frankly amazing. I am marking this as under $10 per person, but we don't get drinks, so factor that in. 
I could keep going, but I have banana pudding to try! I get the feeling they are going to get to know my husband and I very well!

Nickie the server was absolutely amazing and professional!!! Loved the surf and turf special she offered!!! I have to agree that the sushi is absolutely scrumptious, fulfilling and the portion size is great! The reason I'm giving it a 3 star is due to the fact of the unprofessionalism and disrespect of a kitchen staff that was visible to the front of the bar. I believe his name is Felipe and, clearly he didn't know I spoke Spanish but, everything coming out of his mouth was ruining our experience.

Hands down best sushi in town! I order the salmon roll everywhere I go, and this one blew my mind! It was measurably better than any other one I have tried. All the rolls are very fresh, and packed with ample amounts of fish. Wonderful well balanced martinis. Crispy gyoza. Friendly staff. Highly recommended.
Probably best place in town for crabs . Small but food is on point . A must try if your ever in the area .

Skip this review if you can eat real pizza.  Gluten-free (GF) pizza is a bit of an oxymoron.  I get it.  

Pizza is made up of three components, namely, toppings, sauce and crust.   I kept the toppings simple, but the red sauce was bland and the GF crust was cardboardy and charred.  That's just one out of three.  To keep this short, stars for even having the option, but not a food item I'd actively seek out.  If dining with friends, best to order the cheapest thing on the menu and splurge elsewhere.

Don't really understand the negative reviews.  Definitely not seat yourself as people say.  They have a greeter who seats people.  Beer list extensive but not overly exotic.  Still plenty to please most.  Food was surprisingly solid, but really, who comes there for the food?  The steak sandwich was well done and the kale apple slaw was great!  The only negative would be the noise factor.  Had to yell to be heard by my table-mate.  Overall, i was pleased and will most definitely return soon.

My coworker and I stayed here for a recent work event.  I had read complaints about it being so large that you have to walk miles to get anywhere.  I know these comments are probably written by Midwesterners that don't walk farther than their mailbox everyday.  I myself enjoyed the sweeping atrium and multiple lobbies.  It made for ease in conducting business in an alternate of the main lobby to avoid the long lines.  Once you get the lay of the land (imagine a Vegas casino hotel) it is pretty straight forward to maneuver around the grounds.  With the 90 degrees and 90 percent humidity outside, I appreciated not having to leave at all, if you didn't want to.  But that being said, you would be remiss if you didn't take in the Nashville sights lurking outside.

With 3+ bars to choose from, some with great live music, and a couple decent sit down restaurants as well as walk up food courts, it was everything a busy business traveler needs on the way to the YMCA conference at the attached convention center.  Despite previous experiences of bad service with such masses descending upon an establishment, I thought this place handled it all with grace.

I was not pleased with my service. The location has just been open a week, so perhaps my experience was related to that, or perhaps simply to the stylist I had--but it was acute enough that I will not go back.

This was my first experience with a Sports Clips. While I knew going in that part of the business model was the "sports/TV" theme, they also advertise themselves as "specialists" in men's hair. I did not feel like my treatment was elevated in any way unique to their location.

I received their second-tier haircut, "the MVP," which advertises a precision haircut, shampoo, scalp massage, hot facial towel, and a neck/shoulder massage. If all of these were good--it might be a good deal.

My haircut was NOT a precision haircut. It was done by someone recently out of school. You know when someone is taking their time because they being thorough vs. when someone is going slow because they aren't experienced enough to go more quickly...the second was my stylist. She did not cut confidently. I have a beard, and my stylist asked me a sideburn-related question most stylists ask, "Would you like me to do anything different with your sideburns?" I responded, "No, go ahead and blend them into the beard." The next thing I see, she uses the trimmer to chop off my sideburns and then cut a 3/4" gap between them and the beard. When I looked incredulously at the sides and asked her why she did that she said, "It was miscommunication on both our parts." That is not what you tell the customer. My other complaint with the stylist was that her method of speaking through every step of "the MVP treatment" felt very patronizing, as if I was going to get a haircut for the first time.

Regarding the rest of the MVP treatment--it is not that great. The scalp massage had very little pressure to it...perhaps it was my inexperienced stylist. The "massage chair" in the back just buzzed...barely vibrated. I asked the stylist to turn it off. Massage chairs in the mall are better. Finally, the neck/shoulder massage, done by a handheld machine, was again lackluster. It is not a massager. It vibrates a bit, but isn't nearly as relaxing as your Homedics or Brookstone hand massager at home. I asked the stylist to press harder on the machine, but it didn't make a difference. Then I just asked her to turn it off. 

If what you care most about is the sports TV during your haircut, this is the place to go. Otherwise--if you're intrigued by the massages, they aren't great. And the haircut is no better than any entry-level salon.

Review base on customer service only. 
We arrived about 30 mins before closing. There was a few workers towards kitchen area that look at us when we arrived. Stood there for about 10 mins with no greeting. Finally a young lady said we close at 3, you can come have a seat but have to be out by 3. We looked at the time.. 20 mins til close. Why not just tell us from the beginning that they closing soon and we would of left. I understand that it was a nice Friday afternoon and you want to go home ontime but why the attitude? We didn't know. Would of love to try their chicken and waffles but we will never know now.

The food was good. Had a dosa and a vada. The flavors were there. The place was sort of in the middle of nowhere. The cleanliness of the place looked suspect. 

I may not venture there again. 

Good luck to them.

India Palace apparently is under new management.  They sent out a mailer advising they had renovated the place and were serving a complementary buffet from 11am-4pm on Saturday December 16th, 2017.  We arrived at 3:00pm to find they were not honoring their advertisement and had locked the doors to the restaurant to ensure no one could get in.   On top of that they even had a policeman outside telling people they couldn't get in.   I called the restaurant asking what was going on.  They gave me the owners phone number and said the owner had ordered the doors closed early.  I called the  owner and left a message.  The owner responded via a text message telling me I shouldn't be contacting him and to basically leave him alone.  

There are other Indian restaurants in this city.   This "new" India Palace won't be getting my business again.   They won't have to lock the doors to keep me away.  I'll go somewhere else.

I had to rush to the airport but couldn't miss seeing this. The facility is fully upgraded state of the art interior and still holds the beautiful exterior and history of the company. I'm not a Budweiser fan, but the tour and in depth knowledge they share of the company and the beer is pretty cool to see. Also seeing their trademark horses is something to not miss!!
Service not great and food feels very rushed. Overall just okay.
food is good, even if you arent a vegetarian. definitely make reservations because is crowded!

Ok, so I have no reason to go to this hotel because I live in Nashville and the Opry Mills mall is a 10 minute drive for me BUT, the military discount is too good to be true. My Army friends and I use to get a room here for a night and walk around the hotel. It is huge. They have a club inside which is great. The music is good, the bartenders are super friendly, the crowd is usually a tad older than us (us being 23-26). Still, we always have a good time. The restaurants inside are great and every time we have gone, there is live entertainment. And the thing that has me hooked is that they have a Christie cookie inside the hotel. Forget the restaurants and club, I love christie cookies. Anyone who is from Nashville has probably tried them but I was so happy that we could share this with the people who visit our city. I now see why people love this hotel so much.

Bob was our tour guide today and we had a great day with him. We did the tour with kids and even they had a good time. Got to meet some nice people and tried some great food. Great activity to do while in New Orleans!!

Holy Emperor Neapolitan III's mother... this place is out of sight good. Amazing atmosphere, food is off the charts good, and the staff is fun and engaging.

This is the ideal spot for a date; first date, 3rd date, 60th wedding anniversary... it doesn't matter.

Do yourself a favor and order the lemon meringue pie... it's transcendental.

11/10!

Make a reservation... this place is on fire.
Good god- food as crummy as this should be cheaper. Here's my review in 5 words: bland, poor quality and overpriced ". Go to free birds it's right around the corner.

Awesome seafood and reasonable prices for Santa Barbara. The wait took almost an hour but the food made it worthwhile.  The oysters, rock crab and shrimp were fresh, perfectly cooked and tasted sooo good!  Can't wait to come back here again.

It is difficult not to like this place. Some well-traveled friends recommended it to us when we were in the area. The setting is romantic and friendly. The food was not memorable, but I would give it a second chance.

I've not actually been here; I hear the service is abhorrent. But... The jerk chicken is the best chicken I have ever eaten. It's a subtle, spicy sauce that starts you off, but it's the chicken itself that is the star. Slow-cooked, every little morsel falls right off. I found myself nibbling on parts of a chicken I'd normally throw out. At $15 for an entire chicken, you can make a few friends happy on the cheap. I can't wait to try it in person.
Excellent 5-course price fixe menu, with wine tastings for each course (champagne! dessert wine even!) for an extra $18, could not be beat price wise. Each course was quite good, memorable.
EXCELLENT BBQ! I tried the smoked salmon as well, wow what great taste!

Enjoyed the sushi-
I had the lunch special with 2 rolls (florida and spicy salmon), soup, and salad.  Personally I would prefer it cost less and only get soup or salad.  Also had a spicy tuna roll.

Disappointments- 
They don't have hot green tea.  
Part of their philosophy is sustainability/impact on the environment- so I'm confused why they are using plastic disposable cups for soy sauce, disposable chop sticks, and bottled drinks/soda.  Most of the bottles were glass- so pretty easy to recycle- but I wonder if they really are recycling.

Bottom line- would I go back?  Yes if I'm in the immediate area.  But I don't think I would make a trip out to go there specifically.

We just moved to town and were looking for a new Chinese take out joint. Unfortunately we were very disappointed, despite the rave reviews we heard about this place. We tried a variety of dishes: shrimp lo mein, veggie mei fun, king pow chicken, General tso's, wonton soup, egg drop soup, crab rangoons, fried rice, and roast pork. Everything got a resounding "meh." The one thing that stood out for me was the egg rolls. They were fresh and yummy. The fried rice was fine. The generals needed more sauce, the lo mein was oily and tasted burnt, the crab rangoons tasted like cinnamon and had a weird shell, and the mei fun and Kung pow chicken both had zero flavor. The person I spoke to on the phone was nice. It took about 35 minutes for our order to arrive.

Fresh and delicious seafood at the pier, can't leave Santa Barbara without having a meal here. 

The establishment is small, with about 4 tables outside and a few inside with the beach view. And of course there are counter seats facing the open kitchen (best view in my eyes). We were famished by the time we got there so we took the first available seating which was at the counter. We saw how the seafood was hand picked (literally) and prepared.  

Service was very attentive as our orders was taken right away. Food came out fast and the hotel that we stayed at (Milo Hotel) gave us a complimentary clam chowder order for this place, it was definitely put to good use. The clam chowder came in a cup, not in the bread bowl. It was more than enough as an appetizer and tasted so good. For our entrees, we had the Rock Crab Special and the Calamari Sandwich. Both orders came with a side of cole slaw and union rings. I am a big seafood lover so getting my hands dirty for that delicious crab was so well worth it. The crab was a little smaller than expected but super fresh and delicious. The Calamari Sandwich was also good, the seafood quality here is unbelievable for the price. 

I can't wait to come back the next time I'm in SB! Already craving my crab & clam chowder [drools]

Best beer and brewery in indy. Sadly loses huge points for lack luster service. I've been numerous times and they are quick to get rid of you. Met one of their brewers once and the guy was awesome and showed me a lot. This place would be the best if the servers were happier and better at customer service.

I wish I had taken a photo of my Southern Fiesta pizza. It was the most loveless, topping-less, dry pizza I'd ever seen. Have you ever microwaved a Tony's pizza 3 days later? It looked a lot like that as soon as the box was opened. 

I was excited to get a pizza place in the neighborhood, but that excitement quickly waned. I may give this place another try, but first impressions mean a lot. Pick up your game, Sidekicks!

I can usually walk out of here with 5-6 of my own reusable bags filled to the brim for a mere $60, which is a great price when I can feed myself and the boyfriend for a couple of weeks.  I love that the produce is so cheap, though you usually need to eat it up sooner rather than later.  I can't always find everything I need here but when I can get 80% of what I am looking for, I am a happy shopper.
I am a major Foodie and a Concierge.  I frequently dine here and love all the food.  However, I must admit their Gumbo Ya Ya is one of my favorites!
Insider tip, this location of Noodles has the availability to make Buffalo Mac & Cheese, and off the menu item... I just went for lunch today, it is delicious!

The service was great but the juice only comes in a medium cup? I watched one gal throw away the rest, she couldn't give the rest to me in the large cup.? No, the rest was not foam there was still lots of juice. I could go to Tree City and get a large for the exact same price, don't think I'll be back anytime soon.
Food was pretty good , nice setting. Very warm and welcoming atmosphere. This place is in my top 5 for Indian buffet in Tucson.
The French Press has the best espresso drinks in Santa Barbara.  I heard that the will begin roasting their own beans at this new location.

Yum!

I have been to Bubs several times. It is a cute little cafe in Carmel. The wait time on a weekend is usually around 20 minutes, so it's not a bad idea to call ahead.

They have great pancakes- quite large. One pancake doesn't sound like a lot, but it definitely is.

The prices are decent- everything is less than 9 dollars.

I recommend the egg sandwich! The donut holes are pretty good too.

omg, best soondubu jjigae in the philly area! i love spicy food and spicy soondubu is the best kind. i usually get kimchi soondubu ah-joo mep-gae (the spiciest) and pretty much sweat through the entire bowl. the spiciest option is slightly on the too spicy side but i don't care. tastes soooooo good. the fact that they also serve the bap/rice in those dol-sot bowls and you can have noo-roon-ji is awesome too. their service is pretty good. can get somewhat slow when it gets crowded but they're usually over quick with the push of the button.

This place is AWESOME! Everyone is unbelievably nice and professional, especially our bartender, Juliette. We were in town for a bachelorette party and she gave us wonderful recommendations for things to do in the city and made our night so fun.

As I was walking out of my work to head home for lunch, I saw Go! Gyro! Go!'s truck outside. Knowing the beautiful wife's fondness for gyros, I ordered a couple.

They had a number of options today:

Gyro (beef and lamb)
Souvlaki chicken or pork
Spanakopita 
Greek roasted potatoes

and probably some other things I've forgotten.

I went with two classic gyros -- these are normally $7.50 each and come with a side of potatoes. Unfortunately, the potatoes weren't ready yet, so they took $1 off each gyro. They take cash and use Square for credit cards (yay)

One of the great things about this truck is that they're constantly grilling the meat, so there wasn't much of a wait at all.

I thought it was pretty good -- there was a lot of tzatziki (though it wasn't the most flavorful I've had) and plenty of meat. The only vegetables were onions and tomatoes, which is traditional method of preparation, so don't be disappointed at the lack of, say, lettuce or hot peppers.

Overall, I was pretty happy -- I look forward to trying to potatoes and other offerings at future visits.

Their web site is still in development, but you can follow them on Facebook and (I believe) Twitter.

Bob was a great tour guide.
But i definitely expected more food for the food tour. when they say sample size they mean it. I was hoping for at least a small appetizer size portion, in actualitiy you get a sauce size portion.  Don't go on the tour hungry.
This is the most fun casino bar in Reno, which is not necessarily the greatest accomplishment. Stil with tasty beer at $5 a pint and a fun band there is much to like.

Love-ly food and attentive service. I had a strawberry puree cocktail, which was very refreshing, a fried duck leg with a cabbage salad and charred peaches, which was utterly good, a risotto (Pecorino cheese, black kale, Meyer Lemon rind, and fried kale - delicious, albeit too salty due to a generous helping of Pecorino, but still... and the consistency was perfect, and, for dessert, a single serving cast iron pie (sour cream batter with sweet plum) and a scoop of ginger honey ice cream - a very nice chaud-froid ending for the meal.

There is so much to see in St Louis, but many come at a price and sometimes a hefty price. A must see of St Louis history is the Anheuser-Busch Brewery. A tour guide walks you through the entire process while pointing out some historic buildings. I loved the architecture of these old buildings reminiscent of a time before chrome and glass. The tour is free and I saved the best for last, at the end you can sample beer FREE.

So I love their pasta bread bowls-  and they have never messed up my order- but they DONT deliver to my address like what is that- I live in Crystal Beach and no Dominos in this area delivers so to have it I literally have to pick it up. It's insane, like literally the opposite point of a pizza place that's known for delivery it that it doesn't deliver to your place. I've never heard of that.  This is sad lol.

I want to give this place five stars but I just have a thing about homemade ketchup that I cannot get passed. It was okay enough but it'll never take the place of Heinz. That being said, the burger was amazing! Me and my boyfriend both got Woodstock burgers and they were great. The fried Mac and cheese was awesome too. Their sweet potato fries are a little squishy, but all in all the food was great and our server was phenomenal. If only they had normal bottled ketchup.

I came here for a birthday dinner and I was hooked. I brought my neighbor and husband here one night for dinner because I was craving their Shepard's pie. Oh so yummie! My husband is very picky about fish and chips and he decided to give it a try. He love it YAY!! I hate it when he hates his food at a restaurant because he makes his most disgusted face. My neighbor got the bangers and hash and love it. Yes another winner. I love it when I pick something that two picky eater say that was awesome. I had the chicken pot pie when I was here the first time and that was good too. I have left over to take home every time I come.

I stopped by for a last minute Sunday brunch not expecting The Love to go beyond my expectations. The interior is clean and inviting and the staff are friendly and helpful. We ordered a number of side dishes, the burger, and some eggs and they all came out great. If you're looking for true southern food, I wouldn't say this is it, but I still found their menu appetizing and delicious. I would recommend this and will be returning.

I would say that this is the best pizza I've had thus far in the New Hope/Lambertville area. Having moved here about 7 months ago, we've been on the search and glad we found Nicola's. Of course this is not the fanciest place and is more of a whole in the wall, but I honestly don't care about that when it comes to pizza. The first time we ordered, we got a buffalo chicken pizza and philly cheese steak. When we got it home after picking it up, we noticed there seemed to be some key ingredients missing (blue cheese on the buffalo and cheese on the philly cheese steak). We called them and they were very apologetic and offered us 2 free pies. We took them up on the offer and those pies were perfect, very good! We've since been back a couple times and even had a big order delivered to our home in New Hope. Even though they say they only deliver in Lambertville, I was happy they agreed to deliver for us in New Hope. Good customer service and good pizza. They have a loyal customer now!
Their boneless pork steak sandwich reminds me of the McRib from McDonald's. Save your money!

I guess I should have ordered the Pizza, because I cannot believe how bland the pasta was. Save your money and make some pasta at home, even Weight Watchers Smart ones has more flavor with their pasta dishes. I will say the waitress was very polite as was the manager, but that did not make up for the lousy food. No wonder the place was empty. Too bad, because I would rather support a locally owned business over a chain any day.

More than meets the eye, this restaurant is everything I could want in an Italian cafe. When you walk in there is a bar area (deceptive because it is small, but it has a chalkboard menu which immediately made me love it). We had a reservation for my friends birthday so a host walked us through an arch way to a dining area, which was bustling with people eating (and there was another smaller dining room in the back!) It is family run with a few family photos on display around the dining space. The atmosphere is welcoming and filled with the smell of delicious food.

    Our waitress was very kind and attentive but not over bearing, always refilling our glasses and checking to make sure we enjoyed our dishes. We ordered calamari to start and it came out with a dijon horseradish sauce, perfectly breaded and fried calamari (very tender and amazingly tangy and sweet with some lemon sauce) over a bed of spinach which was a nice touch. 

     I then ordered the Linguine Dolano as a half order as my friends ordered the baked lasagna and the Cavatelli Broccoli. The half order was just the right size, still a decent portion and at a great price (mine was only $6). My dish was delightful; pasta tossed in olive oil with pine nuts, sun dried tomato with fresh garlic and basil. I was in pasta paradise. It was simple, refreshing, and extremely good. My friends loved their dishes as well and we were all members of the clean plate club. 

        When our waitress came back to ask if there would be dessert we couldn't turn it down--it was my friends birthday after all. Once she knew this, she created a "sample platter" especially for us, on the house. She brought us in house made tiramisu, a chocolate chip filled cannoli, and a dish of ice cream that was pretty amazing--everyone's favorite (possibly chocolate chip with some sort of sweet fig possibly) And all of their ice cream is from Serendipity's (http://www.yelp.com/biz/serendipity-homemade-ice-cream-st-louis) so I must say kudos for also promoting a fellow local business. 

Mamma Mia! This was an extremely satisfying meal and first visit to this charming cafe.

1 word "Gross". 

After reading and hearing all of the fantasic things about Bulk Barn I thought I would go in and see what they had to offer.  So, one day when jonesing for sugar a fellow sugar addict and I headed off to the Bulk Barn.

I purchased a few of my favorite snacks from the bins: licorice laces, gummy bears and sour cream puffs to name a few. My friend had an equally luscious load. I probably dropped about $40 and she $50. We couldn't  wait to get to the car to twist open a few bags and start the sugar rush and when we finally got the bags open wow.. what a disappointment!  My licorice laces were like eating the leather laces on my boots. I might have pulled off a crown trying to dislodge a gummy bear from my tooth and my girlfriend was dry heaving beside me. Need I say more.

Thoroughly disappointing. The most stale and vile junk food I have ever had the displeasure of eating. The bulk goods must have been in those bins for who knows how long ??? That coupled with the occassional grubby hands dipping into the bins to steal samples when no one was looking; disgusting. In fact it was so bad we threw it all in the garbage.

I learned a costly but valuable lesson that day, and no,  it wasn't to stop eating so much junk food..lol, rather  "To ensure freshness always buy your candy individually packaged". 

Bulk Barn gets a 5 popcorns down!

The owner of 365 use to own Dolce in the Meadowpointe neighborhood. My old review was for that place.

This is located at Wiregrass and it's open at 9am while everything in the mall opens at 10 am. 

We decided on crepes and cappuccinos today! They were amazing. I had a crepe with prosciutto, fresh mozz, tomato, arugula, and added grilled eggplant and zucchini. My additions made this over the top amazing! The size was great too. My cappuccino was so so good. How could I have not been here sooner. It was a great while.

My hubby who didn't want to come here was so happy with his breakfast crepe with egg, mushroom, ham and cheese. 

We will be back here for sure.

They serve gelato, sweet and savory crepes, paninis made with buns not traditional type pressed bread paninis and different coffees, cappuccinos, and espressos.

They also sell Italian cookies and cakes YUM!

The people working despite them being the earliest place open in the mall were very cheery and helpful!

I've been to this place on several locations & one thing I can say about it is "Consistent". The food is average, maybe a little better than some of the other chain restaurants out there... but most of the stuff is shipped and then they try to put a homemade twist on it.... I've had worse, but I've had better... I will say that the Blue Cheese Chips & Wings were better than the 3 stars I gave the place, but the pizza was average... 

The service is hit & miss. You either get a good one who takes good care of you, or one that is always slow with your orders and really not that personable... But you get what you pay for. 

I do think they need to do a little remodeling. The place is dive bar charmy, but really dated.... don't get me wrong, I like dive bar charmy, but not from the 70's (and I do know that's my opinion only).

First the good: I like the location of Jackson's, as Hillsboro Village is a charming little neighborhood and right next to Vanderbilt, which makes it rather convenient as well. The food is ordinary, not bad, just not great. Last month, I made a request for a special occasion meal. I contacted the general manager in advance and found her to be rather rude, unaccommodating, and not very Nashville-like overall. While Jackson's is ok, there is nothing that spectacular about that I would go back until management changes. Too many other awesome places in Nashville to put up with that.

This is an absolute must, but you have to really appreciate quality over quantity. Which some people just don't understand. The food preparation, presentation and overall service is second to none. I have enjoyed their dinners on several occasions over the years and it has never changed from Excellent. Mark and Susan are professionals in their craft. The finest food this side of France. Enjoy.
V Haplea

First time at the Shellfish Company today!  The lobster tacos were awesome and go the Grilled Scallops on Caesar Salad to go.  The service was great. Highly recommended and will go back before I leave Santa Barbara.

M. Young-Lewis
People are always terrific. Nice breakfast with eggs perfectly done sunny side up and nice thick bacon. The coffee is good but not necessarily a stand out. Nice place for a business breakfast
Just Ok...lots of options on the dinner buffet.  The food was bland and not as warm as I would have liked.  Service was good.

It took me three phone calls to reservations (was disconnected twice) and then 24 minutes on the phone to reserve two suites.

I pity my co-workers who have to stay here.

Never in a million years would I have guessed this to be a good place amongst the tourist trap attractions of the pier, and when traveling I will avoid these scenarios like the plague. But being a local, it was inevitable I'd end up trying it out and I'm sure glad I did. The food is great with cozy atmosphere and great views.  It's now my go to place for visiting family and friends who desire a quintessential Santa Barbara seafood experience.

I much prefer the taste of Eagle's Peak water over pretty much any other water available, and they routinely test the safety of the water, which is important to me.  I have been dealing with the company for the last 25 or so years, and am a very satisfied customer.  If a mistake is made in my order (which rarely happens), or if I want to make a change in my order, the office staff is always patient, polite, and helpful.  Highly recommended!

Please do not go here if you want good service. I use to frequent this place 3 nights a week after I would leave the gym. I had a change of heart after i noticed a very dirty hookah. The service also went down hill and they could never keep the same staff. Every month I would have to get use to a new waiter. They will never get another dime from me.
Go to any other CVS, go to Rite-Aid, go anywhere but here. Short-staffed, rude, on the verge of obnoxious. I will not be back!

This is one of our favourite restaurants in the French Quarter. The chic setting and cozy atmosphere make for a great dinner out. Upon entering the restaurant through the revolving door you get a feeling that you've stepped through a machine back in time. Everything from the decor, the servers and the experience could be straight out of a turn of the century movie.  

Each time we have gone to this restaurant there has been a wait...but its never a problem since many come just for the bar where you can have yourself a bloody mary, mint julip or a sazerac while you wait for your table. The restaurant serves contemporary Creole cuisine in a warm relaxed atmosphere. Signature dishes include Gumbo Ya Ya, Barbequed Shrimp, and Bread Pudding with Irish Whiskey Sauce (see menu). The service is amazing- the waiters always happy and welcoming. If you happen to have the Barbeque shrimp (which is really a must if you go to this restaurant) they even go so far as to put on your bib for you (needed to peel the shrimp), bring you hot towels and lemon and continuous servings of fresh out of the oven french bread, which ofcourse you proceed to dip in the bbq shrimp sauce (probably the best part of the meal). The gumbo ya ya is also a must- definitely one of the best I have had since my time in New Orleans...and I have had ALOT of Gumbo. Finishing off with a plate of desert you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu: my favorites- the profiteroles (a french dessert consisting of light fluffy dough filled with vanilla ice-cream and topped with dark chocolate sauce (TO DIE FOR), if you want something more New Orleans in flavor then try the home made breadpudding. You will not be dissapointed. Not with the dessert. Not with your meal. And definitely not with the service you receive at this charming restaurant in the quarter.

Sorry, but that this tour is by a company named Best Tours is an oxymoron.  The only reason I gave two stars is that we were introduced to two wonderful bakeries, and we had a living social deal so I don't feel as ripped off as I would have had I paid full price.  Otherwise, this was a total bust.  In one hour (some people felt it was supposed to be 2 hours) we covered 2+ miles and while the first two places were very nice, the third and fourth were not.  The last place, Scoop Deville, is a well-known ice cream restaurant and our cupcakes were clearly frozen and very dried out.  The tour "guide" practically ran the very large group from place to place and provided little to no information about Philadelphia, which I kind of thought was supposed to be part of the experience.  If you go, don't expect to leave full.  We had 1/2 cookie, one mini cupcake, and 1/3 of a cupcake at the other two places.   And....further disappointment was not a macaron in sight.
Such tasty coffee, and nice people, and delcious baked goods!

I've never been a beer drinker, but I am a dork and I like to know how things work.  This is why I went ahead and did the AB tour when I had some friends in town.  It was really interesting to see how the brewery has grown over the years and how they actually go about making the beer.  This is a good thing to do when you have out-of-town visitors.  It's also nice (not for me, but for people who like beer) that you get 2 free samples at the end of the tour.  My friend's husband was especially happy about that since he got my free samples!
Came during happy hour (M-F 2-5).  Ordered the buffalo chicken wings (12 wings $3.99).  Wings were descent size for the price. I'd come here again.....during happy hour

Ricardo's is located on Park Ave in the Lafeyette square neighborhood in St. Louis. It is a great place to have a romantic Italian dinner. It's pricey but delicious and the cafe-style dining room is completely cute. I love their pastas (especially since I can order the small size and still have leftovers), but their dinner specials like Chicken Marie or Strip Ricardo are really good, too. I've never had a bad experience here and if you're an early diner you just may be the only one in the place; a huge bonus if you're like me and hate a crowded restaurant.
Always a good time! Try the huge soft pretzel with their beer cheese. It's enough for 4 people to share as an appetizer.

Ordered some take out with a large group and let me first say they do take out perfectly right. They have each person's order separated by check and in different bags so they are easy to find and you know what's in the bag without opening all the containers!

I ordered lamb korma with a veggie pakora and a plain naan.  We fought a little to get some rice (my co-eater had to pull out some language skills on the phone when ordering to get it for us complimentary).

It was pretty good lamb korma.  Very tender, great sauce that I just wanted to keep eating.  A little oily but that was the only downside.  The veggie pakora was good as well and still crispy despite the drive. I thought it was a bit heavy though with too much potato.  The naan was too dry or too thin for my taste.  Baked to the point that I couldn't use it to soak up anything and had to rely solely on the rice to get that yummy sauce onto my taste buds.

I would definitely eat here again though and I am looking forward to my leftovers (always a good sign)!

Teds is a small cute old diner that has been around for decades, it has not changed through out the years, which is chronicled on the pictures on the wall. They have a few servers that are always working and the food is pretty decent for a place that has not changed much in the last 30 years.

The building is located on a comer and is pretty cool from the inside. It is like a diner from a retro old timey movie. I have tried the breakfast, and also the party melt burger which I actually enjoyed.

The food isn't exactly five star stuff however for the price it is not bad.

This movie has been featured in a John Travolta movie back in the day, I want to say pulp fiction, there are pictures with him eating in the wall. Which gives this this little diners charm.

I would suggest giving this place a chance at least once and you be the judge.

So I must first admit: I don't drink coffee.  Never had a drop in my life.  Finding a coffee shop that caters as much to the non-coffee drinkers can be a challenge.  I was expecting to go elsewhere on this hot Sunday afternoon, but it was closed for the holiday weekend.  Yelp helped me find Red Hook.  Like another reviewer, I noticed that the staff was sitting chatting with friends when I walked in, but she stood right up to assist me.  She offered her recommendation for an Earl Grey with Caramel Latte.  It was a great choice.  Good flavor... and something I never would've considered on my own.

My one (maybe two) issues with Red Hook is that the place feels a bit like visiting a college kid's shared house.  The mismatched furniture is cute, but worn and dirty.  There was dust and dirt everywhere.  And, probably due to the heat outside and frequent door openings, lots of bugs.  They also didn't have air conditioning.  My fault for ordering a hot drink, but still... a coffee shop should feel cozy: warm in the winter and cool in the summer.

I may come back for additional drinks, but probably not for sitting for any length of time.
The house wine was good and the gnocchi was okay but $3 for 3 small pieces of bread with a little cheese was a bit expensive considering that you a full loaf at Bonefish their affiliate.

I wanted to like their food, I really did. The menu sounded good. Shepherd's pie? Irish baked potato soup? Fish and chips? All good things....unless you order them from here. The potato soup was runny and thin. Maybe 3 actual chunks of potatoes, the rest was like runny oatmeal. The Shepherd pie, which for $11.99 is a rip off considering it came in the same size container as the soup, was watery, the onions were completely raw and the meat was under seasoned. The battered fish was fine, but the chips were incredibly salty. Really disappointed. 

Note: this was. GrubHub order so my review has nothing to do with the actual location or their service. Food related only.

We live in CA so we were a little sheepish about doing the "tourist" thing on the wharf in Santa Barbara, but we have our kid with us, so what the heck.  We used our "monocle" tool to find the highest rated tourist trap on the wharf.  What a surprise!  I bet locals actually go here.  Reminds me of some secret places we go on the wharf in San Diego.  Tiny beer and fried shellfish joint, as big as a thimble.  The waitress was AMAZING.  She brought out all the live shellfish to snap and shake at our 7 year old (scary!!  delightful!!)  And we enjoyed her legs which obviously go to the gym every day.  So good with our kid, and good in short-shorts.  Top notch shellfish, yummy everything.  Why not 5 stars?  Portions were pretty small and the cole slaw was bland.  But fun, by the water, go for it.

I love me some Jackson's.  It's one of those places that can be suggested for a meal and then I can immediately taste the exact food that I will be ordering.  In this case, it's the Rio roll torrado with the chop salad.  Food styles and prices vary significantly between menu items so there really is something for everyone.  They've also got an extensive drink menu.  As for desserts, I absolutely love the gooey butter cake.  I've had many good times sitting with friends on their outdoor patio, and one of my favorite things about the interior, aside from the wine on the wall and the beautiful artwork, is the fact that on pretty days they open the garage doors so that the whole place has a breeze.  This place definitely has a very distinctive culture in addition to delicious food, making it one of my favorite Nash-Vegas places to take out of town visitors.

Great little spot to grab a quick breakfast. Seating can be limited at times but I've never had an issue getting a seat. It is very easy to order and they have many items for self severe. You pay for everything at the end, the prices are very reasonable. Delicious egg, meat and cheese breakfast sandwiches and fresh fruit!

We went today and took advantage of the free lobster promotion, and 20 percent off for the month of october!  it is located in the shopping center right behind the louis and christian hair salon, across from toscana italian restaurant. i had the pleasure to talk the owner, we were able to chit chat on how we loved the boiling crab, hot and juicy in the west coast and how crabby cafe in philly has just gone downhill and how we even gave sea bar a chance in chinatown and weren't too happy about it but hands down the boiling house is the closest thing to feeling like i was at the boiling crab, QUALITY seafood, QUALITY ingredients && AWESOME service. we are so happy we went in and cannot wait to make it our continuous seafood go to, so happy we no longer have to go to philly for terrible seafood. The boiling house is a one stop shop for wings, pho, and amazing seafood!  qua the owner is so nice, he did his research,  his food not only blew us away but his hospitality as well as the taste in everything he served us were great!  cannot wait to go back! and best wishes to his establishment!

I love this place. It's not in the greatest ambiance but the food here is fantastic. We have had the tandoori chicken and lamb vendalo as well as the regular and garlic nann bread. If you like Indian food this is the place to go. We  have had dinner here at least 10 times and have never been disappointed. We always bring our own wine b/c there selection is not that good.btw they never charge us a corkage fee either . Which brings up the price. The cost is extremely inexpensive but the quality and quantity is unbelievable. Of all the restaurants we have been to in st. Louis we like this one the best. It's a real treat.

We like this little seafood joint that feels like you are in Louisiana.  Great authentic Cajun crawfish, crabs, lobster pasta (awesome).  Owner is always saying hello and is very personable and pays close attention to his team and the food.  Great place in the middle of Cherry Hill.

Food was good (sunrise sliders) - even though I got bacon when i asked for sausage. Bartender seemed to rather be anywhere besides there taking care of guests. Used hands to put garnishes in drinks but never saw her(?) wash them.

This is a huge hotel where you can easily get lost. I also had to wait a few hours for my room and had to follow-up with the front desk to find out what's going on. It became obvious that they forgot I was waiting. After that initial hiccup, everything was smooth-sailing. Staff was friendly: gave me recommendations on where to go; they also made follow-up calls to my room to make sure that everything was okay. I also had a very relaxing massage at Relache and again, was greeted by very friendly staff. The spa was small, but the amenities were nice and clean. There were many dining places I was able to try: Cascades, Fuse, Jack Daniels, & Old Hickory. All pricey, but the service was good. There's a Cracker Barrel across the street if you want a cheaper dining option. This is a beautiful resort but its size could get overwhelming. Make sure to take the time to explore to get your bearings and familiarize yourself with the different areas.

Took a tour here with a buddy years ago. The tour was great but at the end of walking like 5 miles they only offered 2 small 6 ounce samples. Thank goodness we were pounding them back at every stop. It was like 100 degrees out us two carrying a cooler with a 12 pack on ice. We made friends quick...lol

The Bricks has a super cool vibe. I've visited multiple times for dinner and once for drinks. I'm always impressed with their sandwiches and other food. Normally everything is very fresh and tasty. They have a good sized line up of craft beers most of them local to the area, which is something I'm always looking for. 

It's sort of a dive-y location on the outskirts of the main part of Ybor. Late night they have a small menu of appetizers/small plates and have a DJ. It's clientele leads to some awesome people watching. 

All in all, definitely worth a try. It's not super fancy, so it's perfect for a casual dinner or a new place to try to grab a beer (there's a full bar as well).

A pretty decent pizza place overall. Doesn't hurt that they got a stocked bar :0)

Decor is pretty standard. Two levels and plenty of space. Eating on the balcony in cool weather was really nice especially with a good coconut rum mojito. 

My friend and I had a pie with meatballs on it. Pizza is thin crust style here but tasty. 
I didn't get a chance to peruse the menu more but I think I would consider coming back with a group of people. 

Overall: Try it if you're looking for a new place for pie. You just might like it.

I have been hearing a lot of great things about the appetizers.  We ate there tonight and I ordered the chicken marsala.  What a disappointment!  It looked beautiful but was a Tasteless piece of chicken laying in a bowl with what looked and tasted like dirty water with no resemblance to a marsala sauce.  My wife had the fried chicken which was  just as tasteless with a blah gravy  and a ho hum coleslaw.  Don't think we will give this location another try.  We were told that the Dale Mabry location was much better.  I don't know,  $19 for terrible fried chicken or under $10 for Publix or KFC that is very tasty....nah!

Came here last Thursday night and thought it was just so so. Their Pimm's cup drink was delicious though if you need a cocktail. We started off with the fried oysters and those were pretty good but not as good as the oysters at Cochon. Their gumbo soup came out cold and not very tasty either. Garlic fries were decent. I had the bbq shrimp and that was actually pretty good. Shells are still on so it was nice that they gave me a bib to wear. My husband had the steak and thought it was very bland. My friend had the salmon and she didn't like it either. Fried green tomatoes were good. I doubt I would come back here but it is conveniently located in the French Quarter.
Good food, pretty greasy, but surprisingly expensive. $16 for a standard cheeseburger fries and drink

This is a mixed review. There is so much that I need to say, good and critical. 

First the food: 
As of this review, this is my second visit within two days. The first time it went well. I stayed in and ate at the restaurant. I ordered a brisket quesadilla and a side of rice and beans. The food was good, not great but good. The brisket had good flavor.. The food tastes fresh. 

I was curious enough to try other items. So I went back the next day with my wife. We ordered takeout. She ordered a chicken quesadilla w/ side of rice and beans. I ordered a chicken burrito with side of rice and beans. This is where it went downhill for us. We live like less than 10 minutes away maybe 5-7 minutes. The rice and beans were pretty much cold, almost felt like it was never even heated up. Not the worst thing, I could just heat it up. The quesadilla ended up just being shredded chicken breast with cheese. It didn't have anything to add flavor. The burrito was pretty much the same way, only that it had rice and beans inside the burrito with chicken. It didn't have any flavor at all. 

I would have liked at least the common ingredients like green peppers and onions or tomatoes to add some juice and flavor or some seasoning or spices. It was just too bland.  

The place: 

The people there are very nice and friendly!!! 

It is a brand new restaurant. They have been there only a few months. I am a big supporter of a new small business and I want them to do well and succeed, which is why I went back to try other items and get a scope of their offerings.  

They are severely understaffed. The first time I went, there was only one person running the whole place. The guy was a really nice person. We spoke for a little while. He helped to build the place along with the owner. The restaurant decor and appearance is still a work in progress. 

The second time I went, there was a different guy working all by himself. He was very friendly and nice too. 
I was very curious about the cow head meat, so he offered me a sample. The sample was very delicious. It's very fatty, but I think that is part of the experience with that type of meat. 

Summary: 

I am trying to be very gentle with my review and not trying to hurt them. I want to share the truth about this place because I want the owner to see this and make improvements.
My feelings towards this restaurant would be much different had this restaurant been much older than year. 
::::: It's a new place and I strongly feel that it has much potential to improve the quality of food and flavor ::::::: It also needs to increase its employee staff. They need to take a few days and finish the restaurant appearance. 

I believe the food quality can also be improved if they have equal training for everyone that cooks and prepares the food. I don't know if the food was just not properly prepared on the second visit or if that is the recipe. 

::::Message to the owner and the chef::::: You need to improve the food flavor. That's it. Nothing else. The food tastes like it's fresh, so that is a good thing. 

I think anyone looking for some tacos or Mexican food should give this place a chance. Just stay away from the chicken for now if you want something with flavor and you will be okay. The prices are reasonable. The food is simple with no frills. 

They offer: steak, chicken, chorizo, brisket, cow head meat. Also they have eggs with chorizo. On the weekends they offered a meat special. 

I will give them another try with the other items. I will try and find out more about the food.

Dinner on March 31 was excellent and our waitress was prepared to handle a 3 year old too.  All steaks prime on menu.  Mine was filet mignon center cut laying in a dish of seasoned butter.  Had several sides of potatoes cooked different ways and sauteed spinach.  Finished off with succulent brandy soaked bread pudding.  Wine list is very nice and a little cognac really was nice.  3 yr old enjoyed fries and dancing to some oldies on the jukebox.  Very memorable meal.  Need to call for reservations.  There are 4 curtained booths for couples.

TERRIBLE service ruined the meal entirely. Our main waiter took our order and then never once did he come back to the table, despite the fact that after 45 minutes we still had no food and needed drink refills. He was checking on other tables around us, but he wouldn't even look at us. The second waiter (Rhett or Brett?) was trying his best, he brought us a second round of drinks and finally brought our food. My husband and I split a burger, each of our kids had pasta, and our granddaughter had fried fish. Our $18 burger and fries were stone cold, completely inedible (this should have been that big, delicious burger you can only get at a bistro). The two pasta dishes were both terrible - the Shrimp & Angel hair Pasta was bland and tasteless, and the Pasta Jambalaya was just gross, it tasted awful. My granddaughter's fried speckled trout was actually delicious. We sent the burger back and waited, and waited, and waited some more. Keep in mind, our main waiter could see all of this unfolding the entire time and still never approached us. Finally we asked to speak to the manager, he didn't seem too concerned and he never apologized, just said he would "go find our burger." After another 15 min or so, we got up to leave and the manager finally showed up with our burger. By this point we didn't even care. Finally, the manager became apologetic and offered to comp our meal, he boxed up our burger to go. After two hours of waiting in a beautiful restaurant, my husband and I ended up hurriedly eating our burger in an Uber on the way to City Park. We will NEVER go back, nor recommend it to anyone. We live just a couple of hours from NOLA and visit frequently; in a city with so many fabulous places to eat, why would we ever give our business to a restaurant that treated us so poorly?

I had a chance to try B2 yesterday for lunch. I've ate the original Bluefin at least 100 times over the last decade. The fish quality is good, and the execution is almost as good. The service here is a work in progress. 

We walked in and waited 10 minutes to be seated. The place was not busy. The man working the front desk spent 10 minutes walking back and forth putting together a takeout order while we just stood there. I even asked if we could just sit, and he was very dismissive. I complained again when the guy was going outside the restaurant, and finally he agreed to seat us. Worst seating experience I've had in a long time, so not a good way to start off a lunch. 

The sushi was good, and our waiter was friendly. The pricing is a bit higher, but that comes with the higher rent and liquor license. It took us about 90 minutes to have small lunch, so I just keep that in mind if you have time constraints.
Wow so glad we stopped on our way through philly... not toddler friendly by any means but we got the food to go and it was Incredible... the coffee was some of the best i have had

If I could describe this in two words, it would be amazing and affordable! The food here is absolutely delicious! I especially enjoy the Tikka Masala dishes, but the Vindaloo and Rogan Josh are also delightful! I usually enjoy my curry with a good deal of heat, but they will ask what spice level you prefer, so you can get anything from mild-extra spicy!
Along with your curry, you can enjoy rice and/or naan bread. The naan bread is solid, but the rice is incredible! It's super soft and really compliments the curry entrées!
Now, if you find the curry a tad spicy for your tastes, you can cool down with one of the most amazing drinks found in Tucson. Ladies and gentlemen, I am speaking of the legendary Mango Lassi. Now you can get one of these at any Indian restaurant, but there is no Mango Lassi out there like this one. It's fresh, sweet, and creamy and will quench any fire in your mouth from the curry.
TL;DR- order a Tilka Masala dish along with a Mango Lassi for an amazing and affordable meal!

Alright. I'm a fan. Came in on opening day for some drinks and food.  Great drinks (cocktails and beer list). We sampled the crawfish
mac n cheese, hoisin wings w/ cucumber sauce and chili. All were delicious.

The chili was a bit strange yet amazing. There's some melted chocolate and salt on top. It's weird yet deliciously pleasant.

They're still working out some kinks but I have high hopes for this place.

Went here when I was staying at the Hyatt a couple blocks away.  Mostly just decent bar food, the servers were nice.  Seriously though get the fried pickles.  They come with this subtly spicy dipping sauce.....best....thing.....ever. Heartburn in the middle of the night, but totally worth it!
I love this place.  Still just as good as the last time i reviewed.  Love the Lunch box.  Everything is delicious fresh and made to order.  I will for sure be back more often.

This is our 4th and final time to book this hotel. The service and rooms are simply inexcusable in this price range. For $300+ per night we were booked in a room that was small, poorly appointed and had a malfunctioning AC unit that made loud noise all night. The noise sounded like brakes grinding on metal. It was beyond loud and kept waking us up during the night. The room I booked was supposed to have a couch but didn't. The final straw was the valet service when we were leaving. Waited 20 minutes for the car. This was a mid week stay and the traffic was slower than a weekend. The wait was quite frustrating but to make matters worse, 2 of the employees decided to stand in front of the exit lane to chat while I am trying to leave. They kept talking and it took me another 5 minutes to exit after I had already gotten my car. I actually had to honk my horn to get their attention. They didn't move much at all even after I honked the horn. I find this to be ignorant and I have had enough of this high priced low service hotel.

So I usually combine atmosphere, food and ambiance into a review:
Atmosphere- traditional steak house, waiters in tuxedos
Food: The seafood I had was delicious( BBQ shrimp (amazing), and scallop appetizer delectable!!) 
Ambiance: dimly lit but nice staff, but I'd go back again and again!
Absolutely phenomenal! We were a group of 4 and everyone really enjoyed the food and the view from the patio seating.

I travel quite a bit for work and I always seek out the hole in the wall places that always seem to hit the mark. This is definitely one of them. The fish was fresh, the warm sake was warm, and the staff was friendly. I also had the pleasure of trying a grilled shrimp head instead of the usual fried. I am a fan!! The head had all the flavor with no grease. I will definitely return the next time I am in Edmonton!

Honestly, I'm severely underwhelmed. Don't get me wrong the hotel is huge, entertaining and with beautiful atriums and many walkways but it's insanely overpriced! Everything is. The rooms. The food. The drinks.

It's not worth the price for the size of the rooms and the service.

I'd recommend getting a cheaper place and going to the various attractions around town.

If you get the hankering for something sweet, this is the place to be. Not a big gelatto fan however, the cakes, pies and cookies are the best.

They sale items single serve so you get to sample what you like without breaking the bank. Then if you really like a certain cake and/or pie after tasting a slice, you can order a whole cake to share with others, you just have to give a couple days notice when placing whole cake or pie orders. 

The prices are great, product and quality the best and to top it off the place is very clean. Also, the staff and owner are very nice and make you feel very welcome.

Im  glad this place is here and hope they stick around for awhile. Try them out, you wont be disappointed.

Great happy hour food and bartenders. Doesn't get too busy on the weekdays or during Saturday brunch. 
Would only change the pickle spears that comes with the chicken sandwiches. They taste like they were brined in just salt.

Such a great place and the food was amazing!! I ordered the Carbonara with shrimp and the sauce was delicious and the shrimp were cooked to perfection. My boyfriend had the ravioli and it was also perfect! And our waitress was so nice and friendly! Great place, so glad we ate here!!

New place just opened this Saturday, Ambience is nice looking. The food I have tried so far has been very tasty  and fresh. The owner Salis and the staff are very nice and full of energy and ready to please each guest that walks in. Will be my go to spot whenever I am in Florence

Came in today because I found it on yelp and boy were the reviews accurate! This place is a hidden gem! I will start by saying that I don't like home fries or hash browns at all and these home fries were BOMB like amazing!!!! I had already agreed to give them to my sister and I was sad I couldn't eat more but now I know for next time. The eggs and French toast and bacon were also very good. Their homemade lemonade is delicious and perfect for a warm day. Our server was Kim and she made great recommendations and was very kind and polite. We will absolutely ask for her next time we are in the area. Definitely try this place you will not be disappointed. The wait wasn't too long either about 15 minutes and well worth it.

Went there at 4am and there was only one waitress. I don't go to Denny's often but I didn't remember the food being that bad, completely unsatisfactory. We only got 3 menus, the waitress only come to our table for drinks, order, food, check. We ran out of drinks and never got a refill of all you can eat pancakes. The ranch tasted like sour milk, I can make better pancakes with a box of "just add water" mix. Waste of 40$ for the four of us.

may just be the best pizza i've ever had. my husband grew up in the area and has been pining for it. i went in a little afraid that his memories would be better than reality.    
nope. 
we had a margherita and split an antipasto with balsamic. it was/is amaaaaaazing.
I just love this place! Every time I am in Santa Barbara I try to make time to hit French Press so I can pick up some freshly roasted Castle coffee and an amazing cafe latte :)

I got crepes here a couple days ago and I wasn't impressed. The only place I've ever bought crepes before was at the Bellagio in Las Vegas so maybe my expectations are high..I ordered them to go and by the time I got to my car (2 minute walk) the crepes were cold. They weren't very soft and didn't taste that great. I could've made better ones at home.


On that note, their gelato is delicious. So, if you're going there, try the gelato!
Had the lunch special I loved the breadstick and the pizza was good will for sure be back loved their cheese dipping sauce.  Nice and clean inside.

Yes yes yes

Not only do they provide top notch customer service and hospitality the product needs they over exceeded our expectations. I have been in the industry for 22 years now and I have to say the bread is Absolutely delicious and the flavorful and holds its integrity overtime. We will definitely be returning back to purchase bread for our trips.

I was passing through Tampa and decided to stop by Kinjo's for sushi. Felix T. described it perfectly: unpretentious and friendly, as well as delicious. The fish was very fresh, and they had a nice menu full of staples as well as udon and soba. Yummy!

I mostly liked this place for the atmosphere.  They have a huge patio out front that gets busy for weekday lunch... great people watching.  The crowd was a mix of yuppies and students, and the wait staff was extremely friendly.  My first experience with fried green tomatoes was here: delish.  I ordered a tuna salad sandwhich, which was good but not excellent.  I like that they used dill in it.  My friend enjoyed her BLT.  Overall, I'd say this is a nice relaxing place to enjoy a decent meal.

This place came highly recommended by friends who've lived in the area for a long time and I cant say how disappointed I was with the pizza. 

The crust was absolutely flavorless and so bready, a thick layer of rubbery cheese sat lifeless in the middle and the toppings were ...blah.  

I'd normally chalk up this poor performance to a fluke but we ordered on a Friday night and the place was packed with diners eating in and people coming and going with take out...so I'd have to assume its not a fluke. 

I mean the pizza wasn't horrible but there are definitely way better options in even a two block radius. The inside was clean and had a very nice seating area, so maybe I'll have to give them another shot with something other than pizza.
Great beer selection, food is really good although the menu is skewed a bit nontraditional. Very lively environment, expect to wait a little even with reservations.

If you want to treat yourself to a lovely meal, terrific service and a uniquely comfortable and cozy environment then hurry to Capital Cellars. The menu is interesting but not overwhelming and the food is delicious and beautifully presented.  I expected higher prices for the upscale atmosphere and service but found it very reasonable. A quality and enjoyable experience.

This place is worth it for the tikka masala and nann alone. I've had several different dishes here, and they're great every time! I've never been to the lunch buffet everyone is talking about, but I'll have to try it out!

Yikes- My wife and I have tried eating here twice now... once about a month ago and again this weekend. Both times, no one waited on us and we didn't even see anyone working there as we sat for 15 minutes. Finally someone came out and said they were out of fries. Still hadn't been waited on so we left to go some where else.

The first time we visited, they told us that their cook didn't make it into work and they only had a few items they could make.

Needless to say, i'm tired of trying. They did a nice job fixing it up from what used to be Chumleys, but if you can't get a beer or food, then why even be open?
Truely a foody stop. Great flavors.  Plentiful amount of delicious food.   Loved the pita platter.   My wife had the special platter.  Very tasty assortment.   Wish I lived closer.   A true find.

This is the best breakfast and lunch in town. Friendly staff and very clean settings. Great food!
I'll be back for more. They receive my five stars!

It's busy for a reason! I had the toasted coconut ice cream and it was SO great! The prices are very reasonable. It is a nice little stop and better than any restaurant dessert. Stop in and have a waffle cone!
My fiancé and I waited twenty minutes to be served. We walked out , while everyone around us got served their beverages. Guess we aren't white enough.
Fabulous sushi place with options for even non sushi eaters with cooked, and even chicken options!  Very beautiful space with delicious rolls.  Highly recommended.

Visited Sake house on a Monday evening. The restaurant was empty with one couple dining and is connected to an Italian restaurant. Our server was impolite and kept forgetting items. He forgot our miso soup, water, utensils and to bring our food when it was finished. We ordered tempura and our good was cold, tempura is fried and is served hot. The Sushi to taste was 2.5:5. I unfortunately will not be visiting again and will not recommend Sake house to a friend.

Uni shooters is a must try special; fresh sea urchin balanced really well with the raw quail egg I must say.  I also had the rock crab special which was a decent 3lb blanched crab whole.  I thought the clam chowder was a little light but it was a delight.

Deliciouso!!!  wonderful pre mother's day lunch celebration!  The Parma, prime rib and burger were all delicious topped off with a bottle of Prosecco!   AND that little glass of Port to finish off the meal.  Lions and tigers and bears, Oh My!  

Thanks Nathan!
Thanks Logan! 

See you soon for another great meal!

Had a really good time. The staff and wait staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The grouper was fantastic. My wife really enjoyed her shrimp tacos and my son loved his seafood too. If the weather permits, eat outside by the fishing boats it is very relaxing and a great ambiance.

Good food, good service and great views and music.
Used to come here a lot when it was Chumleys. The food and service was great then. Now? The food is really bad and service is even worse. Its a real shame that Chumleys went away

Amazing! Still making our way through the eats of New Orleans but this will certainly go down as one of the best meals we had in New Orleans. Our servers were amazing and so helpful in suggestions.
