We started with the fried green tomatoes. So yummy. Next was the BBQ shrimp. Oh my goodness. The sauce... save your bread they bring to the table with the butter to dip in this sauce. You get two pieces with the dish but more is needed to soak up the last drop. Bowl is worth licking if no one is looking. We then got the fried oyster appetizer and another super tasty dish. Simple but amazing. We finished with the white chocolate brownie that was suggested by our server as her favorite. She didn't steer us wrong. Another amazing dish at Mr. B's. Everyone around us was raving in about their food too. Go here you won't be disappointed. Drink specials were also fabulous. I'll be raving about this meal for a long time.

I was visiting my best friends sister on music row and she recommended Edgehill Cafe to us because we were looking to grab a quick bite to eat. I walked in around 10:30 and walked up to the counter and was told the kitchen was closed. Talk about feeling bummed out after looking over their tasty menu options. We were standing outside for about 10 minutes and got called back in because the kitchen was some how opening. I am not sure what happened, but I am sure glad I was able to order my Belgian waffle. I added bananas and chocolate chips for a .50 cent up charge and it took the waffle to the next level. The waffle is made with a cinnamon vanilla buckwheat batter and topped with walnuts and syrup. The waffle also comes with a side and I went with the bacon of course. It was nice thick and crispy. You can tell they only use the freshest of ingredients. The coffee mugs are a pretty decent size which allowed me to enjoy more of my peach white tea. 

What I thought made this cafe unique was that it served beer. This isn't your typical coffee shop. They have something for everyone. You also order at the counter and they will bring the food out to you when its ready. The interior was very modern chic. I loved the tufted benches and light fixture in the larger dining area. They also have a really neat patio and lots of tables inside. I would recommend this place if you are looking to grab a quick breakfast.

The Budlight tour was $11 and included 2 beer samples, a bottle to take home, and a beer at the end. Definitely worth the price for all that we go to see and do! This tour got to see a variety of steps in the brewing and bottling process, as well as see/hear about the history of the buildings and the architecture. Would definitely come to do again when! Great destination for when friends and family visit.

Bon Appétit!  Not really, If you go to Macaroni Grill or Olive Garden demanding Authentic Italian food you are too hipster or just a donkey (ahem you know I meant).

I always get great service here, the prices are fair and food is good for a chain restaurant. 

if you use their free appetizer coupon, you can get 2 entrees and an appetizer for less than $20. That's HARD to beat anywhere else. 

is authentic? no, it's Macaroni Grill.
Are you too good for it? No you aren't

This place had a scenic drive and view from restaurant. Their street calamari  and salmon were amazing! My fiancé said "it was the best salmon I've  ever had".This place was definitely a pleasant surprise and would love to go again. Ps... Service was fast and personable as well.

Grilled artichoke was phenomenal and the saltwater grill salad was divine. Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Definitely will be returning.  

Parking can be difficult at times, especially on a weekend.  Sitting outside is an option but not on a summer day.

Recently revisited T&C location. Quite the hopping place. Food is excellent. Service was so much better this time around. Noise, still there so you have to adjust your conversation volume to everyone else's but after awhile you get used to it and it works. Nice place.
My boyfriend called me "basic" for ordering the Mint Chocolate Chip, but it was delicious! Very fresh and creamy.
The sweet potato fries with jalapeño aioli keep me coming back! I always get a bunless burger & each time I eat here I am disappointed. The price is SO high for an okay burger.

Service was great - really nice.  Unfortunately, if you've had good thai - you will be disappointed.  Not authentic flavors.  Buy curry and you have to buy rice separate?  Food was too sweet for what it was.

Decided to try Ryan Christopher for the first time this past Friday with a group of friends who live in Narberth. The 5-star reviews on Yelp were spot-on. We made a reservation, however given the unseasonably warm temperatures, requested to be seated outside once we arrived. The staff was more than accommodating.  Our server was actually "Ryan Christopher's" mother and was willing and eager to answer any questions about the menu and give a few great recommendations. We started with the cheesesteak eggrolls and the coconut shrimp which were both very tasty. I ordered the veal Marsala which was delicious. I can't speak for the rest of my table, but I can say that everyone's plates were clean before the last glass of wine was poured!  I will definitely be back and will tell friends about this neighborhood gem!

I went here a couple of weeks ago, mid-week dinner, with a party of 15.  They were called in advance and notified to have plenty of ice-cold $1 beers on hand and they did.  Service couldn't have been better.  Personal, friendly and efficient.  I had the Fried Green Tomatoe appetizer.  It came with some grilled shrimp and a spicy remoulade sauce.  I highly recommend it.  Then I had the Crawfish Stuffed Portobello and was blown out of the water.  Fan-freakin-tastic!  Will come back here EVERY time I go to NOLA.  And LEVI - no fair using Jeff Goldsmith's picture!!

This coffee shop motivates me to get up and go to work in the morning! The ambience is great- open layout and bright windows. And the baristas are really hardworking and friendly! I find them to be really efficient and great at what they do. The scones and bagels are amazing, and if I know I'm going to have a really busy day I pick up a fancy sandwich for lunch. The only downside is the lack of plug-ins, but that's also kind of a good thing when you consider how much time people spend on their computers! I really treasure my mornings here. Try the vanilla latte!

Best lunch buffet in Tucson!  A great spot for Indian food, I've been coming here for years.  Never had anything here I didn't like.  Their aloo gobi is the best in town, and the naan is always fresh and tasty.  Dinner here is also great, although service can be a little slow at times.  When you pay make sure to grab some candied or sugared fennel seeds, they are the perfect ending to a delicious meal.
Small place. Nothing g fancy. Be prepared to wait. Went there Friday around 4 pm, waited 20 min for party of 2. Food were fresh and tasty and they came out fast. They have good daily special as well.

I don't write Yelp reviews generally because I feel like they unfairly categorize an establishment that everyone has a unique and different experience with. The only time I write a review is when a place is unarguably amazing or stunningly awful. Gaylord is the latter. It's an incomprehensible monstrosity. Ill keep this short and to the point. Laughably overpriced. Horrendous, and I mean God-awful, food. Fruit flies in droves. The most apathetic, unprofessional, poorly trained staff imaginable. This place is just plain depressing on every level.

End of pier. Free 90min parking on pier, $2.50 every hour after. Not a fan of the food, everything blan, seafood wasn't great. Think ppl come here to sit and eat on the pier?

Sorry, its a gimmick tourist place. Service and view is great! But I expected better quality seafood. Maybe I came on an off day? Not one item we got was even decent. BUT its a great view.

Inside seat is stuff and dirty so don't come in your Sunday best. But its total cute pier shop. Outdoor seating can get cold if you go during the fall.

This was one of the best meals I've had in New Orleans, which, considering most things in this town are covered in butter and deliciousness, says a lot. In particular, I usually dislike BBQ Shrimp but that dish is really fantastic here. The sauce is unreal and there is definitely a reason it's their signature dish.

Bacon wrapped Filet cooked medium rare - sauteed spinach - all I can say is WOW. Truly excellent treat. I am spoiled for any other restaurant and will long for my next meal here! Great atmosphere, great service, great food.

I have been several times and recommended to visitors.  Everybody has been very pleased.  I am a foodie from the East and Europe and was quite surprised by the quality of the food and the freshness.  I very rarely eat fried food but was totally happy with the pakoras (spinach and vegetable).  It was apparent that they had just been made and the chickpea flour covering was a tasty combination of crunch and chewiness.  With our guests they were gone in a heartbeat.  We had several curries, mostly lamb and chicken as well as naan and papadam.  A nice assortment of well priced Indian and other beers to match.  Friendly, knowledgeable and efficient service.  I think they are seeing the success they well deserve.
The burgers were o.k. It was a little pricey too. We got one of the specialty beers on the place mat and liked that quite a bit. I probably wouldn't go back. It was just o.k.

This is my favorite breakfast place in nice weather!! They'll make you anything you want ...food is fresh and healthy!  As a bonus, I often run into some of my favorite people here.  So happy it's just a few blocks from my house!
Slow, bad service. Our waiter was terrible.  Then we got OTIS! Best waiter ever.  Great guy.  Redeemed the place. Good food.

I hate to give bad reviews, but, just not much good I can say.  Took a minute to get seated.  Place was not at all busy and was well staffed.  We were greeted pretty quick at our table.  I asked for diet and was told when my drink was delivered they didn't have diet so she brought me a coke.  My daughter and I split an order of nachos.  She forgot to bring a side plate for me, I ended up using an empty side plate of my husbands since asking twice wasn't cutting it.  She finally brought the plate when I was done eating.  She forgot to order my husbands tamale.  He told her to forget it.  She brought it towards the end of dinner, but he ordered chicken and he brought beef.  The chicken nachos were nothing to write home about.  My husband had tacos, beans and rice.  He said it was alright, kind of hard to screw that on up.  Son had beef nachos which he said were alright.  Over all, between the unpersonable service, the screw up of our order, and the lack of enthusiasm over the food, couldn't rate much higher!  Gave one star for the decor.  It was cute.

This place is legit. The bartenders know what they're doing - so venture beyond a coke-and-whisky young boozers.  

In addition to cocktails, I am coming back for more squid.  It was DELISH, cooked to perfection, and drizzled in a savory salty ink sauce.  Other dishes on the menu looked just as divine and adventurous.  Definitely a place to feel secure in trying new things.

Whisky and bourbon drinks are of course a must.  I dined with a Southern Bell and she adored the Mint Juleps.  We also took a flight of margaritas.  My favorite was that with Philadelphia Distilling's own XXX corn whisky - mixed with tart and sour fruit puree it was a treat to the palate.

We sat alfresco along Head House Square's cobbled streets. The table was too small for the four of us and the chairs uncomfortable, hence the knock down to 4 stars.

Very authentic. The service was professional and kind. The owners speak to their guests and ensure that your experience was good. The curry shrimp was pleasing to the eyes and tummy. Some items are made to order, like the macaroni pie, so be aware or ask. Looking forward to next visit and the next meal!

This is THE BEST BBQ ever.  I catered all the meat for a party and their customer service was great my guests raved over the chicken and ribs .  This is a good example of not judging a book by its cover.  I purchased, tasted before ordering and we haven't stopped raving.

... I was here for a business meal. We had the works, however the private room has terrible acoustics. But I give this place 5 stars just for the Fried Oysters ALONE!

They were so good that I went back the day of my departure for a to-go order and enjoyed them at the airport  :-)

Wow! If your looking for a great sandwich this is your place. Located on the corner of dale mabry and fletcher. 
I loved the Godzilla which has turkey, chicken breast, pepper jack, lettuce, tomato, onions and siracha sauce and mayo. I went back the next day to try their world famous pastrami and damn was it good. 
Not to mention their employees were helpful since it was our first time.
Awesome place. The owners and staff are super approachable and knowledgable.  They also have a great selection of supplies for brewing, wine making, and cheese and sausage making. Fantastic.

With not much experience with Peruvian food, I was not sure what to expect. Although after taking a look through the dinner menu, I sure had an idea of what I wanted to order.

We started with a few Entradas - Papa a la Huancaina, Terra Sur Calamari and Causa de Pollo. Out of the three, I have to say I enjoyed the latter the best. The calamari was good, not the best I've ever had, and it was so large it looked more like onion rings.

Then we ordered some main dishes, which turned out to be my favorite part of the meal. Between the Ceviche de Pescado y Camaron, Anticuchos de Carne and Paella, I couldn't decide what was the best. The Ceviche was delicious, the steak was seasoned perfectly and the Paella was one of the best I've ever had.

The atmosphere was quiet and more quaint, so probably not the best place to take a large group, but I was in a small group of 4, so it worked well. There was a lot of cool art on the walls, so interesting to look around, but also had an authentic Peruvian feel, which was a nice change from some of my regular haunts. Terra Sur is also a bit off the beaten path, so if you're not looking for it, it may be hard to find without a recommendation.

I'll be back for future visits I'm sure as there are a number of other menu items I'd like to try.
Great local food! Sicilian pizza was amazing! Service and atmosphere also great! Highly recommend!!!

I Love this place, myself and my family(including 3 kids) come here all the time. All the servers are very nice and welcoming. They are very attentive. I love the bobba teas and if I ever have questions about the menu the girls are so kind and friendly. I love eveything I've tried so far. My favorite so far is the udon soup and peking beef. The bowl of udon soup is so big we shared it with 4 people and still had some to take home! I am constantly recommending this place. They do also do delivery, but my house is a ways away from the resturant so I havent tried it, but I am actually within the delivery area.

This had to be the worst Mac Grill experience ever.  The food was about 3 stars, but the service was horrid.  I wont name anyone, but our server did not care about anything.  First off, server seemed annoyed to serve us, had to pull teeth to get balsamic with the bread.  That was after not having any water for 10 or so minutes after being seated.  When the food was brought, server just sat it down and ask anything else.  Well, yes.  Parmesan, red pepper etc would be nice.  Again, server seemed annoyed to have to get these items.  

Then, when we paid the bill, I was not even fished signing and the server came up and tried to grab the unsigned receipt as if he was just trying to get out of there.  Everything about our experience after finally getting water seemed rushed and this place does not seem to have any organization with the service.  There were two servers and about 4 tables at this time, so not sure what the problem was.

The food needed to be salted and it still was very average.

Mr B's Bistro was recommended to us from another couple & it did not disappoint when it came to the flavors of the food. 
We ordered the 20oz Ribeye & the Speckled Trout. Unfortunately we ordered the ribeye medium rare & it came out pretty much bleeding. We had to send it back to be put back on the grill. Needless to say my fish got cold while I waited to eat with my husband. But the flavors were so good that we're still rating it 5 stars. The manager did come to apologize & comp'd us two desserts which were both fantastic. We got the molten chocolate cake & the lemon pie. Food was great, service was poor when comparing it to other fine dining establishments. 

Overall score 4.8

Well we had an interesting dining experience. Our server Choncy was nice. She took our order and got our drinks promptly. We received our salad after about 15 minutes. Then we waited... And waited.. and waited.. an hour goes by we ask what's going on and say we are about to leave. Choncy got the manager, he apologized profusely and said he was getting the order now. He also said the meal was on them which we appreciated. The culinary manager came out and apologized and said he was keeping an eye to get it out to us quickly. The food finally arrives, my mom's pizza is hot my food is luke warm. It tasted ok, definitely not note worthy. 

So I appreciate the measures taken to correct the problem but the food was not really with that wait. The server was nice but she could have been more attentive and aggressive about our food.
I have been at a slowe McDonald's in my life. I go there because I work in the mall. With limited time I sat 10 minuted waiting for a soda. I went elsewhere. Unreal

I would be remiss if I did not tell you that this jaded New Yorker actually spent time just staring at the magnificence of the Opry. The indoor gardens & waterfalls are fantastic and provided a welcome dose of oxygen and humidity while battling the worst cold I've had yet this winter. The rooms were beautiful, too, and the beds super comfy. That being said there were a few things that kept my experience from being a 4-star:

- The resort/convention center is HUGE and the maps are CONFUSING. At check in I learned they created an iPhone app to help you navigate around and I thought, "wow, what a forward-thinking hotel chain!"  I was expecting some kind of interactive map using GPS. Unfortunately the app is literally just a list of events and an iPhone-sized version of the same color-coded, confusing, and not-at-all-detailed map that you can find plastered all around the hotel. How was that supposed to help me? 
- The woman who checked me in, upon giving her the room reservation name (i.e. my name), very condescendingly told me that I would have to wait until Devin got there to check me in (she assumed it was only a boy's name). This is why you just ask for ID, people!
- I paid more money for this airport shuttle than I did in Vegas, and it doesn't even take you downtown! And then they tell me it must seem so cheap to me, being from NYC and all. Um, no, actually $40 round trip for a 10 minute ride to and from the airport when most hotels offer such service free of charge seems like a rip-off.

Cool place to stay overall, but could definitely improve. If they ever make a real iPhone map application to help navigate the hotel, that would definitely bump it up at least a half star if not more.

Took half of our family for dinner and was so pleased with our service and our delicious food! And we tried like half of the menu! Our waitress was the sweetest and everyone was so tending to our many needs. We will definitely return! Desert was even better and I highly recommend the pizza!

Being lactose intolerant, it's hard to give up ice-cream. But frozen yogurt... I can do frozen yogurt. It's a wonderful little gem in the middle of the Arts & Design District of picturesque Carmel. I went with a friend of mine from work and we were able to sit, catch up and "chill" with our frozen yogurt. 

I was pleased with the staff's friendliness. I will always remember a bad staff member. Occasional chit chat and smiles go a long way with me.

I went with a lot of expectations but the dosa was cold and really poor service. I have definitely had way better dosa in Nashville. We were not even given  water even after asking for it. Very disappointed. Never going there again.
Great food! I love their Paneer Masala and Saag Paneer. Very friendly service as well.

I wish I could rate this place higher:

- watermelon drink: only $1.35, freshly blended with a bit of ice. Perfect!

- edamame salad: fresh ingredients, but next to no seasoning which made it taste blend. Server lady asked how it was and was very receptive to the feedback, but the other person said to be the manager was not. Disappointing.

- purple cloud: interesting combo of salmon and chicken tempura. Loved red and green onions. Perfect!

- fire tornado: the topping was way too saucy and the whole thing ended up swimming in the sauce. It was out of balance and too rich. Again, server lady was appreciative of feedback but the manager was not, which is a shame. 

They are a new local business and we appreciated the clean, modern decor, but I'm not sure if I'd readily want to go back. I hope they improve and do well.

Overpriced and pretentious. 
I got the pate and cheese plate. You get huge hunks of dry chese and some pate along with stale crackers and wilted greens for $12.
My husband had the fish and chips. I don't know who the hell makes the breading, but please, add some salt or spices to it! So again, you'll fork over $13 for bland and boring fish and some overfried fries.
Despite the fact that they serve exclusively bar food, it take forever to get it. 
If you really must venture there, get a drink and get out!
Super cute find! Thanks Yelp! Very small place, you can easily miss it. Only about 12 tables inside, nice sized bar with 3 large TV's. Food was great! I would come back!
Friendly staff, delicious pizza, even though it was at the end of the night they took care of a mistake on our pizza without asking and re did it.

After perusing the menu and reading a few well thought out reviews, me and my lady decided that this was an excellent Greek themed location and were very excited to eat here on our anniversary. We called to make a Sunday reservation, at 7:30, and were on our way.

Upon arrival, we found the bar area about half full, and the majority of the restaurant empty. So far so good. We then approached the host/hostess stand and promptly waited for 5 minutes, trying to catch the attention of any of the server, all whom purposefully avoided eye contact. Peering at the reservation sheet, i noticed our reservation for 2 was the only one within two hours of any others. Now, 5 minutes standing at a restaurant is a pretty long time, especially in the middle, at the host stand. Finally, a tall man (who we later were told was the owner) bustled up and said verbatim; "Here's whats gonna happen. You two are gonna sit on this couch over here and we will be with you in five minutes." No offer of a drink at the bar, no pleasantries.
We sat on the couch for over 15 minutes, feeling like we were children in timeout, being punished. Finally, a waiter approached us and told us to go ahead and sit anywhere we liked. it was very near 8pm at this point. upon sitting at the table for a good 10 minutes, the waiter approached, and we ordered a bottle of wine, waters, and also asked a question about the Mahi Mahi, which we were very excited about. He told us he would have to get back to us, and there we sat for about 15 more minutes.

As we were getting pretty upset, we saw the server ambling up with our bottle of wine, so our frustrations were temporarily relieved. We asked about the mahi again, and he again told us he had to check. 5 minutes later, he came back and answered our question. Good, as we were pretty hungry at this point in time. We ordered, and sat sipping our wine, watching the owner roam around to literally every table but ours. A good 20 minutes later, the waiter came and told us that they were unfortunately out of Mahi Mahi. This was at 8:45. Still no water. We decided that eating wasn't worth it anymore, and asked why a table of 5 that had just arrived was greeted and seated right away. We were told they had a reservation. When we replied that we also had had one, and we waited a good 25-30 minutes, he actually mumbled something unintelligible while backing away. Still no apology from the owner, or any of the servers. Our waiter came back, and asked if we wanted anything else. We replied that we wanted the check, and finally we were told that the night was crazy and they usually were like a "well-oiled machine." After sitting at the 1/3 full restaurant for over an hour and a half, I highly doubted this claim.

At this point in time, we were so anxious to leave that we actually recorked our half full bottle of wine, paid the bill, and left. This was by far and away the most horrible restaurant experience I have ever had.
I would rather eat at a Shoney's than Momos. Please do not give them business. Avoid this place at all costs unless you are in the mood for a night of slow, painful, regret.

Had the buffalo mozzarella... Was pretty light on the mozzarella so tasted more of the breading than I wanted to.
House salads were alright.  My husband felt they were a bit light on the Italian dressing.
 I had the chicken modega.  It was good but not what I expected from the description.  It came with a mushroom risotto which had a good flavor but was slightly undercooked.
My husband had the filet which melted in your mouth... Excellent!
Very cool tour! The staff was extremely friendly. The beer was cold and free (you get 2 per person per tour), and the grounds were gorgeous. Also, the tour is free!

I wanted to like Mr. B's. Unfortunately, I don't think our server wanted us to like Mr. B's. 

We wanted to have some post brunch drinks somewhere closer to our hotel. Since we were only drinking, not eating, we made sure to tell the hostess that, because their bar area was full. She sat us at a dining table anyway, even after we asked if she was sure it was okay. We didn't want to inconvenience them, but it was 3pm and there was no evident mealtime rush. She assured us it was fine.

Clearly, NOT fine. It takes a lot to make me feel guilty for drinking (sorry for partying), but I immediately felt the disapproval from our server. When we had to tell him that we were just drinking (couldn't the hostess have told him that?), there was some major attitude. When he brought us our first round of drinks, he asked if this would be the only round. It just seemed rush, weird, and full of 'tude. I imagine they aren't hurting for business since they have a prime location for hungry tourists that don't feel like looking any further, but that's also probably the same reason they can get away with being a little rude. 

If it wasn't for the supreme politeness and friendliness from other New Orleans restaurants, then maybe my standards wouldn't be so high, but Mr. B's fell short of the outstanding customer service we experienced at virtually every other establishment, yes, even the to-go daiquiri shops.

Lovely decor, very friendly and helpful staff and five star food. Fried oysters were amazing, the sushi was the best I have had in the phili area. The dumplings were also superb. They are updating their liquor list so the whiskeys were not listed BUT you can still order whatever you want. I will be back I ate this on Saturday and am already craving it again! I just wish they had fried rice but honestly everything was amazing

We were here for a trade show so keep that in mind when reading this review. This place is great when you're spending a few days with more than 3000 of your best friends. 

first, let's talk arrival. We flew into Nashville and there is a shuttle but it's $30 per person round trip. taxi's are $25 plus $1 for each additional person. We found another  person going to the hotel that shared the cab so it was about $10 per person after tip.

Check in. We over 3000 people attending check in was hectic but the hotel had several people handling the check in and it went about was well as one could expect.

The rooms. spacious and comfortable. Our room overlooked the atrium and had a small balcony with a small table and 2 chairs. I would definitely recommend a room on the atrium side. Nice big screen tv, fridge, and microwave. Free internet which I am using as I write this. A little slow for a small fee you can get faster internet.

Food. Very good, especially when we had lunch buffets. Restaurants are good but rather pricey. 

Facilities. Plenty of room for our large group. the only hiccup was there were some internet problems during some of the presentations but that could have been operator error.

Staff. Very friendly

This resort is nice but pricey. Nice for a special occasion or convention. Be prepared to pay resort prices for just about everything but for what it is the Gaylord does a good job.

Can't beat 50 cent wings during Saints' games - every flavor is delicious! Who Dat!

Great environment, delicious drinks, and perfect football food. Try the Kentucky Sunrise - bourbon, maple syrup, red wine - sounds unusual but tastes better than you can imagine.

Love mellow mushroom!

It's cheap and usually pretty clean.  Bring a quarter for the cart and your own bags!

I really hate buying food.  Aldi makes it not feel like I got mugged.  Sure there are no name brands, very limited selection and not even bags but its cheap.  I do an Aldi run at least once a month for staples then supplement at other stores when I need something specific.  The quality is usually great for food and so-so for cleaning supplies and other stuff.

Never go in for 1-2 things, the lines are almost always long.

I really liked Akira.  I came here on a Groupon-type deal and it made the price a little bit better.  I got some curry that was very delicious, and everybody I was with seemed to enjoy their meals.  Certainly not my favorite eatery in Collingswood, but it definitely wasn't bad.

The interior is comfortable and cheery.  Weekends are crammed with families and kids so I go during the week
Nice personal pizza's. This visit I had mushroom, anchovy and sausage. It was good :-)
Their steaks are very good. Fries are ok.   The best thing is $4 Stella's !

Don't be discouraged by what seems to be a lack of parking. There is plenty on the side and back.

.
Love love love Ardmore Pizza!!! Their food is delicious!! Always fresh!!! Delivery is quick! Matt is the best!!! He took great care of us!!! Can't say enough good things about this place!!

Friendly service. The shrimp alfredo was quite tasty! We also enjoyed a special lobster ravioli and saccetti w grilled chicken. Kids are tweens. Next time I will try for something a little lighter. Maybe a salad, soup and a half portion of the pasta. Service attentive, we were there on a Monday night in May, so not too busy.  Other customers seemed to be regulars and they did a surprising amount of take out while we were there. From one of the dining rooms we were able to see into the kitchen. The chef smiled and waived. I always enjoy seeing the cook. Decor appears to be provincial
Italian w costumer pictures and murals on the walls and ceramic tile on the floor white table cloths lighting was medium and music at good conversational volume. I bet this place could be pretty busy Thursday-Saturday.
SO GIVING, SO LOVING, SO WELCOMING!!! Can ya'll move to Cali! Love them, tip them, they deserve it

Love this place and the locAtion and the food for the most part! But my service this time was awful. Our server didn't greet us and made me feel like I was an inconvenience to him the whole time. Others around me had great service and people continued to get their food before my table. We waited a 50 minute ticket time and drinks were constantly sitting empty. AJ you need to either go find a job you love or suck it up and put on a smiling face for your guests. It is your JOB to serve guests.. If you can't do so... Then get out of  the service industry. Salmon was over cooked and so was the chicken.

This is a very nice store and a great find for non-locals who are captive to strict local alcohol laws in PA.  Located right in a charming tree-lined neighborhood called Ridley Park (especially on a spectacular spring day like the day I visited), you can find plenty of coin-metered head-in parking (nickels, dimes and quarters accepted - one quarter buys an hour of time) and enjoy a number of cool shops to use up your quarter.  I saw an old fashioned ice cream parlor across the street.  

The inside of the store is clean and although I can't comment on the spirits since I rarely ever buy them a couple of customers brought some interesting vodkas and bourbons to the register that I'd never heard of.  You can pick up a lot of mainstream wine brands here such as Barefoot and Mirassou if you're not looking to spend a fortune on a bottle for very reasonable prices.  The staff are very polite and professional.

I ordered the Kung fury bowl and it's pretty good, just not a huge fan of Asian slaw. The restaurant is pretty cool with the decoration and not at a super crowded location in ybor. The service was a bit slow, but the food came pretty quick.

I've been here a couple times and the service has been excellent. Taco Tuesday offers $2 tacos and $3 margaritas. It's an easy place to walk into and get flavorful Mexican food with a very nice staff to serve you.

This place is amazing!! I was so surprised and in awe that places like this exist. It's free to enter and you can pay to park close by or park for free at the mall and walk over from there.  There are small shops and spots to grab a bite and several different garden areas to explore. I love being outside and seeing sights without the elements of being outside so this was a perfect spot for me to visit.
We love this place and go regularly for the best sushi in the area.  It's under massive renovation but is set to reopen - with much nicer decor from what I hear - around Thanksgiving.

Rooms are WAY overpriced for what you get. You get more at a super8 or best western for 1/4 of the price. No microwave in room, only a tiny fridge. Beds were comfy but very standard. There wasn't any breakfast or free parking. We had to park at the mall and walk over, considering it's $24 (plus tax) a day to park. And all of the activities are triple the price they should be. We bought some alcoholic drink wavers (3 tickets for $50) and one voucher scored us a sample of beer in a Dixie cup. Restaurants are overpriced and we had the worst service. Food was cold, burger was cooked rare when it was supposed to be medium, etc.

It's beautiful, and there are some fun activities (we really liked the ice sculptors) but there's no point in staying here. Just come look around and do some of the activities for free (they didn't even card us to get into the indoor swimming area) and spend the night at a cheaper hotel. You'll be happier in the end, trust me.

They care more about waterfalls than people.  Stood standing in my room on the phone waiting for someone to pick up so I could order room service.  No dice.  Called the front desk.  They put me back in the phone tree.  More wasted time and told to wait.  Called back and asked for a manager.  Shelly said I'd have to wait.  All she had to do was take my order so I didn't have to stand in the middle of the room any longer.  Of course not.  40 minutes later I wound my way through their stupid jungle and sat at the bar. No food there.  Had to go over to their less than relaxing sushi bar for $40 central TN fish.  Thanks Gaylord.  I was exhausted and wanted in room delivery.  Seemingly a simple request for a trillion dollars per night.  They failed miserably.

Must have been my lucky day because they are usually closed on Mondays(my only day off), but they opened the upper dinning area because they had a private party in the main room. A great dinner followed  with very reasonable prices. And yes the steaks are really prime.

Cesarinas is one of my favorite Italian restaurants . The food there is fresh and flavorful along with the perk of great prices . If anybody asked me if I recommend something to them I would say the steak and cheese with peppers and onions. Great food there

I no longer live an Philly and this might be the place I miss most.  Everything on the menu is delicious, authentic and consistent.  The atmosphere for a hole in the wall on South Street is perfectly fitting.  I always enjoyed the classical music, tasteful decor and the friendly service that makes one truly feel welcome.  I can't wait to come back next time I'm in Philly.  Thanks for all the great meals!
We always love the food here and Angie waits on us almost every time. She's very personable and friendly. The burger is good and the pasta dishes are as well.

Cheap and delicious. Seriously, where can you get  breakfast sandwich and 16oz coffee for $2.89? 

Every employee I've interacted with has been super nice and the food is great for the price. I work in the area and go here now and again for a solid, cheap breakfast.

It's insane to me that this spot has a lower rating than I think it should. Heart breaking, actually.

Perhaps I think it should be better than it is, because we came by so late after 11pm and got amazing food & decent drinks all for decent pricing. 

I was going to say if you're a white wine drinker, be sure to SKIP THE CHARDONNAY AND GO FOR THE PINOT G. FOR SURE!!! 

The Chardonnay is bitter and the flavor is not great - bummer! 

HOWEVER YOU MUST MUST MUST. UHM MUST. Get the quesadilla!!! Our friend highly recommended the chicken, but I went with the bean, it was GREAT!!!!

I had high hope on this fairly new but seems popular restaurant. So I went there on a Friday night with a friend of mine. 

At 7:30pm, It was very crowed, fortunately we made a reservation. We were seated quickly by the window. The server was friendly and nice. Each of use ordered a drink. I ordered Lychee - it's a $15 cocktail. The drink was plain and I could barely taste alcohol. For the price I pay, I would expect a fantastic cocktail. Who wouldn't? 

Then it comes to the sushi. We actually also ordered a fried rice. It's very average fried rice, like the ones you can get in Chinatown for $8. But you pay double of the price in this "fancy" restaurant. The sushi was ok. Just ok. I'm a sushi lover, and I've tried many sushi restaurants, good and bad. The sushi we had was just average. Didn't blow my mind at all.

Overall, this restaurant is over priced for the food, but I must give credit to its ambience, very modern and romantic. They also have outdoor seating. It's a good restaurant for a date night, but don't expect good food.

The BESTTTTT duck eggrolls you will ever have!!  A friend recommended the barbecue shrimp so we tried that as well.. 

The atmosphere is comfy and the service is great.. the servers all have this friendly southernism to them... "oooh gurlllll you soo perttyyyyyy"

We tried their Fried Calamari (4/5) on the pier bc we were famished from walking 3 mi from our hotel to the pier... Glad there was a restaurant at the end of the pier and glad that they had a take out window! 

Fried calamari combo came with fried scallops, fried oysters, fried shrimp and of course fried calamari (we didn't get to try the calamari bc they ran out... they instead gave more of everything else)... It also came with side of onion rings and cole slaw... 

The combo actually isn't big... it's about 2 pieces of each... but I think the price is reasonable... around $13-14... 

For us it was a good snack before dinner... Haha...

Pro: Price reasonable, take out window, location (end of pier), food pretty good

We chose Trattoria Totaro on the recommendation/suggestion of my daughter who had dined here recently for a family dinner to celebrate our son and daughter-in-law moving.  There were five of us with one gluten free eater.  It is a BYO so we brought wine and our server took good care of opening and serving it.
There are quite a number of wonderful sounding dishes, most with home made pasta, We all loved our choices including appetizers of calimari and roasted pear salad.  The gluten free person was very happy with his vegetable lasagna layered with risotto instead of pasta and shrimp on top.  Shrimp Fra Diablo kept two more lifting their forks with pleasure and lastly the Rigatoni Alio Olio with home made pasta substituted for the riggies was wonderful.  Some came home with us from the generous portions,  The deserts were delish (canolis and blueberry crumble, home made and warm) and again generous portions.  We will be back.
It is an unassuming little corner place on quiet Spring Mill Ave,  Charming and comfortable. Give it a try.

Place was a 5-star 3 years ago , I am not sure what happened.  The Big Ben was good, but I also looked like my grandma made it and through it on a plate - the $3 side of sausage was 5 small shriveled up pieces of slim jims.  It sucks because I did like this place but now, will probably not come back.

I'm not gonna lie, their GUMBO looked and tasted like BURNT MOLE (it's a Latin dish for those who might not know what MOLE is) another weird thing about our gumbo, it was warm, but the meat was hot! So it lead me believe they threw in the meat into the gumbo and stirred and thought no one would notice. 2 THUMBS DOWN‼

I loved visiting the French Press! I had to step in when I spotted them while searching for our breakfast in downtown.

To begin with I have problems with local coffee shops, I cannot resist them easily. I loved the French Press' over all decoration; simple and white. My Americano was delightful, and I enjoyed it in my usual style, black.

I was very tempted and wanted to stay in for more cups, but we were ready for our breakfast. Whenever I get into Santa Barbara, I know where I can grab quality cups!
Great stuff. Thoroughly enjoyed everything we had from here. Will go there again. Friendly staff and owners are hands on. Food is delicious!!

Outstanding. The cocktails are interesting, and very aromatic. The food is excellent. The beef tataki was excellent. The bacon is fine but really just bacon.  If you are hungry, try the proper ham and cheese. This will be our new after the Symphony place.
I eat here more than I probably should. And they screw up my order at least 50% of the time. They don't seem to understand the request "hold the onions".

This place is great if you need to get off of the strip and have a moment to chill out. The server I experienced last night was rather rude, but the ice cream soda I had was delicious, despite him knocking my choice of flavors. 

If you're looking for truly delicious ice cream, go to Jeni's. If you want an old-timey soda jerk type experience, go here.
We sat on the pretty patio and ordered dinner combinations. Delicious Tom Kha and curries and kind, attentive service. Thanks for a most pleasant dinner!

Stay away! 

Food is decent, but the service is atrocious -- enough so that I can only give a single star. It took well over an hour to get served our main course, and we practically had to beg for our appetizers to come out sooner. Getting napkins, silverware, and water refills was a chore too.

Some sort of acknowledgement that service was lacking would have been nice; maybe an apology. Then again, asking for extra plates to allow our kids to share noodles drew an eye roll from the waiter. 

So, if you want an ok meal, accompanied by legendary bad service, leave the kids at home, because this is your place. Just remember to pick up extra money at the ATM to pay the babysitter.

Oh, and PS, if you have to go to the bathroom, I suggest holding it in. The restrooms are disgusting. Paper, soap and other liquids everywhere. And there was a bloody napkin on the floor in the men's room. 

Yep, one star.
Aesthetically beautiful, delicious and tasteful in many ways. The place exudes class and good taste - and things that taste good. i'm a fan.

Roast chicken sandwich was delicious, but be careful.  The assistant manager felt no remorse that they served the sandwich with a 2 inch long chicken bone included. Makes the whole restaurant operation suspect... Gordon

Follow up... Chef Jose Guido of Lucky Penny (a related food service) approached and apologized for the mistake in food preparation by the staff at Helena Ave. Bakery. He also offered us cookies in compensation. Revising my review of the Helena Avenue Bakery to 4 stars

I ate here everyday of our four day stay.

W O W.

The Big Dog Ale was some of the best I've tried and the Pizzas are out of this world.
Try "The Don". MMMM.
You can get a plastic cup to go if you want to walk around the Hotel/Casino.
FABULOUS Happy Hour prices, too.

It is filled with TVs tuned to sports channels and gambling games in the bar.
smoking is allowed at the bar...

Just moved to the area, finally got to try this little cafe. Very quaint, the owner is an absolute doll, and everything from the breakfast to the house coleslaw is fantastic. Get the Barista Bagel! It's the best!

Went to Terra Sur based on a friend's and Yelp recommendations tonight.  Started out with the Monk in the Trunk Amber Ale...delicious...highly recommend it.  It's a microbrew and very good.  For an appetizer I had the Tequenos and Yucca combo plate.  Very tasty with two dipping sauces.  My friend had the octopus in olive oil.  It was sliced thin, very tender and roasted just right.  Too often octopus is overcooked or cut too thick so it's like chewing rubber.  This was perfect!

The highlight was the Ceviche Mixto. What I liked about it was that it wasn't swimming in a bath of lemon/lime juices but was arranged artistically on the plate covered with slivers of red onions.  One nice touch that I've never seen before is the use of corn....hominy and roasted corn kernals.  The counterpoint of the soft, almost grape-like hominy, with the crunchy but not hard, roasted corn kernals was wonderfully tasty and interesting.   The fish, squid, and octopus were flavorful, spiced just right, and firm so you know it was fresh.

I didn't think it could get any better until the waitress mentioned the mango cheesecake.  If you can't eat another bite, get a slice to go...you won't regret it!

I've postponed writing a review just because I have a soft spot for inaugural posts in general. However, seeing as that's not going to help anyone, I'm going for it.

For the most part, Jackson's works the Nashville grungy-hipster-organic vibe well. I like to imagine the designer of the space saying, "Hey let's suspend a fireplace in the middle of the restaurant! And might as well bring in the corrugated steel, expose the wood beams, and turn off the lights too. Don't forget the garage door style cabana!" By the end of the meal, this haphazard schematic made me long to be outside in the afternoon sun, but if the dark, loud, and crowded feel appeals to you, then this is the place to be.

My party and I were seated promptly, given the bustling Sunday afternoon crowd. Our waitress was friendly and quick. Our food, much less so. It was a good thing that my companions and I had a lot to talk about, because it took a noticeably long time for our food to come out. They even apologized twice and told us the food would be out soon. Ten minutes after that, our meal arrives from exactly three feet away from our table.

I think the best way to describe this meal is in bite-sized thoughts. So, I ordered the Ahi Wasabi Caesar Salad and:
 Bite One: Oh, I miss sesame and boy, do I love the sesame crust.
 Bite Two: The salad looks unattractive. But I'll eat it.
 Bite Three: The salad is all right, but I think it's the dressing I like. I miss wasabi too. 
 Bite Four: I thought I ordered my tuna medium rare, but it's definitely medium-well. Chewy, not smooth. 
 Bite Five: I'll stick with the sesame crust.
 Bites Six through Eighty-Two: Repeat
 Bite Eighty-Three: Too much wasabi, too little lettuce. Too much over-done tuna, too little crust. I'm done.

It was all right, not too impressive, but then again I'm not easily impressed by food in Nashville anyway. The price range at Jackson's is pretty average too, especially in the Hillsboro area. The salad I had felt a tad bit more expensive ($11). A couple of my friends also had tuna, but in a sandwich, and that was at least $3 less, including fries. 

Overall, I'd say Jackson's is average to good. Not stand out, but solid.

And with that, I've written my first review!

So went here after reading good reviews expecting something great but got something mediocre.  Location is great but it is very tiny no tables inside just bar seating and only 4 tables outside on pier. Food was ok but nothing to write home about and I've had better at Red Lobster.  Waiter was nice and attentive and was pretty reasonably priced.

Really enjoyed the tour.  Discovered mufalettas at the Napolean House that were outstanding. We later went back for more. Tour guide was very nice, but didn't seem too popular at a couple of the okaces. Groupon pricing is the only way to go.

Great time for our group (11 am tour, Sat., 31 March 2018). It was most informative. I had taken the standard, free tour before, but going "behind the scenes" to find out more on A-B's history helped make this tour worthwhile. The tour guide was most informative. The free sample glass and replica 1880 sample token were nice perks (as was the sample of Budweiser drunk from said glass, and the free beer after the tour). Learning more on the history of A-B and seeing examples of their advertising over the years was very good. I greatly enjoyed this tour and would highly recommend it to anyone with an interest in beer and in A-B.

Wife and I have eaten lunch here a few times over the past 6-weeks.  Always a take-out and we have never dined-in.  For the most part the lunches have been OK. Nothing real special to brag about. On the last visit, we ordered a Greek salad and two bowls of chili.
The bar tender is a great lady to work with and pleasant.  every time we call in an order, we are told the estimated time it will take to be ready.  Usually 10-minutes.  Every time we arrive, generally between 10-15 minutes, we have to wait an additional 5-+ minutes.  This last visit was no different.  Paid the bill, about $15.00 and went back to the office to eat.  Very disappointed in the $5.95 salad as there was virtually no lettuce and only a 1/8 wedge of tomato.  The chili was served in 20-ounce styrofoam go-cups.  The chili was Luke-warm at best.  By the way, the drive takes 4-minutes to get to my office from the retaraunt.  I have found the place an OK place as a restaurant but certainly appears to be nothing special.

We got there late in the day and only 2 lb crabs were left so we opted for other menu items instead.
I got lobster pasta (very little lobster was evident) and my wife got crab cakes (mostly filler and seasonings).
We also had shrimp bisque (very little shrimp taste)

The food was not bad, but not great either.  Very middle of the road, thus 3 stars.

I think if you're not going to get the locally caught crab you'd be better off dining somewhere else.

When we arrived to Gaylord Opryland we were blown away with the beauty of the resort. We always stay at nice 5 star hotels, like the ritz Carlton. This resort seemed to be on the same caliber. Beautiful lobby. Extremely clean rooms. Comfortable beds. Waterfalls everywhere. A well stocked gym with treadmills that had personal televisions. 

I would have given them 5 stars but after staying here for 5 nights you are bound to find a few areas that they fell short.  First problem was the concierge.  Elizabeth acted like she was high or extremely drunk. She was slurring her words and had a glazed look in her eyes. We wanted suggestions on what we could do on Monday before our flight took off in the evening. The best suggestion she had was the mall. We have the best malls in LA. I went online and checked out what things we could do. There were loads of tourist attractions. The concierge was totally useless.

The second issue we had was with the housekeeping staff.  We stayed here for 5 nights. I used to work in hotels and I know that the sheets need to be changed after the third night. They didn't do that here. I called down and requested the sheets be changed. When we got back to the room the sheets were not changed.  This showed me that their front office staff did not communicate well with their housekeeping staff.  

We will definitely be back to the Gaylord Opryland because of it's beauty and the comfort of the rooms and nice restaurants.

Was in the neighborhood and needed a space to grab a quick breakfast and to get some work/reading done. Red Hook was a great space for both. The small space was quiet with one 1-2 other tables of customers but tons of foot traffic of folks stopping in to grab a coffee. I was indecisive and asked for a recommendation on a breakfast sandwich. Ordered the Preacher Man which was a good blend of sweet and savory. Bonus points for the tempeh bacon and veggie sausage options. I think all sandwiches come with a side of potato salad which was also tasty. Would definitely stop back if I'm this neck of the woods again.
The service was quick and easy. The bagel was delicious and the cost was cheap too. It was a nice discovery that wasn't too far from home.

I went to this place for the first time last Saturday. I just wanted a place to grab some brunch that had mimosas and my friend suggested here. Boy am I glad she did!

Besides the crazy run in with a hard core group of strangers doing a running/fitness challenge, the staff there was really really friendly. Our server was very friendly and he even gave us free Appletinis on him!

I had the deluxe grilled cheese and it was really really good. 

The decor was awesome and I'm definitely going back and bringing friends!

If you are downtown this is a must. Great music, food was delicious and staff very friendly. We were in Nashville 3 days and stopped in each day. Musicians play acoustic so you can enjoy and still have a conversation. Check out their 2 for 1 beers during happy hour!
Love this place! The buffet is always packed with traditional Indian favorites; they're always hot and fresh. If you like Indian buffets, you should definitely check this place out.

Sofia, you did it again.  Your food has once again blown my mind (for the third time).  This time was also the best!

Since reading about the mezze dinner promo, I searched and waited for the (few) interested friends to become available to join me on this greek feast.  Sofia only offers the mezze dinner during the summer and a mezze dinner consists of small plates, similar to spanish tapas.

Dish 1: Assorted dips served with pita wedges and dolmades.  The dips were tzatziki, a feta cheese/tomato mixture, hummus, a spicy garlic/eggplant dip, and veggie dip.
Thoughts: Ahhhh so good.  My favorite was the feta mixture.  It tasted fantastic!

Dish 2: Grilled octopus & feta stuffed calamari.
Thoughts: Wow, I had feta stuffed calamari at Estia and Sofia's just blows theirs away.  Both the octopus and calamari were flavorful and cooked to perfection.

Dish 3: Beets with skordalia.
Thoughts:  I've never had beets before, and I will say that my first experience was good.  They were served cold and with a vinagrette of some sort drizzled over.  The skordalia is a "mashed potato" type of dish.  In fact, I just may like it better than mashed potatoes.  The amount of garlic in the skordalia was delish!  Both of these together are definitely ingredients to a flavor explosion in one's mouth.

Dish 4: Horiatiki salad.
Thoughts:  This is a REAL greek salad.  I'm used to the greek salad with lettuce, feta, olives, anchovies, etc...but this was good...very good.

Dish 5: Fried eggplant & zucchini w/ a side of tzatziki.
Thoughts: This kinda reminded me of japanese tempura, except you're dipping into tzatziki.  The veggies had a very light coat of batter and they tasted great dipped into that tzatziki.

Dish 6: Scallops & shrimp
Thoughts: I would have loved to have second of this.  The scallops and shrimp were seared and had a delicious crisp, sweet, outside and a juicy, flavorful inside.  Each bite was magnificent....luckily I got to have half of person C's scallop since he didn't eat em.

Dish 7: Halloumi cheese wrapped in green peppers and topped with pine nuts
Thoughts: Never had halloumi until this night.  It was grilled and had a lovely flavor.  The combination of the pine nuts, peppers, and cheese was great!

Dish 8: Greek bruschetta
Thoughts: This was a pretty interesting take on bruschetta.  A whole slew of veggies and spices served on pita wedges.  They also had that spicy garlic eggplant sauce on it too!  Very good.

Dish 9: Lahanodolmades over rice
Thoughts:  Lahanodolmades reminded me of Polish halupkis/galupkis.  They're ground beef stuffed cabbage leaves and tasted great.  A very warm feeling took over me as I ate this.  The kind of feeling you get from eating home cooked chicken noodle soup.  It made me happy.

Dish 10: Spanakopita & lamb wrapped in filo
Thoughts: I love spanakopita.  It's flaky filo crust surrounding a tasty, feta infused, spinach center!  Mmm.  The lamb wrapped in filo...I don't remember the name of this, but I wish I knew it.  I believe Sofia served mini versions of this at the Taste of South Jersey food festival and I fell in love with them there.  I need to  find out the name of these so I can order them next time.  Whatever the name, these are also fantastic!

Dish 11: Vegetable Stew
Thoughts:  Reminded me of ratatouille..tomato base with many other vegetables.  Very delicious.

Dish 12: Pork & Chicken Souvlaki and Biftekia
Thoughts: Both souvlakis were great.  Very tender, juicy cubes of meat, wonderfully accented by the tzatziki.  The biftekia was flavorful, a greek "meatball" or "burger".  I'm definitely going to have to order these again.

Dish 13, 14, 15: Galaktoboureko, Kataifi, Karidopita (not included in the mezze)
Thoughts:  Sofia's desserts are delicious.  The previous desserts I've had (baklava, chocolate ganache over kataifi) were both fantastic as were these.  The galaktoboureko was a tasty custard wrapped in a sweet, crisp filo.  The kataifi was great as it was like a shredded baklava.  The karidopita was a thick, perfectly sweet flavored cake.

On top of all that, for my third time here, we actually had a Greek waitress this time.  Christina was a very sweet and friendly waitress.  She explained what everything was and even had a chat with us every once in a while when stopping at our table.  Sofia even walked around the dining room for a bit once things calmed down to ask how everyone was doing.

 Also, there aren't many Greek restaurants around here (that I know of).  There's Estia in Philly which is good, but is expensive and doesn't quite compare to what Sofia makes here.  I've also been to a couple Greek festivals and Sofia's food seems to blow the food I've had there out of the water.

This is (hands down) my favorite restaurant here in South Jersey. 

Do yourself a favor & check this place out!

Now if I can only manage to gather people up for another mezze dinner...

PS: you may get hungry looking at my photos

This Aldi location has plenty of parking.  The store is pretty big so they have a large selection.

The prices are good.  Most items are off brand which does not matter to most.

My only downer is there seems to never be enough registers.  I went on a Sunday afternoon.  Only two registers open. no express.. So I had to wait behind 3 cart loads of food for 2 lbs of butter  :/

Everything has pretty much been mentioned belowm. Interesting , informative tour in which we saw the stable and famous clydesdales, the brewhouse, and the packaging plant, as well as got 2 free beer samples at the end. Tours were running every 30 min (at least when we went on a weekday). Tour guide did a good job and really knew his stuff

Well, what a gem this is! Happy to find it after our Donut 5k. We were starving from the freezing walk we just completed. There must be a theme when ordering breakfast, because yet again, we started with the cinnamon bun. YUMMO. Also, I just love how you get this little appetizer of granola. It was mighty tasty, reminded me of shortbread. I opted for an omelet and it was very filling and fresh. Our server was very kind and helpful when deciding what to order. It's a little tight when needing to use the facilities, as there is only one and you have to wait in a hallway where the workers are also coming around, but you make do. Super cute!
OMG best ice cream I've ever had in my life!!!! So many great flavor choices and they are all amazing!

I LOVE this place! Hands down, the best authentic Mexican I've had around here! I make special trips there solely for their chorizo torta. It is heavenly. My daughter loves their tamales. 

True, the staff doesn't speak much English, but most of the other patrons are bilingual and friendly, and don't  mind translating.

This was my and the bf's go-to HK pastry place for the last two months. I thoroughly enjoyed their hot dog buns and egg tarts. Cash only and they're nicer to you probably if you speak their language. Overall, a good chill spot after roaming around Philly/Chinatown all day if you need a short 5-10 minute break. Let the soy milk drink go though, it really didn't taste like anything and I don't like the foam silky part on the top.

It was authentic and I wish I can get one of em hot dog buns right now but whoever is reading this - enjoy one for me!

Love this place. The beans are some of the tastiest around. You can really tell that the people running the shop and roasting in the back are coffee aficionados. Different roasts which are rotated every few weeks by my estimation, and I have yet to be disappointed when trying a new roast / blend. Shop is a little small as the building is a wedge, but the vibe is cozy.

New York deli? You have to be kidding me. After living in the northeast for 6 years I was excited to see this new establishment in my Carrollwood hood. The place is clean and the staff is friendly but the food is nothing like what you'll find in NY and honestly the Publix down the street is better. I got the hot pastrami...which did not come with Muenster cheese and they don't even have Muenster in the place. My sandwich was greasy, salty, and I could barely taste the mustard....put that was an $8 price tag and the whole thing was a disappointment.

Edgehill Studios is definitely a technology-oriented cafe, and they seem to do a good job with that: a long, thin table with an outlet strip running down the middle makes for easy access to power, and there's even a fax machine by the door ($1/page local, $2 long distance).  The three flat screen TVs, each showing a different movie or news program, along with the lack or decorations, and the new, super clean feel contribute to the technology-centric feel I get from Edgehill.  There was some neat art for sale on the walls, a small stage in the corner, and some quiet rock music playing, which kept the cafe from feeling like a computer lab.  

Edgehill Studios would be a good place to get some work done when your internet is out or when you're having trouble motivating yourself to study.  The customers seem to be mostly young professional types, and while there were a good ten or so people there, it wasn't crowded, and there were plenty of open tables.  They serve coffee, espresso, chai, soda, bagels, baked goods, soup, and basic sandwiches, all at lower prices than you'd find at most Nashville coffee shops.

Even with a discounted tickets using groupon, this tour was a waste of money.  The guide must have been new because he didn't have the background and stories that we had hoped to hear about the history  and blending of cuisine in Cajun and creole cooking. It was the only tour we took that we weren't warned to stay together and keep a portion of the sidewalk clear for other passers by. in some instances he didn't even stop to address the group zbut rather talked as he moved forward with all following behind. Needless to say, we didn't hear much of what he did try  to say.

If this tour happens everyday, it was not well organized. 2 of the 4 restaurants we visited were not prepared for us and we were left standing on the corner or outside the door. In one instance I had to tell customers that there was not a line to get in or the restaurant would have lost those customers.

The restaurants we visited were generally 2nd class with somewhat bland jumbalaya, an OK gumbo and po'-boy. The nicest surprise was a little pizza shop that made their own focacciaa bread and offered  a nice variation on a muffaletta (-Little Vic's). Not necessarily traditional, but nice. Oceana, Napoleon House, Tujague were  the others.

In general the afternoon was a disappointment and I could not recommend this tour.

I have no complaints about portion size as it was just a TASTE of New Orleans.

I love love this Restrautant for years but I do NOT like new menu. No Futjiyama roll -so sad. Teriyaki stir fry gone- boohoo. I am not sure why they are messing with a good thing. It was great just how it was. Please bring old menu back.

We visited for my husbands birthday. The family we sat with ordered all together 2 lbs of garlic butter on their JAPANESE food.... And the young cook really accommodates them. Caters to wants and all their food they wanted was all well done . Our shrimp dinner was like rubber.... So disappointed. This is not our first time there. We never received the shrimp appetizer are the mushrooms in with the vegetables. The family ordered sautéed mushrooms for an appetizer and he gave them all to them. We always tip the cook separate from the waitress..... Not this time. So disappointed

This place is great! Don't shy away from the size of the place, it seems like a common size for most great seafood places in Santa Barbara. The wait isn't too long for a weekend night. Approx ~ 20 minutes. 

Oysters

A little pricey. They have 3 options but I found it to be not worth the money. Brophy Bros can give you more oysters for less and a much fresher taste.


Rock Crab!

THIS IS A MUST. You get a salad a soup combo with it as well. Its 3 lbs of a whopping local rock crab. The flavor was superb. Best $23 dollars I ever spent. I split it with my girlfriend and I was still full.

Overall,
I recommend getting whatever the daily special is. They'll always deliver and you'll save some money too. I heard good things about the beer-boiled shrimp so i'll come back soon to try that out. Clam Chowder was descent but I'm a bigger fan for Brophy Bro's chowder. I'll reiterate, DAILY SPECIALS!
This is a really great intimate spot with incredible food and really great service! A hidden gem! Victoria was our server and she was really great as well. I highly recommend this spot!

Make your own salad or choose from one of theirs on the menu? Make your own sandwich or choose from one of theirs on the menu? Make your own plate of food from various pre-made options like you're at Whole Foods (or Central Market, for my Texas friends - geez, I miss Central Market and HEB. Sorry, sidetracked)? Something for everyone. Healthy eaters? Options. Picky eaters? Options. 

I decided against their tasty sounding salads and sandwiches to try some of the pre-made options. I got some simply baked salmon, some kale salad, and some pesto grilled peaches. All of it was pretty good. They also have lots of options for snacks, drinks, desserts, etc. 

You go order what you want, they give you a ticket (or tickets if you go to two different lines or if you're paying for more than one person), and then they ring you up at the registers closer to the entrance. 

They also serve breakfast (I'll be back), and have a bar where you can order beer, wine, or coffee. (I got a cappuccino to go - very good.) 

C&B is another new Nashville spot that is trying really hard to be cool. High, high ceilings, white paint everywhere, so bright and airy you feel like you're in an aviary. Chairs that are beautiful but WILL leave a gorgeous geometric pattern in your legs and butt. I don't mind this as long as 1) the food is actually good, and 2) the prices aren't quadruple what they should be because you're paying for the decor. C&B isn't cheap. But overall, I liked the experience and the food.

Parking is rough, but there's a garage for the building just to the right of the entrance to C&B, and they validate for 1 hour (possibly during certain hours only, so I'd check that). I stayed for longer than an hour, so I paid $3 when I left the garage. 

Eating at C&B felt like eating in a cafeteria at a fancy museum in NYC. That's good, right?
They are pretty fast making my sandwich when you think it will be slow considering their crazy crowdness.

Excellent greek food, great atmosphere. I've been here three times and haven't had a bad meal yet. The lamb is always tasty and tender, the grilled octopus is one of my favorite dishes. Make sure you get the starter sampler, it has a little bit of everything and is great for starters. My only complaint is the staff, they seem a bit pushy and pester you too much. On two occasions the chefs have come out of the kitchen and asked us about our food, its nice but then they bug the hell out of you.

First time my husband and I tried hand grenades.  We loved them. Semi frozen, but easy to drink. Sweet and fruity like a green apple without the sour. Not too sweet...so great for both guys and girls. Plus.. they're huge! I also had the Shark Attack...and it was fun. They do a cute thing with all the bells and whistles, literally, and an actual toy great white shark. It's fun!

This is my favorite BYOB restaurant. Get the Veal Vivian (I get extra homemade pasta) it's absolutely delicious. The specials are always on point too. The chef/Most Interesting Man in the World has mastered the art of making sauces. I seriously can't say enough good things about this place. Just go and take plenty of wine. The prices are very reasonable for the quality of food you'll be eating. 

The only turnoff is the pic of Hillary Clinton. Lol

Always have had a great time here! Exceptional selection of beer, great bartenders! And Ezra know how to light the place up!!! come join us Thursdays for drinking games and prizes!!! Make this a stop on your beer tour of Boise!!

After following the chowhound trail, I found myself yearning to try this place on a Monday night.  I was taken aback when my concierge said that there might be an hour wait.  Irregardless, I walked down to Royal street to put my name down.  To my surprise, the place was flooded with customers, but I was seated without a wait!

I ordered the Gumbo Yaya-so tasty!  Great mix of spices with seafood and rice.  I loved it!

I also ordered the BBQ shrimp.  This was excellent.  Sure, I had to put a bib on and get my hands all dirty, but the shrimp was worth it.  When I heard that it was BBQ flavored, I imagined the BBQ sauce you'd taste from the supermarket (with a strong vinegar taste), but this sauce was just right.
Almond milk coffees!  Hallelujah!  BRILLIANTLY delicious!  And you can get ice cream?  So fantastic!

Awesome experience. The menu is inventive but also covers all the bases, there is something for everyone. Family friendly atmosphere. Blackberry mojito so good it made me want to cry! I had the bison burger with avocado (perfectly cooked) and stole a fistful of my friend's truffle fries (sublime!). Quinoa fritters and fried mac n cheese bites appetizers are not to be missed. And be sure to ask for David when you get here. Best service on the planet.

They are so unorganized!  Confusion from start to finish.  The food quality is fair but that is all I can give it.  The manager/bartender is a loud-mouthed shrew who smells like cigarette smoke as well as most of the other servers.  Note to servers:  Please don't smell like smoke when you approach  table.  It's disgusting!  It interferes with my enjoyment of the food, which is not too much.  Also, do you have a liquor license or not?  Some days its free, others it is not.  Please advise us as to the policy.   Also by hiring servers who are in school, you are not keeping the money in NOLA, they will eventually leave you and start anew somewhere else.  Hire those with a vested interest in the city those who will eventually buy a home here, pay taxes, and keep the money made here local.   Owners must be mindless as well. Save your money and eat elsewhere

If you go on weekends be prepared to wait. This place gets busy. It is a small restaurant, but you know if it gets that crowed the food must be good, and it is. I had Pastor taco, steak taco, and chorizo and huevo taco. They make the corn tortillas right there. My friend had lengua tacos and tripe tacos, he said they were good too. I also had a tamale, delicious. 

It didn't  make it to 5 stars because  it is to small of a place.

I came here right before closing one night. I lived right outside of Koreatown in LA for about a year so I think I might be a bit critical. The food here was okay. I definitely think it's overpriced for what you get. I had the chicken bibimbap and still felt hungry afterwards. 

Customer service was a 10/10. Super friendly people!

This place has a complete menu of delicious food!!! Everything is fresh and well made. My favorite "go to" lunchtime dish is the chicken and poached pear salad! It's delicious and perfect! A little pricey but its worth the splurge.
Excellent brewery tour. I had no idea, I went for my husband. Beautiful, historic, interesting & Clydesdales! A must do!

Pam and the Fishers crew consistently provide outstanding service, quality and value. The brisket I had tonight was unbelievably good, fatty and flavorful the way it should be. No sauce is needed! I am serious when I say it is the best brisket in the city of Indianapolis. I am an accomplished backyard smoker so i have a pretty refined palate when it comes to this stuff. Sides are amazing as well.  Keep up the awesome work!

My roommates & I decided to try this place out. The pho is okay but it's pretty pricey. We also got pork fried rice, beef chow fun and the tofu pad thai at about $9.45 per plate. All of the dishes were mediocre at best. I would definitely try somewhere else. However, their smoothies/drinks are very yummy but again pretty pricey starting at 5$.

Any place that questions my very authentic, peachy ID is questionable itself. Still, I like that it's not as trashy as a college bar could be. It has 2 1/2 floors with people dancing in pockets, rather than there being one giant dance floor. So if you're the type of person who likes to bust out moves and start a dance party, go, go go! They need you! The DJ will spin your guilty pleasure songs on repeat. 

Don't know how much the drinks are; there are always Villanova students and randos to chat you up and buy you drinks if you're a girl who looks like she has a questionable ID.

Barbara and Sam hosted us on Saturday night, and we had two great meals.  Give this place a try, and you will recommend to friends as well.  We need to support small businesses, especially the ones that give us healthier choices, with great flavor and service.

Worst ramen in Philly. The soup was greesy and bland, the noodle was not great, and the meat was super fatty pork belly. I have tried every ramen restaurant in the city, and I can't say that I like all of them, but none of them makes such terrible ramen. They kept most of the items from Rai Rai on their menu, but the taste and quality are not even close.

Best Peruvian restaurant outside of Peru! Food and service are outstanding. My husband and I go there very often. Lots of good things in the menu, our favorites are "Aji amarillo ceviche" and "Picante de Mariscos."

The food is not good at all. Came here for resturant week and the Lobster Bisque was the most disgusting thing I have ever had. And I'm pretty sure it was spoiled because I got sick after. The mashed potatoes taste way too much like horse radish and aren't good at all. The salmon and steak were just ok. The service is just okay too. The waiters have no idea what's going on with the tables and like 4 people came up to us to ask what we want to drink when we already had drinks in front of us but no food menu to even order food. This restaurant isn't worth the money to spend here, even on restaurant week when it is cheaper. I will not be coming back.

We had just an okay time. Not sure if it was the small group or the long stories. Seems the intention was to go to restaurants to have us order a drink and pay extra. I'm sure the participating restaurants would appreciate this. I thought the tour was going to be focused on the history and types of food not necessarily about the history of the restaurants. Also seeing a mouse in the Napoleon restaurant was a big turn off. I get the buildings are old but no excuse to have rodents in the dining room. YUCK!! Preston was nice, knowledgeable and very familiar with the area. Food was good and portions were large for a "tasting"  I think the pace of the tour can pick up. It was very slow.

I went to this restaurant recently for a date. It was certainly a great date spot- cozy and romantic. The food was very fresh and seasonal items were highlighted in the menu. We bought a "can" of wine to split between the two of us which was unique and different. The quality of that too was very good. However the menu was limited for vegetarians though the restaurant really tried to accommodate. I had the kale risotto which was very filling. My date (who is also vegetarian) had a tofu steak. Th tofu steak was very well done, of good consistency, and had barbecue sauce. I wasn't a fan of the barbecue sauce because it think it could be better nightlights with an Asian or Mexican style Barbeque sauce. We also had the torched broccoli and crudités platter and rolls with chive butter for appetizers. All these were good though I expected the crudités to be pickled and they we're not. The reason I gave this a three star is because I think the menu while innovative had hit or miss items. I look forward to seeing the change the menu up in the future.

I usually like OG, and I understand they're a chain restaurant...but this location is okay...salad wasn't great and the bread was old and hard. We had to almost tackle the waitress to get a refill.
I won't go back there.

Interesting menu that changes frequently. They have a large bar with a decent draft list and a great selection of whisky. Bartenders and servers are professional and friendly.  Try the chicken sandwich or the burger; both are good.

Love this place. (Yes, coming from San Fran Bay Area and I can't help but dig the hipster staff and decor). I was in town for a business trip. My client asked me if they could provide any suggestion for food. I asked them, "what are the places that I have to have in Indianapolis? like, if my visit doesn't count if I don't go there [other than st. elmo]"

One of them recommended this place for its bacon flight and extensive liquor available. 

I love how the bartender customized drinks; and they knew - how women don't like to have the same stuff as their girl friends. ha ha ha :P I truly appreciate the extra minute that the bartender spent on me to ask what my preference was.
