I love Trader Joes. It is my favorite grocery store ever. They manage to combine great quality, service and selection with low prices. Some of my favorites here are the coffee, wines, and snacks. They have some of the best trail mixes you will find anywhere.

What a great little restaurant. You can order any item throughout the day, so don't have to get there any particular time. Really pleasant menu. I am doing wheat-free and there are plenty of options. Our server was so nice, and offered to find answers to any questions. The fare was lovely. I had the kelp salad, my husband, the McHenry, pimento cheese, bacon, tomato, sourdough sandwich. Both delicious. The fries accompanying the sandwich were delicious not greasy, great flavor without adding anything. Am looking forward to returning...eager to try a frittata!

I recently read somewhere that the best places to find ethnic food are those unassuming restaurants without fancy names or signage that you find in strip malls. African Palace was fits that description perfectly. I went here a few months ago with my adventurous restaurant buddy who had heard great things about it. It's waaay out in the county, but if you are looking for a different place to shake up your dining experience, it's totally worth the drive.

I've never been to West Africa nor am I an expert in that type of cuisine, but the place screamed authenticity to me. Our very kind waiter recognized that we were first timers and made suggestions on what to order. We had a simple, delicious beef appetizer with onions and a fantastic sauce. My friend ordered a fish dish and I ordered beef, both of which were very different from anything I'd tasted before, and very tasty. If I'm ever in the area again I'll definitely go back to try the rest of their menu.

So impressed with this place! Hands down the best variety in all of the city. The staff are very helpful and knowledgable too, I came in to put together a sampler type gift of craft beers and they made some great suggestions that also worked with my budget. I'll definitely be coming back!

We were seated quickly upon entering for dinner at 5:30 pm this evening, we waited at our table for 15 minutes before we left. We were never greeted by a server, a server didn't even stop by to say "hello" or to mention that it would be a few minutes before they would be back to take our drink orders. We stood up and left, the hostess didn't seem to be concerned that we were leaving.

For the price, I expect more. It's very noisy in the rooms and pillows are so flat - my neck hurt the whole trip. I called room service and asked for synthetic pillows instead of down and they were just as deflated. Zero blankets in the room, just sheets which were in pretty bad shape.

There are barely any plugs in the room for your electronics and a previous guest unplugged the iHome, probably to charge their phone. I called the "consider it done" front desk and asked them to reset my clock radio and she says, "what time does it say now?" It's wrong, does it really matter?

Nothing is free with your stay. The resort fee is $15 plus tax, which includes wiFi and 2 water bottles. Wow! Parking and shuttles are extra.

Was here for a conference, but stayed in the Cascades area which is almost a mile to the convention center. If you're staying for a conference, book in the Delta area unless you want to hike over every morning.

The shops are all overpriced cheap and tacky souvenirs. Many of the restaurants are closed a few days a week and nothing is open late.

Such a fun time!!! We arrived at 9:30 to get our passes for the complimentary tour at 10. Very informative for being only 45 minutes long. When you learn about the brewing process, you get a small free beer (about 8oz).  They give you a chip that you turn in at the end for a free full size beer!  Free beer AND free tour= an awesome time! Next time we will do the $25 tour to get the full experience!

We came across Olivier's Creole Restaurant somewhat by happenstance.  We were returning from a visit to the WWII Museum (which B/T/W, was a must see, but we'll save that review for later).  On our way back to our hotel in the French Quarter, I was craving for some gumbo and pulled Yelp on my iPhone to see what was on the way.  I read the reviews for Olivier's and thought that this was worth stopping by for a quick bite.  It was about 5 p.m. on a Monday night, and we were immediately seated.  There were two other tables occupied at that time, so we had a choice of tables and took the one against the front window.  The host was very courteous, and our waitress came immediately with ice water and an offer of a cocktail or drink.  She asked where we were from and was quite friendly.  She was also very knowledgeable about the items on the menu, and make several recommendations.  

We had the special appetizer not on the menu, "eggplant Olivier!"  Winners!  It was an excellent choice of generous slices of eggplant perfectly cooked, and smothered with an exquisite creole sauce with shrimp.

My wife had the blackened catfish, and I had the gumbo sampler.  Both were delicious, and not overpowered by any particular flavors or seasonings.  I felt like I was eating "home cooking" at a good friend's house.  We were even greeted by the owner, who was checking on our comfort.  We both definitely would recommend this fine restaurant.

Stopped in for a drink and a quick bite to eat.  I love crab cakes but do not order them anymore because I'm always disappointed.  The waiter highly recommended it, so I took a chance. I am so glad I did - it's the best I've ever had! We also had the seafood gumbo and gumbo ya ya.  Both were great, but this crab cake - OMG!  Live trio played great music, suitable for the establishment.

Went to this place only because the line was ridiculous at Fido, which I love.  That was my first mistake.  The food took a long time to come out.  There is no organization, rhyme or reason to this place.  Servers walk around really fast, looking very busy but never seeming to get anything done.  My Tennessee omelette was a game of Find the Sausage but the joke was on me because there was hardly any in it.  It was tasteless as well.  They claimed the Buffalo Feathers were their version of Hot Chicken.. no they weren't.  Perhaps they've never seen Nashville Hot Chicken before but it's not pale white chicken not breaded and in an oily sauce.  Our server must have walked past our table about 10 times when we needed something and at no point did anyone ever ask us if everything was Ok. So since they didn't ask, I'm putting this review here to tell you I won't be back and to tell everybody else to not make the same mistake I made and just wait on the line for Fido.

Boyfriend and I were pretty skeptical about this place because it looked like a total tourist trap. It was pretty busy at around 2pm and we sat outside after about a ten minute wait. 

The food was really really good. My boyfriend just loves crab so he ordered the stone crab special. It was very sweet and fresh! I ordered a grilled prawn caesar salad and it was awesome!! 

The reason for 4 stars is for the service. Our server just made me feel a little weird, like she was really irritated. Plus, we barely saw her. Other than that, the food was great!!

This has been a long time favorite for me! It's always a tough decision between the Yum Yum Club and the Shrimp Salad. I moved away 7 years ago and try to hit this place when I'm in town. The Greek salad is amazing also! Staff is always so friendly and efficient!

[PROS]
+ Cozy, sophisticated pub-like atmosphere
+ Live jazz music on weekends 
+ Mmm fireplace 

[CONS]
- Way overpriced, even for a hotel bar

I really do love the ambience at F&H - it's the perfect mix of cozy, dimly-lit, plushly furnished, and old-timey pub atmosphere that works well for a casual but sophisticated couple of post-dinner drinks. The last time I was here on a Friday night there was a live duo on upright bass and piano plunking down some Sinatra tunes. The atmosphere really is perfect - I only wish the drinks and service followed suit. 

Being a hotel bar, I sure get that prices will be steep. But not THIS steep, and certainly not this high considering none of the crafted cocktails ($12-13) we tried were particularly wonderful, let alone mindblowing. I'll give them credit for conjuring up cocktails inspired by various literary classics (e.g. "The Last Word", inspired by Bram Stoker's 'Dracula'). "The Last Word" is made with Beefeater gin, maraschino liqueur, lime & chartreuse. The drink was decent but the flavors just didn't meld right and felt like some element was missing. I felt similarly about "The Moonstone", which I was really excited for as it featured Pisco, one of my favorite liqueurs, but this also failed to deliver. I was especially disappointed when I saw our bartender shake out a butt ton of bitters to top the drink. Bitters are meant to be "dashed" with just a sprinkling...your drink shouldn't end up with a whole splatter of it. 

The last straw was being charged $20 (TWENTY) for a pour of Balvenie 12 year. New York prices in St. Louis... NOT OKAY, hotel bar or not. $20 for a small pour even in NY would be a bit steep. 

I was pretty dismayed with the quality of our cocktails, and even more disgruntled at some pretty unprofessional behaviors from the staff behind the bar. If I am sitting at the bar and can hear and see the bartenders jostling with each other, exchanging some "you know you're not supposed to ____" followed by "shut up" and "no, you shut up"... something is not quite right.

I'd be willing to give F&H another chance, maybe to try the food, get some of those yardstick beers and try a few more cocktails, esp. because I like the environment so much. But we probably would avoid getting any whiskeys or scotches given the exorbitant prices.

Been going here for their fish tacos a couple of years now, but yesterday's fare was below par. The tortillas were stiff and chewy and the fish was a bit dried out. I'm hoping it was just a fluke. Our iced teas arrived with little ice left in it. The server kindly brought us an extra glass of ice which solved that problem. 

I was stunned that they were also out of Italian dressing for my colleague's salad. Really?

Hoping my next visit proves it was just an off-day.

One of my favorite spots for lunch or coffee & my laptop.  The staff is friendly, the decor/environment is pleasant & interesting (coffee bag Queen Anne chairs, anyone)?  The food is delicious & fresh -- great place for a panini or salad.

Since I am not a vegan,  the meal was tasty and very filling.  I will probably give it another shot. 

Service was very good,  but remember it's a small place and it gets a little crowded.
Great food. Very old school and basic but the food prices are old school too. Gray meat and service is great as well. You won't regret going here.

I went into this Starbucks on a Sunday last week and heard Rap Music which isn't good music to listen to when I was coming in to enjoy coffee and work on my laptop. Shift manager was some female with the name tag Nic not a very good representative of the Starbucks atmosphere you want. Will let all my friends know to stay away from this Starbucks. Hope they change the shift managers if they want to keep customers coming back.
I really enjoyed my BBQ pork chow mein. The service was good and everyone in my party enjoyed their meal.

Good beer and wine bar with pretty decent food next door. Kinda pricey but that's expected at a joint like this in Santa Barbara. Overall good spot for a beer and burger.

Feedback for management: One thing was they served our wine in a completely wet glass (inside and out) with water droplets all over it. This was surprising at a fancy beer and wine shop for this to happen, so only feedback is to dry the glasses before serving. 

Otherwise cool spot!
Free tours and 2 free beers at the end! Very interesting but also pretty long. Still liked it and would do it again... But a couple months or years later. :)
My favorite local restaurant.  Easy to be vegan here.  I love their Pan Bagna.  Grilled chickpea patty sandwich on great baguette.  I crave it weekly.

Lama dog is a great place to socialize on a weekend evening. There's always interesting beers on tap, and the food available is awesome. I like the urban/warehouse/hipster vibe.
Parking can be a little iffy, but the place itself is great.

I normally don't write reviews for chains, but the service at this Blaze is always incredible, everyone's so happy and accommodating even when there are large crowds. It's also an unbeatable price for a meal that will definitely fill you up.

If I could give this place 0 stars, I would.  The Gaylord clearly valued bringing in big groups, like the Beta Club National Convention, over providing the Country Christmas experience they heavily promoted.  

I had hoped to begin a new holiday tradition, and begin a low-stress all-inclusive option this holiday, but navigating thousands of some of the most poorly-behaved and disrespectful middle-schoolers was not what I had in mind.  I witnessed more pushing, swearing, and running through crowds than I have ever seen at a family event (and that includes the St. Patrick's Day parade in Chicago).  

Gaylord missed the mark. They could have managed this situation better. They could have had the student group together in one of the 4 hotel areas, rather that dispersed among the families trying to have a relaxing holiday. The food lines are ridiculously long. They don't have enough staff to manage the demand. And the staff are clearly stressed as well -- they, too, have gotten increasingly rude in the last 24 hours.  

Total Fail, Galylord!

I've been dying to come here for months now and I finally had the opportunity to dine here today. The inside is a lot bigger then the outside appears! It's super cozy with dim lighting. The staff was warm and friendly and our waitress was constantly smiling. 

Their lunch menu is pretty simple, but it's so hard to just choose one item for your meal. I will definitely be back because there are so many things I want to try! My girlfriend and I both started out with the tomato soup. Hers came with her meal, mine did not therefor I could only get a bowl. The bowl is a meal in itself! I surprised myself and ate the whole thing because it was just too good. For my entree I got the Blue Corn Tacos w/ greens and a black bean salsa glaze. I unfortunately was so full from the soup I barely ate the meal, but what I was able to eat was delicious. Ingredients tasted fresh and the asparagus was a nice touch. My girlfriend got the grilled cheese and she said it was great and nice and crispy.  For the two of us it only ran around $30 dollars which was nice! 

Blue Sage is also BYOB! Already looking forward to coming back here.

yes I will agree with great barbers but their system when you come to get hair cut the barbers let people cut ahead of other people waiting!ghetto clients cut ahead!
Barbers should create a list but they take people ahead of other s and they do not have appointments they are full of crap if they say they have an  appointment

March 13'  walked in a late Friday night to a pleasant surprise. Since moving here from the West Coast 7 months ago I have a had a real struggle finding classy fine dining. There are only handful of nice places outside the onslaught of beach bars, coconut shrimp, and flip flops, the Pearl is one of those few. 
At 3/4 full the ambiance was very subtle and tasteful. I was immediately greeted by a nice fellow at the door and decided to eat up at the bar. I passed a man playing guitar and he was AMAZING! I ws then greeted by the bartender and she was very polite and attentive. The staff all at one point made an effort to greet me. I ordered a beer while looking over the menu. I decided on the ribeye. What I got was a steak the size of my thigh!! It was perfectly cooked along with sides of fresh grilled vegetables and scalloped potatoes. I had a delicious glass of Cabernet recommended by the chef. It paired excellently!!
I hear gripes about pricing, but being from the West Coast this was exactly on par for a restaurant of this caliber. I highly recommend The Pearl to anyone who has had their fill of Hawaiian shirts and a deep fried menu. I will be a regular!

2 words THE CURE! I ended up here after a night of one too many drinks (it happens). A friend recommended this place for a hang over cure! She was not mistaken! After reviewing their menu, which seemed a bit obnoxious, (I'm talking quirky names that require you read the description to be able to decipher what you're eating) I settled on the sandwich with an egg on it! Im a sucker for a runny egg on just about anything! Messy eggs, bacon, mozzarella, jalapeño aioli, on toasted cuban bread; this holy grail of a sandwich is called THE CURE! I have been back a few times to this establishment just for this sandwich, the mimosas too. Oh yea they have liquor so you can totally have drinks here. 

The ambience is very chill. There are a good amount of tables inside and bar seating; no outside seating. I have been here on a Sunday for brunch and found it to be pretty family/kid friendly. The whole place and most of the staff is painfully hipster but it works. The bathrooms are clean and there is a small back patio with mural art.
I really enjoy everything I've ever ordered. The pizza and mozzarella sticks are my favorite. Second is the pasta dishes. yum yum!

Followed previous reviews to select this restaurant. Service was impeccable and timely. Water was never empty, feeling very attended to by the staff. The food was served beautifully with fresh Naan. It was a true delight

I really wanted to like this place. My boyfriend and I had a friend in town so we decided to take him to Granite City. We had heard good things, liked the look and had a gift card. We visited on a weekday during lunch hours so it wasn't busy at all. Basically the whole experience was just waiting around. 

We walked and and stood at the host stand for over 5 minutes and watched multiple employees look at us and argue about who was going to greet us. Finally someone came over and sat us at a booth. It then took over ten minutes for someone to get to our table. It was at this point that I made the observation that there were very few other people in the restaurant. Finally the bartender came over and explained that she wasn't sure where our server was but she would take our drink order. I ordered a Bloody Mary and the guys each ordered a beer. We then waited another ten minutes for drinks. It was at this point that we met our server. Twenty minutes after sitting down! 

Anyway we ordered the dueling dips which was fine. They were a little oily, but fine. Our main food took over 30 mins to get to the table. I ordered the margherita flatbread and cheese and ale soup. The flatbread was soggy and the soup was very gritty. I switched to the tortilla soup which was tasty. The guys both got burgers and fries which were cold and soggy. Honestly none of us cared for our food but we knew if we said anything it would take another half an hour for new food. 

We all liked our drinks but we would not come back here. The service was awful for cold mediocre food. I'm disappointed because I wanted to like it so much and I see that many others do enjoy this place. The icing on the cake for me was when we were walking out there was a table that had been sitting for over ten minutes without a greet from the server. This tells me that this wasn't a one time thing and that this is a regular occurrence at Granite City.

Sure, I've diversified my coffee shop/pseudo office portfolio quite a bit since my days of practically living at Edgehill Cafe....

Yet, I am still charmed with the space, the staff especially Rachel the manager who is just an authentically dandy person, hummus sandwich, and of course my favorite caffeinated cup - The Hiyah!

This is just a great spot to plug your laptop up and tackle your workload or host meetings too.

I was fortunate enough to recently attend a gathering of sorts at the Libertine and here is what I have to report. First, it is a touch pricey. Drinks are pretty much all in the $10 dollar range. However, these are some of the best most creative drinks I have ever had period. I tried a drink called a dark & stormy which to my knowledge was a mix of rum, ale, ginger, tonic, lime, and something else. Long and short, it was quite possibly the smoothest cocktail I have ever tasted. 

The Food:

The food at this place is fairly exotic for a place in Indianapolis. They had some rye crackers that had beef that was off of a cows cheek. Sounds odd, but other than feeling like i was kissing the cows face, it was mighty tasty. They also make popcorn with bacon grease which makes for a different tasting popcorn to say the least. 

All in all, cool place with a great atmosphere and environment. A touch pricey, but if you are more of a social drinker than a get wasted type of guy or gal, I would highly suggest this place.

Iced hazelnut coffee is amazing! Loved it! I have been here many times for crepes and gelato. I love the Nutella crepes and the Nutella gelato.  I also have enjoyed the coconut gelato.  The service is hit or miss. At times wonderful and other times I am shocked at how understaffed this place is.
Came for Father's day brunch, and will definitely come back. great selection of vegetarian food.  Veggie Cuban and cheese grits were awesome. .and service was so good!

We went there unexpectedly for lunch.  They didn't have much for drink specials and we split a cheese steak and fries.  Everything was as expected but it didn't wow us.  

We were able to seat ourselves.  The bathrooms were clean.  And the waiter was friendly.

Went here today for lunch with my girlfriend and when we first stepped in, the restaurant looked great inside with tv's on the walls with an assortment of different channels. We took advantage of the 20% discount and ordered the fried calamari. It came with 2 different sauces and it tasted amazing. We ordered 2ibs of jumbo shrimp, boiling house seasoning, and mild. It smelled delicious with a generous amount of jumbo shrimp, sausages, corn, and potatoes. The service was amazing and the owner recognized me from yelp and gave me an additional 10%! I'll be coming back here to try the pho and burgers. If you love seafood this is a place to be at.

If you are a fan of long winding walks to get around the hotel, slow food service, over priced items, then Gaylord is for you.  Where do I start? (business trip for a conference)
1) Breakfast a the Cascades, at least one coffee cup or glass was dirty at the table each morning.
2) Breakfast buffet, besides being over priced with limited choices, the item were usually not hot.  I am sure some people like cold biscuits and scrambled eggs.
3)  Findely Irish Pub, over an hour to get sandwiches, while we watched other tables get food.
4) Thermostats are limited to how cold the room can get, I know this is being picky but I like to be able to get the room cooler than 70. 
5) Since it is a 'resort' type hotel, then everything is nickle and dime extra charges.  For example, I will FedEx items to myself at the hotel that I will be staying, for hold pick up when I check in.  Since FedEx has a small office near the convention section, they have an agreement with Gaylord that item will not be sent to the hotel for pick up.  Instead you have to pick up at the onsite FedEx, and FedEx gets to add a 'handling fee' for holding the package.  
6) $15 / day 'resort' fee a way to make pay high mark up for limited wi-fi service, limited to your room.  I fyou want wi-fi in the hotel area that is extra.  Even for the Elite Marriott members, which is free at other Marriott's.

I would not return to this hotel 'resort' again.

Well, well, well......my old lunchtime friend Baxter's.  Things haven't been the same since I moved to a new job. No more Buffalo chicken sandwiches with blue cheese on the side. No more witty banter with the regular drunkards who somehow find the time and money to sit at your bar for hours on end, day after day. But alas, all good things must come to an end. Now, you are just too far away for me to justify wasting the precious fossil fuel in my vehicle to get to you. 

The food is good. Nothing great, but good bar food. We always went here for lunch when I worked for the largest employer in Chester County (the behemoth known as The Vangaurd Group) and rarely did we have a bad meal. Our bartender was always prompt with our order, sometimes having our drinks ready before we even sat down, and we rarely waited more than 10min for our food no matter what was ordered. They did have an awesome lunch special of filet tips which were off the chart. It wasn't always on the menu, but when it was we would actually  call ahead and  reserve a few plates just to make sure we got some. Ya, they were that freaking good. 

But, a 3 star rating is all this place can muster. It's not the worst, but certainly not the best either. If you are in the area and want a decent lunch stop by. Their lunch specials are generally good and the service prompt and attentive.

Nashville is for Ice Cream! On a hot summer night. 
BIG scoops of ice creamy deliciousness!
A short walk from Omni Hotel. 
Downtown where all the action is!

Great place! Love the acai bowls - they are so healthy and delicious and make the perfect breakfast when meeting up with a friend! The facility is clean, the staff are so friendly and warm, and the juice is SO fresh! You can even watch them prepare it in the kitchen. But get there before the afternoon or your favourite juices will run out because they are so good! Great location in the Factory at Franklin.
Good food.  I had the BBQ shrimp.  The sauce was tasty and good for dipping your bread.  Price per plate was a little high but worth it.

Sher e Punjab isn't just a restaurant, it's a way of life.  Look, I've been to all the Indian restaurants in Tucson, and none of them come close to Sher e Punjab.

The food is outstanding and the family that runs it is a class act.  The enforcer (a gentlemanly old Sikh man who is 55-60) keeps things running smoothly.  His sons will make you feel welcome, even if you are a sociopath or otherwise rejected by society.

While it is true that the shopping center is a haven for those down on their luck, I think they are all panhandling for the $7 they need to eat like kings and queens at Sher e Punjab.

I was very disappointed with my last visit to Tap. I dont see this place lasting long with the management it has now. After ordering coctails I told the waitress they very flat. She came back to tell me that the manager said "It seemed fine to her." She did not offer to make me something else or do anything to fix this terrible drink. Once it was time to pay I told our waitress I would prefer not to pay for the drinks we didnt touch. The manager came over and asked what the issue was. She continued to argue the drinks were okay. (I probably drink way too many cocktails and these were NOT okay.) After arguing with her, she finally agreed to take them off the bill. This woman came back to the table AGAIN just to say the taps were fine. I was personally insulted and will make sure I tell ALL my friends in the Broad Ripple area to stay clear of this place.

The Beermasters Tour was so worth it! We sampled beer that was 8 hours old. We got a free hat and glass too. It was really an awesome tour and I got to see my boyfriend tipsy (he drank his and my full bottle samples because I had to drive) for a few hours which is always highly entertaining.

I've always liked Saladworks and the Newtown location has recently been revamped. The interior looks very new and clean and there are plenty of seating options. The Asian chicken salad with mandarin oranges has been a favorite and I recently tried one of their creations that had squash, quinoa, and Brussels sprouts that was very good. 

I like the dressing selection they have and the ingredients always look fresh. The location of this branch is great and I've always left feeling very full since the portion sizes are large. Overall, a good place for lunch and there are plenty of options here.

Love India's Kitchen. We usually go for their lunch buffet which is phenomenal but recently ate there for dinner and it was just as good and the amount of food you got made for plenty of leftovers. The service is great with everyone super friendly. The prices are great for both their lunch buffet and their dinners. If it wasn't for the fact that it takes 30 minutes to get there we would eat there a couple times a week.

4 stars for location, atmosphere and orange juice. I didn't like their breakfast too much. My bagel was burnt and not enjoyable and my granola & Yoghurt was too bitter. I stopped by at 10:00am and it was quite busy- I didn't get a table outside. It's a nice enough place if you just want to stop by and have a low key breakfast but don't expect too much. It's all about the atmosphere/location.

This review is for their restaurant week selection. WOW! So good. 4 course meal (plus bread) for $35 each, plus tax and tip. If I had to do it again, I'd choose the Tarte de Legumes, the Saumon, and the Tart Tatin. Also, good-sized portions on everything! Not tiny little fancy portions.

FOOD:
--Delicious little warm rolls, served with an awesome pesto.

--First course is a "creamy truffle wild mushroom soup"...those of us who got it were delighted. It was delicious if not a little weird-looking...Due to allergies, one in our party got a split pea and ham soup and the other a tomato red pepper bisque. Kudos to them for having substitutions (the waiter explained it's their vegetarian option as the mushroom one is no longer vegetarian), and both enjoyed their soups, but I personally didn't really like either of them.

--Appetizer (8 options): We had the Calamars, the Tarte de Legumes, the Tartare, and the Salade Boston. I had the "sustainably-harvested calamari stuffed with house-made provençal sausage, fresh herbs, saffron rice, piperade, jus de legumes"...I don't know why but I was expecting your more usual fried calimari, and I'm not a huge fan of fresh seafood, so I didn't particularly care for it. The other two who had it absolutely loved it though. I also tried the "Tarte de Legumes: roasted eggplant caviar, caramelized onion, and red pepper tart with black olive and goat cheese tapenade, herb sauce, poached Sandy Ridge Farm egg" and WOW was it delicious. The runny yolk, the tapenade was delicious, and the tart was a little mini cookie-but-not-a-cookie kind of phylo dough thing, a nice accompaniment, as was the bit of greens it was served with. The "Tartare: fresh Scottish salmon, mango, basil, capers, black olives, cornichons, tomato, lemon juice, extra virgin olive oil and wonton crisps" was apparently good, but was being eaten by a tartare conoisseur (6/10 on her scale). She said "It had bigger chunks of salmon than a standard tartare, which makes it a little fishier tasting." The salad ("Boston bibb lettuce with crumbled gorgonzola cheese, apple, walnut pralines, and walnut vinaigrette") was well received: a sweet little salad. My only note on the salad is that it's not a real leafy salad. A couple large leafs of lettuce topped with the other stuff. Fancy salad.

--Main course (8 options): We had the lamb (Agneau), steak (Bavette), scallops (Vol au Vent), and salmon (Saumon). The lamb was oh so tender, literally fall-off-the-bone. Even after removing all the fat/skin, there was plenty of meat for a good-sized entree. The mashed potatoes were also awesome. Carrots were fine, but I didn't notice any turnips. My friend had the steak and loved it, although we noted it was rather lukewarm if not on the cold side. She liked her mashed sweet potatoes and the green beans too. I personally, having tried all the dishes, would say this one was the least special, although still good. I think my favorite was the salmon ("Saumon: pistachio and goat cheese-crusted Scottish salmon filet wrapped in phyllo, carrot purée, creamy Swiss chard, light turmeric and cumin sauce"), although I can't say I tasted the goat cheese. It was just delicious salmon in delicious buttery phyllo. And finally, the scallops ("Vol au Vent: butter-poached scallops in puff pastry with creamy Swiss chard and saffron mussel sauce") were delicious as well. The sauce they pour over it (table-side) is a sauce made with cream and the juice that the scallops and mussels cook in. It was heavenly. The scallops aren't literally in the puff pastry. It's a puff pastry in the middle (my friend wished the pastry hadn't been soaked as it got soggy, so maybe ask your waiter to pour around it), with 4 good-sized scallops around it and lots of different little vegetables (I want to say I stole some okra off her plate but I could be completely wrong) that get drowned in the delicious sauce. Yum.

--Dessert (4 options): We tried all except the profiteroles: the St. Tropez Cake ("double-layer valhrona chocolate mousse cake with crème anglaise"), the Tart Tatin ("warmed French caramelized apple tart a la mode"), and the Creme Brulee ("caramelized vanilla bean flan"). The cake was our least favorite by far. The bottom is like a spongy cake, and is not texturally-appealing, although the mousse part on top is good. Would not order it again. The Tart Tatin was delicious, although they were out of ice cream, so we got fresh whipped cream instead. I also wish it had been served a little warmer than it was (it was room temp), but it was just a simple little apple tart. Not too sweet, just simple. And the creme brulee was well executed.

SERVICE:
Our waiter was awesome. Funny and friendly and knew the menu very well. Asked us if we needed anything at a couple points throughout the meal. Water was always filled. My only complaint is the lady who seated us was cloyingly polite, it was annoying.

---------

Great little place!

Love this Starbucks. It's the closest to my home and it's a quick stop on my way to work. Bob, the guy on AM drive-thru, always has a kind word for me, and made the effort to know me by name. The drinks are almost always good, though I have had mistakes before. The staff here isn't as diligent after the busy morning hours, but no major complaints. A good tip for any Starbucks patron visiting even once a week is to sign up for their Rewards program. By paying with a pre-paid gift card that is registered on their site, members are treated to special offers, periodic freebies and more. It's really worth it if you frequent often.

Visited on a Thursday evening and was seated right away.  

We started with 2 large beers and a baked pretzel.   The pretzel was crunchy as it was cooked in a pizza oven.  I loved the texture but the flavor was pretty basic.  Although the beer cheese dip and stone ground mustard was AMAZING!

Dinner was a French Dip Sandwich and a Bacon Crusted & Cheese Stuffed Hamburger.  The French Dip was amazing. The meat was shaved which makes for an amazing sandwich.  The flavor of the hamburger was great but was a really thin patty on sourdough bread.  A little disappointed in the burger as I was looking for something a little bigger.   

Atmosphere was cozy and relaxing but loud.   If you are in the area I recommend stopping by.

Do not get the crawfish. They are so freaking spicy. It's not even pleasurable. I was born and raised here in a little spicy crawfish this is spiciest I've ever had in my life. Trust me I've had it all. This is borderline torture. Not enjoyable whatsoever. Spicier than a big spoonful of wasabi.

I stopped by here after spending most of the day on the Santa Barbara beach. It's just a short walk down the harbor from the beach, a convenient and scenic spot. 

I ate the Caesar salad with scallops and onion rings. The salad with scallops was delicious and the price felt fair. 

What really stood out to me was the quality of service--the restaurant staff were extremely attentive and friendly. 

5/5 would come back here again.

Love the location. 
I was craving clam chowder, good clam chowder and this place definitely had it. It was very delicious. There was a bit of a wait time but it is a popular place.
Great pizza, salad and customer service! Definitely coming back for more. Pretty much a Subway for pizza.

The scallops dinner is wonderful. The scallops were in an excellent sauce and were delicious. The coconut pineapple rice was amazingly good. My wife had the shrimp and corn chowder and was very happy with it and her crab cakes. Excellent food and a very good value for a quality dining experience. This is now my go to place to take friends and family.

Excellent Vietnamese cuisine! The Pho is phantastic. We started with shrimp spring rolls, which were fresh but unremarkable. A little crunch in the form of cucumber and a little punch in the form of say, cilantro, would have made these stellar.  The pho itself was perfect, and my partner had their take on pad Thai, which was made spicy, just the way I like it. Service was friendly. Price was fair. I will definitely return.

The band No Filter was playing tonight and were excellent. It is a very noisy atmosphere and hard to have a conversation but that's probably because the place is packed and everyone's having fun. Food is typical bar/pub food. The selection of beers is very good even though they were out of the one I wanted to try. If you check in the us a $5.00 off $25.00 or more. Great place to have fun.
old school corner store. Great place to grab a poboy and head to the new park on the river.

Came here for lunch recently with a friend.  The bedda chedda burger was absolutely pathetic.  Super thin burger that had no flavor.  The only thing that saved it was the bbq sauce.  I wouldn't go back here.

Really enjoyed my meal here. No complaints. Had sunday brunch, they had my framboise lambic on the beer list, among many other tasty looking options. The chicken sandwish and cheese plate were the winners at the table, but the mac n cheese also looked awesome.

Dang. I've been on an Indian kick recently, and I was really looking forward to Amber once I saw the many many positive Yelp! reviews. I dined with a few people over the lunch buffet, 2 which know a thing or two about Indian food (since they are Indian) and they were very nice to go and explain what everything was. Like Tandoori King, I can't exactly state what I ate other than it was amazing, the garlic bread (naan?) was great, and the service was phenomenal. The guys always came around to refill water, a few times which was definitely needed after trying a few things blindly.

The absolute WORST "deli" we've ever been to! Neither sandwich was as advertised. I suppose we should've left once we saw microwaves above the cooler of presliced meat, sadly we didn't see that until after we ordered. My spouse ordered the Corned Beef on Rye, whole sandwich that the cashier said was huge, at least two meals worth- Nope! The manager was making the food. He put presliced luncheon corned beef, NOT fresh corned beef brisket which you'd be expecting from all of the advertised pictures of delicious looking sandwiches and the claims of being a deli,  and proceeded to heat it up in the microwave. Eww! Never mind the perfectly good grill chillin right next to him. After a few seconds he pulled it out and set it on top of the microwave where there's a large cutting board while he prepped the other sandwich. The other sandwich was an Upper Eastside, made wrong according to the description which he was reading from the board while he made it so how he made it incorrectly blows my mind. There was no one in the place except us, two people, so there was zero rush. The Upper Eastside had toasted bread (it's a cold sandwich), was covered in onions (no onions in description) and it had no mushrooms on it. Back to the Corned Beef of Rye, it was the saddest corned beef ever. The top and bottom bread was coated with mustard, the bread was plain white bread, there was hardly any meat, very small sandwich for $12.89 and how someone could eat the salty, gray colored muck meat disgusting, sickening thing without vomiting is beyond me. I truly hate writing a bad review, especially on a local joint but please don't waste your time or money. Two terrible sandwiches, one of which was missing the pickle (come on man!) for $23...go somewhere good, there's tons of great places in Carrollwood!
Quality South Indian restaraunt.  Probably one of the best one I've eaten at and I travel all over the country.  It's like getting quality food right in south india

I normally wouldn't review a chain restaurant but since this place has barely caught on in Canada I'm willing to give it a pass. Let's start with the burgers... they are good. Very good. The beef is clearly freshly ground, they give you more choice of toppings than anywhere I have been so far, and the whole package comes together in a delicious way. The only complaint I have about the burgers are the buns; seriously the buns are too small to fit everything they put in them. I understand there's a certain charm to eating something so messy that it spills everywhere, but I usually reserve those times for things smothered in chilly or gravy, not just a regular burger. Although these aren't the best burgers I've ever had, they are definitely better than your run of the mill fast food joint. What really makes Five Guys a staple are their fries. The cajun fries are without a doubt the best fries I have had in my 22 years of fry eating experience. Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, a perfect thick cut french fry covered in spicy Cajun seasoning... I think I'm in love. Oh, and I can only assume that the fry cup they give you is some source of great humour for the employees, since it is completely inadequate to house the massive portion of french fries that you must dig your burger out from under (not a complaint). I'd suggest sharing a fry portion with a like-minded chum. Definitely worth further investigation for those who have grown tired of traditional fast food fare.

It's been a while since I've eaten at Fulton Burger... Market... uh Burger Company... whatever. Anyways, it's been a while but I really like the place. The burgers here are extremely customizable. You have many pre-made options as well as the ability to make a brand new burger (take that McDonalds). Oh, and filling out the card with those little pencils remind me of playing mini-golf... so I guess that's a bonus? I have had a few of the different options here and they are always good. The buns stand out as compared to many a burger I have tried. For one, they are actually an adequate size to contain the vast array of toppings one might decide to grace the burger with. Secondly, they are not just any old bun, you actually have a choice of many different "gourmet" buns. Semantics aside, this place provides quality burgers at a good price (worth the extra to not eat at a chain). Once again, not the best burgers I've had, but this place is worth checking out.

Great service, quick and efficient. Bison burger was great and sweet potato fries done well.  Three stars because my Kale Salad had cashews instead of roasted hazelnuts and dried cranberries instead of dried cherries and I wasn't informed of the change- I had never been here before so I thought I had mixed up two salads and ordered the wrong one. When I double checked later on for sure had different ingredients than listed on the menu. Didn't worry about sending back- the salad was fine but not a $10 salad for sure.

We are visiting From Seattle for our year wedding anniversary and were told to come here to watch the Hawks play. It wasn't the best food or beer, but it was the only option we had for the game. Overall, we may try to look for another bar next time-- there was nothing special about the food or drinks and the benches were not great .

4.5 stars on their pizza (the white pizza and country boy are super yummy!), but I've been disappointed with their lack of customer service more times than I haven't. The bad taste the service leaves in my mouth has really begun to overpower any pleasant pizza taste I normally wind up with.

First time here, and what a great first impression.  Tuesday, lunchtime. I was in the mood for burgers, and we were in the area. We ordered chicken nachos to share. The flavor was great, the chips tasted fresh. It had a chicken fajita vibe to it. I had the mushroom burger, and hubby had the Bleu burger. The fries were crispy, and seasoned just right. 
I love great fries.
I don't know what type of buns it was, but it was toasted and delicious. I was so full off of nachos, i could only eat a few bites of the burger. The food came out pretty quick too. 
They don't do local nor military discount. 
My husband raved about his meal,  which he rarely does.  I definitely will bring any out of town guests here! Lunch cost $33.. Sooo worth it.

Wonderful atmosphere, friendly staff, and a delicious menu make The Love a top Center City pick. 
The warm and slightly salty Parker House rolls, delicious pasta second course as a savory starter, followed by the entrees. Tasty. If you are a fan of grits and collard greens, don't miss 'em. They are excellent. Dessert was green tea sorbet that was light and a happy ending to the meal.
Excellent food. Excellent service. Shrimp and grits was by far the highlight. BBQ shrimp was messy but delicious!

I've been to this restaurant a few times, as well as a beer event they held once. The view is very nice as well, especially at night. The food here is clean, fresh and delicious. I've had the opportunity to meet the owner a couple of times and he is clearly passionate about his craft. Everything is homemade with little touches that really make a difference. The waitstaff has always been friendly and accommodating as well; service is never an issue. It is a little pricey so I tend to go here as a special treat. The only reason I left off one star is because the portions are a bit small and by the time I get home, I'm ready for a snack.

I love Mr B's.  The BBQ shrimp and burger (believe it or not) are fantastic.  And this is the best pecan pie I've ever had (modeled my recipe after it.)  The Gumbo ya-ya is pretty good...there are better places for that (Jacques-Imo's and The Gumbo Shop).  They walk the line of making the roux too dark and the bitterness becomes overpowering.  Oh and get a Pimms Cup...they make it the classic way here.
Local grass-feed beef appeals to my middle-class whiteness, but not when said beef has the dryness of a cardboard Big Mac container. I like my Chardonnay dry, not my sustainably sourced meat.

Pretty good food food & price. They have lunch specials that are awesome for dinning in. I always order a boba tea while here. I ordered spicy broccoli chicken, small egg drop soup, a Thai tea, and crab puffs to go. Included with my broccoli chicken was white rice. I paid 20$.

So if you ever wanted to know what the Philadelphia area is all about by exploring it's people and food and only have 90 minutes to do so? Well, you have found its best possibility. 
Donna and Vince started this place about 20 years ago as take out and 10 years ago started seating people and it's pure perfection. 
Family run and operated, this hand crafted Italian restaurant is easily the Top 5 Italian places in Philadelphia. 
BYOB, the bread is freshly made 1 block away and Heavenly, Vince takes the reigns from there and you'll be glad he does with such quality and obvious love put into his dishes from appetizer to entrée. 
I have grown up in the Philly area and have been lucky enough to dine at such praised locations like Victors, Four Seasons, Tre Scalini, Le Bec-Fin ect, ect...
Great atmosphere, warm and friendly staff with wonderful food, and BYOB to boot.

This is one of my favorite places for shellfish I love the local lobster I try to treat myself at lese once a month ... but when ever I don't get the lobster I get the rock crab its so good and it comes with a salad and a chowder ... love this place
I used to love this place until the last time. I got food poisoning. I went to the mall right after and within 1 hour I was seriously sick! Never again!
Management is not professional and does not honor reservations. Quite an attitude. I do not recommend this place.

Pathetic service! Was there earlier on Sunday evening, was waiting outside on one of the tables for over 10 minutes, the waitress and waiter never came, they kept serving other customers and passed by me couple of times and just looked at me but never came over. I have to think again if I want to go back there. It wasn't even crowded that they were swamped. I like the place though but if the service was better.

This is my second time at this restaurant.  I can't say enough good things about it. The food is amazing. Even more important is the outstanding customer service we got from Hayley! She is the best!I brought my mom here who has alzheimer's two times  and Hayley went above and beyond.  We need more people out there in the resturant industry like her. Los Tres is lucky to have her.

This is a must-see attraction in St. Louis!  My family and I took their free tour, which is a walking tour about 45 min long. We got to learn how they make beer, visit the Clydesdales in the stables, sample a Budweiser or Bud Light and at end drink more beer in their Biergarden (including one free 16 oz beer). Soda is free in the Biergarden. I was amazed at the history there and our tour guides were funny and very entertaining. Definitely worth a trip to visit this classic brewery which is a part of our American culture.

I have been going to Tin Drum for a couple of months now and I have always ordered the same thing. Tikka Masala. I have not ventured out and tried anything new because I absolutely love this dish of theirs. I get chicken replaced with Tofu and it is still amazing. This is actually an Indian dish and I must say that it is way better than some of the Indian restaurants I have been to around Tampa and I am Indian so I am pretty picky when it comes to Indian food. :) 
I must say though this particular dish is extremely spicy and I just get the normal order or level and I just learned the other day that you can get it even spicier as it comes in a 1,2 or 3 spice level. I don't know who can handle the 3. 
The service was great and I always order my food online and just pick up as it is convenient for me to do that. 
The restaurant is always clean when I go in and employees are very nice as well.

It's a bit cramped for space in this delightful ice cream shop, but the ice cream is worth it. We tried the cake batter, peanut butter-chocolate, butter pecan, coffee, and the moose tracks flavored ice cream. All of them were creamy and delicious. Our favorites were the coffee flavored (nice, dark, and rich flavored), the cake batter (takes just like the name), and the peanut butter chocolate (how can you get that wrong).  They also advertised hot chocolate flavored from around the world, which all sounded wonderful.

Yuck yuck and double yuck. This place has new ownership. Not friendly. Prices are higher than The Habit but food is much lower quality. Charburger was overly "charred" and had a burnt taste. They are definitely using dirty oil to cook their fries- they are darker brown and you can taste the grease on them. Having worked in fast food and restaurants, that is a big no-no. Clean oil produces very light golden fries- no oil taste. Do not eat here - prices are no bargain and food is not good. Hoping I don't get sick. Yuck.

This is one of those places I keep going back to when I want to treat myself. I recommend getting  a reservation because the place tends to be crowded (including on weekdays, early & late in the evenings). I have never ordered anything here that I didn't like. I am an omnivorous foodie. This place is great for any foodie. The dishes are not trying to fake meat flavor & texture, they are just great for what they are: vegetarian. Lots of vegan options as well. I highly recommend this place. I have pretty much taken my entire social circle here at some point.

Some specific things I like here: Carnival, Nachos, Blue Plate, Poblano, all desserts...

Great food! Large vegan/vegetarian menu (even custom made a vegan curry dish for me.)
The seafood eater with me ordered the Shrimp and vegetables and said it was wonderful. Large portions. The vegetable  soup (small order) was enough for 2 people. Wish this place was in Phoenix! Friendly staff! Great price! Will definitely eat here again on my next trip through.

So I came back to Tin Drum on my own, and I have to say that I'm pretty impressed. I walked in after the lunch rush, so there was plenty of parking, and there was no line!

I ordered one of the main dishes we'd had at our event, which was the Tin Drum Curry. It was the first time I'd had curry, and it set well with me. I did ask that it not be too spicy, and as I made that request, they brought me more rice so I could thin out the sauce.   When it was brought to my table, after very minimal wait, I was pleased. It wasn't terribly spicy at all. 

It was incredibly good. There was just enough chicken, sauce and spinach to make me happy.  And a few minutes later, Kaitlyn brought out the bowl of extra rice, apologizing that it didn't come with the meal. I thanked her. 

The staff was very proficient about keeping the place clean and neat. The tables were wiped down and dishes - if you were eating in - were never left on the tables long. 

My only complaint? No Jasmine tea! It had been there for the event, and wasn't there when I went back. *sad*  Ah well, I will be back, I truly enjoyed my meal!
This location used to be great. The staff have changed over and it absolutely sucks now. If you can wait 5 minutes just keep driving. You'll find another one.

This locations seems pretty slow.  If you are in a hurry I would suggest you move along.  I have been here a handful of time in December 2015 and each time I am finding myself checking my watch out of boredom.
I love this place. My favorite beer is on tap. Son of a Peacher Man. Peachy delicious. It's the perfect meet up, drop in, hang out place. The food is great and so is the atmosphere!
Yummy Thai food. Chicken pad Thai is our favorite. Great service and very fast. Their dinner special is a great deal and they also offer a lunch special. Also the veggie spring rolls are delish.

The coffee is just as great as the original State Street location - easily the best in Santa Barbara - and there's plenty of parking, too. The decor is very clean and contemporary and the ambiance is just as friendly as always. 

I'd like to reinforce that last point. In nearly four years of frequent visits to both locations of the French Press, I've never once experienced nor seen any customer be treated with condescension by any of the staff... even when the customer might very well have been acting like an entitled wanky jerk themselves. 

In fact, I can't recall any café or restaurant with friendlier or more polite staff than the French Press. Because I've neither seen nor experienced any evidence to support such claims, and because I've spent quite a lot of time at the French Press over the years, I'm left being forced to assume reviews claiming otherwise must come from jealous competitors or people with warped perceptions of reality...?

Anyways, come for the coffee, stay for the great ambiance and warm, friendly staff. A great place to meet friends or pop in for a snack. Watch for them to expand into pour-over and other exciting new coffee adventures in the near future, too!

Nice location at the end of the pier and very friendly waitstaff. We got oysters, crab salad, and tacos - the food was just ok. Everyone else seemed to be getting the crab special, so I would get that next time.

I had dinner here last night with my family. We had a bunch of apps to share including the chicken liver mousse, pulled pork empanadas, kale salad, beet salad, grilled hot peppers, Mac and cheese and veggie burger. The kale salad and Mac and cheese were by far my favorites. I didn't get a chance to try their main course dishes but I will be back!

I had an immensely frustrating experience here this morning and consequently don't plan to return.  I came in at about 6:20 AM for a cup of coffee and a quiet place to study before an oil change.  Although the hostess station had a sign stating that I needed to wait to be seated, no one acknowledged me.  After 2 minutes of standing there, I called "Hello?" audibly into the kitchen and still was not acknowledged.  I finally stood at the hostess station and called the restaurant from my cell phone in an attempt to be acknowledged.  The phone rang loudly into the restaurant for another 3-4 minutes with no acknowledgement.  I finally walked around the restaurant trying to find staff to acknowledge me and found a waitress.  She did not apologize for me not being acknowledged, but told me there was a problem with the gas in the restaurant and they could not prepare and serve food in a timely manner.  Needless to say, I didn't waste any more time here and went to a competitor.  I would recommend you don't waste your time here either.

Came in just before 5PM so there was not much of a line.  Cory& Tristan helped us out. They were both super friendly and VERY generous with the banana peppers (what I look for in a pizza place). They gave me ranch with my pizza as well, bless them.

Took my pizza back home to devour and it was delicious. 10/10 recommend

Everything we ordered was very, very good. We started off with scallops (2 cooked to perfection), gumbo, fried oystets on the half shell and the crabcake. Also served was a warm, delicious loaf of French bread. Our entrees consisted of the red fish with new potatoes & asparagus,  the filled mignon with sautéed spinach and sliced roasted potato seasoned with garlic, and finally the half chicken seasoned with rosemary and garlic, glazed with a date reduction sauce accompanied with orzo rice. Everything was absolutely awesome. Dessert consisted of a strawberry chocolate crusted cheesecake, the pecan pie with vanilla ice cream, a cappuccino and a Mr B's coffee. Dinner was very satisfying. I would definitely return to Mr B's the next time I'm in the area. It was that good. Oh, and the service was top notch! Don't hesitate. I should add that I was wearing a tee shirt and shorts and at first felt apprehensive going in because I felt I wasn't dressed appropriately but later felt at ease when I noticed I wasn't alone. So you can wear a suit, shirt only, polo or a tee. Doesn't really matter. You'll be treated fairly and with respect. It was a memorable dinner experience.
I used to ride my bike from my home on St Pete Beach when William's was located in Gulfport...circa 1950's...like an other St Pete original it ...Ted Peter's...it remains one my go to eateries.

Not sure why this palce has good reviews. Maybe im just ordering on an off day? The parmesan chx sandwich was terrible. Chicken tough and breading tasted like it was cooked in old burnt oil. Also the sauce was scant and was like it sat under a heat lamp and the water all evaporated out of it. The breadsticks were tastless and dry. The chocolate cake was dry like it sat in a fridge for a week uncovered. The food was just terrible. And im not a very picky person. Never again.

Absolutely terrible food, bad management,  My wife and I eat there about every other month and it's usually very good. Tonight was awful after throwing away our dinner I called to speak with the manager and he said bring it back I said we threw it away. He said no return no nothing. I am telling all our friends and family don't eat there anymore.

Worst experience. First time here. Ordered me and my kids food. Got it. My order was wrong so I told them. Waited 10 more minutes. My kids finished eating as I sat there panicking about my food. Got a refund for mine and left. So frustrating. My order wasnt difficult at all. I really was looking forward to liking this place. Now we'll never know.

Well it's good thing for this place that it's Christmas and every place is busy lunch was lack luster salad not dressed croutons stale wait staff slow asked for stuff like balsamic vinaigrette none came never came back to ask how
Everything was I asked for chicken on my pasta no chicken told him forget it since I was so starved my fault skipped breakfast won't come back unless it's a family thing and I don't get a say I don't like to give bad reviews I know that waiting tables is hard I have done it but this lunch sucked it wasn't busy enough to justify crap service

This was my first visit here. I was referred by a friend. I had the Build-Your-Own Pizza. It was delicious!! The toppings I put on it, plus how it was made, enhanced the whole experience. I will become a regular.

People who rave about the BBQ shrimp aren't lying. It's amazing. It was probably the best meal (or tied for the top with one other) of my entire trip. The shrimp was so tender and the sauce was extremely flavorful and delicious. It came with bread for dipping so I was honestly sad I had eaten so much of the table bread beforehand. The bread that comes with the meal is better (softer) anyways so save room for that. You'll be glad you did! 

I'll be dreaming of that BBQ for a while.

So as a native New Yorker, I will always claim everything is better in New York. That said, this is easily the best soondubu spot in the North East. Nothing in New York can compare. The one in Fort Lee, NJ comes close but still falls short.

Of course the caveat to all this is that you have to like tofu soup to begin with. If you do, this is totally your jam. I haven't been here in years but came after a trip to Atlantic City this past Christmas and was not disappointed. 

My favorite combination here has always been the seafood soondubu and the pork kalbi. The beef kalbi is only okay, but the pork kalbi is perfectly spiced and finger licking good. I like it spicy so I go for a level 5 spice level on my soondubu and it is ridiculously good. I promise you that no other spot gives you more tofu. I highly recommend this spot.

It's only not getting a 5 because it's so far away. You need to open more locations!

I've had the opportunity to eat at multiple Morton's locations in their boardroom dining areas and the experience was wonderful from the service to the food. On this occasion we were in the standard dining room at the Philladelphia location. 

The server was pleasant but not nearly as attentive or informative about the offerings as is typical at Morton's. Although I have been many times and understand the various cuts of steak and flavors, the remaining 5 members in my party did not and when they are looking at a steaks ranging from $45 - $110 it would be nice to know what they are getting. 

Four of us decided on one of the two more flavorful cuts, the Chicago bone in ribeye.  Three of us were very satisfied with our choice and raved about the meat.  My husband however said it was just okay after eating most of it. We couldn't understand how he could say it was just ok...I tried his and he was right.  It tasted like something I would cook on my backyard grill. I then had him taste mine and he couldn't believe the difference. I suggested brining it to the attention of the waiter but he said no it was fine.  He now wishes he had at least mention the difference. 

The side dishes that I typically love were just okay. The "giant" baked potato I normally get was maybe a large standard potato and the sever that brought the condiments for the potato slapped the sour cream down splattering a large glob on the table. The creamed spinach was warm but certainly not served hot. 

I will say my wedge salad held up to its reputation and was terrific - best I've had anywhere. 

Morton's is a premier steakhouse however this time around I left the restaurant feeling like the meal with a $700 tab (pre tip) was a rip...

Looking for sub joint while visiting clearwater beach from cali.   Small hole in the wall mom and pop joint.  Found this place on yelp.   Ordered the Italian sub and it was very tasty and reasonably priced.  Far surpasses strip mall subway sandwiches.
Hidden jem, awesome place to get some good grub. Place is nice, people are awesome, and the food is amazing!

Atrium area was very nice and decent restaurants. However, people at customer service were not helpful at all and marketing of the rooms was very false. Paid for a junior suite and was given a large empty room with only a bed and a couch in it. No decorations of any sort. Took half an hr at 1am to be given an new room which was much nicer but did not have a pull out couch as advertised for the third guest. Then took another hr to try to get a third room or a roll away bed. Took over 2 hours in the middle of the night to get even close to what had been promised. Inexcusable. Will definitely not be staying here again and would not recommend it.

This was our last super fancy meal in town and we enjoyed it a lot. Between the 2 of us we got the 2 "tasting" plates they had so we could get as much variety as possible.  We started with the gumbo tasting and it was awesome. My jambalaya and etouffee were delish. Also I think some people are under the notion that creole food should be spicy - it's not and it's not supposed to be. It's more down home and therefore a much milder taste - and it was great. The bottle of wine we chose was perfect for the meal and the service was excellent. I would however quibble with the two $$ sign rating sign on Yelp.  This is definitely a more pricey restaurant and our bill for 2 people came to well over $140.

We were on our way from LA to Big Sur and we wanted to do dinner somewhere along the way; Siam Elephant came up on our radar in this lovely beach town.
We were so glad!!!
Spicy tofu basil, Pumpkin coconut curry, and Pad Thai was feasted on, and we promised each other we would surely return.
Very friendly service, very sweet cozy atmosphere, and lovely vibe all around!

I very much enjoyed my first visit to Romano's Macaroni Grill in July of 2011, shortly after my husband and I moved to Reno, Nevada, from the Midwest, after hearing positive reviews form family and friends.  I vividly remember our first visit:  My husband ordered the Mama's Trio, I ordered Create your Own Pasta.   We were both pleasantly surprised; our meals were fantastic.  So fantastic, in fact, that we went back again the following week.  And then a few weeks later I invited my in-laws to join me for their first visit, to celebrate my birthday.  They left very very impressed.  Food and service were both excellent.  The lasagna left a memorable mark on me.  I raved to others that Macaroni Grill has the best lasagna I have ever tasted.

My husband and I continued to frequent the Reno Macaroni Grill.  We became fans on Facebook of the company and enjoy the updates.  We purchased several boxes of the Macaroni Grill lasagna at our local grocery store and frozen entrees to enjoy at home.  We have asked for and have received gift cards for birthdays and holidays from family because of our interest in the restaurant.

Food was fair. Every one at work likes to come here so I go along. Service was just fair. The wait staff only checked on us when it was check time. Aka tip time. Needed extra napkins water to go boxes. Oh well. Food took a long time. I think next time I'll eat a sandwich in the office

So you know when you have a strong craving and you get to the place and they don't have what you want? It's 1015a...I'm starving and craving for a Filipino breakfast. And we called in advance (15 mins) and they said they had it. We arrive...they didn't have it..at all. I was so disappointed. I wish they would have just told us the truth when we had called because that was a major strike for me. Too bad I won't ever take the chance to try the food.

Best coffee house in Nashville. Jack Egan is a champion amongst boys behind the espresso machine. Ask for an 'Iced Jackicano' and it will change your life. All the workers are super sweet and they make a mean chicken salad sandwich.

Jacksons is synonymous with weekend brunches, happy times, great patios and a decent adult beverage selection. 

Let me expand on the patio a bit - there's nothing more fun on a Sunday morning than sitting and watching all of the beautiful people walk around Hillsboro Village. The neighborhood itself is just so awesome it's to die for - when the weather is right (typically 80% of the time) - so many great surrounding shops and places to walk... Hillsboro you absolutely have my heart. 

The menu is rock solid. Buffalo chicken feathers is a great starter (keep in mind, it's crispy chicken) and I always find myself getting the wraps. Another good starter is Fried Green Tomatoes OR the Spinach Dip server with tortilla chips. Dang, why am I writing this review? I need to go to Jacksons now... ;-)

One more thing... the cookie dough egg roll is UNREAL. The kind of unreal that makes your spirit glow and takes you to another dimension. 

The service - while not the fastest on the planet - tends to be good. If you're ok with sitting a little bit longer than most places, you'll be ok but it's worth it in my opinion.

What are you waiting for, seriously? Go give this place a shot.


***DOG FRIENDLY PATIO YA'LL***

Went for supper. Very pleased to find it open at 9:30.
We had the dumplings, noodle bowl and tuna sushi roll. 
All outstanding. Great service as well. Can't wait to go back.

Been meaning to stop here for awhile but it seems we're always in Carp on a Monday and Siam Elephant is closed. Well, so glad we finally made it!! Great service, attentive and friendly. Had the lunch special starting with the Tom Yum hot and sour soup and then the Pad Thai... delicious!!! The plate came with a generous amount of pad Thai, spring roll, rice and some fried wonton strips. Vet reasonably priced and wonderfully flavorful. Delish!!!
Love love love world of beers!!! They have so many options, so many choices. Happy hour is a great deal, and the food is killer!

Two words: BARBECUE SHRIMP.
For real. I would bathe in that sauce.
Husband had the pork chop because the crazy man doesn't eat seafood. His loss, although he loved loved loved the pork chop, so maybe not his loss? (Also, more seafood for me) 
Service was the best we've had in New Orleans so far, and honorable mention to their bread pudding and chocolate cupcake with raspberry sauce.
If, by chance, the soup of the day is a red pepper soup with shrimp, definitely get that (or at least the soup trio). It was ON. POINT.
So good, you guys. So good.

Food was alright, certainly not one of our better dinners on the trip. The filet was dry and poorly seasoned. The sides were not great either. I do like the fresh baked bread that they bring to the table and the service was great. If you're looking for a steak, try someplace else
Inside outs are the best.  Cool place too. And they sell beer!  Fast, clean and nice employees.

It's Taco Bell. It's crap food, terrible service. Literally the only expectation is that the place is open when advertised. This place isn't. We went 20 minutes out of our way to get here to be told they weren't serving food, 20 minutes before they closed. The owner of this franchise should go bankrupt. He hires unqualified managers I would fire immediately.

I dig the art and the choices on the menu.

Skanky Chai is pretty good. 

The Elvis was pretty awesome. Peanut butter, bacon, and bananas on cuban toast. 
That sounds a lot like something I would drool over.

Nice!

Always busy but worth the wait. They have the best beer 2 for 1 in town- you get to keep the chip and can redeem the free drink whenever you want! The beer selection is phenomenal, and the burgers are probably top 5 in Nashville.

First of all let me start off by saying I was totally freaked out to order sushi from a place I have never been, and have it delivered. The girl that answered the phone asked her manager of they would deliver to be even though I was slightly outside of their radius, they did! Which was so nice. The delivery driver called to confirm my address, and they were earlier than they said they'd be... Which NEVER happens. She was sweet, apologetic because she originally was given the wrong address. 

The food was great. Sunken island was Delish. It must've gotten tossed around in the car but it was really good, Rangoons were amazing, sauce was fantastic, and the miso soup was good too. I'm super impressed and will def be back!!!

This is not your supermarket type bread store.  At Breadland, you actually are purchasing bread made from 'scratch' with wholesome and natural ingredients and the products are made by very qualified and experienced bakers.
They generally use 'organic' ingredients and tend towards staple ingredients such as spelt and use real 'sourdough'.
I love the baguettes which are only made one day a week;  Saturday.  The baguette is lovely, it is chewy and has a taste reminiscent of the breads that I purchased in Europe.  As well, their seeded bread loaf is awesome, it toasts beautifully and leaves you full.  And lastly, the white bread is terrific on it's own or used in a grill cheese sandwich: just the best.
Downside of Breadland - the bread and baked goodies are really expensive but I don't mind paying the price as I find that I am getting quality that is just not found in the so-called bakeries of grocery stores such as Safeway, Sobey's, Save-on, etc.
As well, many times my bread of choice is not available because it was sold out or you need to come back in a couple of hours....which I won't since I don't live close by.
The staff here have little personality but it is likely due to the outrageous hours that a baker lives by and they need a good sleep to enliven their demeanour.
Probably the best squid salad we've had! The sushi was fresh and delicious.  The outside seating was nice and dog friendly!

I think this is the best place in Indianapolis to get Hibachi.  I cannot wait to return.  The food is excellent and the atmosphere is great as well.  

Driving by Tomo, I would not have given it a second look.  I was told by a friend that he loves the sushi there.  I have had the sushi and Hibachi and love both.  

Excellent food.  Excellent Service.  Quiet and cozy atmosphere.

This was actually a very well done tour with lots of information. You find out how beer is made and then get a free one. There was a fee-based part but we didnt stick around for that. Definitely worth going by.

I've been meaning to come here for the longest time and I'm so glad I finally did! It's a hole in the wall and the menu is very minimal, so you know that they've perfected every item. I got the beef bap and the sauce is so good, they have a bottle of sauce if you'd like to add more. You can dine in or take out. The inside is a cute little spot and the man taking orders was very sweet. As you can see I killed the bowl.

Brand Spanking New Opening.

The pho here looks better than the ones from Saigon Express around the corner, but their dry dishes (vermicelli and rice plates) did not make me happy...not at all!

I ordered the bbq beef vermicelli with fried egg roll, when i received my food there was a bowl full of vermicelli, one egg roll (about 1.5 inches long) cut into two bite sized pieces, and a handfull of lettuce. 

thats not what it's supposed to look like! its supposed to have carrots and bean sprouts and more meat and more egg roll! and whatsup with the fish sauce? isn't it supposed to be orangey red? why did they give me a soysaucy one...is that something that's usually put it in? i'm not used to it. 

this is not a review of their pho, so when and if i do go back, i will update.
Had a great meal. The crab was delicious, clam chowder was on point, and the service was great.

Went to buy a package for a friends who's Grandfather passed away. We wanted to spend $80 and when I went to pick the package up today, I was embarrassed. It was on a dinner sized plate and looked like it probably cost $25! We did choose a lot of chocolates to go into the package, which are $19.95 a pound. But for $80, the package should've been close to 4 lbs - and it wasn't! The only positive thing I will say is that they let us return the package because we were not satisfied. But in the future, I would not go there!
The food was absolutely the best food I have had in Doylestown! Our waiter was very kind and made our experience such a pleasant one. Overall wonderful and I will be back for more.

I was very happy with our first trip to City BBQ! I had a beef brisket sandwich with fries and Mac n cheese. Delicious! I'm not a big meat and BBQ fan generally buy I really enjoyed my lunch today. The staff was very friendly and the restaurant itself was something different!
The food here is ok, because the dipping sauce does not taste like the sauce in JP. The dish "seafood and yasai" is too salty.
It's an awesome place from vegans.......I really surprised by seeing the number of vegetarian dishes available.......

My favorite pizza joint of all time. 
Usually my first stop when in town 
Best pizza on the planet!
Been going here since the 80s
I've had pizza worldwide, nothing beats Martys.
Secret ingredient in the sauce is insanely delicious and addicting. 
I usually go with a cheese pizza.

Just enjoyed dinner with my hubby.  This place is amazing!  Justin our server was outstanding!  So helpful with navigating the menu.  The service was impeccable.   We started with the sangria.  I don't know what they put in it but it is some of the best I have had.   The mixed ceviche is fresh and flavorful.   With Justin's recommendation, we had the snapper with mixed seafood and the cilantro rice with mixed seafood.  It was very much like paella but with a slightly different flavor.  This was our second time eating at this restaurant.  If you want to enjoy some delicious fresh seafood in a warm atmosphere, this is your place.  Great for date night!

Wait time: 1 hour
Food Choices: Numerous
Service: Excellent
View: Excellent
Food Quality: Good and Bad

The line gets long so be prepared to wait for at least 30 minutes. Try to sit outside so you can have view. We had garlic baked clams, clam linguini, and calamari sandwich. Baked clams had too much fishy smell and taste for me so I had to use a lot of lemon and/or lime. The pasta was recommended by a friend, it was a good choice. They give lots of clams in the pasta. Calamari sandwich was THE best sandwich I'be ever had. I'm a fan of calamari, and this heavy sandwich made my day. The servers were very kind and the ocean view was nice. When everything goes well, you can't ask for more.

This was a fun and delicious place to spend our lunch.  The Italian and I took a friend of ours here on her first visit to Santa Barbara, and it was a hit.  The outdoor booth we had was scenic, the fried seafood we had was very well cooked, and the company was enjoyable.  We will most definitely be back here.  And PS - come hungry because their platters are gigantic and full of their yummy french fries.

We were here for a friend's birthday celebration on a Friday night, and it was a fun place for a party. We had a reserved table, live entertainment, danced a good part of the night, and basically, had a great time.
