We had birthday cake and cupcakes too, and they even brought us plates and napkins for them. Everyone seemed to enjoy their food orders. We had already eaten earlier, so we took advantage of their all day everyday pitchers of Killians Red for $7, and the pitchers had iced centers, keeping the beer nicely chilled and enjoyable. We were there at 7, and the  tables filled to capacity by the time the band started up. Lots of dancers on the dance floor too. It was my first time here, and I would come again.
I do not visit this place nearly enough...I could eat here everyday n not get bored with the tofu mushroom stew extra extra spicy....this place leaves my tongue in shock for days...

Every time I go to this pharmacy there is some sort of a problem. The people who work here are rude and not helpful. I have spent over an hour waiting multiple times. I am definitely going to find a new pharmacy!
This place might be ok for beer, but is not great for food. Slow service, cold food, and the children's menu is not kid friendly flavors at all.

Awesome sandwiches!  Definitely one of the best I've ever had. Possibly even the best. Try the "the uptowner" sandwich.

Great service too.

If it were closer to downtown, I would have had a very tough time not eating lunch there every day during my one week visit.

I think we found our new favorite place for breakfast! Express Cafe exceeded even the great expectations set by fellow yelpers :) The staff was super friendly and did a fantastic job. They made us feel welcomed and appreciated while handling our large table seamlessly. All our food came out piping hot and my special order came out perfect (I had the veggie omelette no eggs, sub hash-browns) and it was *heavenly*. This dinner is a great, low key local place I was so excited to find. ENJOY!
Food sucks & so does the service. Blah.

I live in Carp and this place is my go to 9/10 times I want to eat out. I probably go here a solid 4-5 times a month (would be more if my friends/boyfriend wouldn't get mad that I always choose thai). I'm happy this place exists. Love their Tom Kah Soup, Panang curry, Pumpking Curry, Pad thai, and pineapple fried rice.
Best tacos in New Orleans!!!! Cool vibe and a wonderful staff! Great addition to the neighborhood!!!

It seems like s cool place however they check all black males for belts and every other rule that they have. I watched countless white males go in without being checked. That's not cool at cool at all.

I ducked in here after walking the strip on a Sunday afternoon.   It was a hot day and I just wanted something cold and sweet to satisfy me.

It was just OK.   Better than your usual chain ice cream shop but not any better than your typical locally-owned soda shoppe.

Their freezers may have been on the fritz as my ice cream started melting before I even left the store.
They're food is good for the price. Don't come here expecting anything fancy, though. The breakfast burritos are delicious. Definitely not authentic Mexican food.

Food was great but the service was too casual. Took a long time for the order to be ready. The waiter complained about the tip sharing policy of the establishment and about the bus boys not doing their job but still getting the cut off the tip. Very nonchalant and unprofessional. 
Nothing wrong with the good though.

Well normally I'd give a ten but one server here that always makes it difficult to stay
She is inattentive and rude. Every time I've come in here n end up in her station it seems she sends a busser or manager or her supervisor to take my order. 
Its sad BC everyone else is amazing. All of the bartenders are great and very personable and always fun to be around. The hostesses and manager are great as well. 
Her name is Macy 
Food is always top notch however. 
Thank you brew bros staff besides her for always being the best every time!

It stinks like old fish. Very hard to shop in a place with a smell like that. I had the nerve to circle the inside of the dirty grocery store thinking there would be a huge fish (or at least dried fish) section in the butcher area...nope. After my circle I realized that smell was probably old animal blood or something grosser than that.

I really thought I would hurl in the parking lot when I made it back to my car.

I don't recommend walking in at all.

This is my second year coming to this place for St. Patrick's Day. We were finally lucky enough to have it on a weekend day. 

This place is HUGE. There are a ton if Irish places in Tampa and this place has to be the best place for a St. Patrick's day celebration. Not only do they have a huge inside but they have a huge tent on the outside for live music. I don't live close to this bar but every time I've been here I've always had a good time.

Mr. B's earns five stars based solely on two things: fantastic bartender, $1.50 Bloody Marys and Martinis (Monday-Friday). Sure I had some food; it was top notch. Particularly good were the Barbecue Shrimp--an amazing entree and the fried oysters--slightly above average but presented so well that I immediately fell in love with the whole dish. Our bartender, whose name I remembered for the past three days and only just now forgot, was super nice and offered lots of insider tips for dining in New Orleans. This is definitely a Brennan's restaurant worth checking out.

Tour was really informative about the process of brewing. However we had 2 guides Adam and another girl who had no idea about what was going on and didn't know anything. Adam was a great guide and new pretty much everything. Disappointed we didn't get a picture with the Clydesdales. FYI the picture inside the Clydesdale barn are extra. Overall I was pleased w the door....
However we were lucky enough to get a bottle of today's brewed beer...9-11-14
Never disappoints! The few times I've gone late night, the line was rather long though it is worth the wait.

I came on a quiet Sunday while waiting for my flight. Pretty nice place around the corner in the terminal towards gate E62. Wide range of Irish drinks and beers. I was in a rush but without saying the service by John was quick and awesome. I ordered the shepherds pie and it was a pretty good dish that comes with the soda bread and that's for a different taste to it.
Went to dinner here with some girlfriends. Everything was mediocre - service, food, drinks. Many better options downtown.

The quickest way to my heart is Jackson's on a Tuesday night. Ordering 2-for-1 bottles of Dos Perros makes me smile.

Getting a table at Jackson's is hit or miss. Being first come/first serve, it depends a lot on the day and time you go. If I'm with one or two people, I usually just grab a seat at the bar (you can order food there, too). Besides, you'll probably get your order faster that way.

My one beef with Jackson's is that the waitstaff (on the off-chance you're not at the bar) tends to go MIA at any given moment. This is not the type of place you want to take too long in making up your mind. Or to frequent if you're in any type of hurry.

On the other hand, the relaxed atmosphere is what I love about it.

That and the interesting people you'll meet there.

Try the Buffalo Chicken Feathers in bleu cheese dressing. And the spinach/feta omelet for brunch! The meatloaf is really good, too.

Also, check their Facebook and Twitter accounts; they post internet specials all the time!

Ok, so love that there was a dog to greet us upon entry! So friendly! We went up to bar and the lady was very informative. She gave everyone a sample of every beer they had on tap. I. didn't get any since I was driving. I tasted some of my husband's though and really only liked two of them. You can buy "bullets" which is 32oz bottles as carry out, but you couldn't drink there otherwise. I found it strange, but it is just a tasting room. They did have some pretty creative names for their beers that were for next week. Makes me want to go back just to try them!

we were really surprised
we totally walked in expecting to be disappointed
most restaurants on the pier are over-hyped
and not very good
after scanning the menu, we decided we'd just nibble
and go somewhere else 
so we went for the 6 half shell oysters of the day
and a cup of lobster bisque
the bisque was surprisingly super tasty
and the oysters were delicious!
it's a bit pricey
and not really worth a long wait
but definitely a pleasant surprise

I had the Panino "Fresco" and it was the best lunch I've had in the US. You could tell that they were using real italian-style mozzerella and the whole thing was just very tasty. They included a cup of aioli which just made the panino even better - great place!

Good food 

but the buffet  does not offer varieties like other indian restaurants!!!

The best meal of our trip! 

We came in on a weeknight slightly early for the dinner hour. We were seated right away. This is certainly more of an upscale restaurant and has a nice ambiance to it. The kitchen is open and you can see it towards the back of the establishment. 

Our servers were wonderful. One was from our area of the country and took the time to give us recommendations on other places to eat while in town. 

Meals...wonderful. Garlic fries were delicious and my fish(from the specials menu) was outstanding. Even the bread they brought out was good. 

We would love to come back here and sample more items off the menu. 

A great meal out!
Good food poor service. Hope it gets better. Only opened a week. New staff. I really hope it improves

I love the burgers here. I've had all of them. I love the loaded fries. The fried pickles and okra are also good. You're gonna want to order the thick ranch, just believe me. Unreal. I don't know why the hate, they don't pretend to be a Michelin restaurant but I've eaten a lot of burgers in nashville and these are always consistent. My love of the waffle fries definitely helps. Thick ranch, don't forget.

No Yelp Elite member reviews yet? Hmm, okay, let me take a stab at it. 

I had bought a Groupon for Dawna Ara and it was soon to expire. So I tried calling but I didn't get a response. In the voicemail, she prompted to book via the website. You check the website and the only date that was available was the day after the Groupon's expiration date.

Hmm...Plan B.

Decides to email her directly and email Groupon just in case I can't use it. Groupon responsed and said they would give me credit in Groupon money if I never used the deal. Dawna also responded and after exchanging a few emails, we had settled on a date.  So if you have problem getting through her, I would say email is the way to go.

The date arrived and finding this place wasn't too difficult via GPS. However, it's a residential building and does not have any company name posted. Look for the house with the little white fence.  I walked in and just saw candles lit and chairs with literature on the table. I also saw an Iphone but I figured that was hers. I was finally greeted by Dawna after what looks like the owner of the building came in and shut the door. 

Dawna does everything herself. So there's a bit of a wait before, during, and after the session. This was my first time at acupuncture and I actually did feel something working immediately after I finished the treatment. I came in for multiple ailments but she concentrated on the main aspect of my problem. BTW, the treatment was relaxing since I was lying down for 30 minutes but the actual treatment was a little bit shorter than I expected compare to the other reviewers. Also the massage was a bit shorter than I expected. Nevertheless, this place should be tranquil enough after she updates it with some furnishings since it is really bare at the moment. Thus, not bad for the Groupon rate. Note to add, if you ever check out the bathroom, it feels a bit slanted.

Beer, pizza, oak street, what's not  to like?

Had a nice meal here tonight, the venue was nicely decorated, clean, and pleasant.

Very persoable and friendly bartender helped steer me to a good beer choice amid the plethora of flavors available, and then it was time to figure out the pie.

There is a nice variety of signature on the menu pizzas, but you can build your own, which I did. The end result was a white pizza made with olive oil, garlic, ricotta, shaved parmesan, ham, spinach, and double mushroom. I loved every bite!

Enjoyed staying here. The scenery and the hotel room was very nice. Parking and food was absolutely terrible. Parking is $28 to self park and $38 for valet. It is not included in your stay. We did self park and always had the hardest time finding parking especially at night. So we were forced to valet two nights in a row.

Also the restaurants were so disappointing. The wait was extremely long for most of the restaurants. The food was over priced and definitely is not worth the price.

Definitely stay at this hotel but drive out for food.

This is another one of those breastaurants with girls in minimal clothing who go through "auditions" for their jobs rather than interviews. It makes for a good place to get some beers and watch football with the guys, and at least this place is a little more unique than some of the other ones around.

I made it here on a Friday night to meet with a group of 10 friends. They had a large table reserved for us, and we were seated quickly. The place is really cool inside, with a lodge vibe that looks like something you would see up in the mountains. It was large, and it wasn't very full the one time I was here. There are more than enough TVs to see whatever sporting event you want to watch without having to turn your head very far.

Their menu consists of appetizers, burgers, sandwiches, and a surprising selection of dinner entrees. We ended up with a few appetizers that were pretty good, and a whole bunch of wings. I went with their "smoked and grilled" bone-in wings, which were phenomenal. I got them with sauce, but I would probably just get them plain with a sauce on the side since they were that good. They were some of the best wings I've had in the city. That being said, they were also pricier than most, but at least you get what you pay for.

I was surprised to see a decent selection of good local beers on tap. They also had a couple beers under the Twin Peaks brand, and quite a few of the largely distributed craft beer brands. And of course, you can always get an ice cold glass of light domestic stuff as well. 

Service, especially considering we had such a large group, was fantastic the entire time we were eating and drinking. Drinks never went empty before getting a refill and our food came out much quicker than expected. Unfortunately, for some reason that we never figured out, our server went MIA as we were wrapping up and we had to wait around a while before we could actually ask for checks. At least we were done, so the empty glasses and plates in front of us didn't need refilled, but it was still frustrating to be stuck there as we were ready to leave. If it wasn't for that snafu, the service would have gotten 5/5.

I don't have as much of a bias against large chain restaurants as the rest of Yelp tends to have, and I was very happy with what we ended up with out of this place. The food was great, our service was almost great, it is a neat place and there are lots of TVs, the beer list was probably the one shortfall and even it wasn't that bad. I would definitely go back if I was looking for a sports bar in the area.

Having only visited this location once, I have been rather impressed with the variety of organic whole grain items available as well as all the delicious varieties of sweets, savoury foods and more even rather late in the day. The staff person working at the counter was really friendly and helpful when I asked questions about the available items, and purchased my food.

I really liked the fact that the staff person asked me if I wanted a receipt or not, if I wanted a bag or not, if I wanted things to stay or to go, if I wanted my bread sliced or not, and confirmed precisely what I wanted before I bought it.

Food isn't cheap here, but unlike other Edmonton specialty bakeries, the fare is pretty much universally whole grain, and the bread selection isn't completely whittled down to nothing after the end of a weekday, even though it might only be open until 6pm. Good bread and snacks are worth paying a little bit.

There are not too many good Indian restaurants in Tucson, and from the outside I wasn't expecting much since it's in a little strip mall next to a 99Cent store.  I went for dinner on 09-11-14.  Once inside i was pleasantly surprised as it was very clean and a nice atmosphere.  I ordered Chicken Vindaloo with Basmati Rice and Naan.  The Rice was cooked perfectly and the Naan was also great, with a nice charred texture from the Tandoori oven. The chicken Vindaloo was prepared nicely with fresh cilantro and a flavorful sauce.  The Vindaloo was made with dark meat which i do like, but i would prefer some white meat from the chicken as well.  The prices were reasonable for dinner, but also is a la carte, so the rice and Naan were not included in the meal price.  Either way the prices are very good here and nice size portions.

I've been back to M.L. Rose several times, mostly to have a drink after work, but the past two times I have ordered food. Once for lunch to go, once last night for dinner and drinks with my husband and friends. For lunch, I ordered the black bean crunch salad as a wrap, with waffle fries. That wrap was awesome. It had avocado and little crispy tortilla strips inside. Yum! And the waffle fries were so good. They had seasoning on them that made them even better. Last night I had the angry dragon burger with a veggie patty. This was a burger topped with avocado, a fried egg, and Sriracha. I chose to add pimento cheese. Once again, I chose the waffle fries as my side. This burger was really good. Although I have to admit I was a little disappointed... Out of the 3 angry dragons at my table, mine was the only one whose fried egg was overcooked! Both of my friends had runny yolk and mine was completely cooked through. Wahh! But still good nonetheless. The fries were good but not as good as they had been during lunch. Oh, and they currently have one of my favorite beers on draft: KY Bourbon Barrel Ale. I will definitely be back to eat again and maybe I'll try a different veggie burger or have another black bean crunch wrap.

I pretty much want to make love to this place. Fried oysters amazing. I didn't even like oysters before this wknd bc of 1 bad raw oyster experience but they were out of this world. Then the BBQ shrimp, omg! So delicious. I didn't understand what New Orleans BBQ shrimp was until this. Service and ambiance was also great. Definitely coming back.

Fresh seafood at the end of a pier. What an amazingly simple concept. This little seafood shack pulls it off well. Depending on the season, their tanks are filled with seafood right out of our own waters, Pacific Spiny Lobster, Rock Crab, Abalone, etc. Everything is prepared very simply, the seafood is the star. And the prices are reasonable as well. I had the rock crab special - it was a full crab + half a crab, salad and a cup of soup for $23. 

If you're thinking about bringing your own bottle of wine, corkage fee is $10 inside the restaurant area. But if you want to go all ghetto, order from the side window, bust out that red plastic cup and sit on the pier :)

Best Indian food in Tucson, bar none. Great for vegetarians and meat lovers too. I'd say try anything with lamb in it because there aren't many places around here that even serve lamb. And of course you should always wash your meal down with their amazing mango lassi, such a guilty pleasure. 
It doesn't help that I'm writing this review on an empty stomach, but trust me when I say that Punjab will go above and beyond the call of duty to fill your gut with goodness. I think the overall thing that I like best about this place is the sheer feeling of comfort that comes from everything. Modest atmosphere and comfort food served with gingerly kindness. It's like what momma used to make, if she had originally immigrated from India. The pricing is fair, not too expensive, and well worth the portions you'd be receiving. 
So yeah, go take a friend here and enjoy the food, or help yourself to some takeout. In the end, you'll be plenty satisfied.
Amazing experience at Tuna Bar tonight. The food was amazing and service was great, as well. I would definitely highly recommend.

Wow what a wonderful experience. Me and my fiance came here for our anniversary. We made reservations and were seated immediately by an extremely kind gentleman, i assumed to be an owner or manager. Our server was Erica - such a sweet girl. Very friendly and very informative about the popular city sites to visit while here. She even did the impossible - I do not drink but i figured I would have a drink for our special day. I never know what to get - since I do not actually like drinking alcohol, so I always ask the server to recommend something I could sip without wanting my fiance to finish it for me. Many have tried to find a drink like this for me, and they all failed. Well, all except sweet Erica.  Thank you Erica! 

We both got the NY Strip Steak, Amazing! It was so perfectly cooked and melted in our mouths. Will be sure to come again whenever in Philadelphia. Also got the bacon and onion mac and cheese - very rich in flavor but also amazing. The grilled asparagus was delicious - drizzled with balsamic. MMMM.. And the carrots were to die for. Whatever wasn't finished had to come home with us so i could eat it again!

DESSERT: Dan got the Creme de burle and even i liked it - very good. I got the blueberry and peach crisp..... It was so good, i almost wish I didn't eat so much so i could have finished it. It was so flavorful and perfect.

Because it was our anniversary they took a photo of us at the table and put it in a little frame for us and the dessert was on the house. Really and truly a wonderful experience and I would for sure recommend to anyone and everyone.

Thank you for making our night so enjoyable - ERICA DESERVES A BONUS.

Got to go bahn mi's since I had their pho in house before and have eaten at the metairie location. Man, what a disappointment.  There was a miniscule amount of meat on our pork bahn mi. And it was very dry with hardly any cumber and too much carrot.  I don't recommend it for  to go or if you want a quality bahn mi. Eatwell and Hong Kong market do better  and at a better price point. I feel like they put the product they should have put on one sandwich and put it in two. 
 Not worth the money.
Love the tortellini pasta salad, pita/taziki dip and the gyros! Best place in Saint Louis for a gyro. Wish they were open on Sunday.

So new spot for Katie and some rough patches. Flatbread pizza with Salume Beddu had so much lemon it was inedible and bitter arugula spoiled the delicacy of capellini. Artichoke salad delicious and wait staff, though harried, competent. Why however would prominent southeast window look out on trash containers? Eeesh. Put up one of Ted's paintings!

These Raspados are Delicious  Jackie has these down to a science just the right amount of ice, fruit, milk, and syrup! I had the coconut with pineapple and I was in paradise! Jackie's customer service is outstanding she knows how to treat her customers, this was my first time trying her raspados and I will definitely be trying her other drinks soon! A+++++++

Absolutely spectacular! We called for a reservation, but they were full-house. It was recommended we try walking in for the bar seating, which is for walk-ins. There was about a 30 minute wait, which is understandable given the wonderful experience. Our drink order was taken, we sat on the patio and received excellent service and attention whike we waited. Meal was positively delicious, service was outstanding. So quaint and inviting, we made new friends with other patrons. Will, our waiter and bartender, was so courteous and warm and made great suggestions. We made reservations for our next dinner before we left!
Nice folks and lots of beers to choose from. Maddie was very helpful. Got two growlers and two six packs of pumpkin beers to take home to Atlanta.

We've been here several times over the last 5-6 years or so. We kept coming back because they're the only Mexican restaurant right in Victorian Square (downtown Sparks) and ends up being the place that we end up with big groups of people that can't agree on other places to eat. The location is great and the place is actually nice, but the service has been between just passable and the worst ever.

One of our good friends is a regular at this restaurant and really enjoys the Chingalingas (deep fried burritos). She insisted that we stop in here before we went to see Kung Fu Panda. My wife and daughter showed up just after 4pm and waited for 10 minutes before someone even came to seat her. They were seated inside. (There were about 5 or 6 full tables outside on the patio.) Her friend and her daughter showed up 5 minutes later and sat with her. They asked for menus then 10 minutes later the menus finally showed up. So they ordered their drinks. The kids got the drinks almost immediately, then a few minutes later the moms got their drink. They placed the food orders at this time. Then the hubbies showed up a few minutes later, just before 5pm (me and our friend's husband). Chips and salsa were brought to the table after the food order was placed.

The chips were stale--and they even went through the hassle of breaking them up into small pieces for us. How thoughtful! The salsa was ok, slightly watered down.

So we kept looking into the kitchen and saw 7 or 8 people working frantically preparing meals. We assumed they were preparing our meals. At 5 after 5 we asked if our food would be out soon. Our server went back to the kitchen and came back to tell us our order was the next one on the line. Huh?!? It had been 25 minutes since the food order was placed and they hadn't even started preparing our dishes yet?? C'mon, I've been the tons of Mexican restaurants and it ain't that hard to throw together a plate of carnitas!

We were now 20 minutes from start time for our movie so there was no way we would make the movie if we stayed. So we all got up and asked for our bill. We told him we had to go because we already bought our movie tickets. The owner came over and apologized and comped the drinks that were on the bill (the least he could've done). As we were walking out (at 5:15pm--ONE HOUR after my wife first walked in) he came up to my wife and said our bill shows that we were only there 25 minutes. Um, no, 25 minutes was how long our food order was sitting on the line waiting to be started!! What a jerk. And this guy is the OWNER!

First rule in the service industry, the customer is always right. Second, how dare you stop a customer on the way out to tell them they were wrong??

We were the only table inside. The place was dead. You think they would be grateful and falling over themselves to gain and retain any business they can get. That wasn't the case.

In past visits, the food was pedestrian Mexican. Nothing really had any distinct flavors. Everything was either coated in cheese or sour cream and it all just blended together. Blah. I never got sick after eating there so that's why I gave them one star, otherwise this would be a zero-star review.

I gotta say, I was indifferent about this restaurant before tonight--I would eat there but I wouldn't go out of the way to eat there. But after tonight's experience we will NEVER go there again. And our friends--who regularly ate there--will also NEVER go there again.

Insider tip: don't even bother with this restaurant, go to Great Basin Brewery instead (a couple doors down).

Although I have previously had a good experience here, today my experience was negative enough to write a review when I usually don't. My primary complaint is that when you are paying $13.50 for an acai bowl, I expect it to be a quality bowl. A quarter of the bowl was composed of very unripe, hard, bitter bananas. When I mentioned this to the worker, she said they knew the bananas were unripe. I'm not sure why they made a bowl knowing that one of the main ingredients was not up to their normal standard. On top of that, she was not apologetic and did not seem to really care that our experience was subpar. In addition we waited about 30 minutes for the bowl and left hungry because the majority of the bowl was the green bananas. Hoping their quality control and customer service improves some, because I want to like this place, although we probably won't be back any time soon:(

I've been here many times. They are very consistent in their quality and service! 

Yummy appetizers, entrees and desserts. The chef comes up with some unusual but amazing dishes. 

A must try if you're in the area.

As far as chain BBQ places go, I'd rate Bar-B-Cutie as my second favorite behind Jim-n-Nicks. The food is pretty decent even through the drive thorough. I particularly like getting my BBQ on the corn cake thing, because the sauce seeps in and makes the cake awesome. I find their brisket is better than their pork, which seems to often be the case in places where BBQ may site for a few days at a time. If you want quick BBQ, they aren't a bad choice.

This is a great place for lunch,a small, or to satisfy your sweet tooth.  I had just that....a sweet tooth. I wad visiting in tge area and was looking for a place that served frozen yogurt and stumbled upon this place.  

From the moment you walk in your greeted by the gelatin display amd the smell of fresh made coffee, crepes, and paninis. Everything but the gelato is made to order. 

They have a menu with something to please even the pickiest of eaters and satisfy a hungry visitor.  My only regret is that there isn't one close to where I live

I came here twice and each time i had drank 2 margaritas at chambers for there $5 happy hour.  i was feelin niceeeee

Got a bottle of Rose- really good and its the cheapest bottle.

Had the steak frites- really awesome fries with very tasty harrisa aioli, and bernaise.  
Steak was pre sliced and cooked to perfection.  came with Awesome caramelized shallots.  

The restaurant itself is very nice with a large bar (i always eat at the bar) 
The chef is very nice and you can give him a thumbs up through the small kitchen window.  

I was feeling so good by the end of the night that i went over to the chefs window and was talking to him.  lol

The menu has awesome selection, and good prices for this kind of food.  

Would definitely recommend slate bleu

This place blows the pharmacy out of the water! Being a vegetarian, most places have the same old mushy black bean patty that the heat up and bring to you on a bun with basic toppings. This place let's you sub a veggie patty (not black bean, but I don't think it is homemade either) on any of their burgers and it was delicious! The beers were great, my husband loved his full on meat burger, and those cheesy fries are heaven. 

We hail from Seattle and had given up on finding craft burgers here after hearing the pharmacy was the best of the best. It is definitely not, M.L. Rose takes that crown for us at least.

This is such a fun place too eat.  Here are some of my favorites.

Appetizers:  
Bread sticks (yummy comes with a tangy sauce that is red and delicious)
Focaccia (also quite delicious, similar to the bread sticks but with spices added on top)
Hummus (good, not the most amazing that I've ever had, but good)
Garlic sauce thing (I can't remember the name but it is really tasty)
Soup of the day I think it's the crab chowder, if they have it, get it!  It's so good!!

Salads:
Chicken salad, I really love this salad it's more than plenty for a meal so don't worry.  It comes with apples, and nuts and the dressing is a vinaigrette that is just right!    

Pastas:
Both of the baked tortelinnis are such a treat!  I prefer the pesto but both are worth a try.   

Pizza's:
I don't have a preference and if I do order a pizza I get peppers and onions and have yet to ever have a bad experience with it here.  Very good!

GO you will enjoy it!  :)

OH and I've been to all of the locations.
Closest thing to good, solid diner food in philly. Usually a long wait on the weekends though for brunch. Big portions as well.

I paid for the brewmaster tour, as well as the beer school. First of all, Kevin, the tour guide, was fantastic. Great knowledge and personal history with the company. The tour easily surpassed my expectations. Then, crystal was great in the beer school. I learned a lot between the school and tour. Love my Budweiser and I'm a bow tie boy for life!!

Zio's makes the best meatball sandwich I've ever had. The meatballs are homemade and delicious and the bread is always fresh. The Italian is very good although I wish they had sweet peppers to add to it. I'm looking forward to going back to try some of their lasagna and other Italian dishes. Oh yeah, they also have cans of san marzano tomatoes!

mmm solid soondubu! the place is very spacious and parking was easy.

we ordered the seafood pancake which was crispy and a nice filling appetizer to complement the two bowls of tofu soup and banchan. i ordered my usual fave soondubu which is the combination (seafood + beef) and requested it on the very spicy side per the spice range which was actually spicy enough for me for once! there was a good balance of flavor to complement the heavy spicy level which can sometimes neutralize your taste buds and make the soup taste too bland. once the perfect boiling soup cooled down (much much much later in the meal) it was borderline too salty but still delicious. the banchan were all really good, too!

good service and cute ambiance, too. can't wait to come back and try some other things. this is definitely going to be my go-to soodubu spot!

Have eaten here twice and was impressed by the quality of the food and the courtesy of the service both times. First time I had one of the soups and had to ask for a to-go container since I couldn't finish it all. Second time we ate there with another couple. The food was just really savory; lapped it up! I highly recommend Siam Elephant!

Very good burgers. Try the bison! One of the best places I've been to. I really appreciate the fact that they know their temperatures. A lot of places over or undercook but Burger Up nails it every time.

I went on a Sunday afternoon just to grab a beer. The staff were all very friendly and the bartender was happy to share the daily specials with me. I know that sounds like something that should be standard or at the very least shouldn't stand out, but I can't tell you the number of times a server or bartender has been annoyed at having to relay the specials. The interior was very clean and had a rustic feel with a beautiful marble fireplace and brick accent walls. I was also pleasantly surprised by how clean the restrooms were. It is a bar and I'm sure it has a very different atmosphere on a Friday or Saturday night, but on Sunday afternoons, it is very relaxed.
Really nice chill spot. Excellent location. Great place to eat good food, smoke hookah, drink a good drink while watching the game and listening to music. My new must see place when I'm in Nashville.

Cute ice cream shop. There was a long line that was forming out the door so I thought why not try it....glad I did. I got rocky road ice cream with waffle cone. It was creamy and had plenty of almonds and marshmallows. You gotta get any of their ice creams with waffle cone...sooo gooodd!!! 
tip: the line can be long but it goes by fast!

It's a great deal. Choose from "buffet" and pay by pound. It's about $5 for a pound. Not too shabby. Also because it's self-serve, you can get your food and eat and out the door in 5 minutes (if you are fast eater). The food isn't anything to brag about but at this cost, you can't complain. The selection is about 3:2 ratio for meat:vegetable curry.

Waited 45 minutes for the food, nachos were stale, chicken was cold, burger was average at best, didn't see the waiter until halfway through the meal, and then they included an 18% gratuity on our bill. Never again

Tried medium spicy chicken and burned my tongue so badly that I wanted to cry. And I love spicy food. They brought me a second serving of non spicy when I asked though which was ok. Beware when eating chicken even if advertised as medium....it's not.

The dosa is fresh and fluffy. I've never been to India but Dosa Hut seems authentic. I'm much more impressed on my second and third trips here :) service is friendly. I would erase my first bad review if I could.

We had ice cream, crepe and a sandwich here. The food is good but nothing memorable. 

A weird thing happen, a guy asked for my husband's name and wrote it down. He also manually enter the number in the system as well as looking at the back, quite slowly. My husband was super sketched out. But nothing happened so far. They might just took the name for the order and the cashier is new so he was figuring his way out with cards. But be careful, just in case though.

A warning first (and I do not blame the restaurant for this)  If you want to sit outside, which is nice, go before or after the shrimp boats are going out which is around 5:30.  Otherwise you will be sickened by the smell of diesel coming from the boats.  Now, the food;  eh!   Our server, Jill, was very friendly and she really talked up how great the food is (really, give that woman a raise).  Unfortunately, after being all excited upon hearing her explain the freshness of the ingredients and the fact that everything is home made we were very disappointed.  I had the fried shrimp;  the breading was overpowering;  very thick, over seasoned, and killed the taste of the shrimp.  I ended up taking off all the breading and was able to eat the very tasty shrimp hiding underneath.  The fries were soggy and inconsistently cooked;  some raw, some overdone. The salad dressing was home made but unfortunately fell flat;  very little flavor except for what I believe was buttermilk.  My husband had the grouper special and Jill really talked this up and talked him out of having it fried telling him it was better lightly blackened;  he should have gone with his gut on this.  It was tasteless, very little seasoning.  It was served with rice that was cooked in coconut milk making it very soggy and again severely under seasoned..  Perhaps the chef can take some of the overbearing seasoning out of the fried coating on the shrimp an put it in the rice and blackened mixture.  The juliann vegetables were good as was the cole slaw.  The grouper portion (although we were told it was huge) was not worthy of the price paid.

Well, I read the reviews and went anyway. I must say, I wasn't disappointed. It is just as others have said, a very basic selection of standard Indian dishes and a few tables if you want to eat in. I grabbed my chicken vindaloo, chicken tikka masala, and naan to go, and when I got home and dug in, everything was up to par. Nothing was as spicy as I would have liked, but nothing ever is. Perils of being a spicy food junkie, I suppose.

All in all, if you want something fast and happen to be in the area, Mumbai Bistro is definitely worth considering. The prices are super reasonable, and the food gets the job done. Don't, however, expect something worth writing home about.

Best Indian food I've ever had in the United States. Their Tikka Masala is the best. (Pro Tip: Be sure to order it with mushrooms!) They also have great poori bread (Indian elephant ears!) and mango lassis. Whenever I'm visiting Indy I make an effort to visit. Their Chicken Biryani is also very good.
Fresh local lobster is in season. Steamed and dipped in melted butter -- nothing on the menu could be better.  Pick the new England clam chowder over the lobster bisque.

We didn't really feel the love here. First off, we were greeted by an unenthusiastic waitress who was very cold and short with all of us. We started off by ordering 3 apps: the pierogies, crispy duck salad and cheese board. All of these items were delicious, however the portions of the cheese were completely underwhelming. Four people were suppose to share the cheese board. While the presentation was cute with the mouse shaped goat cheese, the portions of the individual cheeses seemed as if they were fit for a mouse! Each person basically got a crumb of cheese to taste. Moving on to the entrees, two of us ordered the scallops, one person ordered the lamb and another ordered the beef stroganoff. The scallops were good, but the best dish was the beef. We have dined all over the city and the country. The aspect about The Love that left us with the poorest taste in our mouth was the fact that this place charges $1 per person for water (still or sparkling). Mind you, it's not bottled still or sparkling, it's super filtered Philadelphia water. To top it off, there is no complimentary bread or rolls served. You must pay $5 for the Parker house rolls with chive butter, which, in my opinion, were not worthy of the price tag. Overall, the food was good, not great and we do not plan to recommend or return. At $200 per couple, these ancillary charges made us feel as though we were being nickeled and dimed.

Sorry Jeni's but Mike's wins! I ventured in here late on Thursday night and had a "scoop" of the red velvet cake which was HUGE and not very expensive. It was also delicious - creamy, red velvet ice cream with chunks of cake and cream cheese frosting. I didn't try any other flavors but they all looked good. The place has a cool hipster vibe and is on Broadway so parking can be a bit of an issue. They also have excellent coffee. I paired an americano with my red velvet.
Me B's is consistently outstanding no matter which dish you order! This has been my "must visit" every time I am in NOLA. Great Bistro ambience. Outstanding service.

The food was good but is rather highly priced for breakfast. Our waitress wasn't great, I think she may have been new. We had to wait for refills on water several times. I would go again but I don't like spending $11-$15 / person on breakfast.

I was going to post negatively about this restaurant due to a customer service snafoo that I will now not go into detail on. However, since the food is always good, and the Owner/Manager on duty has since apologized, Im inclined to give it a solid 4 star.

They get mega points for authenticity and taste. I lived in Chicago for a few years, and got to experience great Greek cuisine. One owner of one such restaurant there said that if it didn't taste iike home everytime, he would pack up and leave. And most of the food here is on par with that. 

I've chosen to largely forgive the service I received on my latest visit, because ignoring the issue (since resolved) with the Owner/Manager, the cashier/service people who I talked to before the issue were great! They were very helpful and eager to take my order. 
I had initially gone in to inquire about this locations history and the experience these two were having  here as compared to their previous jobs, and to order something small for the road.  To which they had only good to say about the owners and the conditions. 

There are two other things that I think they could improve on. One, the locations appearance. Im not going to judge it too much, because in our current economy small business owners have to be conscientious about space rent and such. However, a remodel or some painting or brightening up would probably go a long way. 
The other is a better drink selection/ self service. I think they might benefit from a fountain machine for drinks, like the Gyro Co. down on baumgartner and meramec bottom. Again, I won't really hold this against them because I'm not aware of the cost management of that vs. what they currently do. 

Overall: This is a great authentic eatery. Im glad that the owner(s) are able to keep going during these times when it's hard to do so.
Previous reviewer's description as a redneck joint is dead on. They're also rude. It's a mixed use area and they treat their neighbors like trash.

NEVER EVER stay at Gaylord Opryland Resort & Convention Center in Nashville, TN. I would put -10 stars but I have to select at least one star in order to warn the unsuspecting general public. The worst customer service you will ever experience especially since they are not cheap. Closed off almost all the bars and restaurants for a private event even though you're paying for it, ridiculous! The concierge did not even know what time their own shuttles ran. Room service food was cold. We went to a Finleys Irish Pub one night, were seated and then told to give up our seats because it turned out members from a convention needed them so we were booted from our seats!!! Save your money folks and stay at a Best Western where the service is far superior to this pretentious overpriced hotel.  The hotel caters to whatever convention is going up on which is great for them  but then the other paying customers are seriously deprived of all the resources they are paying good money for because they are blocked off for convention members only even though we are paying the same or higher cost. I was extremely disappointed and will make a point to tell everyone I meet to avoid this place at all costs.

My siblings and I came in last night for dinner for the first time. The server was great she was very friendly and brought the refills for our drinks when she saw needed and checked if we needed anything often without being annoying. We had chargrilled oysters and Rockefeller for appetizer. Entree: 2 lobster pasta, crawfish etouffee, 8oz filet mignon, chicken Caesar salad,  crab cakes, and Mac and cheese. The sad part is no one liked their food. Lobster pasta tasted like they just dumped a can of tomato paste in the pasta and mixed it into the linguine and the lobster was over cooked which caused it to be chewy. Crawfish etouffee was too salty. Filet mignon tasted like a over cooked sirloin it came with potatoes and vegetables that look like the whole plate been sitting under the light for a long time. As for the chicken caesar salad the chicken was so dry and it had way too much dressing on the plate and it was too creamy. Crab cakes barely had any crab in it and it was just full of stuffing. We ordered Mac and cheese for my niece and it looked like it was made from a Kraft box and dried. My niece usually eats her Mac and cheese and this time she ate a little bit and didn't want it. We spent over $200 and left this restaurant having to go eat at another restaurant right after. For the first time ever that my family had to do that. Very disappointing.  I forgot that we had calamari too...flavorless and oily

Where do I start. Their food has always been fantastic, BUT if you are looking for great service to go along with it, DO NOT GO THERE! My three friends went here for dinner. (2 females and 2 males.) Compared to tables that had all males at them, our service was not appreciated and neglected. These girls need to get their heads back on their shoulders. If you want a good tip and no complaints, then do your job to your highest ability. The manager apologized for the service but didn't do anything to comp for the meal that was half-assed. My fiancé had one drink the entire meal which was served at the bar during our long wait for our table. There was no refills given during our meal. The waitress didn't check on us after we received our food. Two of the plates were delivered 10 minutes after the other 2 plates had been delivered to the table. My fiancé ordered one beer and the waitress never brought it. When we asked her if the beer was almost ready because we were now wanting to leave since we had finished eating our meals, she apologized and had to re-order it because she forgot to place the order. I have never received such horrible service. We won't be back. Texas get your shit under control in Indiana, because you are falling apart!
Best trip! They guide you through bars and also do 'drunk history' and trivia. Well worth it! A must for anytime in Nashville!!

Well... Got seated and somehow ended up with two servers, one was great the other not so much. Ended up getting the really good one to finish the job so other than the initial confusion service was good. Except we never got water, and i had to steal salt and ketchup from the wait station. I will say they were slammed and we got our food really fast. On to the food. Cheeseburger roll-ups were just OK . Kind of bland. Basically a cheeseburger egg roll that you can make better at home. My girl got the Philly. Yikes, one bite and done. It was like chewing on a Converse. Getting a Philly west of Harrisburg  is a crapshoot at best and this one was just plain bad.Salads were OK, not sure why they use Provel on a salad but apparently it gets tossed on everything. I got the chicken neptune and it was delicious, side of potato casserole was allright. Ended up getting the Philly off the bill  cause our server was good. I'd drop it to two stars if we got stuck with first server.

This is the best Thai food we have ever had. Our son from LA and his friend said there isn't a  place in L.A. As good as this! The owners and staff are very nice, and helpful. From fresh rolls to shrimp curry you can be assured it is the freshest. Have eaten there for 6 years and it hasn't disappointed us or our guest once. Try it, you'll agree.

We've made this a definite stop every time in Santa Barbara. The food is always excellent and can't beat the view. On our most recent visit, we had Pete taking care of us. He was very attentive and made for a great experience. The staff are always really friendly give fantastic customer service. We will come back here every time when in Santa Barbara. Jeff and Christine

We ate here for Mother's Day and couldn't be more disappointed.  We waited 20 minutes for our glass of wine and another 45 minutes for our food to arrive.  I ordered the chicken Marsala.  My mushrooms and roasted garlic were burnt.  The waiter brought food for 2 of us and said the rest was on the way.  My daughter in law never received her food.  She had to take it to go at the end of our meal.  The manager apologized and they paid for her meal and gave us a 25% off your next order.  It's unlikely that we will ever return to use that coupon. I used to love eating here.  I don't know what happened but it continues to go downhill.   On the plus side, our waiter was very nice.

I had been wanting to try this place that opened in Apollo Beach about 10 months ago. Their location is unfortunate, because unless you know it's there, it won't attract much drive-by service. I hope they can do some advertising to get more folks in the door.

The owner was super friendly and freshly made our orders promptly. I got the Falafel platter, which came w/ tabouli, rice, pitas, hummus, and of course, the BEST Falafel! My girlfriend got the Seafood pita and also loved the flavor. 

I will definitely be a regular and encourage others to try if you're in the mood for authentic, homemade Mediterranean.

So here's the skinny. If you want amazing service, outrageously well prepped, and delicious food, great wine's and delectable desserts, look no further. The cider factory is the epitome of amazing. The wife and I needed a night out of Reno, and Virginia City is a pretty good retreat from the heat and hustle of the valley. On a whim we looked into "Bistro" type spots in VC and stumbled onto this absolute gem. Totally tucked away from the noisy and tourist trap that's Main Street of VC, Cider Factory is one street "up" from Main Street, close enough to walk, but far enough you'd feel like your a 1000 miles away. The staff, amazing. Gracious and hardworking. The food (think Italian cuisine) is so well done and unbelievably delicious. Side story: we just returned from San Fran this week and while there had Fiore de italia (oldest Italian restaurant in the US) and our meals at Cider totally blew them out of the water, no contest. 

Not only is the experience amazing, the people are as well. Family owned is a thing of the past, and my wife and I seek out smaller spots for this reason. The fam at Cider is nothing short of perfect. Only two total people working (host and waiter) on a busy Saturday, and we were never short on food, drinks, conversation or service. Great work guys!

-If you're doing dinner we totally recommend the patio. 
-Try the Moscato it's amazing.
-While not on the dinner menu we had, I ordered Buffalo blue cheese alfredo (chef totally accommodated my request) and it was to die for.

So, make Cider Factory a MUST do on your next Virgina City trek. I promise you it's worth the drive.

Oh my lord! This place just delivered my family uncooked pork in the lomien. I call them up, they said sometimes we make mistakes. I say refund my money, they say we don't do that. I say I'm calling board of health department Monday morning. She says do what you want, we don't care. They are way higher priced then the others also. Eat at your own risk!
Huge resort with beautiful scenery!  Great staff, nice rooms with comfy beds. Just be prepared for long walks of 10 mins or longer.

I walk in, and they're playing the greatest hits of De La Soul throughout lunch. They could have been serving Big Macs and that gets you four stars alone. 

I order a grilled cheese sandwich, and it comes with apple, plums, and bacon on some delicious bread with tortilla chips. And it is sublime. The cheese is perfectly melted, and the goodies inside are covered in wonderful gooey dairy greatness. 

I order a cafe con leche while getting some work done on my laptop. It is flawlessly prepared by a lovely server, and I'm a coffee snob. And if I didn't get buried in work stuff, I was jonesing for one of those half-price martinis they serve on Thursdays.

Wonderful atmosphere (the skatepark staff makes it friendly and fun), great food, delicious coffee, a full bar, and lots of different options. This place is a total home run, and a can't miss for anyone in Ybor.

Great atmosphere, nice staff and beautiful vanilla latté.
Great to grab a coffee, have some snacks or spend a few hours working.
Won't disappoint.

First, let me say the location is amazing. Therefore, 3 stars. However, the food is not really good. We had a lobster soup which tasted like instant tomatoe soup and a uni, which was okay.  Not aure if i would go again for lunch here or just stay here and enjoy the view.

I love the Bricks! We live in Ybor and this is one of our favorite lunch spots. I always have a hard time selecting between two sandwiches - The Elvis which is a peanut butter, banana and bacon sandwich or the Bird and Pig - roasted chicken, bacon, brie, apple, pressed on a Hawaiian sweet roll.

Bricks always offers weekly specials and featured drinks. The crowd is always fun and the staff is friendly.

Amber has the best Indian food in the U.S.! My husband and I have been to other Indian restaurants in Chicago, Seattle, Portland and so far none came close to the creamy goodness that's in our favorite dishes in Amber. Our favorites are: Malai Kofta, Vegetable Korma, Chicken Tikka Masala.  The Malai Kofta stands out because of the creaminess and surprise sweetness from the grapes. It's definitely good to the last drop.  I am definitely going to miss this restaurant!

The husband and I had a kid free day so we decided to have a (gasp) lunch date.

 We picked The Bricks because...well why the hell not.  As soon as we walked in I loved the place.  It was bright and cozy at the same time.  The staff was super friendly and we got the vibe that we could hang out all day if we wanted.

I ordered the most delicious "adult" coffee to drop kick the sleepiness out of my head.  The coffee was SUPER yummy and the liquor did the trick.

It took me a while to figure out what I wanted to eat because everything on the menu looked soooo good and I was super hungry.  In the end, I decided on the Harvest Grill Cheese Sandwich.....nom nom noom.....I was not dissappointed.  It hit the spot and filled my belly with melty cheesy goodness.  The bread was fresh, crunchy, tender and tasty.  The sandwich innards were porportioned perfect.  The Gouda, bacon and apple playing off each other in perfect harmony.

GO HERE AND EAT!  I cannot wait to go again and feel this will be a staple on our lunch resturant list.  Even if your not hungry this would be a wonderful place to have a drink and just chill day or night.

Thanks Bricks for a great lunch!
Wasn't a long wait right after leaving Nissan Stadium Titans game. They have various flavors and we enjoyed it.

It's a bar.  The fact not too many people know about this place and I think it adds to it's mystique at first.  However you enter and what you will find is a neatly decorated bar, seems bigger than what it is due to the high ceilings.  The service for a small place like this you would think would be through the roof but it falls short compared to other places I have been to in Indy.  I would say the service I've had a Chic-fil-a on the northside is better than this place.  The drinks are watery, the bartenders are rude.  The owner, whom was there the night I was, seemed arrogant and rude as well. I would say save your money and time and hit Ball & Biscuit on Mass Ave instead.
The HOUSE margaritas were awesome, the food... Meh! It was ok, but the drinks are worth your money and the service is also great, ask for Fl

Sunday brunch at the bar was a bloody mary -- quite a small glass but it served me well and at $6 I can't complain -- and sauteed chicken breast with hollandaise sauce and fried potatoes. Oh my! I was a little bit concerned when the bartender gave me a steak knife for the chicken, but there proved no need for it, the skin was wonderfully crisp the meat juicy. And the hollandaise was the silky goodness it should be.

The bar has three small TVs that allowed this lone soul to watch the football discreetly (the bartender knew a thing or two about the game, which was a bonus), and the jazz was your typical background affair. I thought it was cute how they moved to play in different parts of the restaurant. Only downside to the atmosphere was a dowdy couple in jeans at the other end of the bar sipping Miller Lite and white wine and looking rather wretched (it was raining and windy outside, so I sympathised).

My first time here and it was crowded. Nonetheless it was a very clean looking environment. I ordered the number 4 which was a spicy chicken sandwich. It came with the potato wedges that were nothing like anything I've ever seen but they were alright. The sandwich was delicious. 

I also bought a large strawberry milkshake which I can honestly say was the best I ever had. The employees all had a very upbeat attitude unlike the rude ones you get at the typical bottom of the barrel fast food spots.  The two cashiers who served me in particular were very energetic. After I said thank you they both said "my pleasure" which was a nice unique touch and a first. They probably say it to everyone but it was a nice note to end on. I will return to try out other items! 

*And they do have a play area with a slide for those of you with small children

Did a "Dinner on Don", we were hoping for great Indian a couple weeks ago. Checked out yelp and there were a lot of great reviews. It was downtown so I made reservations for it. Arrived around 6pm and there were only 3 tables full..the place was empty and we would soon find out why. We were quickly seated and ordered our food, took them about 40 minutes to get it out to us. The food was ok, but the price seriously! 1.50 for 1 nan! not for a basket or a few, but 1 skinny thin little nan!!! that was a bunch of crap! Would not recommend this place to a single soul!!!! The curry's were ok, I would have rather we go to the Indian restaurant on state and Glenwood! much better!!!!! 1.50 for Nan!!!!!

Wow! Really? Amazing!! That was the best crab I have had and I am a huge crab fan! The claws were huge and I asked our waiter if he could bring me the innards with it and he added a side of bread. I had the local special- rock crab with a side salad, onion rings and soup for only $25.00! Our waiter's name was Jp and he was not only attentive but quite adorable I might add. The place was cozy casual with a real authentic cali coast feel terrific classic rock playing and Didn't have that "touristy" feel. Very impressive!

Delicious. Servers are always amazing. Food is always amazing- I love the Eggplant Parmesan and the Penne Rustica.  Create your own pastas are always delicious too.  Love the music they play and the singer for birthdays.

India Palace is a fantastic lunch spot with a good buffet. I normally shy away from buffets, especially for lunch... I hate over eating and then having to go back to work, but in normal indian style, this food is full of flavor and is so good that two plates with a broad selection on each will fulfill your palette very well. 

The staff are friendly and it is fast service with a smile.

I'm writing this for my wife, who would have left me for the Red Velvet ice cream if she didn't eat it so quickly.  It's a cute shop, and the ice cream is delicious, and a steal at what they're charging (at least compared to Boston prices).  We'd go here again in a heartbeat!

Great ambience, tasty food, and variety of drinks.  The perfect place to watch games and fantastic place to hang out Friday and Saturday night.  Great entertainment that you do not want to stop dancing!!

Our first stay wound up to be a debacle, mainly because we seemed to have some sort of youth party going on next to us which made our night miserable.  When the management learned of our experience, they invited us back to make it right, so we came back on our anniversary. 

I cannot begin to describe how overwhelmed we were that night.  What actually happened, is something my wife and I didn't expect.  

First of all, we were upgraded to a junior suite at check in.  Wow - the suite was amazing, had plenty of room and a great view.  Within minutes of our arrival, we had our second surprise in the form of champaign and chocolate covered strawberries delivered to our room! At this point we were past the point of overwhelmed, and I haven't even gotten to dinner yet.

When we arrived at the Old Hickory Steakhouse, we were seated at an excellent table on the terrace with a view of the gardens.  Our waiter, Andrew, was fantastic.  I never even pulled out the certificate you left us or told him who we were.  He knew right away and gave us our final surprise - he informed us that our entire meal with comped!  The then went on say that in situations like this, he recommended (with our consent) a "chef's choice" dinner.  To sit back, relax, and let the chef send out a few courses and enjoy.  Being in the restaurant business ourselves, my wife is very much a "foodie."  She was in heaven.  The meal was fantastic.

You made our 5 year anniversary absolutely amazing, and just saying thank you somehow seems inadequate.  You didn't just make things right, you went far above and beyond anything we could have asked for.  I can only describe it as a "wow" experience.

I will, of course, re-write my review and plan to write multiple reviews for not only the hotel but the restaurant as well.  I will be sure to word it in a way that describes the experience without all the background details, as I wouldn't want people to write a bad review for the purpose of getting something out of it (it certainly wasn't what we expected).

I've learned over time that business (especially in Nashville) isn't about "the deal," but about building relationships.  Thank you for what you did; this is by far one of the best "romantic evenings" my wife and I have experienced.  I believe we will have to come back and do it more often.

Beautiful.  What a facility!  

A little too much nickel and dime...for everything

Some poor service.  Waiter Rudy at Wasabi's sucked and got a weak tip for it.   Dawn at front desk sent me the long way through the Cascades to where my room was supposed to be.  It was actually at the other end and the hall right next the registration was way shorter which I would have appreciated when I was toting all my luggage and supplies.  She was also difficult about giving the room I reserved and tried to get me to take "a bigger room but it has a pull out bed".  Ended up giving me a room with a parking lot view.  Nice Dawn- way to try and spoil my experience.  Everyone else was very nice and helpful
We stopped for lunch on a whim. What a great find. Food could not have been better. Claire is a terrific bartender and server.

For a laid back, no frills, seafood meal, Santa Barbara Shellfish Co is an alright place to visit. If it was not located at the best view spot on the pier at Stearns Wharf, it would not be high on my list of places to visit.

The waiting list for a table in the limited space inside is long, and customer-driven (write down your party name and wait to be called). Because of this, I chose the shorter wait for a spot at the public benches from the self-serve window. The food is good and the service is prompt, but the presentation is modest. Expect something akin to paper plates and ketchup packets. A lot of people visit the area, so the benches are messy. You may need to clean a space - and be careful where you sit.

Where do I start:
Phenomenal food
Excellent Bartender - I didn't know what to drink and bartender created one to her liking
Great Atmosphere
Great music - DJ on Friday Night was awesome
Even the free water in the beginning tasted amazingly
Definitely would go again
Great food - best pancakes and French toast around this will definitely be our favorite brunch place around now!
best selfish ever!!! The Ultimate Spider Crab and shrimp crevice was out of this world! Best CRAB EVER!!!

Great little place with excellent sushi and very helpful staff. It was so good I did not save any for later. Nice that it's open until 10:30 on a weekday. Don't miss the special where you can get 2 rolls from # 1-62 plus miso soup and salad for $15.99! I had # 43 and 38 and they were great.

We were one of the last ones seated for food on a Thursday night although we ended up sitting at the bar to eat. The beers were good. The pizza was good. The Mac and Cheese not so good. Maybe it was because it was near the end of their food service but it was almost inedible and I am no food snob. The pasta was either way undercooked or had been sitting so long it was dried out. The sauce wasn't too great either. I would return again but not for the food.

YUMMY clam chowder in a fresh bread bowl! Big, tasty lobster at a VERY reasonable price! Scampi wasn't the best I've had, but again .. a lot of shrimp for the price. Cold beers while waiting for our table..gorgeous scenery. .great service...what more do you need?!

Be sure and check your bill closely at Tomo's. We ate there recently and as I was clearing out receipts from my billfold, I pulled out my receipt from Tomo's and found that I had been charged for a Pinot Noir, when we all had water, and were charged for a sushi roll that we did not order. Yes, my fault for not checking the receipt but want to warn others to check before paying.

This is my favorite bar inside casino spot hands down. Love the switch from live music to the dj. 

Def needs a bigger dance space but all in all my favorite spot

Nothing great. Another Run-of-the-mill restaurant that has nothing great to offer. The first 2 visits are good in terms of taste and quality. So i thought i found my next food destination. But, No, after couple of weeks the standards came down real quick.

And last week, i ordered a onion dosa and the dosa came out snow white. I asked the waiter and he explained that since they opened an hour ago, the skillet is not hot enough, so the dosa i white. This is HEIGHTS!!! When they now, there is a problem, they shouldn't have taken orders for dosa and they shouldn't give me half baked product.

The lady sitting next to me also got a snow white half baked dosa and she really got confused that she received a wrong order while she ordered Onion dosa. She was also told the same story.

People don't come to restaurants to eat half baked stuff and pay $10 an item.

Their Biryani is a real joke. I expected atleast this to be good as the restaurant name itself is Biryani Hut :) 

I'm not going again.

I did not stay in this hotel, however I went with family to enjoy the Christmas events there. The place is gorgeous!!!! They prepare everything in details with attraction to children. This year Charles Brown Christmas was a theme. Just a little pricey. You still have time to enjoy there.

I really enjoy Doc's. Great food, excellent service and a good spot for us that have out-grown the college bars.

The Salmon entree is fantastic as are the specialty cocktails. This has become a go-to spot for us when visiting West Chester.
The best thing to get here are the soup dumplings. The service is friendly and fast. I have not tried that much of the entree menu, but the couple of entrees I tried were just okay, too oily.

My son and nephew had pasta--pasta carbonara and fettuccini al fredo. They loved it. My sister and I had large salads--Casear and the House. More than enough for dinner, which made for a very reasonable meal. Service was quick, the pasta came out hot, food was very tasty, and I would reecommend this for a family or for a date night.   Prices are very reasonable.

First time here. Food is OK. Chicken fingers are the typical "frozen out of a bag" kind. To be expected at a sports bar. Beers are wonderfully cold, with a solid selection. That gets a star. Lots of big screens for any sporting event you can request. Another star. Servers have a sexy "Paul Bunyans secret mistress" thing going. On task as well. They never let the beer go empty. +2 stars. 

Now, for the manager to address. On this cold night, a group of a$$-hats stood in the patio door, smoking and drafting the place out. People need to smoke outside. Most people don't enjoy a cold 20 knot cross wind filled with second hand smoke.   I have walked out of places that don't control their second hand smoke. Get a grip on that before you lose customers. Oh, and -2 stars.
Super great sushi, though the dinner entrees aren't as great as the sushi bar.  The servers are very friendly!

Came here to print off some documents and was having a bit of difficulty. The man working did everything he could to help and we finally got my papers printed off. Great customer service! 

I didn't try any refreshments as I had no desire to stay long.

40 of us descended on the place after a workout. Was absolutely excellent. The food was perfect and well prepared. It would make any alterations you requested in the menu. The service was terrific. There was a bit of a wait but really 40 of us what would you expect. I don't know what's going on in the neighborhood. Its a breath of fresh air. The food portions were perfect to keep one in line with a good healthy meal. bar was refilled and refilled and refilled.
Also the cost wasn't much more than they paid for at a fast establishment like Starbucks. And the quality was Immaculately superbly better..
This may be our go-to place after a hard workout.
YMMV... BUT OURS WAS SUPERB
Cool spot for beer and grub. We literally stumbled upon this place and glad we did. Hip atmosphere with cool side patio with a cool restaurant attached. Tasty food.

Workers literally throw your stuff down the conveyor belt. Nothing is ever stocked - for example this past trip they had no milk - not just giant brand milk but they had NO milk. Going to the giant in Aston from now on.
they changed names and the sandwiches are amazing. Not sure if it's the same owners but this place has improved. Pizza is outstanding. Love this place.
Great old school New Orleans exercised. The grouper and red fish were both delightful.

I came here during my stay in Reno from April 15 to 17 and was told that this place had good food. It sure was! What sold me that this place has its own brewery at back of the bar area a behind glass wall! I tried out several of their micro beers and I like the   Red Head. The first time I came in for lunch and ordered a Tuscan Chicken Salad and it was good. The staff was friendly and had a chance to chit chat with the manager.

I came back later in the afternoon and happened I caught the tail of Happy Hour and had a beer. I was chatting with a guy sitting next to me and offered a slice of pizza and was surprisingly good!

The next day, I came back for lunch and had a Buffalo Chicken Wing Pizza and it was good!

When ever I come back or have friends who're going to Reno, I'll recommend them to this place.

Overpriced food that's good if you're in the area. No reason to stop by here otherwise.

FOOD - 3.5 stars
=====
+ Complimentary, fluffy, muffin-shaped bread is a plus!
+ Tried the toasted ravioli and St. Louis-style pizza.
- Price is really high for ordinary food in a normal restaurant. Paying by the topping for pizza?! You've gotta be kidding me.

SERVICE/ATMOSPHERE - 3.5 stars
====================
+ Food came promptly and our hungry bellies never felt like we waited long.
+ Our waitress was extremely attentive and professional: she kept our water filled without interrupting conversation.
- Interior of the restaurant was pretty dark. It's a big place, but the TV's were kinda small and a bit too far away to be really engaging.

Good:
* Pretty.  Its kind of hard to beat the surroundings--greenery & water-wise--at least in a hotel.
* Decent apps served at the party (I'm pretty sure we paid through the nose for them and I'm sure you would do the same at whichever hotel restaurants they might serve them at)
* Generally friendly staff in my experience.  In fact, I don't remember encountering any mean staff.  It helps that the affluent and conventions probably tip well--at least on balance--if only because they are on a nice per diem.
* Its also nice around Christmas, if you like that kind of thing--lights & various statues in Christmas garb.  (Google it, I'm sure it shows up in Google images)

Bad and Ugly:
* You can't not pay less than $15 to $17 for what is an essentially an $8 to $9 meal by most standards.
* Having to pay extra for parking sucks.  Seriously, include this in your package(s) and prices.  I realize they should be able to make money for visitors, but I was at a conference and I ate something like 6 meals.  6 x $15 = $90.    Plus the convention I was with paid a ton of money to the hotel presumably--not to mention all the guests staying at the hotel.
* The place is kinda huge & confusing.  The huge part is kinda normal for convention type places--but the confusing generally isn't.  Pack comfortable shoes.
* Never been a fan of the buffets here as an adult and overpriced to say the least IMHO.  (not sure what I thought of them when I was a teen).

Service was quick and very attentive. Never was my beverage glass empty. 

Food was very good. My dish was spicy. It was a moderate level spicy dish and it was hot like I like it. So be careful on the spice level of what you order if this is not your thing. 

If you're looking for lunch the combination specials are the way to go. Soup or salad and a main dish with a roll and deep fried shrimp. I would recommend the soup. It was a coconut chicken soup with mushrooms. Very good.

I have been frequenting Burger Up for about 6 months now.  My wife and I are now hooked.

The place has been steadily improving, especially the service.  Whereas in the past, the staff seemed somewhat unmotivated and stretched too thin, there now seems to be a really positive energy.  The place has a sort of urban hipster vibe (which is unusual for the Franklin area).  There is a patio that I prefer to the inside if the weather cooperates.  The music is contemporary without being offensive.  There is a full bar with several craft beers.  The salads are large and fresh.  My wife swears that the Kale Salad is the best she's had anywhere.  The fried pickles are really good.  The burgers are high quality, but unfortunately diminutive. You can get a much larger burger elsewhere for $13.  This is probably my biggest complaint.  

I like the mission statement of serving local organic foods whenever possible.  However, that apparently comes at a price.
Fresh, simple menu, and a great value too. Restaurant is a little small but cozy. Service can vary, but generally very good.

Two Words. "Spider Crab"

Shared a 5.5 lbs spider crab at $9/lbs. It was simply boiled. Came with two soups and salads. Crab was moving around in the tank 15 minutes before enjoying it. One of the best crab experiences.

Skip the Tomato Bisque and stick with the Clam Chowder.

Also, came back the next day to try the other menu items...specifically the Steamed Clams/Mussels and shrimp Tacos. We order these from the To-Go window this time, and the food was okay.

Though I am not a vegetarian, my meals at Blue Sage Grille have been some of the best I've ever eaten.

The unique aspect of Blue Sage Grille is that they don't fall back on the "fake meat" band-wagon that so many vegetarian restaurants do. As an omnivore, biting into tofu where I'd normally get meat is pretty much always a downer, but at Blue Sage Grille, the food is designed to be focused on vegetables from start to finish. 

A large contingent of the dishes at Blue Sage are of south-western or Asian inspiration but they are not simply familiar recipes minus the meat. The staff at Blue Sage have concocted a menu of interesting and creative entrees that utilize fresh vegetables, grains, and legumes in a variety of ways. I've yet to get a dish that has disappointed me. The menu changes from time to time (they don't have the Chinese 5-spice dumplings anymore), but I hope they never get rid of the BBQ Summer Rolls because I could inhale those things non-stop if given the opportunity. 

The food has always been beautifully presented and the service impeccable. The servers are educated in the cuisine and can offer great recommendations and the pace of the meal has always been spot-on.

One other aspect that I enjoy about Blue Sage Grille is that since it is a rather small dining room, it is easy to strike up a conversation with the diners next to you. This restaurant seems to attract a rather eclectic clientele and several times we've met and talked to very interesting people about topics ranging from baseball to local politics. 

If you find yourself in Lower Bucks County, go to Blue Sage Grille and treat yourself to one of the best dining experiences in the area.

Best Hibachi in Indy! Peter is the main Hibachi chef, originally from Vietnam, but has been doing this for 30 years and it shows. He loves preforming for a crowd and especially kids. (Please note - by kids I mean 5 and up, I don't think Tomo is a great place for younger children)

Also, while the sushi isn't the best in town, the presentation of the sushi can not be topped. Each plate is designed. The sushi isn't just stuck on there, it's thought out and presented artistically with an array of sauces used more like paint. The Perfect roll, is perfect. The Rock n' Roll is a interesting look and worth trying. And I have found many other rolls equally as satisfying.
