It took 20 min for the server to come by to ask about drinks, and when we said we were all fine (4 of us) with the water we already had, she promptly walked away. The server didn't introduce herself and then waited to come back for our food order for another 15 minutes. My crab enchilada was good, nothing to write home about. My friend who ordered the Ahi tuna tacos couldn't even chew the tuna due to the membrane - thinking the tuna was cut incorrectly? Don't think we'll be back anytime in the near future.

Long-time patron. Just had our first visit to their new location. The previous spot and vibe was tight, local, homey and comfortable. The new location is vastly different: grand, high ceilings, modern, simplistic decor, large yet few tables. A few TVs on the walls that were not on (Friday, dinner). It was quite a shock.

Luckily their food remains creative and wonderful. The menu remains small, but has a nice variety of options and prices (12-25).

I came for lunch and honestly had some of the tastiest Indian food I have every enjoyed - off a buffet, at a hole in the wall, next to the half empty shopping mall that looks abandoned. I was shocked! Everything was delightful, service was impeccable and prompt, and everything was delicious. I am so glad my friend convinced me to come and try this restaurant. Come and try the food - you won't regret it!
Very busy restaurant. Try to arrive before the dinner rush. Ceviche sampler was amazing. Dying to go back to try their Tallarines Verdes.
We were here for my sister's graduation. Because we had a large party, we made reservations.  Food was great! Staff was wonderful! I will definitely return!

Fabulous atmosphere with amazing drinks and great food.  I was there for a baby shower and the easily handled our little crowd.  Everyone raves about their food and drinks.  Nothing was a disappointment.  Service was fabulous.  Our waiter was helpful with recommendations and quick to serve.  Overall this was a great experience.

This is a really cool place to eat and enjoy some classic, nostalgic drinks. Pricing for food and drinks is good. About $10 per cocktail/martini which is par for the course but you might find you enjoy them a little too much.....

Located inside the El Dorado Hotel, this restaurant is open in the middle of the day while many restaurants are closed.  The menu is large, prices average and drinks average.

My mediocre writing skills cannot possibly do justice to the amazing mac and cheese!  Holy Cow!  This is quite simply the best I've ever had.  Description is:  Rigatoni pasta with beer cheddar cheese sauce, crisp bacon and crispy onions.  I don't normally like a bunch of extras in my Mac and Cheese since it tends to be too rich or too "one note."  Not this.  Do yourself a favor.  If you like Mac and Cheese, give it a go.

The bar also has happy hour pricing Monday-Friday.

Came here with the fam after a 7-day cruise. All of us had pho tai. Very tasty and authentic broth. I personally appreciated the small bite sized pieces of beef. Generous with the dressings (I'm talking about green onions and stuff). Overall very enjoyable pho. 4/5 would eat again.
Best tortellini salad and chicken gyro in St. Louis!  The place isn't much to look at, but it has me going back over and over because the food is that good.
Nice atmosphere, friendly staff, good selection of beer and delicious food. My only suggestion if for them to buy a glass washer for the bar - from an efficiency and hygiene point of view.

It's great. or rather, it was great.
Arguably a staple of the mall itself, it did not return during the reopening.

5 Guys is my go to burger place.  I eat low carb and really like that you can get bunless and appreciate the free peanuts since I do not eat fries.  The burgers are always great as well.

The bottom line is 5 Guys is one of the best burger joints.  I go here when I can.

Seriously one of the best gyros I've ever had. I ordered the chicken souvlaki. The chicken was tender, well seasoned, warm, and generously topped with tzatziki sauce. Mmm. I am sad my styrofoam box is already empty. Go Gyro Go is my favorite food truck so far. 

They do seem to have an ingredient problem - today they were out of tahini. Still, five stars, what I ordered was awesome. Further items of note: the owner (who took our order) and the cooking staff were really friendly. Also, there were two people in front of us, but I think we had our food within about 5 minutes of ordering - they worked fast.

I went here today for lunch with my colleagues. 
The place has a decent ambiance but most things look old and a tad pale. They could really use a fresh coat of paint and color.
We sat at the enclosed booths that are nestled away in the inner sections of the restaurant. Do try sitting there when you go. It's not the best decor I've ever seen but is unique nonetheless.
The prices at this place are very affordable. They do have a large menu (apart from a separate lunch menu) that contains everything from empanadas to pasta. The thing I liked about their menu was that they had at least 15 items separately listed on a 'vegetarian' section of the menu. That is always helpful for vegetarians. 
I had ordered a lamb gyro with a side of home-made chips off the lunch menu. The gyro was served on an open pita with a generous dose of Tzatziki sauce (Which I love). The lamb meat was well cooked and the whole dish was quite filling. The only thing I would criticize were the potato chips that were served on the side. They had zero seasoning and hence were bland and some of the chips had lost their crunchiness/crispness, which leads me to believe that they chips are just being held in an open container somewhere in the kitchen.
Overall, a nice new place to have tried out. The server was nice and helped pick the dish for a friend when he asked for her help.

We've been here three times, sadly, this will likely be our last. While visiting from Chicago, we called Momo's on Sunday at 8:45 to be sure they were still open. We decided to make the drive from our hotel downtown. The gentleman on the phone stated that the kitchen was open til 10:00 (website stated midnight, but whatever). We figured we'd still have time to grab a quick bite. When we walked in, however, the tune dramatically changed. It seemed as though the bartender (guy with long beard) and staff was irritated we were there. We quickly took the hint and asked for the check after downing a quick appetizer and a couple drinks. We ended up at another place downtown, where we didn't feel rushed. We had looked forward to stopping at Momo's during our trip, so this was a letdown.

A few things on this place...I consider service to be highly important when eating out. Cantina was EXTREMELY accommodating. We had a friend in our large party of 11 that has a tomato allergy. Jeremy the bartender assured no tomatoes made it into her dish. He answered all of my annoying questions honestly about their menu and did so with a sense of humor and a smile. One of us ordered their "not bad" hamburger and guess what?? It wasn't bad!!! Margis were great, throwback tunes playing overhead (hell yah Hall and Oates) and the food was pretty good. I would definitely return. And I most definitely recommend.

Mr. B's Bistro's greatest challenge is its name. Something about the name really doesn't seem nearly as classy or sophisticated as other great restaurants in the city, so much so that I almost passed on this one. Very glad I didn't.

Mr. B's has classic straightforward Louisiana and American food. The restaurant is elegant, yet accessible to everyone looking for a fine dining experience. (You could dress up or simply dress well and be at home here.)

I was delighted by this place in three ways:

1. Impeccable service. There was never a nearly empty glass of tea, and the server was simply among the best in her profession. The wine pairings she chose were also spot on.
2. Everyone at my table loved their meal. My steak was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The pear salad was delicious, having the right balance of cheese, dressing and pear. The seafood gumbo and redfish garnered rave reviews from others in my party.
3. The setting of the restaurant is also very relaxed. There were a few families with children here as well as all-adult tables and everything seemed as calm as it could be. You are steps from all the action of the French Quarter, but feel worlds away in here.

If you want to have a delicious meal, this is it. I especially recommend Mr.B's if you have a party with diverse palates. You can have spicy or simple here. Cajun or Southern.

Great vibe and setting. Gives off that authentic feel that all seaside seafood restaurants should have.

For one, the seafood is fresh. In fact we saw fishermen come in to drop off a new catch of crabs. 

Clam chowder is a must have. Easily one of the best. Rock crab special was good though a bit salty for my taste. Get ready to get dirty because you'll need to get cracking. Onion rings that came as a side were a great addition. 

My dad got the crab sandwich. I had some and it was really good, with bits of crab. 

Mom and sister both got different pastas. Though I did not try, I don't think it was spectacular because neither of them finished their plates.

Will come again, probably to get clam chowder and a sandwich.

The decor and atmosphere of the restaurant was really cute and country like. I love the wooden furniture and all. Our waitress was super sweet and checked on us regularly. I ordered the hot chicken sandwich with truffle fries. The sandwich wasn't as hot as I'd hoped, but I also have a pretty high heat tolerance so most food isn't. The sandwich was juicy and flavorful, though, so I'd definitely order it again. I've found a new love for truffle fries recently so I approve of the ones here. A girl friend that I was with never had them before so when she tried it for the first time, she instantly became addicted. I look forward to trying more of their menu.

Slamming fries and killer service! My best friend ordered a burger which was sufficiently juicy considering it was well done. On the downside, they charged for selzer and the prices over all were a few dollars above normal per item but in my humble opinion well with it.

Great food but horrible customer service, the guy w the beard josh I think his name is, is one of the upmost rudest individuals I have ever come encounter with. I spend my money there on a regular basis, and I thought after being a long standing loyal customer that would afford me a sense of belonging at this pizzeria, but it seems to be the complete opposite every time I cross paths with this man who doesn't seem to understand the logic of the restaurant business. It's a upmost shame that an establishment with such quality food would employ an individual with this type of attitude towards it everyday customer. Just goes to show you how that you money and time is not appreciated there. Thanks Josh for not only ruining one of my top dinning and pizzera establishments, but putting in a horrid attitude and leaning a bad taste in my mouth every time I leave Not Average Joes Pizza. I will spread the word, I don't care how long this individual has been employed there, this is never a way to act, be professional and have some class!
I live in the neighborhood and I've been here a couple of times - the food is great, no issues with service, nice atmosphere. The wings are delicious.

We had a great experience today at Burger Up! Our server David was awesome. He realized immediately that we were kind of in a hurry, so he took our order quickly. He was super friendly and made sure the girls and I were well taken care of!! 
This is why Burger Up is one of our favorite restaurants!

After a three night stay, I wouldn't return. This way OVER priced motel 6 like hotel is not all that it seems to be! For starters, we had to wait almost an hour to get our room. They didn't have it ready? At 6pm? For two people? And then to give us the wrong room. There's that. But the room-bla. We were in the "old" section. So only one sink, one outlet in the bathroom, and only two other outlets in the room. Really? Two? The floor was gross. Upon setting my bag down, a huge bug went crawling under the dresser. For the higher price of these rooms, there should be higher quality---but it's just an overpriced hotel. Period. Find another place. As other people have mentioned, the food chioces are expensive & low quality. And the hours are awful! Remember this place is huge! Huge! But places seem to close at 8pm at night. Or don't open until 10am! For the resort type place this wants to be, you'd expect a busier night life or geared toward early risers! Especially if the weather is bad, you're stuck waiting for places to open. All in all, find a different place to stay. Period.

Horrible service, horrible bland food for the price points, I would never come here again for brunch. 

I love lunch and dinner here but that would be it. 

They said it would take 15 minutes to wait, it took over 30 minutes, it took 10 minutes for our server to come and get us water, then our food took another 30 minutes and it was horrible. 

We should have waited in the line at Fido. NEVER AGAIN
The tour guide was great and well informed. The food was really good. I would definitely recommend taking the tour.

1. Service is incredibly friendly
2. Menu is actually vegitarian and carb free friendly
3. Um, and the most important, my fish tacos were ridiculously good. They used their house salsa to marinate the fish. It had such great flavor I regret not getting a 3rd taco. Oh and don't worry about your tortillas getting soggy. I ate my tacos in lighting speed they were so good ;)

We stayed here for our 1 year anniversary and paid the extra money to get a balcony and view of the inside garden. It was fantastic and we had a great time drinking wine and people watching. 

The restaurants were a bit expensive but we knew that going in so it wasn't a big issue and it was a great experience. 

The resort fee is $18 and it takes care of the two bottles of water you get in the hotel....which seemed a bit ridiculous but again it's part of the deal. 

Parking isn't free ($23 a day) but we parked in the mall parking lot and we had no problems. We weren't alone so I at least felt safe with my jeep out there. 

Definitely would do it again for another special occasion.

The staff here was great. We had a bunch of people includeing two little ones. The waitstaff was fast with the refills and great with the kids. The food was what you exspect at a Dennys and the place was clean.

Mr. B's is a pretty good meal with some strong spots, and some definite weak spots.  We showed up about ten minutes early to our reservation and grabbed a drink at the bar.  The drinks were pretty much par for any upscale restaurant's bar...a bit pricey and good but nothing clever or great.  The atmosphere of the bar is a bit crowded making it loud and a little unpleasant.  Still, the clientele and the bar itself was nice so this wasn't a big deal.

When we were seated, I was FREEZING.  I thought it was from my martini, but  I realized about half way through my meal when I stood up to navigate the corn maze to the bathroom downstairs that there was a vent blowing freezing cold air right above me.  Oh well.  On to the food....

I started with Gumbo Ya-Ya, which is this places staple.  It did for sure live up to all it's hype.  I'm no gumbo expert but this had a delicious, rich and smoky flavor, that was very well contrasting with the natural sweetness of the chicken and broth.  It balanced smoky, salty, and sweet in excellent layers.  I ordered a scallops appetizer because I didn't want anything fried (seriously what's the deal...only like 1/7 appetizers wasn't fried).  I knew my entree would be heavy so I opted for this, and it wasn't a great dish.  The fried oysters and shrimp were much more flavorful.

My entree was the braised rabbit which was a really nice dish.  It was almost unfairly sweet and about half way through it it just felt like I was forking through molasses.  I really was moving at a New Orleans pace.  I think this might have worked better as an appetizer because at this quantity it felt like there was no beginning and no end.  The bacon and mashed potatoes were delicious, but were all hampered by a very very sweet and thick sauce.  The filet was okay (but nothing great), and the fish of the day was pretty nice, but also nothing great, from trying off of other plates.

Overall, I think the food was four stars, but the limited dishes under 5,000 calories, the packed bar, and the freezing cold atmosphere detracted a star from my review.
First time in New Orleans and the only place with a real margarita. Very authentic Mexico food like home

Heard great things about this restaurant, so decided to,go on a Friday night. Was told that we would be on a 50 minute wait so we were directed to a standing table and decided to order a drink while we waited. (There is no where to wait at this restaurant)  Got texted to come up to the hostess stand after putting in a drink order. 5 mins after we were told it was a 50 min wait. So my husband waited for the drinks while I was seated at a two top table outside.  My husband finally got the drinks after I had been seated for 15 mins. He was annoyed and so was I. If you tell me it's going to be a 50 mins wait at least be somewhat within 15-20 mins if it. The food was great but we constantly being bumped into by people and the wait staff going by our table. Very frustrating.  The tables are too close. If you want to be knocked around every couple of mins. Then this is your place. Way too small.
Had dinner there I got a chicken tikka masala, naan, and raita everything was awesome! Would definitely recommend!

If i could give this place 0 stars I would. I've tried this place 3 times but never again. They have nasty attitudes. They never seated us we had to ask if we can be seated, served sushi with clearly old fish, and once i got it MY FOOD HAD HAIR IN IT. Then they literally put a spoonful of salt at the bottom of my drink!! wtf is that who does that! Every time i asked for a frozen drink i just got a drink with ice cubes in it!  Never coming back to this place again!!!!

I would recommend this to anyone - whether you live in St. Louis or are just passing by. It can be a long way from time to time but it's a free tour, what can you expect - worth the wait! If there is a long wait for the tour, head outside to their patio and enjoy some delicious drinks! 

The guides are always very knowledgeable and friendly. Tons of great opportunities for photos. So much history! I LOVE getting to see the beautiful Clydesdales. Of course the free drinks at the end are always an added bonus!

We visited this restaurant on a Saturday night, and when we walked in, the place was almost completely empty.  Not the best sign.  The wait staff was friendly, and the atmosphere is nice.  That is pretty much the only nice thing I can say about this restaurant.  The food - starting with the guacamole - had zero flavor.  I am not sure how you can even mess guacamole up, it's so easy to make.  My son ordered two soft tacos with brisket and nothing else on them - they literally had 2 slices of brisket each - and in his words "taste like nothing"...those 2 tacos cost $11.  That's crazy.  The kids menu provides an $6.95 entry for kids, but charges extra for a DRINK.  Why?  That's just tacky.  Everything on the menu is alacarte, so if you want rice and beans, be prepared to pay more for those.  My husband had the taco flight - 3 different tacos, and this is a guy who never would turn food down.  He said they had absolutely zero flavor - and wound up only eating a few bites.  We joked that they definitely do not have Mexican chefs - there is no way authentic Mexican food should ever be so bland and unseasoned.  Would not recommend.  Totally overpriced, as well.  Never returning.

This place is a vegetarian's paradise. I wish I lived closer.

Words can't even come close to conveying the delicious (and flawless) menu.

My favorites are the goat cheese nachos and brioche avocado sliders. For dessert - the banana chocolate bread pudding.

Just stop reading and go right now.

We selected this place because of the high Yelp ratings.  Unfortunately, I'm bummed out that of all the places we could have gone for dinner..we ended up here. Very disappointed with the experience.

To find this place you have to walk all the way to the end of Stearn's Wharf which is no big deal because we were already there.  By no means is this the only restaurant in the area but since we were on the wharf I pulled it up on Yelp and it had many, many favorable reviews. So we thought...let's give it a shot.  

Upon arrival, you place your name on a list hanging from the post just outside the entrance to the restaurant.   You can indicate eating indoors, at  one of the few tables outdoors, or first available.  We were in no rush and it was a nice afternoon so we opted for outdoors.  The restaurant is very small with even fewer tables outside. Service was below par.  The waiter even apologized and self-admitting he "forgot about us" after leaving us for 10 minutes and not returning to take our order.

The menu is typical seafood with specialization in crab and lobster. My two kids were with me and unfortunately their taste buds aren't at the level to pick from the menu. I asked the waiter if they offered a kids'  menu...they got three choices chicken dinos, grilled cheese sandwhich, or pasta. I opted for the crabcakes and my husband for the shrimp tacos.

I wish I had read Steve I's review...I couldn't agree more with his description of the crab cakes.  I would assume that if you are calling a dish "crab cakes" that there would be some crab in it? Maybe?  They were a mushy mess.  Could not find lumps of crab nor taste the crab.  I won't complain about the skimpy size since it would have been a complete waste of "food".  The "crab" cakes came with a garnish of onion rings and a side of coleslaw.  The chipotle aioli tasted more like thousand island dressing.  On to the shrimp tacos.  Anyone who has had baja style shrimp tacos knows that they are breaded. In fairness to Sta Barbara Shellfish Co., the menu did not state they would be breaded.  According to my husband, they were just "aw-right".  From my vantage point across the table his plate did NOT look appetizing.  A side of box quality spanish rice to complement the tacos?!  The best thing about this place?  Getting the heck out!!!Overall, never coming back.
I called in an order for pickup and for $30 got a lot of food. Order was accurate and ready right away. It wasn't the best Chinese food ever, but it wasn't bad. I'd definitely order again.
Pretty good food especially salads desserts and belly dancing.

Delicious coffee, and not too crowded early on a Saturday afternoon. The interior is a little uber-modern for my taste, but the small outdoor patio is a perfect place to sit and chat or read a book. Friendly staff who pull great espresso. I only wish it didn't directly face a car wash - it can be kind of loud. There's a bike rack right near the outdoor seating so French Press is not a bad post-ride stop.

Oh my goodness.  This was an amazing meal from start to finish. Service was outstanding, and it was one of the most memorable meals we've had in NOLA. Gumbo, BBQ shrimp, all the standards done perfectly. This will set you back a few pounds, but it'll be worth it.

I visited while in NOLA for business, was eating alone this evening, so I put my name in for 1 and went to the bar, the bar looked enjoyable to me, and so it did for everyone else because it was hard finding a spot.  I decided to hang out there during my 45 minute table wait time and got my table in about 30.  YES!  

I was guided to my table, was greeted by a polite, professional and smiling waiter, and just sat quietly taking in the ambiance of a busy NOLA restaurant and kitchen, bustling with activity... Was like being in a movie.  As the hot french bread and butter arrived, I was anticipating the experience, hoping for a good one.

I chose the wood char-grilled Red fish, on asparagus with new potatoes, with an ounce or two of lemon butter sauce in a small ramekin.

Bottom line, the fish was cooked perfectly. Every corner, perfect!  The asparagus had full color, cooked just right with just a slight snap and the potatoes... again, perfect.  

That was my experience... I was very pleased and could not find fault with my meal, the preparation, or the service.  Of course, I was a table for one, but that didn't seem to discriminate Mr. B's from delivering a sensational meal.

Well done!

Well I hate to knock off one star, but the last few times we've been here the service hasn't been that great.  Service was never that good to begin with but the last few times we've visited it's been even worse... so knocking off a star for that.

Otherwise the food, ambiance, and prices are still great.

We'll still keep eating here and do recommend the place-- just know that the service is probably going to be kind of bad.
This place is my go to restaurant. We have been a regular for over 10 years. The soft tofu Is the best in the country. The pancake was GREAT. Would recommend to any1

The Bricks completely lives up to the hype. Don't leave without trying their amazing Basil-infused lemonade!

Really chill cafe-like vibe, with a creative comfort food menu (peanut butter sandwiches!), and full table service.

In a few weeks they will be opening a quiet "study hall" space for laptop lurkers, making this a killer telecommute/study spot.

Authentic Indian flavours and great prices! Tried the aloo paratha, garlic naan, and raita, all of which tasted great. The portions could've been a bit bigger, but I suppose it's fair for the price. Definite value for money. Can't wait to go back!

Wow!  This was our first experience with Peruvian style cooking.  It was delish!

I love different stuff, so beef hearts sliced, marinated in chili paste and grilled was right up my alley!  Be careful of the pink sauce on the side- it has a bite.

Ceviche pescado was very fresh.  The fish was, admittedly, overpowered by the lime, and some on the bottom wasn't "cooked".

I had some seafood and rice dish which was delicately seasoned and again, fresh.  One child had the steak on French fries and cleaned his plate, while my wife had the catch of the day fried and topped with a red sauce and shrimp. Scrumptious!  A ribeye for another child was tasty, but a little chewy. At least the pieces she gave me...

I looked at the wine list and gave up.  Too many choices.  Their manager, sight unseen, took into consideration our food choices in picking some nice pairings for us.  They also have a ton of beers.

We had dulce de leche cheesecake and tres leches because they were home made.  Neither will disappoint, but I preferred the tres leches. 

I recommend it, and really look forward to our return.

Crust is really good and the kids menu is spot on for our kiddos. It's one of the few places I'd say is truly family friendly. All the specialty pizza's are pretty good. We recently got the house special and that was great! The appetizers are just ok, not anything I'd say is noteworthy. Really it's a great neighborhood spot to watch the game at the bar or grab a slice with the kiddos. Prices are very fair for the quality and portions. Our family loves Mellow Mushroom on Oak. St,  and it's pretty much our go-to get out the house with the kids place.

My boyfriend and I came here for a pre-concert dinner (House of Blues is right across the street). I ordered some shrimp entree and my boyfriend had the rabbit. The only thing I enjoyed was the pickled okra, everything else was too bland or too salty. I was terrified I was going to get ill because everything was not hot, just lukewarm. They need to revamp these recipes, it was awful.

Had the biryani, tandoori chicken, and the chana masala + naan while visiting a friend down here. All was standard and fine. The food wasn't remarkable, but it wasn't inedible either. I'd probably go back again if I was down there and someone asked me to (after I try Cafe Poca Cosa first, though).

In any case, Sher Punjab seems like a good, safe bet for Indian in Tucson (I'll have to visit Tucson more often before I can compare it to other Indian joints).

Waitress was rude when explaining that something didn't come with what we ordered because it's a different special, TWICE then askeddif we needed a box . We said thanks and that we would not return. She says, "What?". We then just asked for tbe check. The person on the computer sitting at the back came up to us and rudely "explains" our misunderstanding, AGAIN. Waited another five minutes for a box, then I stated that she asked me if I wanted one and she never brought it. Computer person yells from her seat if we want a box, and brings us one... NEVER GOING BACK. Food was amazing, the help was not. I worked in the food and customer service industry for 16 years. Never have I managed employees to treat their PAYING guests this way. Also, maybe rethink the unprofessional dress code. Tank top, short shorts hair all over the place? Fast food, maybe... But in a dine-in establishment? I bope the owners read this. Ill be posting on yelp and online...

I had the worst chinese of my life here. That says a lot considering I have had chinese food in places like Utah and upstate New Hampshire. It was so greasy and foul I ended up throwing it out. I probably should have known better given the skeezy neon lights.

The eggrolls tasted like they had been fried, then thrown aside for 6 or so hours, and then refried in really dirty oil. So gross.

The chicken with broccoli was a greasy mess. It tasted like it had been reheated as well. The kung pow chicken was also swimming in old grease. 

I have heard other people say they like it, but I really don't think I am going to give them another chance. I'll stick with Chinatown.

My wife and I stopped here because we were visiting the funk zone. Came in for their great selection of beer and decided to try and item off the food menu. Ordered the grilled salmon salad... not really expecting much but the salad was fantastic. Beautifully presented, great citrus dressing and the salmon was cooked perfectly. I'm giving it an extra star as I think the owner or manager is a grateful dead fan as there were fare the well posters in the rest room.

This my go-to local spot for bagels. The bagels are delicious. My wife is a big fan of their flavored cream cheeses. I on the other hand go for the breakfast sandwiches. Either way this place wins every time compared to other chain bagel places in my opinion.

Headed to O'Brien's in Carrollwood for a Gator game not expecting much but some cheap beer. I was pleasantly surprised when flipping through their menu and decided to try the Chicken-feta-spinach burger. It was amazing. So delicious, and the sweet-potato fries were so crisp and delectable too. Their menu also featured several authentic Irish dishes (bangers and mash, shepherd's pie, chicken pot pie, etc.) that sounded delicious. The restaurant is a big, open space with nice, clean tables and high-tops. There are TVs everywhere, so no matter where you are seated, you can see what's happening in the game. They also have a large stage area where I'm assuming they do live music, but for the Gator game, they had a HUGE projector taking up the space. The volume was good too...you could hear the game in the entire restaurant. The service was fantastic. I will definitely be back if I'm up in Carrollwood, but they should consider opening a South Tampa location!

Wonderful food! Great service! We are visiting from out of town - wish we lived closer.  Paneer Butter Masala had wonderful mild flavor. Samosas also delicious and loved the Masala Chai Tea. Try it! You won't be disappointed.
So glad to finally have some good Indian cuisine in Wilson County!  I will definitely be back here again!

You can find Carmine's Steakhouse in downtown St Louis at 20 S 4th St, St Louis, MO 63102, this is about a block away from the famous Gateway Arch and convenient to the Old Courthouse and Busch Stadium, as well as the junction of I64 and I44.

Carmine's is an old-school steakhouse featuring aged cuts of beef and an ambiance that would work well in New York or Chicago. There's an expansive bar, plenty of seating and also a patio for those wanting to people watch during lunch. 

We came to Carmine's from Scottrade watching the Blues loose to the Flyers - great action at an exceptional venue. Carmine's was recommended to us by the cab driver and a fine recommendation it was.

Our server was prompt and handed us a couple of menus - the alcohol menu was fairly extensive with four pages covering the various wines, house drinks and beers - I selected a quite good Deschutes Brewery Obsidian Stout and my dining companion went for a glass of red.

The food menu featured some interesting appetizers, Salads, Chicken, Steaks/Chops and Seafood. What intrigued me was the local favorite fried ravioli and we decided to split the appetizer (note that I had been warned that this local treat was "disgusting" - not my words). After trying it, I'm sorry but I simply can't recommend it here (and I'm betting that it's very well done at Carmine's). For me, the issue with the fried ravioli is that it contains beef - I think that if it were chicken or something a bit less fatty it would be fine. As it is, when you cut into the ravioli you're greeted by a greasy meatball surrounded by a lightly breaded ravioli pasta. The marinara did little to cut the grease and after eating one I couldn't stomach a second. Oh well, I was warned!

For dinner I selected the 10 oz Filet Mignon, inquiring about getting it black-and-blue (cold, rare guts with a bit of char on the outside). For a side I chose the broccoli sans the cheese sauce. The steak, while it could have had a bit more char it was indeed perfectly cooked temperature-wise. The broccoli wasn't anything special (maybe the cheese would have improved the dish? I almost asked for it on the side). I was passed a plate of mushroom risotto which was much better - I was just trying to save some of the calories and have something green.

Overall, I thought the steak was just about perfect, the sides mediocre and the appetizer yucky. However, based on the excellent beer and the steak, I still think this restaurant is worth visiting and giving a try, especially if you happen to be downtown. Also, the service was excellent - I don't remember the server's name but she was quick, answered our questions and was very patient with a couple of visitors.

(also published to my food blog)
Kinda like Chipotle but it's pizza. Really good cheap pizza. You can seriously put whatever on your pizza for $8.  Will be back for sure!

we were very disappointed with an appetizer we ordered. Felt like we got robbed and wasted our money. We ordered the hummus and we were only provided with about 5 or 6 chips which was shocking.. We asked for more and we were told it would cost $2 and we said no. I paid for a bowl of hummus I couldn't eat. Thanks a lot.

We came here in a group of six on Friday evening, June 24th. And boy were we impressed. 

We started with the bread. Perfectly warm and crusty. Then our table shared the garlic truffle fries and they were SO CRAZY GOOD. 

But...then....my steak. Oh my steak. I have had great steaks. Many of them. Bohanon's in San Antonio, Pappas in Houston, etc. and the truffle filet at Mr B's was so spectacular that my jaw dropped and I was speechless. I gave a bite to several of my table mates (I can't eat 8 oz of steak on my own so I happily shared). It was crazy how good it was. Served with asparagus and potatoes and they were great as well. 

Dessert was AMAZING. Don't miss the white chocolate brownie. 

Everyone at our table ordered something different. Everyone at the table cleaned their plates. Amazing. 

The only thing that keeps it from five stars was our server. She was awful. So rude, she actually rolled her eyes at me when I asked what would be easiest for her when it came to splitting the bill. She was sullen and rude all around. But we interacted with another server as well (he took our orders) and he was awesome!!!!!!!!!! He was super nice. Then there was another runner who made sure no water glasses were empty and that we had bread! We liked him too. 

In all, we will be back. And we will hope for a different server!

I had never visited Granite City before but had seen them. They always smelled great and looked expensive.  I was in Indy for work and decided to give it a try. I am SO glad that I did.  They have $5 flights with 8 different beers, a large menu, and friendly staff.  Their beer ranged from light ale (which tasted just like a Bud Light) to a dark and rich oatmeal stout.  I would recommend the Bennie, a Bock german malty lager.  I had probably the most amazing beer cheese soup I have ever had.  My co-worker had this amazing pasta with sundried tomatoes and pine nuts.  If I had been in town for a couple more days I would have gone back for lunch and dinner again!  I can't wait to go back and try a burger.

Pretty disappointed. Food was as good as anywhere half the price. Duck spring rolls were alright. Bacon wrapped shrimp was tough. Oysters were deep fried to the point you wouldn't know there was an oyster under there. Asked for medium rare pork chops - got very, very rare. Normally wouldn't complain but my girlfriend's fish was completely tasteless as well - bad seafood in New Orleans is a crime. Waiter was very nice and offered to swap it out for another dish -the pecan crusted redfish. It wasn't bad but not worth the $30 price tag. You can get better seafood at a half dozen other places. Atmosphere was nice but, at least where we were, it was way too hot. Got a few martinis which were pretty excellent. Maybe it was a rough Thursday night so I give the two stars for the benefit of the doubt and the quality service. If you got other places you're thinking about visiting, go there first.

We have had three meals since opening day. Proud to admit that this has now become my favorite sushi spot. The drinks are phenomenal. Sushi is fresh and creative. And I love the vibe in there. Ps to one of the previous comments. They have high chairs. Kids have lives too!
Good food and good beer! But guy bartenders every day of the week, not the hang around atmosphere I look for in a pub/ restauran!!!!
I've been here for lunch with a beautiful date. Food was excellent, tough it's a little bit on the pricier side. If you want some delicious vegetarian food, this is your place!
This place had really good bubble tea! I got the strawberry. Also got the vegan wrap, it was really good but I will ask for less lettuce next time. Was way too much.

Stopped here to grab a bite to eat. It was recommended by a local. The lump crab cake on the salad I ordered was spoiled. Can't understand how the staff preparing the dish didn't notice it. Retched. The steak on the streak sandwich ordered by companion was cold and flavorless. Please tell me that this isn't the norm here.

Love their beer selection here, their food is pretty good too. The bartenders were great though, very attentive and quick even though they were clearly swamped with customers. Really nice place to hang out and try some great beers.

This place is upscale. It has good food and very good service. I had the Jambalaya Pasta which had a variety of seafood and a rich sauce. It was very tasty.

The only drawback was that the rear of the restaurant, where we sat, was a bit loud. Otherwise, it was a great place to dine.

Have been here a few times, but went on Friday and finally tried the food.

We ordered a bunch of things, including the oxtail (comes in a pate form with truffle oil and bread), the pulled pork empanadas (DELICIOUS!), ribs, and grilled asparagus. It was all really good. I wasn't impressed by the oxtail but did love the empanadas and grilled asparagus. In fact, I think next time we will try more of their "charcoal grill" selection (included chicken, lamb meatballs, asparagus, etc.)

Additionally, the live band was great. Limited cider selection (just Angry Orchard and Jack's), but they had a good amount of different beers on tap.

If you like the smooth creamy texture of Palaak Paneer, do NOT order it here. The paneer has small chunks of diced ginger and pods of spices. I found the texture off putting, and would not order again. I've had the tiki masala before and that was good. So will go towards meat if you go here and the garlic naan is good.

Love this place! Discovered it last year during "Hot August Nights," and made it a point to eat there twice this year.

I have yet to find a disappointing item on the menu. From their Chingalingas appetizer to the tacos, all great. Here's where it might get a little weird, though: if you are a fan of calamari, I cannot recommend the calamari steak enough. It is amazing, so tender and lightly breaded, with an incredible lemon sauce. This struck me as being completely off-the-wall for a Mexican restaurant, but I'm glad I tried it. I have to have it every single time.

The joint itself is pretty unassuming, just a basic restaurant with the obligatory laminate tables and neon bar lights. The food is what sets it apart, for sure.

Food was amazing and the service was very accommodating.  Although they quoted us a wait time of 30 min, it ended up being about an hour the staff was very accommodating and apologized numerous times. We did go about an hour before close and they still accommodated us. Price is pretty reasonable for sea food and i did enjoy everything i had to eat. 


Pros: food, service 
Cons: food turn around time is slow, wait time, no free refills for drinks 

Will i be back? Yes, but i would make a reservation.
The menu is diverse without drowning a guest with options. But CAMI seals the deal with her southern hospitality. We can't wait to go back and will definitely request her.

Twisted Tail took over the old Kildare's on Head House Square a while ago and I've been meaning to check it out for a good long while.  Recently, I wandered in on a Sunday and was treated to one of the best bar experiences I've ever had.

I went upstairs to the bar and ordered off of their specialty cocktail menu.  The bartender was quick, skilled and friendly.  The mint julep he made me was probably the best version of that drink I've ever had!  My date had some sort of fruity black cherry drink in an up glass that was similarly excellent.

Best of all was the live blues band rocking out on stage.  I was floored when I found out that the band was really an open mic jam session that they host on Sundays.  We were treated to some very good musicians who just showed up to play.  It made for a great atmosphere that I'll likely go back to experience again.

I can't say much about the food, since I only came in for drinks.  Somebody else was eating farther down the bar and whatever he was having smelled excellent.

My only gripe is with the prices, which are on the high side.  The drinks I ordered were on par with the menus at a lot of center city places ($8-10 a drink). However they were certainly high quality and well made, so I can't quibble much.  The food menu did seem on the high side, with most dishes over $15.

Great place though and definitely one I'll return to in the future.

Over-priced, slow service. It took 5 minutes to get a seat at 9am, with the restaurant half empty; wait staff was invisible for 15 minutes after I was seated. The food was no different than McDonald's; thoroughly unremarkable. I'll never spend my money here again.
Waited almost 2 hours for a to-go order. Got home and they forgot the appetizer I ordered. Good was subpar consider I no the dishes are almost $20 a pop.

Honestly, one of the best buffets I've been to.  I'll be back in Indy at Christmas, and I'll be sure to make a stop!

It's pretty standard Indian fare, but it tastes extremely fresh.

This place is definitely the best Indian I've had in Indy!

Had a mocha here. It was just the right amount of chocolate and coffee. Nothing else needed. :) Considering, I like my drinks on the sweet side, that's quite a compliment!

There is plenty of indoor and outdoor seating and overall, it has a really open feel. This is definitely one of those coffee shops I feel like I could spend a few hours at, just reading or, if inclined, using a computer.

There is a parking lot, which isn't usually a problem for SB, but it's great for meeting people who aren't too familiar with the area. 

Didn't try any of the food, but that will probably change next time.

This spot was not that bad at all consideeing the low reviews it has on here. The food was good and the service was good. I would recommend this to anyone. However,  it was a little more expensive that what have liked.

The smoothies here are fantastic, they never fail to impress. You walk in here and it smells like fresh fruits. These are some of the most healthiest and flavor packed smoothies. The wait time isn't even bad, 5 mins is all it takes. In conclusion these smoothies make me so back flips. YAGA YEET!

I went with​ a friend for a casual dinner.  It was pretty packed​ with the only seating​ left was at the bar.  On this evening a band was playing memorable​ songs from years gone by.  
I had the fish and chips which came with a side of coleslaw​.  I really tried to like this dish.  But, nothing was seasoned.  The coleslaw was finely shredded and sort of maybe had a dressing on it.  What would it cost to put a little something on it?​  The fish was fried in a thick crust without any seasoning.  Thick cut fries which I tried to put salt on but each of the salt shakers the holes were​​ clogged.  Price $12.99.
My girlfriend​ had the bangers n'mash.  What a flavorful dish (4) sauges over mashed potatoes with a gravy.  What a flavorful dish the sausages were delish.  Every item on that plate had a ​flavor which made the eating so much better.  I would have to say it is a plate of comfort food.  I believed she paid $15.99 for the dish.  The mash potatoes were so creamy which made the flavorful gravy even a better moment in time.
I would try a lunchtime​ to be able to see more of the decor. Also, make a different selection of food.  The service was wonderful and attentive​.

Some of the reviews have mentioned how long it takes, and you should listen to them. We sat down at 7pm and ordered two vegetarian dishes and by 8pm there was still nothing coming from the kitchen. The restaurant only had a couple other tables filled, it was mostly empty. When I complained, the owner talked to me and said they make everything from scratch. I get that, that's fine with me, but at least tell me when I sit down that it will take a couple hours so I can leave and never come here again.

We sat back down and five minutes later the owner came out to tell us our order was just being started, after an hour! We told him forget it and left. I mean, making each meal from scratch may take a while, but it takes even longer when you don't actually start preparing the food for an hour. They need to fire the cook and get somebody back there who knows how to run a kitchen.

So, I haven't actually tried the food, but if you read some of the other reviews for this restaurant, neither have some of the other reviewers, for the same reason.

I can't believe this restaurant is still in business. Three tables filled and we have to wait over and hour for some indian food? That's not a recipe for success. Plus it's expensive, $7 for a mango lassi, are you serious? $15 for a vegetarian entree? It's too much.

I'm glad we left, we ended up going to Sawadee in Meridian, and it was awesome.
There was no wait when I went and was quickly seated. Tried the chicken Marsala and liked that they replaced the traditional mashed potato with grits! Great food and nice atmosphere

Deep. Fried. Cookie Dough. Egg Rolls. Order these - I promise you will not be disappointed. 

When I was in college, I used to eat here with my friends and sit at a table, and the service was decent. Now when I am in town for business, I sit at the bar and I always have the same female bar tender with the short, trendy hair cut and immediately regret it every time. She acts as if I am inconveniencing her by placing an order and checks on me infrequently even if the restaurant is not busy. 

As far as the food is concerned - I always order a torrado. They are basically just burritos with a different name. So if you like burritos, you will probably like these. I have never heard anyone complain about anything on the menu so the food gets two thumbs up from me.
The amazing aroma of fresh seafood alone will knock you into heaven! Lobsta Tacos & chowder will drive you mad! Place really a find at end of the pier.

Have come to The Bricks a few times as I wait for classes, there is wifi and it's a nice environment to sit, eat, grab a beer and do some homework.  If I'm in Ybor for an extended period of time and have to wait, I usually try to make it here as much as I can.

A little stuffy for my taste but the food was decent. Great gumbo. BBQ shrimp were amazing as were my shrimp and grits. Bread pudding was cold which kind of pissed me off. We had no reservation and only waited 20 minutes.

Great place for lunch!

It's been many years since my last experience at Bistro St Tropez, so was happy to try it out again for a business lunch. 

While the menu is a tad boring, the dishes were anything but. The salads are bright and crisp, the soups delectable and the ingredients fresh and well presented. 

Vegetarians and vegans could get by there, but have to great a little creative. Nothing on the lunch menu is specifically vegetarian.
Not a smile the whole time. Mostly for asian tourists. Must be in some guide book. Food was not filling.
I prefer Baba ganoush on the smokey side but this one was very good! Fresh and tasty. Ordered the mixed grill, very good too! Good amount of food. I'll be coming back!

Noodles and Co is one of my favorite fast casual spots, and this location was great.  My coworker got a fairly complicated order and they were easily able to accommodate it and ring it out in the register, all very politely.  The service was exceptional and the food came out quickly.  I got the Mac and cheese, and it was fantastic as usual. 

As far as St. Louis Noodles and Co go, this one is near the top for me.
Friendly bartender, The beer was middle of the road quality.  Folks seemed to enjoy the Molecular Munchies food truck.  The ambiance fits the tech park environment.

Okay I can't say enough about this place!! Soooo good! Came here for dessert and the cookies were to die for! Best cookies I think I have ever had... located in a perfect spot in the funk zone- very industrial looking inside which I like. Also located in a spot where they have wine tasting, community style seating- which is fun! All around great atmosphere/ I can't wait to come back and try the breakfast!!

Cannot say enough nice things about this place!  We've been to the lunch buffet a number of times and the food is always fresh and delicious.  Often you'll find the wife of the chef waiting tables-- she's delightful. We get a kick out of the Indian cooking shows on the TV and the music is great.  Make sure you save room for desserts, they're first rate.

Alright. Atmosphere reigns supreme at Jacksons. Chill on the patio and people watch, chat, whatever. The drinks come in a close second. A properly made cocktail makes up for many a shortcoming. Third is the food. Decent. If your looking for gourmet, go elsewhere. If you want a sandwich to soak some liquor or a burger to satisfy your bloodlust, they have what you're looking for. Service is completely hit or miss. Some servers are all over you like red on a baboon's ass while others couldn't spell service if they tried.

Gotta give it three stars cause it's one of the best hangout/drink/grab a bite places around the Vandy area. It's comfortable and it's not pretentious, but thats as far as it goes. Yippee.
The bacon was as rubbery as Reed Richards. Tasted as if it had been "cooked" in an old microwave.

This place is fun, but the food and service is a bit hit-or-miss. Sometimes it rates 5 stars; other times it's a 3. Still, it's a good bet if you are looking for fresh seafood on the pier and a funky, casual atmosphere. And I have to say that they do a great job with lobster - it is among the best I've had in a restaurant. I do love clam chowder, and sadly theirs is only so-so. If you like crab, it is a good bet. The view is lovely, and it's a nice spot to watch the sun set as you pull something tasty out of a shell.

I stumbled into Mr B's on a suggestion from a local friend.  I was traveling alone, and I prefer a place that serves dinner at the bar.

I went straight to the bar, where I realized what a nice place it is.  I was in shorts and T-shirt and surrounded people dressed up for dinner.  I was still welcomed and treated with a white table cloth at the bar.

This place is definitely pricier than some of the other dive bars around, but this is cuisine, not hot dog on a stick.  Turns out the BBQ shrimp I ordered is what they are known for.  

You should be warned, the shrimp have shell and head-on.  So this requires a bit of work, but it is worth it.  Tear the head off with your fork, and shell it like you are on the Bayou.  It is amazing, like tell my grandchildren about it amazing.  I was offered a bib to protect my t-shirt.  I declined, not wanting to lose a man point for wearing a bib, but I should have totally gone for it.

After I had finished the shrimp, I was left with amazing soupy goodness.  The waiter offered more fresh bread.  Sopping up the sauce, with perfectly crisp french bread was an amazing end to a perfect meal.

Had the place to myself.  Of course that's what happens when you eat a late lunch. Ordered the lamb gyro. It's more like a gyro salad. It was piled so high on the pita that there was no way to pick it up and eat it without making a terrible mess. But that was okay. It was a good mix of meat and lettuce onions n sauce. I really likes the sauce. It came with homemade chips on the side although not really enough but then again there wasn't really enough room on the plate! So I ordered extra chips. Service was good...how could it not be? I was the only one there. They should really get new plates. The ones they have are wooden and are showing ware. Will definitely come back again.

Found this little spot on an off night. Cozy place to grab a beer and sit by the fire. You could bring some board games and hang out in the great room. Small pub menu makes choosing some lite fare easy. If you like chess there is a large outdoor set that would be fun in spring or summer.

Caleco's is a unique little restaurant in the heart of downtown, full of classic bar paraphernalia and charm. Unfortunately, Caleco's has bought into a bit of its own fame, as evidenced by the prices of certain menu items. Overall, a good choice for classic St. Louis style bar food, but in my opinion, nothing to write home about. If you go, get the Spinach salad, it is quite tasty.

My family and I went to parlor for lunch and I have to say I have never had a problem with the service or food before. My dad ordered the half chicken entree which came out very undercooked to the point where it was bloody and blood was on the plate when he cut into it. It was sent back and no manager ever came out to apologize. It wasn't until we got the bill and noticed there was no adjustment and I asked to speak with the manager. It is also to be noted that we were the only people in the restaurant, so there was no excuse as to why anything would be undercooked. The manager then came out and said this was the first he had heard of the chicken being undercooked and it seemed as though he was blaming the young waitress as to why he didn't apologize. He then said that sometimes things like this happen, as if that is an appropriate response. He then said he was sorry and didn't even offer to adjust the bill. He said he would give us a free pizza, which would only be 12 dollars when the chicken was 23. My mom said she wanted the bill adjusted. He said he would see what he could do. He then came back and said that he "took most of the chicken off of the bill". He charged us a little less than half of the full price, which was still ridiculous. He should've taken the entire meal off of the bill since serving undercooked chicken is extremely dangerous. I will not return to this restaurant now that I've had this experience.

Another fun, funky, fantastic Tampa eatery made so much less desireable by being stuck in a shopping plaza! Don't let this deter you too much.

We enjoy Kelp's vibe and also their menu's unexpected twists. They have really fab veg options (which we enjoy even though we are not vegetarian) as well as interesting specialty roles. Our faves are the classics though, and Kelp does them well. Their simple salmon/avacado role makes a stop in worth it. Everytime we have been in the mgr/owner is also there which is impressive to me as it seems he is committed to growing and getting better which speaks volumes.

Typical "Irish" (again, I'm not sure what makes this place Irish - the name? but whatever) sports pub that includes:

- a menu where you're hard pressed to find something that ISN'T deep fried.  Artery clogging, brocoli bites, onion rings, chicken tenders and repeat. Just envision a kitchen that isn't a kitchen, but a room with multiple fryer stations and freezers.
- aloof, forced, unfriendly, repeatedly forgetful service both from waitstaff and bartenders.  
- A generic atmosphere and ambiance with lots of plasma TV's strewn everywhere and beige as far as the eye can see.
- Cheap domestic draft beers, if you're on a tight budget and don't mind drinking Miller Lite, their pitchers are $5!  You can't beat that deal anywhere.
- Crowd content varies, although I'd avoid this place during the weekend at all costs

Came in with a group when the restaurant was rather empty, the staff was not very helpful or accommodating - the bartenders would not spare any high chairs for our table nor did the restaurant have any extra chairs for a big top.  

Staff struck me as rude while no one really seemed to care or to try to solve the issue.   Our group was there for at least four or five hours during which no bartender or waitstaff cracked a smile.  At the end, I had a hard time mustering up energy to even give them a decent tip. (Uh, hello staff, you're in the SERVICE industry)

In all, a Blah-bar that's decent for cheap blah-drinking and watching a sports game or two while clogging your arteries with some fried fare.  The extra star is for affordability - the only aspect that saves this place.

Very nice hotel with multiple atriums that are beautiful day and night. Gondiola rides and colored fountain shows available. Bed and amenities were perfect. The only drawbacks were the price of all food within the atriums-outrageous and the whole area is huge and easy to get lost if you don't take time to figure it all out. They also provide bell hop type assistance with luggage and valet parking for a fee. Enjoyed it and would like to return, although would probably make other arrangements for food.

Such wonderful brunch! Though this place does get busy, I feel like it's a hidden gem because I never hear anyone talking about it. You definitely have to check this place out. You can find something fantastic on all menus but the Reuben Hash and Fried Green Tomatoes are my favorite. Cookie Dough Eggrolls are a must have as well! Such a great spot and worth checking out if you're traveling and looking to avoid the hype or long waits of the other popular places surrounding it.

I know you're probably wondering what I was doing at an Olive Garden, considering I live in one of the best food cities in the country.  When someone suggested we go here, I was hesitant.  The one and only time I had ever been here, I was 12 and I just remember hating it.  But, I figured my food tastes have probably changed in the last 16 years, so I thought I would have an open mind and give it another shot.

The food actually wasn't bad at all and it was super cheap, considering all you get.  With two entrees, you get a big bowl of salad (to share) and breadsticks.  That right there covers your appetizer.  I got the linguine with marinara sauce.  True, it's hard to screw that up, but I wasn't feeling adventurous enough to try one of their "stuffed" pastas.  I decided to play it safe.

This is one of those places that you know what you're getting when you go.  It's a chain.  The food is mass produced.  You don't go here for authentic Italian, you go here because you want some cheap eats for your and some friends.  

I probably wouldn't trip over myself to go back to this place, but I might go sooner than another 16 years.

Dinner here is delicious! It's definitely a dining experience, service is at a slower pace. Had the shrimp and grits, it was delicious, the grits were super buttery and the shrimps wrapped in bacon were cooked perfectly! Our group had the duck spring rolls and they were so good! Must try! Also had some of my fiancé's filet mignon and it was buttery and delicious with the truffle butter! Had a Moscow mule, pretty good, but not the best I've had, not served in a copper mug. Generous pours at the bar, they won't seat you until your entire party is there, dress nicely!

This place never disappoints!
I have had their regular burritos before, it was great size with good price. Finally had their breakfast burrito with chorizo, even better! Only $6.50 and it was huge! One of the highest price-quality ratio places in SB!
I love this little spot! The smoothies are really good especially banana its my fave. Also the hot cheeto elote and tosti-locos are good here. Plus they have good fresh cut fruit here for sale!

EXCELLENT!! Service, food, ambience.  A special thank you to our wait staff team:  Wade, Errol, and Toni.  I had a wonderful fish dish and my husband had the filet mignon - both were superb but the best dish was our shared appetizer of Pork Belly with fig jam....YIKES!!
The food is pretty good and I love eating in the restaurant. It's a fun environment. The parking lot it tough to maneuver, epspecially if it's busy.

I don't know if we were starving or what, but I had the best house salad and steak in my life.  And I know steak.  Don't waste your time with toasted ravioli or whatever others say. Order a filet and get it medium at most (otherwise you don't know how to eat a steak), but mid-rare is better.  This place was awesome.  Pricey but awesome.

Really good food and great atmosphere.  They even have a handy bell on the table.  Their menu is small but everything is really good!  I prefer smaller menus where everything on the menu is good.  Location is Ok but the service is good.  I've been here several times and will keep going back!  I can easily recommend this restaurant!

I used to grab breakfast every once in while when the restaurant was Jany's and run by a cute, older Greek couple. Always seemed a little slow, not quite put together. Since selling the business, they've had 2 new owners. I recently visited Cafe Victoria. The service is better. Still makes a great breakfast sandwich. They've set up square so you can pay for inexpensive orders with your credit card. I feel the average ratings are from when the business used to be Jany's.

Great little cafe. Had an omelet ( tasted just like home made) with hash browns. Really friendly servers. A lot of food, so ask to split the order. They are happy to do it. The wife and I will be coming back soon.

Horrible, horrible service. I took friends who were in town to this place because they'd heard about it and wanted to go. My last visit several years ago was terrible, but I wanted to make the friends happy, so we went.

As usual, terrible service and the place was sweltering! It was warm and when asked a few times if the air could be turned on, we were ignored. They did not refill drinks, the food was lukewarm, and it also took 10 minutes to get our drinks, and close to 30 minutes to get our food - which again was lukewarm!

There apparently was no manager to complain to and the server acted as if we were being a pain in the butt the entire time we were there. 

I do not plan on going back, no matter who asks me to take them. After we left, one of my friends said "I see why you wanted to take us to Cheeburger. I bet their service would have been loads better." Wow.

3.5/5 neighborly

so this is my neighborhood reginelli's, and i'd say whenever i've needed it (examples: late, drunk), it has been there. and yeah, the menu is standard. but you know, i'm still always slightly pleased when that fancy hummus spread comes out, i mean come on, pita triangles! 

so really, the thing that probably makes me a fan has been the service. it's pretty genuine for what it is. it's like, yeah, we know we're a pizza joint, so you're gonna get pizza joint service, but good pizza joint service. they've been chill when i've walked in with drinks from outside, have been accommodating when we've needed tables mashed together, knowledgeable and patient when our drunk butts are indecisive past 10pm, etc. etc. so for that alone, i'll gladly consume their specific carbs. and i'm generally happy with the one that has the capers on it, the calzones are oddly satisfying, and the vegetarian sandwich is pretty tasty as well!

like a good neighbor, reginelli's is probably within reasonable distance and will take your money in exchange for cheese and bread.

As of 10/14/2014 this location is closed.

Words To make this review long enough.

Im sure the service was awesome and so fast you would freak, but i guess i will never know.

Very good Mexican food. The nachos were a little salty, but we devoured them still. The mahi mahi tacos and the avocado tacos were amazing. I think I preferred the avo tacos over the fish. It was a rather long wait so we put our names in, grabbed a drink at another bar and checked out the famous wings on 11th street. Was very happy we didn't eat someplace else.

First time visiting Nashville and was told I needed to try this place. Upon arriving in this place, it had a beautiful ambiance. It wasn't busy so we got good service from the server, asked what burger they recommended and it was the Bison Burger. I thought it'd be gamey but not at all, very tender and full of flavor. Ordered it with fried jalapeños, made it totally worth every bite. I'd definetly recommend you try this place.

David and I stopped in for dinner on a Friday night.  We decided to do take away instead of eating at the restaurant.  The food was very good, we had a combination appetizer and the giro platter.  The giro was our favorite.  Portions are generous!  Go hungry!

Let me tell you how magical this "Korean soft tofu soup" is.

Before I discovered Jong Ka Jib Soft Tofu Restaurant I was mean-spirited, 85 lbs overweight, unemployed, major drug/alcohol problem, and I had a goiter on my neck the size of a donkey.  Women hated me.  All of them.

However when I took my first bite of "Korean soft tofu soup", my goiter shimmered and turned into a gold coin and I quickly began to shed the extra weight (and my drug/alcohol problem).  

Since then, I've gotten a job at WalMart!  And women wearing hoop earrings are basically like lining up out the door to have sex with me.

This soup is totally life-changing.  Year of the Dragon, baby!

Never stayed a night here, since it is quite far from downtown Nashville and is outrageously priced, about $200 and up/night, for supposedly mediocre room quality and service.  Parking is expensive, food is expensive, the tacky little knick-knacks are expensive. With Opry Mills still closed (honestly, people want to STAY next to a mall?), it stands out, along with the Grand Old Opry like a little island of tourism in a sea of nothing.  

So why did I rate this resort so highly?  Because sad as it is, this is a bonda fide tourist attraction in itself. The resort is the largest non-casino hotel complex in the world, and it has a very impressive internal environment replicating a rainforest. I have experienced the casinos of Las Vegas on multiple occasions, and this place rivals them in spectacle: a small river (complete with boat ride and waterfalls) runs through it, colored fountains dance, and a full forest of subtropicals is arrayed below a massive glass ceiling like a greenhouse for giants.  It is a great place to visit if you happen to be bored.  Park somewhere, walk in, experience the sites and sounds and people, then get your meals and sleep somewhere else.

Had a really wonderful dinner this evening. Learned this is Restaurant Week in New Orleans this week. Three course dinner for $35. Appetizers were bistro salad and Byster Crab. Entree was tuna and crab ravioli. Dessert was bread pudding (best we have ever had) and pecan pie alamode. 
Our server was extremely personable and added to a great experience. Can't wait to return.

Cesarina's is a great little place! Let me start out with the bread! It's delicious and they make it themselves! The sandwiches are phenomenal! I am never disappointed with my choice! I love the grilled chicken with balsamic vinegar, roasted red peppers, olive salad spread, and fresh mozzarella cheese! Whenever we are in town we stop on in for sandwiches! They have a great selection of olives, cheese( mozzarella is homemade) and sliced deli meats! They make all their food fresh. You can't go wrong with this place! The prices are very reasonable and he portion sizes are too! Our family just loves this place!

Really cool spot right at the end of the pier. We went for a little snack and ordered the whole crab. It didn't have much meat and was super small, but still fresh. The only thing we didn't like was they were having a crab special at the time with bigger ones than we got for less price and served with sides. The server didn't mention anything about it. Watch out if you sit on the patio... The seagulls will steal your food!! Lol

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. We went in not knowing what to expect. It was a weeknight and dinner time, but relatively dead inside. We ordered an app and a pizza. Both were excellent! The only downside is that we got a beer from the tap and it was a little on the expensive side for a crap draft. Other than that, we will be back!

Did brunch here and everything was amazing. Decor is awesome and cozy. We got the mushroom veggie burger and Thai chicken salad. Flavor was incredible on both. My only complaint is paying four dollars for a shot-glass sized amount of grapefruit juice, but otherwise everything was perfect!

Although a little pricey, I think the food quality offered is great.  I have not been around for the buffet, so my experience is limited.  Their dinner menu, however, is good filled with your typical curry and tandoori varieties.  I don't come here for anything new, but get my regular cravings satisfied.

I enjoyed the lamb curry.  The rice doesn't come with the food so you might want to order it as a side.  They are generous with it though.  I ordered medium and could still taste the spice so be careful with that.  The service was good and the food came out really quick.

The best shrimp I've ever had in my life!  They are bbq'd and bathed in a garlic butter creole sauce. Wow!  My mouth is watering just thinking about it!  The staff were awesome and friendly. Colleen was very helpful in recommending what to order. The bread was warm and delicious.  What a great way to start our New Orleans vacation.

Had nachos as an app-chips were mediocre and smothered in cheap cheese sauce and a black bean sauce of some sort, neither flavorful. Piled on top were what could pass for imitation peppers and tomatoes. 

Dinner- had the chicken and waffles. The "chicken" portion was compromised of quite possibly the cheapest mushrooms and pearl onions in some sort of wack Asian sauce, paired with waffles not so good. The waffles were good after I smothered then in butter. 

Of all the vegan/vegetarian places I've been to this is the worst.
AMAZING FOOD!  My friends travel from the city to meet me for lunch here bc they love it so much.
Very good ice cream, good service, nice place. Had a milkshake and it was a 9/10, not too thick not too thin, just right. Would reccomend

Holy tourist trap! But its really good ice cream. And its fun to stand in line with everyone like wheeeeee....If the line is out not out the door then you're doing it wrong. I recommend the blueberry cheesecake, love.

The sandwiches are topped with fresh ripe tomatoes, onion, dill relish, oil, hot pepper relish, spices. I like it with and with out the hot pepper relish, depends on my mood. This topping combination makes for the best sub I've had anywhere. Hot pepper relish is really hot if you dont like hot stuff and I would consider it in the medium range if you like hot food. The bread they use is outstanding.
  The inside is very clean and very dated it has looked the same probably since the year it opened 50 years ago. You come to Williams for a sandwich and if your a local its always a blast from the past. It always puts me in a good mood. The same ladies have been working the counter including the owner for as long as I can remember.
 Its CASH ONLY.
  I always get the Jumbo or Italian the way it normally comes with out hot pepper relish or I recommend  the Yum Yum Club for your first visit.
 Williams subs is right off of the Pinellas Trail so it's a great place to stop for lunch with out having go more than 20' from the bike trail.

How this place got 2 1/2 stars is beyond me. One of our party received half their order. There was no silverware because it was all in the "dishwasher". What?  We were here in the morning before a Titans game and noticed a huge line outside this place. Turns out it was for a different restaurant. Wish we were that smart. Stay away from here.

We frequented the restaurant a lot over the summer after we moved to the area. Very impressed and loved the outdoor seating. Bolongese pasta was my favorite. Pizza and apps were always great as well. Never had an issue with service.

Brought family this evening and did not have such a great experience. First off, bolongese pasta is off the menu. I asked the man who I couldn't figure out was a waiter or manager or what, as he kept coming over to the table as well as our waiter, why it was gone. I was told the new meatball dish was an "evolution" of the bolongese. Really? They also increased the price significantly from the bolongese. Skeptically, I order it. We also ordered other pizza, pasta and an app. 

Well, app is fine and the pizza that came out way before the pastas was ok. Bit too much topping. We strike out in two of three pastas when they arrive. One winner was the shrimp, the other two were red based sauces, meatball and scuie scuie. Both had no flavor. Meatballs were good but the sauce was just plain bland. My wife sent hers back and got a pizza instead which came out soggy. Waiter took it off the bill. My wife basically left hungry. Come to find out, the cook is new. Which explains the menu change. Evidently the bolongese removal was not popular with the waitstaff either. 

Experience kind of ruined the evening as it was supposed to be a nice family night out. The man that was not the waiter that took our comments tried to tell us the pizza was supposed to be floppy. Really could have done without with his attitude. It costs too much to eat out to have this type of experience. The place was not very crowded which was unusual given how busy it was during the summer. We won't be back unless we hear that something has changed to the positive. Really hope it does because whatever they were doing before was special.

So, yesterday I decided to go this restaurant that people have been mentioning about for a while now that it's good. I walk in through the door I get my table buy the waitress and first thing she does is walks off. I had to wait about 10-15 min for her to come back to my table so I can have water. As I was ordering my food the waitress I had walked away in the middle of me ordering and did not come back for another 5min to go talk to an employee. After all my sushi finally came to the table. Just so your aware the sushi here the size are very small. Not your average roll. If you have coupons for this place forget it useless because you can't use them at all there a caption on the menu. I personally will not go back to this location I'll go to origami sushi next time.

My boyfriend and I ate here the other day for lunch and we're pretty pleased with the service and food we received. I ordered the crab sandwich and my boyfriend got the lobster roll and we shared Oysters Rockefeller. My sandwich was fresh and tasted great. I also tried my boyfriend's lobster roll which was equally tasty. The oysters Rockefeller were large in size and so delicious! This place is very small so the wait to get in can be long but you can also order food to go at the window. Our server was friendly and the service was speedy! We sat at the bar and enjoyed watching all the food being cooked. This place is definitely worth checking out.

Great place for a classic breakfast. Eggs and hash browns were cooked just to our liking. Pancakes light and fluffy, and hash browns crispy. Bacon delicious, biscuits and gravy good too!  We will definitely return!

Four visits in three years.  I have always gone here specifically for their bacon bleu-cheese burgers with the waffle fries.

Great variety of beer, comfortable, dark/cool atmosphere, lots of seating, good enough covered parking garage, good location.

Every time I have been here, I have always gotten a seat. It's never been too crazy crowded, but then again, I have never been here for a ballgame.  Flat screen TV's everywhere, tons of beer on tap, great big booths that seat large parties..

And then there is the burger.
Grass fed, local farmer, never frozen, cooked on a grill, lots of toppings to choose from.
I've never eaten my burgers with a bun, so I can't comment on what they're served with. I get mine wrapped in lettuce, served with a fork and knife.  Lots of bacon, bleu cheese and juicy goodness.
Love the crunch of the waffle fries - and the portions are perfect for the American appetite!  salty, crunchy waffle fries!

If you're doing the "Finding The Best Burger In Nashville" thing,  by all means, give this burger a try.  It's good. Beer is good, too.

Loved the atmosphere, located in the Funk Zone. 
Packed house on a Tuesday night and rose on tap! My husband enjoyed an IPA, quick service at a very busy taproom.

So sad to see the restaurant leave the northwest side at their Foothills Mall location. It was not the most authentic Italian food in town but I had never had a bad meal there. I absolutely loved the seafood manicotti and many other dishes from the menu. It always tasted fresh and very homemade.

Plus, my husband and I got engaged there. Not the most romantic ambiance some might say but it was perfect for us. 

Good bye Gavi, you will be missed.

I came here because I wanted to introduce my vegan friend to a great restaurant instead of the opposite way for a change.
