I speed-read a few reviews for this place and convince my husband we need to go here ASAP. 

And like Audrey Horne, I get what I want.

I ordered the mushroom soft tofu (beo seot soon du bu) and my husband ordered spicy chicken & vegetable (dak gal bi). Both medium spice and both so freaking amazing. My soup is spicy, it's comforting, its downright perfect. It was exactly what I was looking for.

But before your food is ready, they bring out 5 different banchan: Kimchi, marinated bean sprouts, spicy cucumber slices, adzuki beans, burdock and jalapenos (I think) marinated in sesame oil and soy sauce? Not sure, but they were all tasty. But the best part is they bring you some weirdly awesome hot tea that I can't get enough of. I haven't figured out if it's Boricha (barley tea) or Hyeonmicha (rice tea). So weird and soooo good.

Preventing a few faux pas:
1) That egg they give you is raw, and it's meant to go in your soup.
2) The weird little box attached to your table? That's a call button for the staff.
3) Don't be dumb. That soup is boiling in there, so DON'T touch the caldron-bowl. Use the plate underneath.
4) Do you mix some of the pitcher of tea with your leftover crispy rice or not? I still haven't figured that one out.
5) This place is totally not for kids. Delicate wall hangings? Boiling hot stoneware? A call button on the table to play with? A raw egg just sitting there, waiting to be used as a weapon? Yeah. Not for kids, but perfect for us adults.

I love noodles so ramen is surely one of my favorites but this place was not a favorite. I ordered the Shio ramen and my friend ordered the Miso ramen, in both our opinions, they were both quite salty. It's flavorful don't get me wrong, but it was a tad too salty that made us extremely thirsty. I have  to mention what was being shown on the tv screens, it was animals that were wounded and it was pretty gross because that is not something I want to be watching while I'm eating. The workers there came out from the kitchen and was literally shouting across the room to one another, the atmosphere here was horrible. I don't think I will be returning here but it was nice to try.

I had a really good time here on a Wednesday night (which I guess is their open mic?).  I was really tired from attending a conference all day long but this place really lifted my spirits.  The musicians were great playing jazz covers of classic and contemporary hip hop and r & b songs.  No cover.  Decently priced drinks although the selection isn't too broad.  It's a really cozy place to get a few drinks and enjoy a few tunes.  I really felt like I was in the real New Orleans at this spot.

Hard to believe this jewel is in Tenn. Even harder to come by good Indian cuisine. This place had excellent food at Great prices. Butter chicken with garlic naan and raitha! Cannot go wrong. Will not disappoint.
Being a southerner, I was a bit disappointed there wasn't an actual Cajun cooking . However, the burgers are great and service was very friendly.

I love this place. The pho is good and they give you huge portions. The fried rice is yellow so thats wierd and the egg rolls are so so- there's something off about the dipping sauce. The spring rolls are good though. The owner is really friendly too. Check this place out its one of the better places in IV- if your in the mood for pho..
Great homecooking and great service.  Salad bar is awesome.    Lots of spcials and southern cooking. Went there for dinner
Absolutely loved this place! We were seated the moment we came through the door. Food was amazing! Service was super attentive! Will definitely be back for another great experience!
We only got the cookie dough but it surpassed my expectations. I definitely recommend this place, but during the day when it's not too crowded.

This place rocks. The food is top notch and their chefs are very enthusiastic and very entertaining. They put on quite a show. There were no shortage of laughs at our table. Their prices are pretty reasonable considering the show you get with your dinner. Portions are huge and always have food to take home. Their sauces don't quite compare to Arigatos but that's ok. Their restaurant is much trendier and roomier than Arigatos. Great atmosphere. I'll be going back.

The staff are wonderful! Yes, it's large, but there are staff everywhere willing to stop and help you find where you're looking for. There is plenty to do... Places to eat, shop, walk... Shuttles to downtown and the mall are FREE! I think it's the perfect place for conferences, families, and people who don't want to deal with the heat and humidity. I was amazed that with all the people staying at the hotel, I never had to wait more than 20 seconds for an elevator to our room! My husband and I had a wonderful experience here.

Located in what was once an old car factory, now a Furniture Mall for Interior Decorators.  The decor is somewhat amusing.  The ambiance was nice despite that someone had to bring their yowling babe (and at 9 PM!) The waiter was nice and sat us away from the squalling babe.  We ate Degustation, which is reasonable compared to many Prix Fix restaurants.  

I ate there with a friend who is a chef. The melon, cucumber and mint soup was a little bitter.  The corn soup was just right.  The pate was curiously bland, needing something.  The Salmon Tartare was good.  The Divers Scallops had a curious bitter under taste.  my friend believes that they were not fresh but had some preservative.  The steak frites was fine, a little bland.  The cheese plate was delicious and the desert was very good.  

Overall, the food was nothing to write home about.  The staff was friendly and polite.  The table of young ladies were a bit much with their cackling.  And is it too much to ask you keep your infants home with a sitter?

The best for sushi and non-business lovers. 
Food and service was just amazing!
I will definitely be back.

I was really surprised by this place. Is this the most amazeballs Chinese food that I have ever had? no. Is this incredibly delicious, fresh, and inexpensive take out with overly friendly service?  ABSOLUTELY.  Yes the building could use some updating, but so could my house.  The food doesn't disappoint and that's what matters.

I booked a room a couple of months ago. We arrived there today, travelling from NJ and were turned away because they were overbooked. The clerk at the front desk summoned a manager who apologize matter of factly, telling us that "upper management" regularly screwed things up.
She offered to get us a room in a downtown Radisson which we declined.
We have traveled quiet extensively and this has never happened before.
Very shabby way to treat people.
Book somewhere else.
Ate here for the first time the other day & the food was amazing. The outside booths are petty cool too. Reasonable prices and big portions. I'll definitely be back.

They over cooked my steak medium well when I ordered itmedium rare.  They offered to fix it but I don't like doing that for a variety of reasons.  They charged full price for my meal.  Not happy with this place
If you love chocolate cake you have got to try theirs. Incredibly delicious. That's all I'm going to say.
Absolutely delicious! Such a warm and engaging staff and flavorful food. Come here for AUTHENTIC cuisine with a gorgeous atmosphere. Lots of vegetarian options, too!
Went here for NYE. Great space and friendly, knowledgeable staff. The food was outstanding, especially the avocado toast and flash fried yellow tail. Will go back.

YES YES YES!!! I love this place and so do my meat eating friends! 

The staff is not nearly as pretentious as you may expect and the food is incredible. The menu is great. I have tried almost everything, and i have yet to be disappointed by the food. My favorite meal is the Rubusta sandwich with the almond salad. The tacos are fantastic as well. 

Dont skip dessert! The coffee is wonderful and the chocolate toffee is a must-try! 

My only complaint is that the restaurant does get very loud. They dont do much to cancel out any noise, so it sounds like there is about a dozen dinner parties happening in the same ballroom.

Bbq shrimp... large serving of really big shrimp in a too-die-for sauce. A bit messy- but they dress you for it- and oh, so delicious. I finished the sauce with a spoon once the shrimp were gone. Great creme brulee, as well. An excellent meal.

We travel to Carpinteria about twice a year. On the top of our to-do list is "eat at Siam Elephant." 

As vegetarians it's difficult to find excellent Thai food. Luckily for us Siam Elephant has our favorite dish. Well it's actually two dishes. 

Our favorite combo is the Pumpkin Curry with the Spicy Fried Rice. They are perfect together. We usually go with the normal Red Pumpkin Curry, but we decided to switch it up this time and changed out the Red for the Yellow Curry. It was still perfect. 

We also love their spring rolls and their Pad See Ew is perfect as well. Their service is always nice and polite and we always feel welcome even though they can tell we are from out of town. 

Just look for the wooden elephant.

5/2/12-was advised by a bartender that there are 3 must-do things in New Orleans-#1 go to MR  B's Bistro and have the BBQ shrimp,#2Have the char-grilled oysters at Drago's,#3 go to Frenchmen st. and listen to the music.Lunch-waiters impeccably dressed-BBq shrimp incredible-gumbo&gumbo ya-ya exceptional.1.50 bloody marys  really good.5/30&8/15-every bit as good as the first time.Our  first stop whenever we're tn town.
Great food, clean establishment, and quick service. The store has been turned around for sure. The manager Breanna is doing a great job.

I really want to give this 4 1/2 but yelp doesn't have that option but I just can't give it a 5.  Here's the deal.  My husband and I went for our anniversary.  When we arrived the host greeted, took our coats, and seated us immediately.  The server was attentive without being overbearing.  The manager (I'm assuming) made a few recommendations and checked on us to make sure his recommendations were satisfying to us.  The staff could not be beat.  

We ordered ravioli and steakhouse skins for appetizers.  I love that they let you order as many as you want.  We had 1 ravioli and 1 skin for each of us.  Perfect amount.  5 of each would have been way too many.  So if you want to try a few appetizers, you can certainly do so.  Then we each had the Caesar salad.  Excellent.  Homemade dressing that has the perfect tang.  The bread (obviously not made in the restaurant) was also excellent.  

Then came the steaks.  I would have liked a smaller cut of meat because 14 ounce is just too big for me.  But I do not like filet mignon, too thick for my taste.  So I had the 14 ounce strip.  My husband had the bone-in ribeye.  Fantastic.  Great flavor.  Seasoned perfectly so you could still taste the beef.  Carmine's doesn't just add sauce to their steaks to mask the sub-par cuts.  Mine was a little undercooked but the server saw it immediately when I cut into the steak and he took it back to the kitchen.  He offered to have my side dish replaced so it was hot when my steak came out.  I declined because I ate it while I waited for my steak.  Well worth the wait.

My husband had the twice baked potato and I had the mushroom risotto.  Believe the other reviewers when they say it's the size of a regulation football.  The potato is huge.  It tasted like cheesy bacon goodness.  If the mushroom risotto wasn't fantastic, I would have wanted to switch.  The risotto was top notch.  

Then to the dessert.  I ordered the vanilla caramel cake and my husband ordered the triple chocolate.  They were ok.  Mine tasted like it had been frozen a little too long.  That's the ONLY negative I can say about the entire meal.  I would not order the dessert again.  If you have to bring in frozen desserts, don't offer them at all.  Do your thing and do it well.  If you can't cover all aspects of it flawlessly, then don't do it.  

Our bill was $130 for the two of us.  That includes a few cocktails.  So it is a little on the expensive side but it was worth it.  When we stopped at the coat check to pick up our coats, I saw the valet take off running down the sidewalk.  By the time we had our coat and were walking outside, he had our car pulled up and ready.  The heat was on high, seats were warming, perfect.  Could not have asked for better service.  

The reviews where people complain about every aspect, they are whiners.  If you can't come up with anything positive about Carmine's, they are whiners that can not be satisfied.

First class all the way!!! Wandered in here on a sultry (4 below zero) evening and sat down at the bar. My Bartender Puck, took great care of me and was a total Pro!  
Made me a perfect Vieux Carre and then another "night cap" of his own design.  Chatted me up the whole time and made me feel right at home.

DO NOT go to Indy without hitting this spot.....I won't!

Blue Sage has been a restaurant I have consistently frequented for the past 15 years, but stopped visiting as much the last couple of years due to disappointment in the food/smaller portion sizes. However, I have had two wonderful meals here over the last six months and now feel that Blue Sage has once again hit its stride. The portions are good and the food is inventive and delicious. As a vegan with Celiac, I also appreciate the wide range of gluten-free and gluten-free upon request items. My faves: Fresco Salad, Buddha tacos, Carnival, and anything with the Korean cauliflower.

Solid 4 stars. Food that goes a bit beyond gastropub, but with moderate prices.  Can def order apps and sides and build a meal, this has worked well at a lot of Stephen Starr restaurants and allows multiple visits at different price levels-I like.  Big open front room with windows everywhere, nice side dining area as well.  
   Loved:  corn soup--big portion--had texture, several flavors, garlic croutons, yum!
   fries--perfection, best I've had in awhile, comes w. sirracha ketchup
   pasta w. sharp provolone and stewed tomatoes, had a lot of spice (rosemary??) in  
   tomatoes, plays like a mac and cheese w. tomatoes on the side--I'll get this 
   again. 
   burger--can get as single or double, good size for price, highly recommend
   maple cream pie for dessert--amazing

Wasn't excited w. the homemade potato chips, might be amazing just out of the fryer, were ok. 
Not a fan of the checked outfits worn by wait staff, they add weight to the persons body--visually and kind of make the staff look like they don't have good fashion sense.  

Next time will go a bit deeper into the menu and try some entrees. 

Spent $37 before tip, had corn soup, burger, w. chips as side, split pasta as side, split maple pie, had one drink.  Was quite full (am 6'5", 235). 

Staff was excellent across the board.

I've been going to Williams for 20 years and I think the subs are great, that's why I was so disappointed with the hygiene today. I only get to stop in every few months when I'm working around there. Today this young woman was making subs and she has decided to grow her hair into dreadlocks. I couldn't care less about her hair style but with this particular style it involves months of not washing hair with soap and causes lots of breakage, I could see the broken hairs all over the shoulders of her shirt, she was leaning over the deli station and all I could think was how is nobody making her wear a hair net, GROSS !!!  Do what you want with your reggae hair but put a hair net on for crying out loud !

As soon as I walked in, I was offered help. After explaining what I needed, the guy working got what we needed and made suggestions on other products we may like. It's nice to see a business that has helpful, happy, knowledgeable employees.
Great food! I paid $9 for a boil and it was huge. The old atmosphere was great and makes for a great service! The hostess was extremely nice and attentive

Loved this place!! I got the Verduras and they were so flavorful. My boyfriend got the Robusto and he enjoyed that as well. We shared a Hazlenut Toffee Basket and it was very rich, but delicious. I would highly recommend coming it. Also, it looks huge inside and you would never guess from the outside.

Out of all the eateries on the wharf this place is it. The restaurant has a a "salty" look with an incredibly awesome staff. Every time I fly in or out of Santa Barbara I make sure to stop in for food and drinks. They have a great selection of beer on tap and the sea food is great. But what really keeps me coming back for more are the Vodka Oyster shooters, this shot is the bomb!!!

What we ordered was good. The menu was limited with regards to fresh seafood. The catch of the day was Chilean Sea Bass. Best I know that sure isn't local. He food 
Took for ever to get to our table. Not really worth the money.

Been to Mr. B's several times over the past couple of years.  The BBQ shrimp have been consistently fantastic.  My buddy said the shrimp and grits he had might have been even better.  Bread pudding very also very good.  One person in our party said the fish special was just average.  Also thought the service was excellent.

Nothing struck me as particularly outstanding here, but neither was anything particularly poor. I enjoyed their fine selection of craft beers and drafts, though many bars can match or exceed that. The food was mostly adequate, which is perfectly fine. I would describe this place as solid and reliable. The world needs more bars that will rarely disappoint, even if they never amaze.
One of my top sushi houses to go to. They have a vast variety, great quality and the ambience is nice

I tried this place based on the yelp reviews, and was underwhelmed by the experience. By no means horrible, it was a rather rote, predicable and very mediocre to decent american style Chinese take out. The service was very pleasant and the restaurant itself is kept very clean, but the food itself lacks any distinctive flavors or presentation, relying more on tried and true simple dishes not unlike you've probably had a hundred times before. Not bad in a pinch but not something I would seek out otherwise.

For days I have tried to put a side the terrible experience I had, I really don't like to put a bad review, but most of all I deeply appreciate when businesses treat everyone with respect and priority, and for some reason and actually for no reason.
I walked in and noticed I have to go to the bar for service, there were no available seats, so I stood at the beginning of the bar from the entrance, made an eye contact with the bar tender, 5 min passed he still didn't come to me so I looked over for a menu and grabbed it myself, shortly after he reached to me and took my order of drinks and food... 10 min passed and he didn't prepare my drinks, he left the bar area, and another guy came to replace him, he asked us if we needed help, I told him we already ordered, mean while I'm waiting and waiting and I see our server went to take out food for people, totally forgot about us, he could have at least tell the other two guys who were at the bar ( one of them was the owner) to make us the drink...
Then the owner came to me and he told me I should have told the guy that replaced him to make me the drinks, i told him how could I know it works that way?
And instead of trying to make excuses for why I don't have my drinks and blaming me for it, he obviously didn't care for what u had to say but I tried explain him how long I've been waiting and that I should have been taken care off and that he's been very rude for trying to excuse the situation instead of handling It property...
End of story, He got mad he said I'm the owner and that I'm not going to talk to him that way and he walked away from me!


So to sum it all up, I waited a while until I was served, the tender argued with me that chocolate always has milk inside ( just a lack of knowledge) the owner saw us waiting and waiting , looked at us while serving others, and than he got the nerve to be mad at me for being upset....!!!!

I first have to say that the service at this place is incredible. It's also a great location with an excellent environment. 

I had the seafood gumbo as an appetizer, the fillet as my entree, and bread pudding for desert. 

The seafood gumbo was terrible, incredibly over seasoned. It overpowered every taste within the gumbo. 

The fillet was ok. Keep in mind this is a $52 dollar dish. Ok doesn't cut it, especially when the best steak in New Orleans, located at Clancy's, is $10 less. 

The bread pudding was also not good. Bread was really chewy and tasted like wet bread. Again, at the price point, it should be better. Boucherie has the best bread pudding in New Orleans, and once again it's cheaper than here. 

I'd suggest to go inside, have a drink at the bar, but eat somewhere else. If you eat here, you'll overspend and leave hungry.

I had the luxury of being able to experience both pre-game drinking and so-called late-night dancing at Brew Brothers. Situated conveniently at the Eldorado, it's a hard to miss spot, especially with the drought of reasonably festive hangouts in Reno. The place has an "outdoor" patio, where one could enjoy the sights of BBQ rib stuffed folks passing by. The evening started with a sampling of beer, which was of course, brewed in-house. Beer prices were fairly reasonable; the first round of 5 tall beers set me back $22. Check out the Redhed Amber Ale and the Double Down Stout. As soon as the staff started clearing out the tables, we knew that music and dancing was eminent. The live band was a plus, switching between them and what seemed like a preset MP3 playlist. You can't go wrong with a musical mash-up between Bon Jovi, Deadmau5, and the Luniz. The crowd was a good mix, but with most places these days, skewed significantly as the hours passed. 

If you're itching to win the hearts of some ladies, you can do this by getting a stamp at the door, make your way to Circus Circus, win a few furry friends, and bring them along and back to the Brew Brothers dancefloor.

First time trying after going to my usual breakfast place and then being out of bagels, coming here and trying it. I have no words for how good this place is. Amazing is the word to describe it, small place but definitely worth the wait, absolutely amazing. Must try the Oreo pancakes

I'm not sure which type of tour the bulk of these yelpers went on but the free tour is disappointing.

The brief visit to the stables is by far and away the best part. The rest of the tour was standard brewery tour garbage.  Brief history of the brewery, a sample of Bud or Bud light, upselling the birch chips to make the water beer seem better. I wish they would do something more about the history of the buildings. If they did that it would be a much better experience.

I would have given the tour 1 star except they were patient with me sampling the tappers at the end.  I settled on the Goose Island saison and it was delicious.  The bartender told me the staff drinks that over Bud so that should tell you something about the beer!

Where can you get a better free tour you ask? Come to Milwaukee and Miller will hook you up. From the history video, to the caves, to the building histories, to 3-4 free samples the Miller tour is a much slicker and informative free tour. I think Bud could stand to send its employees on it to get an idea how to improve its own game!

Good place to get a drink over the weekend! They had a good selection of beers and wine. Also on the weekends they have a live band playing on the second floor if you love live bands. The bar on the second floor gets a bit crowded because of the band but go to the bar in the first floor for quicker service. They have a second room on the second floor where you can find easy seating and play shuffleboard.

I think this place has the most rude staff I've ever experienced starting with the bouncer with the dirty dreadlocks who just said "no" as we went to walk in.  After being seated we were ignored by the waitress Rachel for a good twenty minutes before I decided to go up to the bar only to stand there for ten minutes being ignored by the bar tender as he chatted up some girls.  30 minutes without being served so we left.  Awful staff
We order for carry out often(once a week). Food is overall great. Gyros are not consistent. Sometimes they are awesome and other times just average. Chicken kabobs were nothing special for the price.
Great donuts and always fresh. My co-workers love them whenever I bring a dozen in for them plus the staff is super friendly!
Cozy, comfortable cocktail bar in downtown Indy!  Cool decor, friendly staff and extensive cocktail list.
Excellent dim-sum but better get there early. Often sold out.

This is one of favorites in Kirkwood. My go to happy hour (all night btw), date night, or book club with the girls! The service, drinks and food NEVER disappoint. The pours are very generous. I hesitate to even tell you how awesome it is because I don't want it too get too popular! ;)
The wait was long but totally worth it. Seafood extremely fresh and nicely cooked to perfection. Tip on getting seated faster: be flexible about sitting inside or outside.

We were greeted by a very pretty waitress that made us feel like we had chosen the right place. We were then turned over to a nice gentleman that took our orders with a polite smile. We are vegetarians and there were lots of options. We settled for the salsa and house made avocado sauce with corn chips  and we split their famous black star black bean burger... Yesss!! The food presentation was that of fine dining and the food was very pleasing to our pallets. 
We give The Bricks 4 stars and would recommend to anyone who plans to visit Tampa

I don't really care for any Bud products.  In fact, I really hate a lot of them.  But this tour is good clean fun.  And free.  

I've been on the tour several times, and if you want an idea of what your tour will be like, know this: among your tour companions will be at least one mulleted fellow in jean shorts.  Remember that he's a pilgrim and this is his Mecca, so be nice to him.  Here are a few of the observations and comments he'll make when the tour is on:

"Who's ready to get this party started?" - in the gift shop before the tour has started.  

"Take me 'bout a week to go through one of those!" - on the size of the massive fermentation tanks.  

"Tastes alright to me!" - on the car trunk skunked beer they have a few persons sample.  Mullet jort man will always volunteer to be one of the taste testers.  Always.  

"Let's go get some fuckin wings." - after he's finished his free samples.  

Enjoy the tour, and enjoy your time with mullet jorts.  He'll glow like a bride on her wedding day.

We absolutely loved the service, food, and atmosphere. We were seated in a cozy corner table where we could view the entire restaurant and could view the outside sites from two corner windows. We were in New Orleans for an anniversary get away. A friend suggested the restaurant and we were very pleased with our experience. We had the fried green tomatoes, gumbo ya-ya, red fish, short rib, blonde brownie, and pecan pie. The food was excellent.  I could have eaten twice the short rib. It was so very tender and juicy. The house Pinot Noir was very tasty as well. I highly recommend Mr. B's for a nice night on the town.

skrimp n gritz....nuff' said.
oh les not forget over-the-top friendly, accommodating staff.

I'm surprised this wasn't listed yet - it's certainly well known in the area. The smoking trucks are parked along 301, and you do a double-take because there's nothing but a large Sunoco gas station ... yes, the BBQ counter is INSIDE the gas station. 

I know, I know, super classy. But the BBQ is very good. The portions are generous, the prices are very reasonable, and the flavor is very good. I'm always pleasantly surprised when there's miniscule charcoal bits in the char on the ribs instead of just liquid smoke flavor. I'm so tired of liquid smoke flavor.

It's closed on mondays and tuesdays right now. The owner seems to run the whole thing himself, and is apparently a Jamaican guy, but the BBQ seems pretty traditional. It's really excellent, and worth the trip. Bring some people, and tell them that you're taking them somewhere really nice... then pull into this gas station. :)

This place is a DELIGHTFUL surprise near the beaches of Madeira. 
When you think the beach, one would normally come to dine on seafood, but we came to find this special moroccan restaurant that followed up with thirst quenching martinis, a warm bread basket that we asked seconds for, and two great entrees that included RACK OF LAMB, and a SEAFOOD CREPE. 

I would urge anyone to go for the rack of lamb. It was by the far the best and yet delicate savory meat I've ever had the courtesy to dine upon.
And not to mention, that our waiter, whom I believe his name was Ali, was the most amazing waiter that we had experienced during our entire stay in Florida.

This place is great for a late meal, when the lights are dim and just looking for a little sexy for your Moroccan inspired meals.

Thank you The Pearl. You have been more than generous to us. 

See you next year.

The food here was amazing. This restaurant is a little pricey, and there is always a wait (although they told us 30 minutes, it was only 20), but everything we tried was excellent. 

Primarily we ate several appetizers - it made for a good family style experience. Biggest recommendations: sea scallops, pork belly & fig, Gumbo Ya-ya (though it is a small portion for the price). From the entree menu, try the pork chop. I used to generally dislike pork chops, but this was tender and the honey-ginger glaze very flavorful.

I live in West Philly and don't have easy access to good grocery stores. The stores here are also either very dirty, or crowded, or expensive, or all three, so I'm always looking for something else sort of nearby that just needs to be decent.

I stumbled upon this Pathmark and decided to go in and grab some apples. I was very impressed and decided to do all my shopping there that day. 

This place is clean, not crowded, produce OK, lighting good, and no long wait in the checkout line. Staff was also friendly.

A little out of my way, but for me definitely worth making the trip.
Stopped by this place for a drink last night and I was pleasantly surprised. I had a Cool Kat and it was delicious! Long drink menu as well!

I've been here 3 times and haven't had a bad meal yet.I don't get the bad reviews.I thought the food and service were very good.Carne asada tacos with beans rice were excellent. So are there shredded pork tacos.Beans and rice are typical Mexican fare in this area.And my table was clean.I think some people just like to bitch no matter what.Order a big Margarita eat some chips and salsa and enjoy life.The Pico is great and so was the guacamole.

First off- they have turkey scrapple...I didn't know that even existed and it was awesome. 

The place is really clean and the staff are very nice. I had a chicken sandwich and it was really juicy and flavorful. I had hashbrowns instead of fries and that was a great decision. They were crispy with onions and peppers, the way they should be at a good diner. My boyfriend had the Western omelet and based on the clean plate, I'm thinking he liked it. 

I wish this was a little closer to walk to from work, but I'll take a ride over here whenever I have my car.

I love New Orleans version of BBQ Shrimp, so I came here specifically for that since the reviews I've read pointed me here.  The only time I could fit it into my schedule was for lunch, which worked out great since it was on both lunch and dinner menus.  Had a nice $1.50 Bloody Mary as a lunch special too.  Small, but good!
 
I started off with the Gumbo Ya Ya which was very flavorful and had a nice spiciness to it.  Some other places don't have that kick I like in a gumbo.  It's just enough to let you know it's there!  My favorite of the trip (out of 3 places).  My wife ordered the Veal Milanese which was super tender and had a nice crust on it.  Very flavorful as well as we always try each other's food.  

After the waiter put on my bib, I was able to get to the main event.  The Barbecue Shrimp were delicious.  They were a little slippery to get the heads and shells off (yes, they're shell on), but using two hands got the job done.  Had to dip the shrimp in the sauce after peeling, and my hands were getting messy.  The bread in the sauce is also quite delicious.  I preferred the bread they brought before the meal in the juices over the softer bread they brought with the meal.
 
As I was finishing, they brought over a hot, wet towel with lemons so I could clean myself up.  That was a nice touch that I wasn't expecting.  My wife ordered the Pecan Pie for dessert and it was also pretty tasty.  The inside was dark and sweet and the pecans had a nice soft crunch.  Another good dessert!
 
The service was good as well as the gentlemen tending to our table were always nearby if we needed anything.  It's not far from Bourbon St. and I recommend stopping in if your willing to rip apart shrimp to eat them.  If I had one request, it would be to have an option of getting shrimp already shelled (tail on is fine).  Would be much cleaner to eat!

First time visitor to M.L. Rose and the NASHVEGAS burger is by far my favorite burger in the greater Nashville area- and I have made it my mission to try as many of them as possible. This might even be my favorite burger EVER. It is pimento cheesy- plus crispy onions- perfectly cooked- awesome sauce. FLAWLESS. I will be back again and again. Extra points for the extensive craft beer menu.
Omg found a Latin bakery worth a trip and price quesitos omg it's been almost 6 years since I had one with a Cuban sandwich for breakfast

Nice spot near Jacques-Imo's to wait for a table.  I can't speak to their food as we only sat at the bar for a few drinks while we waited for our table next door.

Friendly bartenders with a decent beer list!

This restaurant is at the end of the wharf. Indoor seating is dark and cramped, so we opted to sit outside. Despite the evening chill, the heat lamps kept us nice and toasty. The waitress knew what she was talking about and made excellent suggestions. We ordered the rock crab and maine lobster, which each came with a large Caesar salad and clam chowder. The chowder was delicious and aromatic, with a decent proportion of clams to potatoes. We had one and a half rock crab -- my husband had the half, and I started on the whole. Unfortunately, the whole crab was not only more difficult to crack, but after all that work it was flavorless. My husband says the half was much better, but my experience with the other crab was disappointing. The lobster claw was great though, very tasty with butter. The raisin slaw was delicious as well, and the onion rings were a nice addition.

We had a great view of the water and saw some magnificent pelicans up close. A boat full of loud, rowdy, happy, drunk people passed by twice and whooped and hollered, which made us laugh.

We spent some time here Saturday night after dinner because my sister and her husband were staying at The Cheshire.  Had a nice evening visiting with the bartender and each other while listening to live jazz.  My bf and bro-in-law enjoyed yards of beer and I opted for some of their specialty cocktails named after books.  The Milk Plus from clockwork orange was tasty and they make a yummy Cosmo too.  Very pleasant time.

After hearing all about the Grand Ole Opry, I thought I would have an idea of what to expect, and boy was I wrong. This place took my breathe away. Between the beautiful scenery, the friendly staff, and the overall atmosphere of the entire place was the perfect choice for a weekend getaway. 

Like others have said, this is what makes Country music famous. There is just so much to do here, you will not get bored. Plus it's great for all ages, I saw older folks, as well as many young children. 

The only downfall I would bring up would be the setup of the whole place. It's really easy to get lost. The building is confusing, but there are maps all over the place and people are helping each other all over the place. So be patient! 

I would highly recommend staying at the Opry if you are looking for a great vacation. They had really great packages to choose from too, so I think you will get your money's worth. Plus, now I can appreciate country music on a whole new level!

I think my expectations might have been a little too high. From everything I had read or heard about the Opryland resort, I was set on a week of awesome amenities and plenty of relaxation and pampering. However, I was met by fairly unhelpful signage (it will tell you to take elevator "R1" to access the pool area from the spa, but not actually how to find the spa), rooms keys that were continuously deactivated (causing many 0.5 mile hikes up and down stairs and over bridges to get to the front desk and back), and amenities that were open...sporadically (I know, I know. The first week in November is probably not peak season. Tell that to my $300/night rate.). It's a great place to visit once, but I don't think I'll be back!

My husband eloquently described our stay this way: "it's a beautiful place. Not sure what all the hype is about though."

To give a couple of examples of what I consider to be sub-par service for a place so obviously vying for an upper class clientele:
-Waiters/Waitresses not saying anything after you are seated, just standing and assuming you will speak first to give a drink order
-Restaurant staff placing the bread basket in front of just one seat (instead of mid-table) and not describing the contents
-Sparkling wine, ordered by the bottle, not being chilled at the table and having to refill glasses on our own
-Having to pay for parking with a credit card, because the room key wouldn't work to allow us out of the self parking lot, and the gate employee coming over to tell us that is what we had to do if our key didn't work (it's not...more inquiries at the front desk led to the discovery that we would have been double-charged for parking that day had we not inquired further)
-Restaurants being closed with a generic sign asking us to visit another option (without stating what or where those options were)
-Restaurants and shops closing at 8pm. Acceptable on a weekday. Completely unacceptable for what is sold as an "inclusive" resort on a Saturday night.

Maybe my stay was out of the ordinary.  Maybe.

You can't really be give a bad rating to a place that greets you when you walk in the door, allows you to sample anything you want (as much as you want also), and only requires you to build your dream sundae. I mean, maybe if you don't like fuzzy little puppies or finding money on the ground, then yea...maybe you may not like it.

I really wanted to like this place. Great service by Fay couldn't save this place from leaving us with a sour taste. Here's the problem: It's dark, nothing unique about it, food was good, but not worth the price and the wines? Oh yeah, that's why we came - overpriced and a small selection to choose from. 

Maybe because I knew it was a chain and the Gulch is SO not a chain destination (except of course Urban Outfitters, Laredo Cantina, Urban Flats)...oh wait...are the chains outnumbering the locally owned, locally brewed destinations? How sad if so true. 

Seriously, if the leased spaces weren't so large, maybe small "mom & Pops" could compete. Then again, it all comes down to the developers' vision and how quick they need to deliver to their investors...

Wait, back to the Wine Loft. You need someone to go in and shuffle the furniture, revamp the menu and then, and only then, you might make it. (By the way, do you really expect people to eat sitting on low sofas with their chins resting (in some settings) on the table tops???)

Came in for lunch.  
Got the BBQ Shrimp recommended by my boss back home.

This dish is now moving to my list of last meal on earth choices.

I have had lots of versions of whole shrimp in broth with french bread.
Southern CA has several restaurants that specialize in it.  
But this one blew the others out of the water.
The best, hands down, ever.

Hook me up to an IV drip with that broth, heaven.

This dish is not to be missed.  It will be a must have for me from now on.
Already trying to plan a way back to NOLA just for Mr B's BBQ Shrimp.
Do you guys FedEx?

This place speaks comfy and satisfying.
Great portions and service is wondeful. We got here for brunch and we're not disappointed.
Not the biggest fan.  The filet was a bit fatty which was pretty disappointing considering the price.  Overall the experience and service were great, just wish I had gotten a different cut of beef.

Had the grilled shrimp appetizer to start and we didn't finish the three of them, they were over cooked and did not have good flavor.  Got a tomato appetizer plate the was supposed to have a Cajun flair to it, wasn't anything special. They brought bread to the table in a paper bag and it tasted like something the local grocery store would sell. I got the pork chop and it was on the dry side.  My wife got the filet mignon and it was cooked and seasoned well.although the evening only cost $100 I would not recommend this place.  One more note and it still bothers me days later.  There was like piece of paper from maybe a straw would come from on the floor close to where we were seated and numerous times the waiters and the bus persons would walk over it and not pick it up. Really bothered me. I didn't expect such from a "classy" place

The Lobster Bisque is to die for! I always get the Crab Sandwich and I'm never disappointed. 

There tends to be a long wait so get here early.
The staff is super friendly and the selection is great! The walk in is full of fresh IPAs and special releases! Sad we missed Lama, get there early if you want to meet the dog!

Hugely inconvenienced w/ having to come back 3 times to get these letters ordered 2 days ago (and owner fully aware and involved in my service but didn't seem to have any regard for my time/trouble). Also, the N unfortunately isn't as lucky as the M.  All the other letters match in size/shape. I ordered them individually wrapped, but said I'd do myself since they weren't done.  $25.25 for 14.25 oz of chocolate letters that caused a lot of frustration on my part.
Great simple breakfast place - really good value and friendly service!  I'm really happy to find a place like this in the neighborhood - no overpriced hipster food here!

It's ok....not real tacos...but tasty.  And they deserve credit for doing something other places would never think of.  But...when I went they were flour tortillas....sorry man, but that's like putting stewed tomatoes in gumbo....sure people like that who are not from Lousiana...but it's the same principal here for REAL tacos and ones that are tasty version of the real thing.   don't mess with a sacred culinary staple.  I know...it's the gringo'ed version of how to eat tacos...just like the yankee version of gumbo  is to throw tons of tomatoes in like you making some kind of stew.  See my point?   If you've ever had REAL tacos at a stand in Mexico or Central America these are 2 stars in comparison. In fact these are not as good as the truck that comes by the former Home Depot on Carrolton.   I give Pals three stars here because they are the only people trying this in a non-Latin themed setting.  and they are tasty...but obviously people have never had the real thing.  5 stars really?  lol

The food is absolutely amazing! Service is good, the prices are very reasonable, and they have a really awesome lunch special! I eat here multiple times a month! Also they deliver! The only reason I had to give them a 4 star is because they have messed up my delivery plenty of times- and they ALWAYS forget to put silverware in bag when delivering food.
The service was slow and it felt like we were an afterthought.  And the food was just okay. Renown for their barbecue shrimp - it was just okay. HOWEVER, their desserts were yummy.

It's internationally known that legit deli comes in three flavors: Italian, Jewish and Polish. For some reason Jews don't do deli down here. I heard of a Polish joint but I think that's urban legend. But there is this place... fast paced Italian deli done right. 

They bake their own bread, make their own sausage, cook their own roast beef... you get the idea. The sandwiches are really good, try the Italian. The calzone they make is more like stromboli and it's awesome. 

I saw that someone gave them 1 star for a crumby chicken parm sammich. Do yourself a favor - give them another chance. I know you've been hurt before but Cecarina's is really sorry and wants to make it up to you. Don't give up on love so easily.

This might be my first five star rating. This place was absolutely awesome and I cannot wait until I go back for a second time. Our sever, Millie, was friendly and efficient from the moment we sat down. The atmosphere of the place was unique, and the food was among the most unique in Tampa that I have experienced in years. I got the pork tacos for an appetizer and the "bird and pig" for lunch. The sandwich was so good I could have ordered it again. Overall it was a fantastic experience and I will be returning for their drink specials.

Once again in my quest to satiate my appetite I find myself literally in the middle of nowhere eating some of the most delicious soon du bu in recent memory. Not that my experience with this deliciously hearty tofu soup is worth mentioning but it's very tasty here!! Accompanying the soups are a slew of comdiments ranging from kim chee to bean sprouts- pickled vegetables never tasted so good..Spiciness level can be adjusted from wimp to bad ass (I was on the wimpy side and found it perfectly spiced). Sevice was the only thing that left much to be desired for. I'm guessing they had no idea what I was saying, but multiple requests for water were unheard or ignored... At any rate if you find yourself meandering even remotely close to 66th ave- head on by!!!

To start, I'm definitely not a vegetarian but have an appreciation for all types of foods. I didn't miss the meat at all! The nachos are phenomenal and highly recommended! Make sure to share the nachos because the portion is huge. I also like the tacos. love that this place is close by!

I went to Jackson's on Monday night around 7pm with a group of coworkers. I was excited to try the place based on recommendations from others. I ordered the BBQ meatloaf which came highly recommended from the waitress. It was just decent......nothing to rant and rave about. I ordered my wife a bacon cheeseburger and fries to go as I left. I requested it be cooked "medium", I got home and it was clearly well done and had no seasoning whatsoever. Her fries looked good, yet were hard and overcooked also. This place did not live up to the hype. I may try visiting during the daytime to see if that changes anything.

They are awesome. Love the Pad Thai. Very friendly staff, low prices and great service. My only regret is they are not closer to my home so I could eat there more often. I have only found two places in Tampa / Brandon that make really GOOD Pad Thai. This is one of them! The spring rolls are to die for. If you go you won't regret it.

I was super impressed with how friendly and attentive service was during my most recent visit. The food is still as good as I remembered it to be. We tried something new this time - the spicy marinated chicken with veggies. It was a stew like dish made with bone-in dark meat chicken, potatoes, peppers, onions, and carrots. Honestly when I saw it on the menu, it did not appeal to me. I'm so glad my boyfriend ordered it because it was soo good! I also love that I can bring my vegan friends here - there are plenty of vegan/vegetarian options. This is definitely my favorite Korean restaurant in Philly.

What can I say that has not been said already... This place is a must visit for the BBQ shrimp... My wife and I had super high expectations and I was worried about a let down BUT boy was I blown away. It is amazing!!!

Pecan pie is a great way to finish off the amazing meal.

Kids had already eaten a burrito before we arrived at Mr Bs but they really enjoyed their dessert (simple vanilla ice cream with a wafer). They still remember this as the best meal of the trip.

And a good selection of Port wine if you like that sort of stuff.

The two guys that own this place are genuinely good people.  Always helpful, knowledgeable and honest about what they have.  
The selection is good.  You won't find the prices quite as cheap as a Produce Junction but you also won't stand in line for 25 mins.  The dollar table has helped the wife and I put together many last minute meals with baskets of onions, peppers and the like.

I think what makes this place shine is that the grocery store produce is always insanely expensive (3.99 for Honeycrisp Apples?) That was at both Whole Foods and Shoprite while her they were $1.49-2.49 depending on season.  They supply a lot of the restaurants in the area as well which is a great testament to the quality of their offerings and relationships with their customers.

Ship here confidently.   It's cleaner and much more fresh than Plymouth Produce.

Super steak burrito is great!

Service at this location is lacking, but okay. They do have good drink specials most days.

I am in soft tofu heaven.

Every Yelper who adores this place is now joined by me ... am a total FAN.

Been waiting to go here and was deterred by snow storms on 2 occasions!

Went with dear friends and 2 of us had the soondubu jiigae with oyster ... this was a foodie's steamy, creamy, spicy and bubbly mini hot tub of utter savory deliciousness.  Pair that with the rice in the stoneware that is so hot that it begins to crisp on the sides and then you let that bathe in the soondubu ... ahhhhh.

Service is fast and the food comes out quickly too.  

The little banchan dishes were a wonderful start as well.

Will absolutely be back here !!!!

I just had my first experience at Moose Men's Lounge and it was awesome!  Right when you walk in you know it's a place for men.  There is a whole lounge area that has multiple flat screens all showing sports and you're offered Whiskey or Beer right away.  They had a great selection of bottle beer to choose from and on Saturdays they even have a Bloody Mary bar.  There are also cigars available to purchase.  Besides the awesome atmosphere, the haircut was outstanding.  April was my stylist and she did a wonderful job.  The haircut includes a full shampoo and head massage, complete with a hot towel treatment.  There is also a neck shave at the end.  The entire experience was relaxing and the haircut was great.  I'll definitely go back and I recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a quality haircut and overall great experience!

This is a cool spot, just down the street from the stadium. I came for breakfast even though it didn't pop up in the breakfast search. They have a really nice breakfast menu and the house coffee was actually pretty darn good. I'll come back for sure.
Nice place to eat. The food was good (the wings and ribs were perfect!) and atmosphere really comfortable.

My cousin and I were in town for UFC 101 and while we were sightseeing on South Street we came across this bar. All I can say was the food is bomb, the atmosphere was awesome and the drinks were not too expensive. Coming from California, we know what an expensive bar is. This is definitely a bar I wish was in my neighborhood. I know the next time I come back to Philly, I will definitely come back to Paddy Whacks! You gotta try the S'mores when you go there!

Got a pizza during the soft open. Impressed with the options for an $8.50 pizza, unlimited ingredients is pretty sweet. One pizza size (a medium 11.5in), & thin crust only FYI. Toppings were small in size, but given that you get unlimited I can't complain there. Thought my Mad to Meat you was pretty tasty if not super filling. Husband enjoyed it as well. Can't beat the price or the deal so 4 stars for me!

Growing up in the Nashville area, there was one thing that anyone from the area rarely did: go hang out on Broadway.  It's just where the annoying tourists went to buy overpriced cowboy boots and butcher the classic standards at karaoke.  Even though the city has changed a lot since then, it's one thing that remains: there remain very few good reasons to go to Broadway unless you just want to play tourist.  National Underground is one of those reasons, because it's so unlike any other bar on the street.  It's never crowded, it's very 'low-key'.  The bands are very good (the band there when I was last in, Brian Wain's Hushpuppy's Daddy, was phenomenal), I've never had to pay a cover, the beers are reasonably priced, the staff are always exceptionally nice, and it just has a really good non-pretentious vibe that is missing from its neighbors.  I've never had the food, but I am anxious to try it.

The reason it's docked a star, then? When you ask for a water, they charge you $2 and give you a 16oz bottle. No bueno, guys.  Fix that, and you'll get five stars.

Every time we are in the area we make it a point to come here!  We have been coming for 5 years and the food is always great, yesterday was no exception. 
I'm a Rock Crab Special lover and order it every time I go. For $25 you can't beat the deal!  And I have half of it in my refrigerator for today. Their portions of EVERYTHING are quite generous. 
The atmosphere only makes the yummy food just that much better.  Salt air, the pier, the birds, and you.
I would suggest this place to anyone and actually have many times!
Don't go expecting a 5-star sit down, candle on your table sort of dining. Go there expecting 5-star food in a fun environment!

Opryland Resort was listed as a top thing to do in Nashville so we decided to go. I had heard that the grounds were beautiful and they are nice. There are 50,000 plants of 500 different species. But it's really just a big hotel. Parking is $24. Some of the restaurants will validate so if you eat at one of them the parking will be free.  Most the restaurants had a wait time and seem a little pricey. We ate at the sports bar. Food disappointing and service slow. With all of the entertainment along Broadway, I thought there would be entertainment in several areas with a place this large but we didn't see any. Unless you like walking around a really big hotel, I would pass on Opryland as a must do while in Nashville.
What a shit show. Waited an hour for food that never came. In the middle of a lovely city this looked cool. What a mistake. Didn't even comp us the iced tea.

i have lived in southampton for my entire life,  Now that I have moved to Boston, when I come home, this the first place I come to.  Blue Sage is probably one of my favorite restaurants in the world, and I am not even a vegetarian!!

 I get the same thing every single time, Rasberry Zinger Ice Tea and the Porto Cabana.  I am drooling just thinking about it.  

True, the place is small, and it would be amazing if they would take over the place next door, but they have told me that it is a parking zone issue, which is tragic.  However, the wait is worth it, and I wouldn't have it any other way.
some of the best pizza in new orleans.  The sandwiches rule, too.  the pics of vespas are stupid.  i don't care if its italian or not, its stupid.  the magazine and state street store is the best.

I ordered an order of egg rolls and to go pineapple fried rice, by the time when I opened it. It stupidly didn't have any pineapple nor flavor in it ,and their egg roll wasn't not as good as it used to be. Not sure if I'm going to this place again.

Enjoyed going through with my family. They enjoyed the barn and horses which I did as well. Last time was three months before my 21st but this time many years latter I could partake in the free sample and oh how I enjoyed the freshness. Fun experience for all.

8pm in the evening, only the 20 items or less lane is open, I have 3 items and get stuck behind the guy with 300 items in his basket. I know, it wasn't his fault, it was the only line open. Wake up Schnucks, you were two hours from closing, keep a few lanes open. Bad management decision. That's okay though, Dierbergs is closer and I get to see my 16 year old the nights he is working. Bye Schmucks.

I really enjoyed a the meal I had at Mr. B's.  We had a group of 5 and surprisingly we didn't have to wait at 7 on a Thursday night.  The wait staff is amazing.  They were very knowledgeable, and friendly.  One member of out party ordered chicken, and they promptly let us know that it would be about a 25 minute wait because they were cooking the chicken fresh, and it would take longer, and checked to see if we were OK with that.  We were and they brought extra bread- which is very tasty with flaky crust.  

Their specialty is the BBQ shrimp which comes with a bib.  They don't seem to give you any warning when they come and tie it on you, but  It's a good idea!  They have this dish down to a science- they bring you hot towels and lemons when you're done so your hands don't smell shrimpy.

I had the wood grilled fish of the day which was so good!  My only complaint is that i wish it came with more veggies.  It only came with one medium piece of broccoli, and I would have enjoyed more.

We all got desert too and shared many of the dishes and they're all excellent.

It's owned by the Brennen's and I've heard that anything owned by them is a safe bet in New Orleans.
This place has MIND-BLOWINGLY good tacos and from 2-6p a bunch are only $2.00!! If you don't go you're missing out!

If I could give this place 3 and a half stars, I would. It just wasn't quite 4 star good... My husband and I visited Olivier's, and we were slightly disappointed. Here are the ups and downs of our visit: 

Service - Man our waiter was awful!  Not rude or anything, just way too scatterbrained to be a waiter.  I think just about every other waiter in the place was great though. We did have a couple other waiters help out at our table though, and they were very good. 

Food - The bread was nice, but the butter was darn near frozen solid. The salads were great, and they come with every entree (always a good thing!). I highly recommend the Creole Vinaigrette. My husband tried the Spicy Blue Cheese and it wasn't nearly as good as the vinaigrette. I ordered the Shrimp Scampi, which was excellent. I later found out that it's actually the staff favorite. My husband ordered the Crawfish Etouffee and it was very, very bland. DO NOT order the Crawfish Etouffee if you decide to visit. Fix yourself some Zataran's at home for better flavor. 

Decor - This restaurant is very pretty. It's very elegant with beautiful chandeliers, dark woods, and pretty linen tablecloths. However, on our visit we saw everything from suits to shorts, so don't worry about having to get dressed up. Anything goes here. 

Overall - I would go back and just cross my fingers and hope for a better waiter. The shrimp scampi is definitely worth a repeat visit.

The good: Quick delivery of food.

The not so good:  The palak paneer and chicken tikka masala were like soups.  Usually they are thicker.  Not a lot of chicken or cheese.  The naan felt underbaked and doughy.  

Overall, not a great dining experience.

The decor is beautiful and I could spend hours with coffee working here. However, the servers all seem confused, the flow for ordering is a bit awkward, and the brunch food isn't great. 
We ordered biscuits and Tasso gravy, the sweet potato and kale hash, pancakes, and coffee. Conceptually, the entire menu sounds fantastic. In reality, the execution isn't there. With a stronger kitchen crew, real plates and forks (it's all paper and plastic - hugely wasteful), and some team leadership in the front of house, I think it could be a huge hit!

I really can't say enough wonderful things about this restaurant.  Out servers Stephan and Kendrick were amazing and the good was over the top!  I had the pork belly with fig which almost sent me into a mouthgasm right at the table ! The BBQ shrimp , wear your bib,don't be a baby about it, was messy but soooooo worth it!   Forget whose watching and just go for it. And don't eat the bread at the table until your fine because you are going to want to sop up every last bit of that mouthwatering sauce! (Don't worry they are happy to bring you more bread! ) but try to resist to save room for the best bread pudding you ever had !

Atmosphere: 

The restaurant is located in an unusual place: the 4th floor of the Design Center.  The advantage is a great view of the Art Museum and 30th St. Amtrak Station.  The décor is kind of semi-minimalist modern, nothing offensive.

Service: 

Our waiter was near perfect.  He explained the dishes and specials and when the main courses arrived, he explained the smoldering fragrant vegetation, it was from the chef's property near St. Tropez in France.  Water was promptly refilled but he never hovered or made us feel like he was hovering.

Food:  

The food was really excellent.  I had the 3 course dinner which started with Four Mushroom soup. The soup was tasty and had, as I prefer,  pieces of mushroom.  I really hate it when mushroom soup comes out as if it had spent a minute in the blender! My main course was hanger steak with lentils.  This is the only time I had hanger steak that was not even a little tough.  It came with delicious bordelaise sauce.  The lentils were small beans with cubes of meat and a delicious sauce.  My wife had the Rack of Lamb and it came rare as ordered as was my steak.  She pronounced it heavenly. We shared my dessert which was a flake-pastry with vanilla ice cream and strawberries. Yum!

All in all, this was a great night for dining.  We'll surely be back.

My wife and I have been here twice. And it's been a perfect plate every time.

Food: The steaks are cooked to exactly how you want it. But it's not just their steaks, it's everything else on the menu also! I had their 'watermelon' salad. I usually hate salad, but this one salad made me a fan.
Service: Exactly what you want. Not hanging around or in your face, but there right when you need them, and they have great recommendations.
Decor: Nice, classy little joint.
Ambience: Very relaxed, but fancy.

Overall, a bit pricey, but you get fantastic food and great service. This is the standard of a great steakhouse.

This is my favorite place to go grocery shopping. They just re-did the store and it's beautiful. They now have a larger selection of everything. Everything is cheaper than the big chain grocery stores. I have a family of four and by coming here I save about $40 per week. That's $2080 a year.

We were starving after the game. I think people forget about this place since BPV. We got a table right away. This is going to be so mean, but our server looked like he was a homeless person that walk in off of the street and they hired him. His shirt was dirty and it had holes in it. He told us that he had broken his foot and his balance was a little off, so he could carry a tray. The food was good, we all just had sandwiches.

Who doesn't love a good steak? (Besides the vegetarian community, of course.) Carmine's in conveniently located downtown, which is perfect if you're entertaining out-of-town touristy guests and want to take them to dinner after a long day of seeing the sites of our fair city. The atmosphere is pretty traditional, the food is good (I'm a big porterhouse fan), and the wait staff is very friendly.

Fiver stars. Been on the tour before, back in 1992, but it seemed totally different this time (June 2012). For the better, actually. A very enjoyable experience and tour. The guides were great and the history was very interesting. A must do in St. Louis.
Five stars don't do justice to just how good Mr B's is. Fantastic people great food everything on the menu is delicious. My favorites are the seafood gumbo, BBQ shrimp and the shrimp and grits.

I couldn't have had a better experience. Justin, our server, was a dream. Kind, attentive, polite and knowledgable. We ate the ceviche sampler and had a pitcher of red sangria. Afterwards we were still feeling a bit hungry and Justin suggested the beef heart appetizer, which was absolutely fantastic. The ambiance was quiet and rustic.

If I lived closer I would be a regular, thank you for the great experience!

Oh Tonys... A staple in Alton. Home wouldn't be the same without you. They actually just opened a second location in Jerseyville last week. I've been to ours too many times to not have something to say about it. 

The pepperloins are amazing! The melted butter all over. And those peppercorns! Yikes! Its delicious. The kabob is a cheaper alternative that is just as tasty. If my memory serves me correct though you only get one side that way. 

Their red sauce is really good. Its sweet which really hits my sweet teeth. Thats right, plural. 

The house dressing is awesome, again, kind of sweet. The complimentary bread is really a decent piece of bread and not some cheap roll. They are really good at bringing you more to wipe up that dressing!

Not sure if I've ever had their pizza warm. Cold it is very good. 

Funny story for ya. Came here for sophomore year homecoming. Jacki and I were not officially dating yet, but we went together and all the other guys were getting pepperloins and Jacki was really excited to order one, but I ordered first and got fettucini, so she did too... Learned years down the road. Looks like I have been saving up for my exodus out of this town for a while! BTW the fettucini is nothing special if it hasn't changed.

Service is always pretty decent. They typically don't go too far out of their way, but run a smooth business. Looking forward to a pepperloin with a side of spaghetti and a salad already.

We didn't come here for a full meal, just a couple appetizers and drinks. The blood orange margarita was delicious- not too sweet. I had the crab cake, which tasted so fresh, and my husband had the gumbo, which he said was a 3 out of 5. But let me tell you, the desserts, holy moly. Best pecan pie I've ever had and the white chocolate brownies... Melt in your mouth good. Larry was the best bartender.

OMG the Alaskan Roll.  SOOOOOOOO GOOOOOOD.  The service is decent.  When it's busy the service is mediocre, when is empty its great.  We come here for the incredible sushi.  Hands down the best in St. Louis.  It's small, its local and the food is amazing.

Mona Lisa Lounge is a hidden gem. It has absolutely great prices. A beer was $3. The bar tenders are amazing, Betsy and Corkey. They are the nicest people ever. It has a friendly environment. They make you feel like they have known you forever. The crawfish boil was good and reasonably priced. It is near the big east air boat ride. We highly recommend it. Love this place.

Ok...i was tired, hungry and thirsty ..and the entire city was closed. 
Only Caleco's was open.
I was not quite impressed with the interiors. The place looked crowded and cramped too.
Chicken Quesadillas...they were bad. I got a feeling that it was prepared from frozen stuff.

Then i went for a pizza....and considering Caleco's to be 'Italian' , i was not taken aback. The pizza was made to order the way i wanted and the waitress was helpful too. I liked the pizza.

If i ever come again, i will be happy with a pizza and a beer

My husband and I were visiting New Orleans for what seems like the millionth time and each time we come, we try a new restaurant's gumbo. (ain't that what you're supposed to do? haha) So we went to this place to get us each a bowl and a drink. The gumbo was good, but I'm giving 2 stars because we both felt that our server was giving us not his best service because he assumed we were young, only getting gumbo, and probably not going to tip well. Which is actually not true at all. From a well spoken of local spot, I expected the same treatment whether I was spending $20 or $100.

Yep, one of the most underrated happy hours in the city.  Now granted, there is plenty of room, not crowded until later, and you are not going to find a host of singles to fulfill your alcohol induced desires.  But to meet a friend in old city, a young, sexy blonde friend who just wants to hang on to your arm and stare into your blue eyes, and to be able to hear each other converse (hey millennials, do you know what 'converse' means), a cool, relaxed happy hour atmosphere is what you have.

$3 beers, and I mean REAL beers like Terrapin Hi-5 IPA (normally $7), and on Thursday The Twisted Tail's version of a classic cocktail like a Manhattan for $5, you kidding me?  The red wine on special blew, so knock yourself out and pay retail for something.  $4-$6 small happy hour food items on the menu.  We had $6 for 6 oysters, tender, nice sized blue points, great cocktail and hot sauces.  (That's a buck-a-shuck, for those counting at home).  The chorizo taco was very nice, very tender, a good split just for a taste.  The spicy salmon poke was average, missing something, some sort of tangy bite I think.  

From the regular menu, the harpoon-caught swordfish was 5 star all the way, with perfectly, and I mean perfectly cooked, snappy snap peas.  The fish so tender and fresh, so melt in your mouth with exceptional taste-bud tingling, one of the best I've ever had.

After drinking a ton of $3 beers, my appetite was still alive, had to try the desserts.  We split two: Pecan Pie with caramel sauce...the crust a little stiff, the insides delicious; and the ricotta beignets...not too sweet, a wonderful cap  to the evening as the live music started.

My friend and I work in the Earth City business park and we go to this Dierbergs location at least twice a month for lunch. I'm not sure if all Dierbergs have a dine-in area, but they make great lunch spots for eating all of the awesome home cooked food you can get at their deli and sushi bars!

We like it because Dierbergs deli has a great selection of real food that you can get small portions of and either have them heat it up or you can take it to the little lunch area and heat it up yourself. Most of the time we get either sushi or the baked chicken dinner which for 6 bucks gets you a chicken breast and leg, plus two sides and a dinner roll! Today we opted out of the sushi and went for the chicken as you can see by my before and after pics. Sometimes we get yummy desserts from the deli too.

Another reason we really like to eat in the store is because it seems like a place that older people, blue collar workers and stay at home mom's like to also have their lunch. Its nice to get out of the office cafeteria and be around something other than your working class lunch crowd at all of the traditional lunch hour spots. It's more like sitting down at a dinner table and taking it easy over some good home cooking.

One time we'll always remember is when a cute little old man started talking to us as we were getting ready to leave, asking us where we worked and so forth. We told him we worked at a health and medical sciences book publisher and he asked me, oh so you're not a nurse then? I told him no, he looked sad for a second and said, Oh I was hoping that you'd check me out and see if i'm healthy, then with a wink and a chuckle, he sent us on our way.

I think I'm a lot less familiar with Korean food than some of the other Yelpers that have reviewed this place. Most of the menu is variations of their specialty dish, a soup/stew called sun du bu.  It's got a red broth and lots of tofu as well some meat or something else, depending on the variety you order.  The soup is literally boiling when it arrives at your table, and depending on how you order it, it's pretty hot in the other way, also.  You are provided with a raw egg to crack into the soup if you wish.  You also get a pot of rice, a variety of tiny side dishes and a drink that I understand is essentially iced tea made with buckwheat instead of tea.

My three companions and I really enjoyed this place.  The one problem we had was that one of our friends is a strict vegetarian and it was difficult for us to determine which things on the menu were truly vegetarian, partly because of the limited English of the servers.  She doesn't want meatless soup if it is made with beef broth, for example. It was pretty clear that we weren't going to be able to communicate that to our waitress, so she got the pancake with scallions.  

I'll be back, especially on a cold day!

NO RESTAURANT AVAILABILITY!   Our family of 5 was just in Nashville for a few days to visit colleges for our daughter. We stayed very close to the Opryland Hotel for the sole purpose of walking around the beautiful gardens and having dinner at night.  I have been to Nashville before and was excited to share the hotel amenities with my family. We arrived in the late afternoon and headed straight to the hotel. As we were looking at the property map we were approached by a hotel staff who RUDELY informed us that if we were looking for somewhere to eat we should go some place else since all of the restaurants were booked with private parties.  We still walked around some just to see the gardens, and even the possibility of a snack at one of the counter service facilities.  This was 8pm on a Wednesday night, every counter service facility was closed & as the rep indicated every restaurant was closed for private parties.  We came back the next night in hopes that Wednesday was an unusual circumstance, however once again 7pm on a Thursday and every restaurant except one was booked for private parties, a couple of the counter service facilities were open like the Gelatto shop, but we really wanted to have a vice dinner. I had considered staying at the hotel and I'm very grateful we we did not. Needless to say we did not return for our third and final night nor we will ever return when we visit our daughter who will be attending college in Nashville starting in the fall.  It's too bad because the property is amazing - but the rudeness of the staff combined with the difficulty in dinning availability isn't worth the effort.  GO ELSEWHERE!
Food okay, but only because our waitress let it sit. It definitely had more potential than what we experienced. Apparently, they were baffled by people under the age of 70.

Another cool brewery tap room in Indy. The location is pretty easy to get to as long as it isn't rush hour, and they have plenty of parking in the parking lot for the strip mall of businesses that they are set up in. There is quite a bit of outdoor seating in a patio area in front of the business, and a lot more seating inside that is composed of some second-hand mismatched furniture (including a few couches). Ordering is done at their bar that has a large chalkboard behind it with the available beers on tap.
 
It's a fairly busy interior with lots of stuff hanging everywhere, including a significant amount of awards that they have won for their beers. There are also lots of branded items that you can buy. They have 6-packs of their canned beer already cold that you can purchase to-go, or you can make a build your own 6 pack. You can also fill growlers here. The beers from this brewery are always done exceptionally well for the style, but they also lack some of the more unique beers that a lot of other breweries like to make. They have 8 or 9 beers on tap at any time, and they usually cover a decent spectrum of beer styles. This is definitely a brewery that isn't going to put out anything that isn't done well.

They have quite a few unique events here that can be easily found on their website, including a night especially for dogs, live music, and even a euchre night. Wednesday is their pint night with the fantastic offering of $4 pints. There was a food truck here the last time I visited, but I think that is only a once a week occasion (but don't quote me on that). They did have a few snack items available if needed to buy something to tide you over while drinking. 

I don't make it here very often since it requires a drive to get here, but it is definitely a stop I would make if I was going to be in the area. If you like great beer in a relaxed atmosphere, this is definitely your place. Additionally, and this may be a little judgmental of me, but the crowd here seems to be a little more "normal" than some other breweries. It's not full of regulars that feel like they have priority in the place and there are far less hipsters than some of the downtown breweries pull in. It's a nice social place to come with some friends to enjoy a few beers no matter what demographic you belong to.

We love this little restaurant.  The food is always fresh and creative.  The owner and staff are always very pleasant and welcoming.  The dining area is cozy and clean.  We like to think of State Street Kitchen as "our secret spot", but we love to tell people our secret.  Love this place!

Disappointed today. Took my family to the Christmas show and had a blast. Went to the Brew Brothers and was very disappointed. We started out with chips and salsa with the guacamole. I tasted the guacamole and it was spicy to me. Even my wife who likes spicy items said it was a little hot, and she's Mexican. I asked the waitress what was in the guacamole and she did not know. Later she said it was jalapeño. I'm can't have anything spicy due to an ulcer. I told the waitress why don't you tell people it has jalapeño in it? She did say anything.             So we order and I had the smoked chicken and pineapple. At that time I asked for more water and my daughter asked for ranch. A few minutes later our food arrived everyone but mine. The waitress said it would be only a few minutes. So everyone started eating. 10 minutes later I man came over and apologize for my dinner said they had some problems in the kitchen and it would be a few minutes. So about 5-7 minutes my chicken arrived. Now my family was mostly done eating. I looked at my plate and it's small chicken peace's with chunks of pineapple. Not much chicken. The bbq sauce was lightly poured on to it. So I tried it and no smoke flavor and it was very dry. I was expecting a little more the that.  The waitress forgot our water and ranch dip we had to ask several times. No apology or compensation for the spicy guacamole or dinner issue. I'm not saying I should get a free meal but come on, try to make it right!

I liked my Filet Mignon and baked potato.  Good selection of cuts.

The atmosphere is great and the location is near the Arch, the Convention Center and Busch Stadium.  For someone visiting from out-of-town, I would recommend Carmine's.  

I finished up with a light dessert and a glass of scotch.  A nice evening overall.  

I recommend making a reservation if a convention is in town.

It is definitely a place to bring your friends and chat. I love their different types of Peanut Butter sandwiches. Amazing! Not only that, but the inside environment is just so positive and provides inspiration.

Hands down the best Mexican food I have had in this city! The food is always delicious and the drinks are equally good! Can't beat a $2 happy hour taco either. Don't be afraid to step away from the traditional margarita and try one of the cocktails... you will not be disappointed!
