Absolutely amazing from start to finish. Delicious tuna and everything else, great unusual drinks (I had a saketini--vodka, sake and cucumber). Prices were reasonable and decor was gorgeous. Service was knowledgeable and friendly. Will definitely come back.

Great food that isn't cheap but worth every penny. The goat cheese fondue with figs and jalepeños was excellent but needs to come with more of the toasted baguette croutons (4 isn't enough to share). We also ordered fried artichokes. There were plenty of those, and they were done perfectly! Half of our group ate sea bass, most of the other half ate the fillet with a small lobster tail on the side. My daughter had the mixed grill which looked ok, but the sea bass and fillet were much better. The fillet was tasty - it was a good cut of meat - nothing out of the ordinary. They prepare it 2 different ways - I recommend getting the sauce on the side. The sea bass was delicious - with the raisin-saffron being the best preparation by far (over the lemon butter). We didn't eat dessert, so I can't comment. I would have rated 4.5 stars, but that rounds to 5 - nice job!

Friends in Phoenix told us in San Diego that this place in Tucson was worth the drive. We were in Tucson for New Years so we made it a point to stop in. It did not disappoint. The lunch buffet had deliciously seasoned choices that were better than many meals we had in India. Many classic dishes. A continuous supply of fresh nan. This will be a regular stop any time we get near Tucson.

Location is really the only thing that kept this a 4 instead of 5 star for me. It doesn't seem to affect business as the locals are used to the uhhh....renovation that Carmel is going thru. Just turn on GPS and you'll find it easy. 
On to what matters most. BRUNCH! Outstanding! They offer weekly specials, so I opted for on of those. A Sante Fe scramble if memory serves me. DEELISH. I had a bialy? Guess it's a bagel without the hole lol, and it was just fantastic. 
The lady had a cinnamon roll that was gooey and tasty, and also a "toad in a hole". Very tasty as well. 
Mimosas and coffee were also spot on. Great outside seating, and service was attentive and friendly. Check this place out!

Our Spring Rolls were delicious. I also enjoyed my Combination Bahn Mi although it was a bit small. My wife's Vietnamese Crepe wasn't too good, but maybe it was just a poor choice. Was greasy or oily and the crepe itself had an odd flavor. All in all, it was okay.
Momo's is an excellent spot for a date or dinner with a larger group. Not only is the food awesome, the belly dancers are sexy! The appetizers are to die for! GET THE APPETIZERS!

Been going to this place for years. Quality of sushi is always consistent. The best sushi in town! Although sometimes they turn away take out orders cause they are so busy. But I will always continue to go back.

There have been a couple of good Fiipino restaurants in the Reno area, and several which were at least ok, but despite all of the Pinoy who live here, they don't seem to succeed.

ALM Kainan has a unique business plan -- if you start with a good Filipino restaurant, then don't have to pay for decorations, fancy menus or other extras, you can spend the money on the food!  And they clearly do. There is a steam table, a small kitchen just behind the steam table, two happy Filipinas in the kitchen, and plenty of good food coming from back there somewhere.  

I hadn't expected to find this place -- in what must have been the broom closet of a Der Wienerschnitzel -- but I'm glad that I did.  You can't even call it "Suite B," because "suite" means more than one room.  If this restaurant were any smaller, it would be on wheels.

I had the bisteak, rice and lumpia for lunch, and plan to come back soon for a repeat performance.  The food was top quality, and the portion size just fine (half of the lumpia are in the cooler for a snack tomorrow).

If you haven't tried Filipino food, this is your chance -- except on Sundays, when they are closed.

This is one of my all time favorite restaurants!  If I meet a friend for lunch I always get take out for my husband's dinner.  I also take at least a quart of the tomato bisque home...I can't get enough of it!  The Heirloom sandwich is my current fav...it's big enough for two meals so I'm not feeling left out at dinner.

This speak-easy style cocktail lounge is one the absolute best spots in Indy to get a drink.  Their cocktail menu is really outstanding, featuring drinks from other bars in the country as well as a host of in-house creations.  The atmosphere is classy but not stuffy, with eclectic decor.  The staff is friendly and incredibly knowledgeable about their offerings.  The Libertine is a top-notch bar, and definitely worth a visit (or two or three).

Took 50 minutes to get our salad  

Looks busy but I figure there's mostly tourists down here. Food is standard. Fish tank is cool.

Great food, great staff, reasonable prices, and big portions.  We love to eat here at least twice a month, and have been since they opened.  We always get the deal for 2 entrees and 2 appetizers for $15.  We used to live in Atlanta and went to Tin Drum all the time - really missed it when we moved to Tampa.  So exciting when they opened this location and we were able to eat there again!
we absolutely adore this place.  we've been back many times for the yummy food, reasonable prices, and delightful staff.

Omg, so good!!!  We were driving thru Tucson on our way to Sedona and stopped in here. The name was kind of misleading, it doesn't sound like a Chinese name, at least to me, but don't go by what I say, it might be a Chinese saying for all I know.

Anyway, the food was delicious and the waitress was very friendly and helpful in giving me directions to a Pier !!  We both had moo goo gai(?), highly recommend this place!!

I HIGHLY recommend this place. They make everything fresh themselves, the Pho broth, Thai tea, egg rolls, cream cheese wontons etc. They have really good prices too. For example, the sandwiches are huge and only cost $3.75. This is a great place to check out

First time my wife and I dined there. It was last Thursday night. The place was half full. Nice environment - we sat in the back room where it was quiet. 

I had the broccoli soup and had to send it back. It was not enough broccoli and too much chicken broth. My wife unselfishly share her salad with me - don't know what it was but it was very good. I had the linguine and my wife the salmon. The linguine was fairly greasy and not very tasty. I ate 25% and took the rest home; I didn't eat eat later. The salmon was good. I guess I was having bad luck! The creme brulee was nice. I noticed that I was charged for french fries the waiter forgot to serve us, it was taken off.

All in all a fair but not good dining experience. 2 glasses of wine, appetizer, entree, desert and 2 coffees came to around $80 without a tip. Limited menu. I'll go somewhere else next time.

I gave it 2 stars but it should be 2 1/2 stars.

LOVED this place! Very small-time reservation/seating. You write your name on a clipboard and they call you when something becomes available. We sat at the bar within 15 min on a busy night. The food was all caught that day. So fresh. So good. We chose the sea urchin from the tank as well as the fresh crab. We had beers and wine. Will visit this place every single time we're in town!

When I went here, I ordered a #15. Pho Dac Biet: rice noodle soup with rare beef, beef brisket and beef meat balls ($8.95). For the price, it's a little expensive. While they do give you a decent amount, I'd recommend Noodle City, for something a little cheaper and a place that gives you more (see my Noodle City review!).

I will say, though, that their Thai tea with boba is great! It's a little pricey compared to other places, but it's good. I also hear that their Bahn Mi sandwiches are really good, so that might be something I go back for.
Spent 90 minutes without a beer in hand, then we went to a bar and took a sunny D shot. Probably best to skip this.

Decent pizza. Not customer service oriented. Have had some pretty horrible experiences. Late delivery, rude manager, over billing and generally refusing to make things right.

We're pulling Martys out of rotation. Will stick with Giovannis and Rustys.

I'd call it a hidden gem but the secret is out. One of the top wine lists I've seen. Turtles could only wish they could eat this turtle soup. Pork chop was succulent and tender. The crispy oysters managed to taste light and sweet. And the service was both charming and attentive.

This is a tiny lil gem in Carmel that you might miss in a blink of an eye. It's a lil hidden right next to the Monon within a few feet from their flagship Burger place.

The cafe looks like a lil house. The interior designer did a wonderful job of making you feel good eating home cooked like breakfasts and lunch.

The pancakes are a must try as well as their egg sandwich. The place is packed on weekends for the brunch crowd so make sure you're there early.
Off the beaten path but worth a trip. Short ribs were excellent as was the jap chae, squid and scallion pancake, and bibimbap.

I really, really enjoyed my experience here.  This is a wonderful sushi place tucked away in a corner of Temple Terrace that needs more recognition.  The atmosphere is very classic and "Eastern Chic" and the selection of sushi rolls is vast and very reasonably priced.  

I opeted for the dinner special of 2 rolls from a set menu for 11.99 and then added another roll with my meal.  This came with a little salad and some miso soup.  The soup was absolutely delicious!!!  Seriously, not sure what they do to it here, but it is great!  

I sat at the sushi bar and watched the chef's make their magic, but there is a lot of other booths and table seatings fro groups or couples.  I went stag today....oh well :)  

The best roll I had was the 2011.  Salmon, cream cheese and avocado fried in a bit of tempura batter.  Excellent!  They have a great selection of domestic and Japanese imported beers as well.  

Another great thing about this place is they do deliveries and stay open until 2 am!!!  So if you are in the mood for a midnight tuna snack...check this place out.  Great staff, very friendly and prompt.  I will be going here again!!!

This is a hidden gem at the 1st floor of an office building. Not easy to stumble upon, but once you do, you'll never forget! The atmosphere is amazing and the staff is very friendly. Dan, the general manager was very welcoming and accommodating! One of the other managers, Jenny, had the best knowledge of gluten free items that I've ever experienced in a sushi restaurant, or any restaurant for that matter. My girlfriend has to eat gluten free so that is a huge plus. They are also kid friendly and provided fruit and learners chopsticks for the little not-so-adventurous/picky one. I have eaten here plenty of times and my favorite rolls are the Ai Maki and the Tropic. If you really want to splurge go for the Sea Bass, it melts in your mouth! They have a ton of great drinks and a wide selection of Sake. Head bartender Andrea puts his heart into every cocktail and strives for perfection and is fun to talk to. To top it all off the Mochi selection is very extensive and the tempura green tea ice cream is my favorite! 5 stars all the way!

Bought a voucher on LivingSocial.  The voucher did not work on the website.  I called them, and they told me to e-mail them from their contact page with my information, and they would book the tour.  I did this, and did not receive a confirmation.  I sent a follow up e-mail, and still received no response.  I finally called AGAIN, and they promised they would send me a confirmation, which I never received.  Finally I contacted LivingSocial for a refund, and they informed me that this vendor had marked the voucher as USED.  It was not used!  Terrible customer service, avoid.  After posting this review, merchant said they were "sorry" for the mis communication, but nonetheless reported the voucher used, when it was not, blocking my ability to receive a refund on a tour I never received.  Beyond shady, avoid.

Yummy!!!! There were three of us and we each tried 2 scoops of something different.  Our treats were so good we didn't even offer to share with each other! Get your own!  Wish we had an ice cream shop like this near our home but probably better that there isn't because we would be there constantly!
My new favorite Greek restaurant! Great customers service and amazing food and sauce. Give it a go.

I had really high expectations for this bakery since I'm a pastry chef myself. They seem like they are going for more of a wholesale bakery rather than retail since the show case was rather sad. We arrived at 10:45 on Sunday but there was no sign of life. We thought they were closed but we asked a chef who was just arriving to work and he said they opened at 11.....kind of odd for a bakery. We had the blueberry hand pie. It was good but probably not worth $6.50.  No espresso drinks but they had drip coffee. We will come back again in the future when they aren't so new.
We are here for a conference on a Wednesday and all but 2 quick food places are closed. The lines are ridiculous and we only have an hour.

I was introduced to Terra Sur at a large Yelpers event a few months back. That's when I decided this would be my birthday dinner place!  As it happens my dining friends weren't as excited as I, so I visited with a fellow ceviche eating friend for a "day after" dinner.

First, small place with lots of personality and ambiance. We arrived around 7 and had the place nearly to ourselves (World Cup time, you know). The bartender/server was very accommodating when it came to the wine list and trying out different things.  The wine list is gargantuan, by the way. Thank goodness my friend knows wine better than I and was able to help me choose. 

We were seated quickly.  Warm rolls came to the table first (with REAL butter!!). Our order of the ceviche pescado sampler arrived quickly along with yucca fries and chorizo y morcilla. 

Ceviche was fresh and the "Peruvian hot" was perfect for us - not burn your face off hot, but nicely spiced with good flavor. While the yucca fries came with their own sauce, I preferred using the left over ceviche sauce.

The morcilla was pretty fantastic in my opinion.  I wasn't crazy about the chorizo, but it was good as well. 

Dessert was an incredibly rich double chocolate cake. I mean, just wow. Since we were stuffed I rescued about half of it for tomorrow's breakfast!! 

All in all, I really loved eating here. The food, the atmosphere, the people and service - all really made this dinner an enjoyable experience I hope to revisit soon. I absolutely will strong arm friends into going here for dinner in the near future (or I'll round up my ceviche eating partner in crime!).!
My café macchiato made with the Zip-Zinger blended roast was the embodiment of perfection.

While the food was pretty good, the portions were not. The waitress kept saying that the tapas were shareable for 2-4 people, but even when she explained the dishes (ie. you get 3 ribs), it certainly didn't sound like much to share! And we were right, the portions were tiny. The largest portions of what we ordered were the fried chicken and mac n cheese. Being a vegetarian, we got the mac n cheese with the crawfish on the side and then the gnocchi. While these were good, I could've definitely eaten these all by myself! I was sad to share it with everyone else since we ordered things as a table. The gnocchi was not a large dish at all, and luckily not everyone at the table had some since we had other dishes containing meat for everyone else. The sweet potato fries that come with the fried chicken, by the way, are two very large tempura sweet potatoes. So no, you will not actually get any fries. 

The atmosphere is really cool, and if you love whiskey, they have a large variety. But I definitely wouldn't go here to eat, especially if you want to end up full without spending over $40 for yourself.

Wow! (A little history, I'm from the New Haven CT area, with lots of Italian heritage, I've been in NO for a long time, and miss the Italian food from that area). 
This food is spot on! The cheesy bread appetizer Oh man! The veal is over the top!  Service needs to tighten up a bit, but the food makes up for it! Who Dat!  Go for it you will love it!
TONS OF OPTIONS! I went with superman and I've had better super man ice cream I wish I would have gone with my fav rocky road, but no issues at all.

We loved this tour!  It was educational, entertaining, and so much fun.  Our tour guides were very informative and able to answer all questions that were asked by our group.  I am not a beer lover (can't stand the stuff) but I still loved the tour so much that I would be interested in paying for the more in depth tour next time we go.  

This tour takes about an hour and you get 2 large beer samples at the end of the tour.

so fresh! this is one of my favorite places to eat in brandon. the falafel and hummus are my favorites. the owners are very friendly and always a pleasure to see. i love that they are vegan friendly too! seating is limited but its more for take out and delivery, and one of the best!

This pub crawl is a blast! We were a group of 5- two moms and three daughters. Our group was all women and Tyler was amazing!! He made sure each person was having a good time. Karaoke and bull riding were the crown jewel of the event. Do this pub crawl! You won't be sorry!

I've been here twice now and neither meal was very good. My steak was not cooked to my order, dry, and over seasoned. The crab which was off the menu, due to running out of lobster, was terrible!!! Even the chocolate cake at the end was dry. For the price & atmosphere, go to Ruth Chris's next door!

Only giving four stars solely for the price. If you're a boujie Nashvillian who can afford a $15 salad, go there every day. All the ingredients are delicious and fresh, which I assume is why it's so expensive. It's the perfect little place to meet for coffee, a lunch meeting or just get some work done while enjoying a latte or glass of wine. 

I wouldn't use the "market" of it as much as I use the bakery and salad/sandwich bar. Food is great, employees are nice and it seems well run. The manager is always visible, polite and helping out where is needed. I will be back many times, but have to budget around pay day ;)

I am always satisifed after leaving Blue Sage, and the food is always delicious and presented nicely.  The nachos are excellent. My only gripe... I don't like that my server kept my wine cork. Apparently they "keep them until we are done," but other tables were given their cork back. I asked for my cork, was not given it. At the end of my meal I was given a cork to a different bottle. I find that odd.

Terrible. A weeknight dinner marred by an overtly rude bartender, subpar food and staff who couldn't keep up with the flow. This place is in our neighborhood but it is not worth a visit. The steak, ordered per the server's suggestion medium rare, was brought out 15 minutes after all other food with apologies about it being overlooked. Indeed, meager in size, it was well done. If you can't cook something as intended, do not bring it out. And certainly do not charge for it. How can a joint that's all about pub food screw up the fries? A crying shame.

There are no options for vegetarians in the menu for entree, but they will always make vegetarian pasta with angel hair pasta, which is pretty good. Food is usually good, but it's way better over the weekends. 
The profiteroles and bread pudding are excellent choices for dessert and they have $2 martinis on weekdays.

This was one of the best filet mignon cuts I've ever had. The waitress was perfect in the way she described the meal options & specials. Try the risotto  and you'll feel like you've been transported to heaven. #carmines #steak #bestdinnerever

This is a wonderful restaurant that is classy and yet comfortable to dine at.  We were seated quickly and our waiter came to take our drink order within thirty seconds.  Our drinks were quickly brought to us and he made friendly small talk and explained the menu.  I thought that this was fabulous service, as they had plenty of other customers.  Looking around, I noticed that everyone seemed to be in equally happy moods, and I guess this sort of service is the norm here.  

We started with bruschetta and crab cakes, both of which were amazing.  You know when you get a myriad of well mixed tastes in your mouth and your brain gets those mini tingles in it?  That is what these dishes will do.  I got the Chicken Marie, while my husband got the Chicken Florentine, both of which were fabulous.  Our waiter suggested glasses of wine that worked well with both of our meals.  This was a great experience and I cannot wait to go back.

M.L.Rose is a great bar to visit! They have the best waffle fries (sweet potato waffle fries also available), an awesome Thursday night happy hour special (2 for 1), and ample seating inside and outside the restaurant.

The main drawback is the parking. You can take your chances parking in the lot across the street and risk getting towed. The parking in and above the garage is limited and tight! However, you can park on the street or pay for valet at Sienna which is across the street. If you live or work close, I recommend just taking an uber/lyft there.

The service can be hit or miss as there aren't tons servers which means at times it takes a while to get your order. However, the food is excellent. Lots of vegetarian options, yummy burgers, great beer selection, and ahh I gotta mention it again - the waffle fries! It gets packed on Thursday evenings which is my favorite night to go. I love M.L.Rose!

If there was a .5 option I would give this 2.5 but I rounded up because hey, it's the holidays. I went last night with 3 friends. Once we were seated it did take quite a while for our server to come over and she poured us water and then walked away for 5 more minutes (meanwhile, we were definitely ready for drinks from the bar and to order our food). So then she comes back and has a really hard time understanding our order. We were sharing two pizzas (one of the pizzas was the cauliflower and pancetta which we asked for half without pancetta since two people are vegetarian) and we all good our own salads as well. 

A few minutes later she came back and asked if we wanted the cauliflower to come out first and then realized she must think we ordered the appetizer which has cauliflower so we corrected her and told the orders again. The salads were good. Two of us had the chopped salad and verde salad.

The pizzas came and the cauliflower had the pancetta on every slice so it had to be sent back. Once it did come back correct, it was good. Both were decent, nothing great and definitely expensive for a small pizza. Btw, there was no apology at all about the mixup, which bothers me from a customer service perspective. Overall it was an okay experience but I have no plans on returning anytime in the foreseeable future.

Delicious! We went last night at 7:30pm. I got the Egg Pizza and he got the Pepperoni and we split them. I LOVE that they have KOMBUCHA on tap!!! That already gives 24 a few stars in my book. Service was great; two staff members asked us how we were enjoying the food. The tomato sauce on the pepperoni tasted homemade and fresh. The egg pizza was just so flavorful. I love the crust here, so crunchy but not too crunchy. I will be returning and get a cocktail since I saw that they had all KOMBUCHA cocktails.

I was excited to try this place but I was disappointed. It's a tourist trap with food that's borderline ok. The lobster bisque is ok, a little on the salty side. The shrimp tacos & seafood pasta were so bland & the crab cakes were on the dry side. I'm not sure if we just ordered the wrong dishes but I definitely missed out on what the other Yelpers were raving about

I don't normally review, but my wife and I had a great dinner. The food was excellent we had oysters, empanadas, scallops, burger, and sweet potato fries.  Drinks we had the old fashion, kool Kat and the flight. And the waiter Anthony was very attentive.

Mr. B's was recommended by a friend and we weren't let down. 

Their alcoholic orange Julius was so delicious it made the perfect dessert. I also devoured their bacon wrapped shrimp and grits. 

If you are in the quarter and want a nice meal in an establishment where the dress code is not as stiff, you won't be disappointed here.

Impressive collection of wine and spirits. Was looking for bitters and wow do they have an amazing selection for that as well. So knowledgeable and took the time to help me find what I was looking for. Definitely worth the trip north!

Food was pretty good.  Service was excellent.  A little overpriced, the filet was good, but frankly, I've had better.  The sides are what give it 4 instead of 3 stars, all the sides (mashed potatoes, creamed spinach) and appetizers (bone marrow, cheese plate, shrimp cocktail) were very good.

Mr. B's is one of my go-to restaurants in New Orleans.  Sitting at the bar for lunch is a great way to start the afternoon.  Our group had a light lunch with gumbo ya-ya (and hot French bread!) along with catfish fingers and a salad w/candied pecans.  During lunch M-F, Mr. B's also has great lunch specials on bloody marys and martinis - $1.50...a great deal!
Everything is so fresh.   The food is amazing!!! If you are wanting Mexican just go here!

I have always loved this restaurant and the food.  This is the only restaurant that I frequent in Doylestown.  The food is consistently good, although the portions are tiny and the bread is not warm and super fresh.
Woah partner.....hold your horses.  You must stop at this watering hole and try the Red Velvet Cake Ice Cream.  It will make your toes curl !!!  Yes its that good my friends.   Enjoy!!

Despite being forgotten by our waitress a couple times, we enjoyed our visit last night. Another couple was seated after us and next to us and they got their beer and appetizer before we were even asked if we were ready to order!!! We were salivating over THEIR food so obviously that I think we made them uncomfortable. When our order was finally taken, we over-ordered: saganaki, dolmades, fries, eggplant fries, beef tenderloin gyro, extra pita, orzo, spanokopita. This was for two people! Everything was good, fresh tasting. The gyro wasn't what I expected, on a bed of mashed potatoes not on a pita, but was very flavorful. Also the dolmades were hot, not cold as I've usually had them.

Service was friendly, though sometimes AWOL. There was live music which was great! Decor was a mishmash of styles. The food was solid and we'll be back!

Sundays are my cheat day for diet.  I can have gluten which means I can have my favorite foods: breads, waffles, pancakes.  Also: french fries or ice cream.  Bad things.  I came to the Melrose on a cheat day, thus, I ordered the cinnamon bites for our brunch appetizer.  These are strips of flash fried cinnamon roll dough tossed with powdered sugar.  Yum.  They reminded me of a childhood favorite: monkey bread.  Nothing will EVER be as good as classic monkey bread, but these followed in a close second.  For my entree I ordered classic eggs and toast. The vibe of this place is definitely a burger and brew joint - In order for me to return to a place like that, there have to really be some standout items on the menu or a standout vibe in atmosphere.  Though the service was friendly and smart, this place lacked both.  I'd rather go to Athens across the street.

Blue Sage is always great, almost always crowded, and, tragically, closed Sundays and Mondays.  Reservations are definitely a must and I recommend bringing friends so you can get a larger table and be slightly further from the next table.  The two-person tables always seem to leave us sitting 4 inches from an unknown loud-talker.

While the entrees are all delicious I recommend that on at least one visit you go the appetizer + sandwich route.

My wife and I always choose a new appetizer and then order our regular sandwiches.  We split the Falafel Wrap and the Wild Blue Focaccia and usually have 1/4 of each to take home.   The falafel is ludicrously tasty and has a magical stay-crispy-while-surrounded-by-spicy-slaw property that leaves me stunned.  The mixed mushrooms in the Wild Blue focaccia do their job and let the Gorgonzola really hit you.

We're always too full for dessert.

P.S. BYOB

We enjoyed a dinner for two in a quiet corner of the restaurant with a beautiful view of the river and skyline. We went all out because we had a gift certificate, but the bill would have been delightfully reasonable even without it.

BEV: Champagne
AP: St. Jacques, Champignons
SALAD: Boston, Oysters
ENT: Filet, Dorade
DES: Chocolate cake (melted center), profiteroles

My wife and I stopped in for an afternoon snack - coffee for her and ice cream for me. Both were great. I felt like the banana pudding ice cream was the star of the show. The pieces of nilla wafer make it like the real thing. The dark coffee was smooth and she was happy to see some stevia sweetener on the set up table.
Great service, very good food (grilled shrimp entree especially)..  A nice break from the bourbon street atmosphere.

In my quest to find the best pizza in Roxborough/Manayunk had to eventually hit this place up as it's about 2 blocks from my digs.  It was hard by passing Roma's my favorite local place to taste this, but I am an equal opportunity provider.  Called up and order two large which were ready fairly quickly.  Descently priced which was about 17.95 before tax.  A little disappointed though off the bat as their large is a 16".  When I brought it home knew right away this paled in comparison to the other local joints.  The crust was a dead give away as it seemed to be premade frozen stuff, not the fresh dough.  I've encountered crust like this at other places such as Fiesta II on Henry which doesn't help only hurt the rating.  Nothing stood out about the sauce or cheese, real mediocre.  Friendly and conveniently located for me which garnishes a 3.  Don't think I'll be returning for the pizza, but might give some other menu items a try.

This place is listed as vegetarian-friendly and it is, provided that you eat eggs, cheese, and whatever else they put on the food without listing it in the menu description. Unfortunately this place was a nightmare for me as a vegan. I ordered the veggie cuban with no swiss or honey mustard since those were the only non-vegan ingredients listed in the description, and if it wasn't for the server mentioning "oh that's a great choice; the chef puts an egg on it too," then I would have gotten a sandwich with egg. After I stressed "no animal products, no egg, no dairy, no butter," the server responded with "oh well you know the egg isn't actually meat" as opposed to, you know, respecting my dietary restrictions.

I have no intention of returning, due to the lack of clarity on the menu and the server's rudeness when I was expressing my allergies/restrictions. Maybe if the restaurant lists all of the ingredients and trains their staff on how to not be rude to someone who was rightfully annoyed at almost getting an item I couldn't eat, then it might be worth a recommendation. But then again, it's not a vegan-friendly establishment despite it being vegetarian-friendly.

Just ordered takeout. Was so sad I couldn't give less stars for this review. I ordered the cheeses steak roll a pepperoni  Stromboli and onion rings. What I got was a cooked sock and and un cooked calzone in place of that order. 

The onion rings were good. Only reason I'll accept a single star here. 

Be very aware that if you get takeout from here you may end up with a similar experience.
Since I am native to the Ellwood area, I have been going to this place since high school and all I have to say is that I will fight you for a Cal Burrito when I come home!

Personally, I like going to this place for dinner the best. They have a great vegetarian/vegan selection, great level of spice and a good beer selection. Their lunch buffet is a little underwhelming compared to Madhuban's and Bombay Grill's, but the server and the owner are very friendly and change up the selection a lot; I've been here a few times during different days of the week, and there is always s couple of new things to try out. I think this place has the best pakora and naan bread. Highly recommended for dinner!

Delicious and creative pizza! We ordered the Maui Wowie and the Bayou Bleu and both were exceptional.  We had great conversation with our bartender and the manager, both of whom were working very hard, and took care to remember our names.  We were very pleased with our experience.

We were in Santa Barbara for the day and decided to try this place for lunch.  First of all, parking on the pier is a joke.  You take a ticket when you enter the pier and the first 90 minutes is free with any business validation.  Problem is there was ABSOLUTELY NO PARKING SPACES.  So after driving around like a vulture for 20 minutes I decided to drive off the pier and park in the nearby neighborhood.  At least they didn't charge me when I told them I couldn't find a space.

Finally got parked and made it to the restaurant.  They said the wait would be 30 minutes and it ended up being about 45 minutes.  No big deal cause we weren't in a hurry or anything.  I ordered the abalone with rice special.  She had the 3 pound rock crab special.  It was my first time eating abalone so I was excited to try it.  Everything was just okay.  Service was mediocre.  Price was about what I expected.  This place was not bad but I think they are definitely 3 stars and not 4 stars.  I don't think I'm coming back.

This was my first time visiting this restaurant!  We went with a group of 5 with no lunch reservation and were quickly seated.  The ambience is consider modern upscale and does not remind me of a brew pub-until you see the fermentation tanks visible through the large glass windows in the back-not sure this set up works!  Would recommend sharing the pretzels and cheese ale sauce-they were served warm and delicious.  Idaho Nacho portion is very large and easily could be shared amongst 4 people.  Flatbread was excellent and perfect lunch size for one.  The grilled Chicken and Ciabatta Bruschetta salad was very tasty-just a bit more dressing than was needed. All in all a very nice experience.  Wait staff was efficient and friendly and easily handled our group.

Brand new Garces causal restaurant offering Italian and wood fired dishes. Modern, wood and stone interior. Just opened this week and service was efficient, friendly and no hiccups at all. Drinks well made and delicious. Happy hour specials. We had the buratta which was delicious, the wood oven roasted cauliflower with dukkah, the cacio Pepe and rabbit agnolotti. All small plates, tasty, well prepared and presented. Thrilled to have this new Garces spot in our neighborhood and look forward to coming back again soon!

One of the best meals I've had in N.O.

The BBQ shrimp is the best shrimp I've ever had. Anywhere.

I'd give Mr. B's 5 stars if the service was better. Unfortunately, for a restaurant in Mr. B's price range it was slow & inattentive. Regardless, I will definitely dine here next time I'm in NOLA.

A friend and I tried the Diner based on Yelp reviews.  I can say, coffee-holic that he is, his cup of coffee was never empty!  I was impressed with my Tilapia platter (with scrambled eggs and their veggie homefries - didn't know what veggie homefries were but now I'm a fan!).  The servers were all great and very attentive.  The customers that came and went ranged from college students, to families, to buddies getting together to Philly's finest.  A great dining experience and very reasonably priced.

This place is excellent! I recently moved to town I was looking for a place that had good Mediterranean food. I got the mix plate combo it was very good. Can't wait to go back and try some of the other dishes.

This was one of the grosses dining experiences ever.  I came here while visiting a friend against my better judgment.  It was a fancier olive garden to say the least.  The prices were ridiculous for the quality of food.  I had a vegetarian pasta dish.  While eating it, I bit down on something that made a big crunch sound that kind of hurt my jaw.  I spit it out and it looked like bone.  I asked for a manager to come over and she said it was probably chicken bone.  I'm not a vegetarian but when you aren't expecting any meat in your meal and you get a random piece of chicken bone it's pretty disgusting.  I was not happy and nothing was done to make me feel better about this.  I will never ever go back to a macaroni grill ever again.
It's good old fashioned ice cream
